Reviews.Title: “Resort Style Luxury off I-Drive”
Reviews.Author: PJg8r
Reviews.Content: A luxury conference hotel, situated just across the street from the Orlando Convention Center. Perfect for smaller group meetings. Has a beautiful resort style pool/lagoon area. Customer service is excellent. Eat at the Napa restaurant- outdoor seating faces the pool and when the weather is nice it is a gorgeous experience. Rooms are spacious and clean, with underlighting! could use an in room coffee maker, however.

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth you time or money”
Reviews.Author: Cami P
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right in the middle of the hustle and bustle that is Orlando. The staff for the most part was friendly...right up until you head poolside. The most haneous woman works there. Here name was Danielle, and she was absolutely ANYTHING but accomodating. After the first dose of her attitude, I asked to speak with a supervisor, only to find out that she infact was one. Spoke with the front desk and they helped the situation a little though. Writing a lovely letter to the GM/owners soon. Hopefully none of you will have to put up with HER.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Wait To Go Back!!!”
Reviews.Author: jmmarty72
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed there for the first time for an anniversary weekend. I wish we had stayed longer. We decided to splurge and stay on the Club Level Floors. It included complimentary valet parking and breakfast among other ammenities. The room was well decorated, clean, and spacious. The bathroom was impressive (loved the tv in the mirror). The staff were amazing! When we checked in, we were even wished a happy anniversary by the clerk. What a great touch! And while it appeared there were several groups staying there for conventions, it didn't feel that way. I cannot wait until we can stay there again. It was a wonderful experience!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great change of pace from the rest of Orlando”
Reviews.Author: Clairedog
Reviews.Content: It's an enormous conference hotel with two wings, so you shouldn't imagine it will be cosy or intimate, but for business in Orlando it's an oasis. I had a great and creative vegetarian meal in the restaurant. Only concerns: sluggish service and expensive guest parking that isn't all the convenient. Nevetheless, I'll stay there again next time I am in town.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem”
Reviews.Author: WHS831
Reviews.Content: This place is great. Request to stay in the new tower as it was recently built and is very nice. Rooms are very nice, comfortable beds, lots of space. They pool area is perfect for kids but they do allow smoking at the pool, which is gross. There is no non-smoking area at the pool, so at any moment you can be overcome by a group of smokers. We recommend the hotel consider a non-smoking policy at the pool. We dined at the B-Line and Napa. The B-Line is a diner style restaurant which is a nice change of pace for a hotel of this caliber. Open 24 hours and really good food. Breakfast staff amazing. Lunch and evening staff a little slow. Napa was great. Had a fantastic server, Nathan and the menu items can be a bit quirky but the food tastes great. Our daughter got to be the Honorary Duck Master of the day! Donald the Duck Master is amazing with kids. Highly recommend asking the concierge if you have small children if there is an opportunity for them to be Duck Master for the day! Staff were great!!

Reviews.Title: “5 star hotel with a 2 star rating (one 11 yr old)”
Reviews.Author: laurie Q
Reviews.Content: Rooms Good, overall highlights TV in Bathroom mirror +++++ Lights at night as walking to bathroom ++++ Good beds++++ Its true from the other reviews that rooms are not cleaned on a daily basis or do they chng towels only if requested. Hence, I started to pile wet towels together in the sink before we left so they would pick them up and give us new ones after our second day of our trip . They will do your beds and do the turn down and leave a nice thoughtful note w/ choc if you are on the concierge level and lay out the robe for u (caution we only had one mmmmmm). Though as far as a thorough cleaning and dusting seems to be held off to protect the environment. Its not a big deal but if your not into keeping things green and more like keeping things clean this can get on your nerves. About Concierge Level Floor 25 and up Wonderful staff+++++ Can't say enough about them they are so helpful and kind- We gave them tips much deserved Great Views of Orlando Fireworks++++ Great Place to unwind after a long day at the parks with some desserts served between 8- 10:30pm choc cookies/ pastries/ chocolates with a variety of drinks and or wines/ liquor (though the alcohol is extra). Also around 5:30-7:00 they give u hors d'oeuvres which included prosciutto, ham, salami, etc, different cheeses, breads along with two specialty item for the day with all the drinks and or liquors (alcohol is extra). Bad: Concierge level Breakfast Morning continental breakfast at the lounge was ok. M-F they only serve it from 7-9am which was crazy and cheap. Guess a way for them to save on some money at the Peabody. Saturday and Sunday the hours are extended 10am . The breakfast can be better not much to chose from not sure if it was because they were so crowded due to the plastic convention or what but slim pickings . Though again the girls in the lounge worked diligently, were kind and always aiming to please so by no means nothing they did or could do though they tried to get whatever they could from the back to please everyone. Another Negative about the concierge level our keys to our rooms and or to elevator never seemed to work one or the other always so we always had to go to reception to get this adjusted. Nightmare!!!!! Its a big hotel so a lot of walking. Food Room service is the worst you'll ever have.Don't waste your money this coming from an 11 yr old who does not have a very distinctive palate. Not to mention how ripped off you get for pasta, coke and some cookies $60+tip. I recommend it better to go downstairs and eat at there Beline Diner. The deserts at the Beline Diner are amazing. So if u have a sweet tooth the Beline Diner is the place to go and there breakfast is pretty good too. Open late and good prices. Rock lounge has very loud music and has something going on every night though they do not have babysitting here and this place does not allow anyone younger than 18. Also be aware if traveling with little ones and coming through lobby doors with sleepy little ones this would definitely wake them up. Music starts rocking at 8:00pm and stops around 1:00 am . We did not dine at there Napa Rest for break, lunch or dinner. They also have an early breakfast buffet here every morning which we seemed to miss. Also there menu was a little to distinctive for our 11 yr old. Though one great component of this hotel by far is the Capriccio Grill not to mention if u are ever in the vicinity here for Easter please book there Easter brunch it is amazing and a must do!!!!! The best food and best time . The decor was beautiful, the service is impeccable, the bunnies are adorable not to mention the ducks in the middle of the fountain truly a distinctive touch. JUST WISH THEY RAN THE HOTEL THIS WAY!!!! Pool Was nice with its slides and kids little splash area and its pretty big. Though I've seen better. Also while we were there it was very busy so u could not find sitting and it seemed people reserved early morn by placing a white towel. Also I found it messy. Everyone left there dirty towels on chairs, drinks and plastic containers flying everywhere not to mention food. Did not give it the ambiance one is looking for that for sure mostly not for a 5 star certainly can find someone to go around and clean things up. Beware of this hotels room chrges. This hotel can go chrg crazy so check your bill. I would recommend not to chrg anything to your room . They become chrg happy here ours was 689 which we can't figure how they got this figure. Our cards have a fraud alert on them hence put a hold on the account until we noticed it and called our credit card. This can be pretty scary stuff when u are on vac. Not to mention all the time and aggravation spent on all this to get attitudes and denials from mgmt repeatedly. . We finally paid with another card closed out bill and started fresh making sure nothing else was chrged. Thus to make a long story short when we got home it took another two more weeks out of our lives to get this off our card and to reaffirm it was them. Not to mention all the time and aggravation. To be honest if it weren't for the girls up in the concierge lounge, spa (which my daughter and I enjoye mani n pedi, hair, massage, and facial they were wonderful and so was the staff there too) the ducks ,Donald the duck master and Easter brunch I would of given this hotel an F. Though the ducks are a beautiful touch along with Donald there duck master and it is what makes this hotel distinctive. Though if u have children I would recommend the Hyatt or the Ritz Carlton.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room, Great Pool!!”
Reviews.Author: Tinkerbell1391
Reviews.Content: This was a family trip. We decided last minute to hop in the car and take a ride to Orlando for a couple of days. We got a last minute deal so the hotel price was amazing for The Peabody. We have been to the Memphis Hotel but never actually stayed in the hotel. When we arrived it was a little confusing on where the entrance to the hotel and main lobby was but a hotel employee noticed we were lost and showed us our way! Check in was quick and easy. The Bell Hop helped with our bags and the Valet guys helped with the car parking. You can do self parking but apparently it is a long walk . . . long enough that they have a shuttle (long golf cart) to take you to and from the hotel. We chose Valet but it was $20 a day!!!! A Little pricey if you ask me but its The Peabody so I guess it is what it is. When we arrived in our room it was perfect. The room was spacious and clean with big Queen beds :) The bathroom was nice especially with the TV in the Bathroom Mirror! We quickly changed in to our swim suits and headed to the pool for some relaxation. The pool was amazing. There were two. We chose the one with the huge waterfall, bar, kids pool, slide and gigantic pool! Our son absolutely LOVED the pool. It is a beach like set up where you can just walk in, no stairs so that was super nice. The pool bar was also pretty good. We had an appetizer and some Adult beverages :) The next morning we got up and my husband was completely lost . . . there was NO COFFEE POT in the room!!!! I dont think that I have ever been to a hotel without an in room coffee pot! So once we were all dressed we headed to the "coffee bar" place in the middle of the hotel. Of course, EVERYONE was there because they wanted their Mojo! There were only 2 girls working and it TOOK FOREVER! People were ordering breakfasts and frappiccino's. . . .it was forever. We skipped this the next morning due to the insane wait time. The shops in the hotel were reasonable on somethings and insane for others. Everything in the Peabody is duck related. Even the ash trays in the waiting area of the Valet has duck prints. The March of Ducks we did the second morning and it was cool. The ducks have to walk much further than the Ducks in Memphis! These ducks RUN too, so if you want to get a picture make sure you have a camera that doesn't pause or take its time to take because you will miss it! The ducks in Memphis waddle slowly so this is what we were expecting but these ducks hall some serious duck butt!

Reviews.Title: “Business Trip to Mickey's World”
Reviews.Author: Tim L
Reviews.Content: Attended McDonald's Worldwide Convention in Orlando and stayed at the Peabody. It's incredibly convenient to the Convention Center. The hotel is very nice with excellent staff. The fitness center is good along with the hotel amenities. Given all of the tourist places in Orlando, it was nice to stay at a hotel, conduct business and not feel out of place.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel but still a few details to take care of...”
Reviews.Author: celesteram
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to the Peabody, both visits centered around a trade show across the street at the convention center. It is extremely convenient for that! We like the physical hotel and the accommodations. In many ways, it is definitely high end, but there are a few things that make it not feel high-end, and thus, not worth the room rate. One of our party did not have a shower curtain in his room when he checked in. That was fixed in a reasonable amount of time. On our first full day, the maid did not clean our room. We called at 5pm, just before dinner, and let them know. The hotel employee asked if we still wanted the room cleaned, and we of course did. They did come to clean after that. The check-in experience, as well as any visit to the front desk feels a lot like the corrals in the lobby of Caesar's Palace in Las Vegas. The wait is entirely too long for anything, and it seems there are never enough people working behind huge front desk. We stopped in the lounge after dinner on our last night to meet some business associates for drinks. It took at least 15 minutes to get our first round. It took so long that we decided to forego a second round and packed it in for the night. Our dinner experience at Napa was pretty good, but also pricey for the experience. We did enjoy our room and the view from it. We appreciated being on a higher floor in the newer tower. I hope that we can return, but I will have a hard time convincing our group.

Reviews.Title: “I will be going back for sure ......”
Reviews.Author: maryjam
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel, other than a cheeky bell boy!!!! staff were really lovely, rooms great size & serviced everyday , amazing pool area & food was fab , a little overpriced maybe but always top standard. My other half was I'll for the whole 10 days we spent there which was very disappointing as we would loved to have really taken advantage of the hotel as a whole & enjoyed all it had to offer. Maybe we might get to return at the end of the year as we are getting married and I would love to honeymoon at The Peabody : )

Reviews.Title: “Luxury hotel in the heart of I-Drive”
Reviews.Author: JiruSama
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were in town for furniture shopping and needed close access to Mall of the Millenia and a few other places. I'd actually never even heard of this hotel but booked it because of the steep discount provided through Expedia that weekend and beacause of the reviews. The Peabody is in an excellent location, close to International Drive and a convention center. It's also not too far from outlet shopping which is popular in Orlando. Everything was modern and well kept even though we were in the "older" tower. Self parking is pricey at $17 per day but it goes with the territory I suppose. There is also a $10 daily resort fee. The duck parade is a cute idea, but was hard to even see since everyone bum rushes the red carpet and fountain area. I didn't try out the pool since it was rainy the weekend I stayed, but it looked fantastic. One negative was that I wished the self parking was a little more accessible to the hotel but there is an attendant on a golf cart who will pick you up if necessary. Another con: service was fine except the morning we were checking out room service tried to enter our room around 7am! She then asked when we would be leaving (check out is not until noon), which I thought was rude. We also had a slightly rude cashier while we tried to purchase our coffee; she just handed me the receipt and didn't so much as glance my way or utter a word when I told her thank you. She was already servicing the next person before I even took the receipt from her hand. Nothing drastic, but still hospitality is hospitality - especially when you claim to be a 4+ star hotel. Lastly, the bathroom door was awkward to close because the plush mat kept jamming it and there's no room to move it. All in all, the rooms were clean and spacious. The beds were VERY comfortable with great linens and pillows. The tub was nice to soak in and TV in the bathroom mirror is kind of cool. I even loved the complimentary robes which I normally think feel rough and unpleasant. I'd stay again for the highly discounted price I paid, but not for it's retail cost mainly due to service (some of the service staff was amazing, while others were disappointing). I believe what makes a 4+ star hotel is not just the quality of its bedding, food, etc. but its service.

Reviews.Title: “Girls Getaway”
Reviews.Author: spsandi
Reviews.Content: A girlfriend and I spent 3 nights in April on a quick "sunshine" get away. All we wanted to do was sit by the pool sipping cool drinks and absorb the sun. Peabody has two pools, one adjacent to the new tower. Lovely but geared towards family with kids. The other pool is more for adults who want quiet and the opportunity to do some swimming. This was perfect for us!!! My only complaint is that the pool bar at this pool doesn't open till 5pm and only serves beer and wine. The other pool (geared towards kids) has bar and restaurant with waitstaff delivering. Both pools offer cabanas at no charge for those wishing to stay away from the sun. The hotel itself is lovely, but large and overwhelming at first. Rooms were very comfortable and we had a view of "our" pool. Within walking distance the the Orlando Pointe for restaurants and shopping. The trolley stop is directly out front, very convenient. Would definitely consider again for next springs girls getaway!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay!”
Reviews.Author: KileyC
Reviews.Content: I loved the Peabody, the pool was great, and the shuttle to Disney World was the best part! We just called the night before, said when we wanted to leave, and called 2 hours before we wanted to be picked back up. The hotel was spotless, very friendly staff, and I hope to return!

Reviews.Title: “The Place to Stay for Convention Center Events”
Reviews.Author: BusinessGirlOnTheGo
Reviews.Content: The Peabody Orlando was very nice and the location could not be better for a convention center event. Rooms were well appointed and comfortable with soft beds, nice linens, up to date electronics, even a nice bath robe. I didn’t understand the need for an Electric Mirror, which is a devise that projects a television screen through the bathroom mirror in your vanity. Maybe if you could see it from the bath tub. The equipment in the fitness center was some of the best that I have even seen in a business hotel. I also really liked the “feed the fridge” menu that you could use to make your own mini bar at pretty reasonable prices. I did not have time to visit the pool, but it looked great from my room. While there I had dinner at Napa, which was nice. I also ate several times at the B-line Diner. They offered restaurant seating and a takeout counter which was nice for breakfast on the go. The ducks were everywhere; rooms even include duck shaped soaps. The best thing of all was the proximity to the convention center. It was just a skyway walk away. I will definitely stay again for my next Orlando convention center event. I rented a car but parking was expensive and I didn’t leave the hotel, everything that I needed was at the Peabody. Next time I will just cab it from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Peabody lived up to reputation”
Reviews.Author: mizdarcy
Reviews.Content: I (Grandmother) recently stayed at the Peabody with family...two teenagers and their mother for a spur of the moment trip to Orlando. The room was quite lovely even though one bed was a "Murphy bed" and the other a large pull out sofa. The room had a large bar area with copper sink and fridge, granite counter tops. The bathroom was very cool with (and this was the biggest hit) a tv seamlessly built into the bathroom mirror! The service was excellent and prompt (we needed extra pillow). Negative was the price of a cup of coffee, $3.99 and the fact that there is just no way to make a sofa bed comfortable, no matter how upscale the hotel..... My back could attest to that. After a night or two I finally improvised and use the down comforter to pad the mattress. The hotel is within close proximity to Point Orlando, an open concept shopping and dining area. I have to say that I was disappointed in the legendary "duck walk" . Based on the hype and the amount of adults and children that crowded the lobby I was expecting a long line of ducks parading along to the fountain, however there was only four! Very anticlimactic indeed. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Orlando Has 100 Nice Hotels. Stay ELSEWHERE.”
Reviews.Author: frequentFLtraveler
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were recently on our one year anniversary and although we regularly stay at the Waldorf in Orlando, we decided to try the Peabody based on a recommendation. We could not have regretted our decision worse. The Peabody is a "nice" hotel, but operates like a Holiday Inn Express. It's popularity is based entirely on reputation and not at all indicative of the current service provided. Not only is the old section of the hotel, disgusting, but the pool bat decided to not even open on a SATURDAY because they thought it might rain at 6 PM. All day there were 100 guests at the pool, all of which had to order drinks and food through room service (yes, that included a 25% service charge). When I called to ask why they weren't opening up the pool bar because many guests were complaining, I was told "because it MIGHT rain and you can order room service at the pool anytime you want." The staff was rude and unfriendly and overall the hotel didn't even come CLOSE to living up to the reputation of the Peabody. We will continue to stay at the Waldorf every time we travel to Orlando and the last time I will ever set foot in the Peabody was when I left there. You can take the recommendation of this review or you can waste your money. The staff doesn't care. The hotel service is terrible.

Reviews.Title: “Business trip with a resort feel”
Reviews.Author: Runderful
Reviews.Content: So many hotels that are connected to convention centers cater only to the convention/business crowd. The details to comfort and luxury with enough options for dinner and drinks made this hotel feel more like being on vacation than a business trip. They had a piano bar and a lobby bar that both had plenty of seating so you never felt as if it was too crowded, great drinks and service. Rooms had great beds and bedding and although we never used the pool it looked like fun.

Reviews.Title: “Upscale on I Drive”
Reviews.Author: soberesident
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Peabody during a conference. The property is quite large when you include the meeting space, however the comfort and service levels are more of what you would expect at a very nice resort. The room decor is simple, chic and very functional. The bed was comfy with good quality linens. The bathroom was big with lots of counter space, a large soaking tub and there is a TV built into the mirror. The pool area is huge, with fountains, grottos and plenty of deck space for relaxing. Also noteworthy, I used the hotel's dry cleaning service and the prices were less than what I pay at home. Fitness center access was at no additional charge and there is plenty of equipment. The hotel has a "duck" theme which is quite charming along with the story on how it came to pass. The resident ducks have their own habitat, fountain and parade daily. They are quite spolied, as they should be. The hotel restaurant, Napa, is also quite nice, good food, service and wine selection and the prices were reasonable. There are also many other restaurants, coffee shops, and markets on site. I highly recommed this property for the business or leisure traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property, cool rooms, my kids loved the ducks!”
Reviews.Author: Flayooper
Reviews.Content: First, we booked this hotel at a great price for Florida residents. The drinks and food were very expensive, but we knew it would be and they were both good. The pool area was nice with wait staff coming around regularly. There were several pools, a slide and it was just a great complex. The ducks were a nice feature for our teens and we went around Easter and they did a glow in the dark Easter egg hunt for them. The rooms were amazing (the girls loved the TV in the bathroom mirror.) We will definitely go back but will probably not eat at the hotel as much. Our food and drink bill was double the room bill:) It was a great location close to Downtown Disney, Seaworld, Universal and many restaurants as it's right on International Drive. We went and just hung out at the hotel for the day and had a great mini getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Ducktastic Mk2”
Reviews.Author: Jakeylad
Reviews.Content: Our second visit and even better than I remembered, we stayed for 3 nights and we had a fantasic room with brilliant views on two sides. our last visit was 2011 and we had such a great time that we recommended it to our daughter who is getting married in May and using the Peabody as the Orlando part of her honeymoon, we contacted the hotel on her behalf and they said they loved honeymooners and would look after them as long as they brought the marriage licence as proof. This place is just amazing with beautifull public areas and fabulous rooms, the breakfast in theB-Line is freshly made to order and not over priced, there are two massive pools one for families and one for adults. The staff were great and made us feel at home from the outset, the parking for residents is $16 per night but it is then just a short stroll to some lovely bars and restaurants. I would recommend the 'Peabody' to any one.

Reviews.Title: “On International Drive, thank goodness for the I-trolley to get to and from!!”
Reviews.Author: Avita2484
Reviews.Content: Had a blast on this trip..The I-trolley made it so easy to get to and from eating areas, entertainment and shopping :) Didn't mind that we had to take a taxi to get to Universal..lol It was a relief after days of shopping, with lots of walking to return to the hotel to rest and relax at the pool (heated olympic) and hot tub :) The other pool - though there were water slides and a waterfall etc. was not heated so did not relax there..for this Trinidadian, the mornings and evenings were cold so the heated pool was always the choice! The hotel is huge! be prepared for lots of walking! At the time of our stay the hotel was pretty busy. There was a US national cheerleading competition as well as the NPE Conference at the Convention Centre. Check-in and check-out wasn't too bad. What I did not like - people can really be rude - not the hotel staff, but hotel guests..it seems we were the only Caribbean people at this hotel. Within the hotel we were continuously stared at as if we were at the wrong hotel or something..it was quite uncomfortable.. The good thing though was that we spent most of our time out of the hotel: spouse - at work, me - shopping :) The room was quite lovely - stayed on the 27th floor. Had a view of a small lake and lots of trees and the northern part of International Drive, which at night lit up like Christmas time.. Our housekeeping lady was very pleasant. Had lots of clean, fresh towels everyday :) Room was always spotless :)

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: hdogiakis
Reviews.Content: Staff is fantastic, hotel is immaculate...highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Property”
Reviews.Author: bcjordan
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here for 2 nights for a conference (that was at the hotel). I was really impressed with the entire property. The decor was very nice and the rooms were fairly large. Watching the ducks was great and has really stuck in my mind when thinking about this hotel. I had some free time in the morning on my first day so went down and sat at the lap pool. Was nice and pretty quiet. I didn't know until later that night after walking back from The Pointe that there was another pool (which looked fun for families). My only complaint would be that I could hear loud music in my room from either another room or possible a reception somewhere outside. There was some kind of suite near me, as I could see its' balcony from my window so, it may have been there.

Reviews.Title: “Good solid hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jay J
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights second week of April for business conference in original tower. Everything was very clean and bed was comfortable. TV in the bathroom mirror was cute -no stumbiling during middle of night. Nice touch with motion activated floor light under bathroom vanity and nightstand between beds. Odd not to have coffee machine in room. I enjoyed 6AM laps in the pool under moonlight. Conference food catering was excellent and extensive!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel. Excellent ambiance, food, and service.”
Reviews.Author: Jbcooking
Reviews.Content: Loved everything except the sewage aroma near the Coconuts Poolside Bar & Grill. I didn't know if it was just me being overly sensitive, but I observed other guests commenting on the foul smell also. Would be 5 stars if it weren't for that.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Beansquean04
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The PeaBody for business and was very pleased with the experience. The staff is very accommodating and went above and beyond to make me comfortable. The bed is probably the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in. Living in Florida I travel to Orlando every year for vacation. I am not sure if it is the best hotel for families with little kids as there is alot of traffic from people in meetings. The families I saw there almost looked out of place. There are tons of things to do there for families, such as numerous pools and activities each day. I just prefer something a bit more toned down for my family vacations. This is just my personal preference...this hotel is a beautiful place to stay at and offers a very comfotable stay.

Reviews.Title: “The Peabody is a big hotel”
Reviews.Author: wernickejc
Reviews.Content: It ties into the convention center and has a pleasant pool area both downstairs and in the recreation area. The rooms are a little small for a suite. Some rooms had balconies. There is a service fee for amenities and a charge for parking. Stranger still, our room did not have a coffee maker

Reviews.Title: “watch out hidden fees”
Reviews.Author: Jeanne C
Reviews.Content: i was not impressed by the look of this hotel when i got there. i also got slapped a hidden fee of $9.99 a day that i was forced to pay. This was so called to use the gym, shine shoes, ect. Things i didnt plan on using. I was forced to sign my name on the line for this useless fee.Not to mention all the so called extra taxes that i've never been billed for by other lovely hotels. considering my week there was already paid for in advance but now i had a whole new extra bill at the end of my trip. No complimentary coffe or tea. Coffee was $5 for a large cup. Food was expensive and nasty. B-line diner had the grossest muffins. we just slept there but not really, the bed was so uncomfortable and your head goes right through the pillow. i was tired every day. Some of the staff were rude also. The only good thing about this hotel is location. Waste of my money. beware of this hotel. Portofino in universal studios is wayyyyyyy better.

Reviews.Title: “Bit of a disappointment after our last visit.”
Reviews.Author: karensolihull
Reviews.Content: Just spent 5 night at the Peabody, our first visit since they added the new tower. First of all this hotel is now totally different with the extra tower. When we stayed last time it was a wonderful, calm and sophisticated hotel with more of an adult atmosphere than most of the Orlando hotels and with great service. The hotel is still gorgeous but its now just like another family resort as they have added a large pool complete with water slides etc. We missed the old Peabody! Rooms were gorgeous, we were in the new tower and the room obviously had expensive furniture, lighting etc. My daughter was impressed with the TV built into the bathroom mirror! No complaints there at all. Only issue was the lack of a coffee machine, they had free coffee in the lobby but it was miles away and only available 5.30 to 8.30 in the morning - we missed it everday! Surely it wouldnt hurt to put a machine in the room??? We didnt eat at the restaurants or the bars as the prices were really expensive and lacking in atmosphere, better ones 5 mins walk away. We spend a lot of time at the pool and used the old Terrace pool as it was much quieter. They obviously aren't too interested in it even though a manager wonders about doing nothing, there was all sorts of stuff left there from the day before, there were old towels hanging about for days and often none available in the mornings. The first day we asked the concierge if anyone could bring towels but were told to take them from our room - obviously thats not correct so we went to the newer pool to pick some up and they had hundreds! Also the bar at The Terrace doesn,t open till 5pm - not much use if you're after drinks and food during the day. Maids weren't happy when we asked them to clean our room a little earlier one day but they did do a great job and left the room spotless with loads of towels etc. Car parking was expensive, self parking was $17 plus tax per day and the car park was a 5 min walk away. As we didnt intend to use our car much we parking at Pointe Orlando which is another 5 mins further walk but only cost $6 per day - we saved loads doing that. Overall its a gorgeous hotel but sadly I dont think we'll go again as the market they're going for has obviously changed and is not for us anymore, what a shame!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Suelizabeth V
Reviews.Content: Hubby, daughter and I stayed here from April 4 thru the 7th, and we could say we had a wonderful time, it's not the usual hotel we stay at, we normally get villa hotels but since traveling only with our youngest daughter we decided to stay to try it out. The hotel is beautiful but very expensive if you are on a budget you can't eat here, you can go walking distance to eat out of the hotel, but if you are tired and don't want to go out prepare to pay $16 for a 12" pizza that said the rest is verrrryyy nice the pool is wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “"Out of this world"”
Reviews.Author: Funnygiraffehead
Reviews.Content: I visited the Peabody Orlando in June 2011 with my husband & 2 kids. It was a luxurious stay & everything was great! We stayed in one of the newly refurbished rooms which was fab!The television in the glass mirror of the bathroom is a nice touch. Extremely clean and spacious too. The food was gorgeous but a little expensive in the main restaurant for breakfast. Based on International Dr, everything was very close including restaurants, Orange County Convention Center and much more.. Universal studios is only a 10-15 minute drive & Disney is 15-20 minute drive along with Wet 'N' Wild. Our only issue was with the sink in the room outside the bathroom, My 8yr old son was playing with 1 of his toy cars in the sink and the sink collapsed through the counter & on to the floor! This was due to a lack of sealing around the sink but this should not have happened especially with our room being brand new! However No one was injured & within minutes we were moved to a new room. All in all definately a great hotel but there isn't many things for the children to do!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: pege
Reviews.Content: Very big hotel cloase to conf center and the big turist street Internationell drive

Reviews.Title: “Super”
Reviews.Author: joepr2000
Reviews.Content: Space, cleaning, facilities, poo all are awesome ..only thing they can add is more activities for kids like game room, basketball court, etc

Reviews.Title: “An amazing getaway!”
Reviews.Author: Nijah_n_Avni
Reviews.Content: We are from the Tampa area, and wanted to getaway for the weekend. We booked this hotel, and it exceeding our expectations! The pictures don't do any justice...the hotel is immaculate. The entire staff, from valet to room service to front desk, was friendly and professional. We enjoyed every minute. We especially LOVED the TV in the mirror in the bathroom and the view at sunset from our club level room was so romantic and serene. I wish we had a chance to enjoy the pool, but it was a little too cold for us....maybe next time! We will definitely be back again!!

Reviews.Title: “Weekend at the Peabody”
Reviews.Author: lmclarke04
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful! The lobby is striking and the rooms are very nice. The television in the glass mirror of the bathroom is a nice touch. The location of the hotel is perfect. My husband and I walked to lunch (there is a strip of choices), "The Improv," and "Ripley's Believe It or Not" museum. On the down side, the property is great but the service is just average. I just expected more from such a highly rated hotel. Maybe because the hotel is so big, it is hard for the staff to cater to the guest. The restaurants are insanely expensive. We ate at the diner and couldn't believe the price for mediocre food. One cookie cost $4.50 at the diner pick-up window! The rooms do not have microwaves, and when I asked the front desk staff if I could heat my food up they told me that there would be a twenty dollar microwave charge per day for a microwave to be sent to my room. Would I stay at the Peabody again? I would because the price was great and I know what I'm getting. However, I know better than to eat at the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel by Convention Center”
Reviews.Author: mlfranklin
Reviews.Content: If you are working at or attending the Orange County Convention Center, this is the hotel of choice. Convenient, very good restaurants, decent bars, and nice newly-renovated rooms. I find the staff very helpful, even though the hotel is large. Good fitness center, too.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: justteresa
Reviews.Content: We stayed this hotel from 4/3 -4/6, 2012. It was a great stay. The Pro: 1: It is very close to Universal Studio. It is only $12-15 dollar taxi to there. 2: The room is clean and it has a mirror TV in the bathroom. 3: The NAPA restaurant was great dining place. I ordered their 3 set course which was really great. 4: The cute ducky soap add a little surprise to the bathroom. 5:B-line is open almost day and night. It is very convenience to grab food to eat. The cons: 1: The hotel don't have any free shuttle bus to Universal studio or Disney World. 2: The lobby was quite loud singing..... luckily we stayed at new tower 12 floor. The room was quiet. 3: The room we stayed was clean when we first checked in. But the third day stay.... they didn't clean very well in the bathroom area. I would say this is a 4 -5 star hotel. It has it's charming place but it is more commercial fancy style. It lack a little bite personal detail.

Reviews.Title: “Well done, Peabody.”
Reviews.Author: rickandjudie
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Peabody last week for the plastic convention. This hotel is large, but very well managed. All the staff were professional and friendly. The Italian restaurant is top notch; our waiter did a great job of describing the daily offerings, and the food was delicious. If you dine at the B Line diner, look for Jerry-this guy should be on stage. The daily duck walk is fun. The only downside for me was the weak internet signal in my room, skype was almost impossible. If you stay here you can't go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “3 days of a beatiful hotel, but not such good sevice.”
Reviews.Author: Sheila D
Reviews.Content: Was at this hotel for 3 days of business. Hotel was at 90% full. I think that it was maybe just to much on the staff. The rooms are wonderful, beds are fantastic, food and service was poor compaired to the price you pay. Nice pool area. No airport transfer have to get a taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful fun and relaxing!”
Reviews.Author: MissMomoB
Reviews.Content: I had such a good time. The colors are marvelous,the smells are so clean,the service was excellent! My favorite part has to be the ducks on the red carpet...playful silly n fun :)

Reviews.Title: “I will choose smaller hotel next time”
Reviews.Author: Jules777_11
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very upscale, ducks definitely are an attraction (especially when you are traveling with kids). Rooms are newly designed with comfy beds. They could be a little bit bigger for the price. Also it was mentioned on hotels.com, that microwaves are optional, but nobody told us we will have to pay $15/day to rent one. And staying with the baby we definitely needed one to heat the milk. For the price we paid for this microwave we could purchase a new one... A little bit disappointed. Also, fire alarm in the middle of the night left all of us exhausted. Will choose smaller hotel next time. They are more sensitive to their clients needs and more accomodating to small requests.

Reviews.Title: “Great place!!”
Reviews.Author: sportfanjh
Reviews.Content: Amazing pool, friendly staff, all positives! I would definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “They have forgotten the meaning of customer service”
Reviews.Author: 222ted
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here many times by my self for work. I stayed here last month with my family i called a month in advance to reserve a room with early check in , they told me was not a gurantee but would note the account and try to help. I have a one year old daughter so the need to have a room upon arrival is somewhat important for her. Th only direct flight from ct gets me in to orlando an 9:30am. When i got there they told me no rooms were ready they toke my cell number and said should not be to long. After many check ins to see what was going on i got a room at 4pm 1 hour beyong normal check in at 3pm. After talking to managment they told me this was a freak thing never happens and were very sorry. I said things happen so no big deal . This month i made a reservation a monh in advance, with early check in. Guess what got a room at 3:37 a half hour after normal check in. Service here has gone down hill. Stay at the rosen better people they know how to take care of customers. Oh and by the way for my trouble of having to move my daughter around all day to sleep and change her and feed her i was given 4 free breakfast tickets, for real who teaches these people.

Reviews.Title: “Mostly a five star, but a a couple of little things hold it back”
Reviews.Author: 94Q45T
Reviews.Content: This is a very large property with lush landscaping, a gorgeous pool, fine dining and a fitness center that just won't quit. The entire hotel is tastefully, yet opulently designed; and, of course, there are the ducks. My room was light and airy, and the staff is just wonderful. So why not 5 stars? I was there for a conference, not vacation, so keep that in mind. My nits: there was no in-room coffee. I just hate having to deal with room service when I wake, and worse is having to drag on clothes to go downstairs to buy it. Second, there are lots of little lights in the room that cannot be turned off (like the clock and faint backlights on the LED reading lamps). Light sleepers like me have to unplug things. The pillows were all feather type, and compressed to the point that they offered little support (I sleep on my side). Something in the shampoo stung my eyes so severely that I starting using soap to wash my hair. The shower head was difficult to move into a good position. There is a mandatory resort fee that covers fitness and internet access, so why not just include that in the room rate? On the plus side, there are nice touches. The bathroom mirror has a built in TV (tower 2 only, I think), and motion activated night lights that are quick to shut off and very effective. The curtains seal out light effectively, and there are plenty of lamps and plugs. The rooms are large and have enough storage even for long stays. The Internet is the fastest that I have experienced in any hotel. The primary restaurant is good, but costly. However, the location on International Drive is convenient to many, many alternatives. There is covered parking, important in Florida, and it is reasonably priced compared to most. This is available in self park and valet, and there is a shuttle as well as a covered walk from the garage The meeting facilities are extensive and flexible, The food and beverage service for my conference was both different and top notch. Outside, the grounds are beautiful and the hotel covers quite a large area. The pool is among the largest I have seen with full bar and snack service. The staff is knowledgeable, friendly, helpful and unobtrusive. The common areas are comfortable yet palatial in decor. This is an excellent blend of large architecture with human scale amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Awsome very classy and luxurious hotel”
Reviews.Author: Xtassyboy
Reviews.Content: Awsome very classy and luxurious hotel. Food and drinks are very expensive, and rooms don't cover noise too much, but is still worth a visit

Reviews.Title: “Had a great visit”
Reviews.Author: jimmymac79
Reviews.Content: Had a conference that was at the hotel so we stayed for 4 days. It's a beautiful hotel and we stayed in the newer tower. Self-parking is quite a distance from the hotel (well, it seems far when you have bags) but wait around a few minutes and they have a shuttle to take you to the hotel. Check-in was smooth and friendly. Room was spacious and very modern. Loved the feature of having a television built into the mirror in the bathroom. Pool was very nice but is mostly shade in the morning. As far as dining we only ate at the B-Line Diner since most food was provided at the conference but we were very pleased with the food there both times. Check out too was easy. All over a great trip and we'd goi back there again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: chefmyrtaperez
Reviews.Content: The location to shopping and restaurant is great. The rooms are very comfortable. Staff is very friendly. I love to stay in this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation”
Reviews.Author: CharlotteXa
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I spent four days in the hotel and it was really a great experience here. The pool view from our room is beautiful, and the hotel itself is gorgeous. I am satisfied with all the utilities, and the staff are friendly too. The location was OK, very close to universal studio but a little bit far from disney world. I will definitely come back to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great renovations but not as clean as I had hoped”
Reviews.Author: Lisa P
Reviews.Content: The rennovations of the rooms at this property are fantastic. The location to shopping, restaurants, etc can't be beat. The entire property etc is great and not just for families which was a nice surprise. The room was contemporary and comfortable, however dusty and like it hadn't been cleaned that day. There was also trash in the bin when I arrived. I confirmed with the front desk it wasn't an occupied room and went along with my day. While I would have appreciated a less dusty room I'm sure it just hadn't been inspected due to my early arrival. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful in every way (that I needed)!”
Reviews.Author: SearchingUsa
Reviews.Content: I rarely write reviews from business trips, but the Peabody in Orlando is amazing. Everything for my stay was perfect. At check in, a young woman named Tara was fast, friendly, and efficient. Even though there was a long line, she was patient and notably pleasant. I requested an upper floor and was given a top floor room with views of the entire region. The entire hotel is beautifully designed, but a few amenities are really worth note: The fitness center is an actual fitness center! It has more machines and weight equipment than most health clubs. A great change from the usual hotel "fitness center" which is two treadmills and a blaring television. The pool! Wow. There is a main pool area that is very kid and family friendly, with zero-depth entry and waterfalls, etc. It's welcoming and fun but also sophisticated somehow and not to disney-fied like many Orlando places. Then, there's a separate lap pool on another level that is more adult and fitness centered, and it is incredible. I swam a mile there in the lap pool and it was the best time of my entire business trip. The restaurants (Napa and something like Capriccio) were perfect. Convenient, quality food, great atmosphere. The exhibition space is huge and high-quality. Our group attended a convention in several rooms and there were no complaints. Overall this hotel is fantastic. A refreshing break from large chain properties. A traditional feel with modern amenities. Great design and great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Page O Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, awesome pool, loved the B-line diner. Steakhouse was somewhat disappointing. For the price the food was only good not great.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay -- even with toddler!”
Reviews.Author: annaindc
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a long weekend at The Peabody. My husband and I wanted to get away for a few days with our 14 month old son. We booked 2 adjoining rooms (because our son is a very light sleeper.) One room smelled like cigarette smoke, but only after the first day. It was very odd -- I didn't notice the odor when we first checked-in. It was only after the first morning (and each day after that) that I noticed the smell. Usually I would ask for another room, but we had already un-packed everything, and we didn't spend much time in the room anyway, so we left it. Anyway, the hotel itself is nice and well laid out. We were in the new tower. All guest rooms come with coolers -- not refridgerators, it turns out. It never got very cold, so I called down to the front desk to ask about the settings for the fridge, and was quickly corrected that it was a cooler, not a fridge, so it will not be as cold as a fridge. (Even though the slogan on the cooler door reads: Feed the Fridge.) The pool area is great, although they don't have umbrellas. (At least not in March.) I can't imagine hanging out by the pool in the summer without some relief of shade, but they do have cabanas you can rent. Pool bar is over-priced, as all pool-bars are. Service from waiters in the pool area is spotty. This is a large convention hotel, but we did see a lot of other families traveling with kids of all ages. Self parking is $16, plus tax. Be sure to tell the front desk at check in if you want to self park -- they have to activate your room key so you get in/out priviledges. We didn't eat onsite, so can't comment on the food, but they do have lots of choices. Pointe Orlando is an entertainment complex next door, and is walkable, but The Peabody is a large property, so it is a bit of a walk. Definitely doable, but not just a "block" away. (Think "walkable" in Vegas, only not that spread-out.) Lots of dining options there, but everything on or around I-Drive is a chain restaurant, so manage expectations. Ale House has a great, big Cobb salad for a reasonable price (not in Pointe Orlando, but just up I Drive a bit.) IHOP and Dennys are on I-Drive for a nice, cheap breakfast. (Don't go to the IHOP attached to the Days Inn Hotel on I-Drive. It's tiny and has bad service.) Overall the Peabody is perfectly situated on I-Drive, a short drive to all the attractions. Orlando is a very easy town to navigate.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Property, 2 Star Service”
Reviews.Author: aliwat
Reviews.Content: Our experience at The Peabody Orlando was very mixed - some things were excellent and some things were terrible. I'll start with the good things - the property itself is GORGEOUS. The hotel is beautiful, well-decorated and feels incredibly luxurious from the moment you walk in. The rooms are great, ours was a little on the small side (my mom was staying in the room next door and hers was SIGNIFICANTLY larger even though we paid the same price for the rooms.) The bed is super comfortable, the bathroom is perfect (loved the TV in the bathroom mirror and the duck soap!) Housekeeping came twice a day and did a wonderful job (although one night they woke us up at 10PM for turn down service, which I thought was a really odd hour to come, especially since they knew we were a family with a small child.) And, of course, the duck march was adorable! We ate in two restaurants (the B-line Diner and the Mallard Bar) and both were great - no complaints there! Now, on to the bad: First, the pool. It is a BEAUTIFUL pool, well designed and we loved the water slide and the kids area but there were a couple of major problems. First, there are only 3 trash cans in the whole GIANT pool area and the staff did a TERRIBLE job bussing tables. Every table around us was full of empty cups, trash and ashtrays EVERY TIME we went to the pool. I never saw a staff member pick up even one dirty cup wile we were there. What a shame! Also, the pool does not get sunny until noon and so it's very chilly and windy there in the morning. Next, the rooms are oddly lacking in basic amenities. There are no microwaves. You can request one for $20 a day (but you can also BUY one for $40) so that seems incredibly wasteful if you are staying there for a week to pay $140 (which we were.) I called the concierge to see if we could borrow one to heat up my son's lunch and the concierge was stumped as to how to help us. They finally said they would send a microwave up to our room for us to heat up his lunch and then take it back, but they never sent one. The shampoo and conditioner in the bathroom are terrible. Most nice hotels have a company sponsor their bathroom products and I am wondering why they don't do the same to get higher quality bath products? There is no coffee or coffee makers in the rooms. They do have a coffee service downstairs from 5:30-8:30 in the Mallard Tower but when my husband went down one morning to find it, the Concierge told him it ended at 7AM and so he came back up empty0handed. If you want to buy coffee, it's $4.50. Seems pricey for something that is generally included at a nice hotel. The concierges we spoke to were all very pleasant but very untrained. Maybe there's a barrage of new staff members or something right now? One concierge I spoke with about Disney discounts told me she couldn't tell me what the Disney discounts were, it was all very secret and varied depending on what conference you were with. The woman at the ticket center in the hotel was VERY helpful and gave us the exact breakdown of ticket costs (it was a standard discount and DID NOT vary.) I called one morning to get advice on finding a local orange grove and was transferred to the concierge and promptly hung up on...THREE TIMES IN A ROW. So I gave up and found the information elsewhere. Also, their wifi is spotty and tends to just bounce you back to the Peabody home page. I actually had to turn it off to get my iphone to work properly. So, overall, I would give this hotel 5 stars for the actual property and 2 stars for the terrible service and lack of amenities. I have stayed at several true five star hotels and this one has a LONG way to go. We stayed at the Hilton Orlando last year and LOVED that one (but it was all booked up this year.) Next year I'll be booking again (but earlier!) at the Hilton Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Nice business hotel”
Reviews.Author: DGR1968
Reviews.Content: Very modern, great bed, free WiFi in rooms. Self parking for $17 per night. Valet is 25. Everything is fairly expensive, but normal for this genre. Only complaint is no coffee in the room. And I didn't particularly care for the taste of the limited free coffee in the lobby nor the coffee bar's brew.

Reviews.Title: “Five-star experience”
Reviews.Author: een7508
Reviews.Content: The details are there, they care about their hotel. There is even a tv in the bathroom. Everything is very clean and the bed is very comfortable. You may have some nice views out of your window and the pool is awesome. The best part is the march of the ducks. They come out of the elevator onto a red carpet and dive into the water fountain.

Reviews.Title: “I will go back”
Reviews.Author: hugo0001
Reviews.Content: I liked this hotel. The rooms are modern and updated, I was attending a conference and have no complaints.Great facilities, I took the self service parking and it was painless. I loved the TV in the bathroom mirror!

Reviews.Title: “Convention Center Location”
Reviews.Author: thespottedtraveler
Reviews.Content: I was excited to stay at the Peabody as I have heard many really good things about the service. Arrived around 830pm on a Thursday night and waited in line for 30 minutes before being helped.... they only had 2 girls working the desk, and a third arrived, but with the convention traffic coming in it didn't help much. They were courteous and polite, I was upgraded to a mini-suite at no cost because they had overbooked their king rooms. Okay I thought this is good. They did book me in the tower close to the convention center since I was attending a conference there.. this is a must.. I had colleagues that was in the opposite tower and they were really in for a work out getting to the convention hall. The room was nice, a TV in the bathroom mirror was both creepy and useful!! The bed however was a bed that pulls out of the wall and about 14 inches off the ground, not great for getting up in the morning with stiff hips! Overall the room was clean, fresh, and very nice. The kid pool area is huge and perfect for families. There is a quieter pool on the recreation floor that is almost olympic length and I took advantage of the atmosphere and swam there often. Service there however only starts after 5pm. There is no food or drinks at the rec floor pool during the day. This was disappointing. Getting into any of the nicer restaurants was near impossible.. as they opened at 6pm and closed at 10pm and with the size of the hotel they were booked solid. Another disappointment. The diner was open 24x7 and had good food just slightly overpriced, but when you went there to eat, there was a line going out the door, because of the limited seating capacity.. there was no place else to grab breakfast... unless you count the grab and go which had old looking bagels and coffee... not my idea of breakfast. Service was great in the bar areas, spent 2 nights in the piano bar area, and the food was good and the service exceptional. Its a very quiet hotel, never heard any neighbors, the mattresses are comfortable, and there are lots of pillows. There is a desk and fridge in every room making it ideal for the business traveler like myself.

Reviews.Title: “Will never go back because of the horrible service!”
Reviews.Author: Smccurdy7
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on March 17, 2012 for my birthday. When we arrived to check in everything was great included the front desk staff yet when we were shown our room, we were terribly disappointed! We reserved a suite but that is not what we got. We then called back down to speak to a manager but after waiting in our room for over 30 minutes, we decided to go down and just check out. Once we got down stairs and spoke to someone we were told to wait a few minutes more because the manager wanted to speak to us.... Well, another 15 and we are still ready to leave the hotel but just as we get up to leave, the manager finally decided to make an appearance. We were told they made a mistake and were sorry for the wrong room so then gave us the right one. Our luggage was then brought up to our new room, which was okay, but not worth the price. We had a nice time that day at the pool but need better service down there because there are not enough chairs and when we did get a place we were stuck with our empty drink glasses and food trays for the rest of the day. Anyways, later that night around 11 pm, we returned back to the room from Howl at the Moon with some friends, who were also staying at the hotel. From then on we had 3 different meets with the "Security Officer" who kept saying we were being too "loud"! I called down to the desk to speak with a manager but of course no one was available, about 10 minutes later we got a call back from one but did nothing to recitify the situation. Once again I informed then we will be more than happy to check out and never come back because I didnt know it was against the rules to have people in our sitting room that late at night just talking. There was no music on, no tv, and no loud noises, so I'm really unsure where this loud noise from our room was coming from. I will never stay here again and will make sure everyone we know never stays there as well, as we expected far better from such a well known hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “great property with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: LilMsFoodie
Reviews.Content: A short conference brought us to the Peabody. What a nice surprise. Our room was spotless, with thoughtful amenities. I loved the embedded tv in the bathroom mirror. Also the floor light that comes on when someone walks in the bathroom. I had a great breakfast at B Line and enjoyed watching the line cooks as I sat at the counter. The bar near the main lobby was outstanding with an excellent singer in the evening. Very polished and professional. Saturday, I had intended to shop but decided to try the spa here. I had an excellent facial and manicure and enjoyed using the steam room, whirlpools and lounges. We will definitely come here again. Watched the duck march. I remember seeing this maybe 50 years ago in Memphis. Tradition is a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't get enough of The Peabody”
Reviews.Author: Aworkingmommy
Reviews.Content: A one night stand was simply not enough, and left me wanting more. I just love this property. Contemporary, stylish, high ceilings, great art and decor...every last decorated detail is totally my style. I regret not having more time to enjoy the pool, the restaurants, the spa, and I really want to come back. As far as the room goes, it was fine. Nothing spectacular, but clean and comfortable and nicely decorated. Let me not forget the ducks! OK, fine it's a gimmick, but it's cute and original, so just go with it, people! Make sure you don't miss the ducks. I look forward to visiting again and really enjoying the property next time. A review update will follow when I do. Will a fifth star be in order? Maybe!

Reviews.Title: “Best location for the Orlando Convention Center and International Drive”
Reviews.Author: jax848
Reviews.Content: Overall this is a fantastic hotel, and a destination in and of itself. Although I've was here on business I will definitely consider it as a getaway location to unwind on a long weekend. It is immaculate, has an amazing gym, and easily the best pool complex in the area. Dining options are good, pricey, but consistent with the Orlando/International Drive mentality as the costliest place on earth. There is a room fridge, so stock it up and avoid the overcharging. My complaint, and what keeps this from being an Excellent, is with valet parking. When you pull into the main driveway there are no parking options, and nothing to tell you that you have to keep going. Even when I found the valet zone there was no one to help, and when I tracked someone down they spoke little English and could not advise me on self-parking options. Getting the car was not much better. I had to deal with a smarmy individual that was very condescending over my not knowing the difference between the mallard tower and the other tower. A freakin' sign would help. I'll stop now, since my frustration is building again and I'm about to downgrade to "good" on those valet clowns.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully relaxing!!!”
Reviews.Author: jlmwtaylor
Reviews.Content: Surprised my family with a weekend there for my daughters birthday and it was fantastic!!! The beds were very comfortable and hallways and rooms were quiet. Loved the pool area. We had a perfect little get away weekend.

Reviews.Title: “A True Gem!”
Reviews.Author: NWO2008
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our Spring Break family vacation. From the location, to service and amenities, all I can say is we felt spoiled and pampered. Everything was perfect. The Peabody Orlando is now in our list of all-time favourites. Well done!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wineelf68
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I have spent a few days here on a business trip. The Peabody is an enormous hotel however it never seems too busy and the staff are pleasant. The rooms are a good size with lovely cotton bedlinen. If you get up in the middle of the light, a couple of low floor level lights come on so you don't have to trip up and there's even a tv in the bathroom mirror! Didn't eat here as there are so many restaurants close by. I did forget my toothpaste and had a tube delivered to my room at no cost. Very good service, although valet service at times was slow.

Reviews.Title: “Exceded my expectations”
Reviews.Author: pounchkee
Reviews.Content: I attended a 6 day seminar at the Peabody Orlando and was pleased with every aspect of the hotel and the service. Food at the B-Line Diner was excellent with many choices, all great. The Mallard Lobby Bar never disappoints. Watching the ducks come up the red carpet to swim all day in the fountain brings out the kid in all of us. Accomadations awesome. Clean rooms and staff overall, very nice. Love the TV's in the Bathroom mirrors. Nice touch. Great pools and great place to attend a seminar. Will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location”
Reviews.Author: upcdayzie
Reviews.Content: The Peabody is among one of the best hotels we have stayed at. Staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The only disappointment was there was no complimentary coffee left in lobby at around 8:30am. We still enjoyed the hotel, it's very convenient to shopping and restaurants!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, very accomodating staff”
Reviews.Author: mefcgf21
Reviews.Content: I was here for a meeting so I cant comment on costs, but i will say that the property is very nice. I saw several rooms because many of my colleagues were there as well. They were very nice. I would recommend asking for an upgrade as one person in our group did & he had an amazing room. Also, you might want to ask to be near the elevators as the walk could be long if you dont. The staff was great. I forgot a razor & they brought one up immediately with shaving cream. The rooms had motion sensored lights that went on as you walked by so that after you turned the lights out you wouldnt knock into the furniture. There was also a cool tv in the bathroom mirror & a scale in the bathroom that is always a nice bonus in a hotel room. I am really picky about beds & they were pretty good. The gym was excellent & plenty of treadmills. The bar scene at night was very lively but far away from the rooms not to disturb the guests. The pool looked awesome but we never had time to use it. They had an amazing slide that my kids would have loved. I only miss that we werent able to see the ducks. Each day we tried to get there by 5pm to see the "duck parade" but missed it every day. If you are going to a convention here wear comfortable shoes, its a long walk. There was a Greek restaurant, Opa & a cuban restaurant, Cuban Libre nearby. Both were excellent & in walking distance. Also, Capital Grille was in walking distance but we didnt get a chance to go. :( I would def recommend this hotel to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Great week”
Reviews.Author: Tampa_FloridaWisher
Reviews.Content: The Peabody was easy to enjoy. The service was good and the hotel ammenities are very nice. The only complaint was no coffee maker in the room. Otherwise we had a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent property!”
Reviews.Author: jhn
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Peabody over the NBA All Star weekend and were thoroughly impressed with the property. The rooms were spacious and had everything we needed, as well as a few extra touches, like motion censored lights that lit your way to the bathroom at night and the TV in the bathroom mirror. There is a nice selection of restaurants/cafes, but they are a little pricey. The pool area is great, with lots of pools, hot tubs and even a slide! The hotel staff was accommodating and the location is great!

Reviews.Title: “Great meeting hotel”
Reviews.Author: camdeca
Reviews.Content: So I never went outside. Spent 4 days in meetings. Great support for meetings. AV, hospitality, and attention to details went well. Napa the restaurant was good for the senior management dinner. My only complaint that while wireless was free in the room, the company had to buy a packet of access for use in the meeting facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly and well located”
Reviews.Author: Frank D
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very well located and not in Disney which was a nice change. Check in staff were helpful and friendly. Made the entire arrival easy going. The room decor was nice and the room itself was of desent size and the bed was comfortable. I especially appreciated the free wireless access to check my email. Excellent shower/tub area. Great hotel overall and the staff made our stay enjoyable and worth the money. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Style & Comfort”
Reviews.Author: Tomn8r4402
Reviews.Content: The Peabody is a well known high-end hotel, and yes they have continued the tradition of ducks in their fountain :-) My first impression of the Orlando property is one of amazement, the architecture is stunning and every detail is perfectly finished. Whether your in town for a convention or simply looking for a great place to chill out while doing the Mickey thing, this should be where you stay. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Good if you need to be at the convention center”
Reviews.Author: Sara J
Reviews.Content: Nice, clean, renovated hotel that is in a great area if you have something going on at the convention center. It is pretty pricy for what you get but it has a great location so I would recommend this if you are there for work. It does not seem like it would be a good place to bring children; I was there for four days and saw hardly any. The overall feeling of the hotel is business professional: suits and ties are the norm here (I left for the airport wearing casual shorts and felt awkward). Overall I didn't have any complaints however I wasn't blown away either; I think you are definitely paying for proximity.

Reviews.Title: “Ducking Brilliant!!”
Reviews.Author: TheButchersOnTour
Reviews.Content: We had the great pleasure of staying in the Peabody for Christmas. From the moment we arrived to the sad day when we departed we were treated superbly by all members of staff and always felt completely relaxed and at ease. The hotel and grounds are immaculate and the rooms are extremely comfortable, the one small issue with the rooms is that you don't have facilities to make a hot drink, but as you've got a nice big fridge to keep a few beers ice cold or chocolate milk for the kids then it's a small price to pay to stay in such a great place. The location is superb, you can easily walk out of the hotel to many restaraunts, cinema, mini golf, shopping etc and no matter what time of day or night you always feel completely safe. To any one thinking of booking to go to Florida I would say do it NOW! We certainly will be as soon as we can afford it. No one in the world welcomes you like our American friends and the good people of the Peabody are a shining example of this.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury Vacation Travelers-Don't Do It”
Reviews.Author: Travelerfromchi
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at many of the 4.5-5 star hotels in Orlando, and this is NOT one of them. DO NOT let the deceiving Internet pictures fool you. They have plastic tubs, no cushions on pool chairs, poor service at the pool, and very rude front desk attendants. This is a business hotel, and nothing more.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you Donald the Duck Master”
Reviews.Author: cjsutcliffe
Reviews.Content: Everyday at 11am Donald "the duck Master" escorts down a family of wild ducks from the penthouse suite down a red carpet into the centre of the hotel. Here they bath, feed and sunbath in the delightful surroundings of the beautiful Peabody Hotel. Our daughter Beatrice was honorary duck master and got to help escort the birds. Donald is a truly wonderful man and is full of all the wonderful qualities that disney magic is made off...fantastic time had by all and all ages. contact the hotel if you would like to help you do not have to be staying there either...

Reviews.Title: “Amazing and beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: karlacuervo
Reviews.Content: i love every minute in it ....my two kid girls said they dint want to leave, the b liner is great ;the pool uffff next year im planning to come back with my husband for couple days ....

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel and service”
Reviews.Author: dwirick
Reviews.Content: This hotel is top notch in every sense of the word. The lobby is beautiful, and so are the rooms. I stayed for 7 days for a work conference, and when I left my computer cord in a meeting room, the concierge permitted me to borrow a computer cord until I could secure mine the next morning. I really appreciated this, as I had much work to do that evening. The housekeeping staff was outstanding. The room was immaculate, and the bed was extra comfortable. The towels were plentiful, and the room was cozy overall. It is a lovely hotel, and I cannot wait to return. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone for business or for pleasure. Watching the ducks every morning was also fun and relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “OK, they have a TV in the Bathroom mirror...what more could you ask for?”
Reviews.Author: ehilgeman
Reviews.Content: I was here for a conference, and this was truly one of the most beautiful hotels I've stayed in. It doesn't look like much from the outside, but all the common spaces were really well done, and the rooms were ridiculous. For goodness sake, they had a flat screen TV built into the bathroom mirror. How cool is that? The pool was gorgeous as well - landscaped rock waterfalls, a lazy river, etc. Stylish, non-standard decor, a great fitness center (though they charge for it), and terrific food...... I travel a lot for work, and this place is definitely a couple of steps above the usual business hotel experience. If I were paying for it myself, the price might be a little prohibitive, but wow.....

Reviews.Title: “Good place, wish I could say the same for the service.”
Reviews.Author: MrCouture
Reviews.Content: Beautiful place, friendly staff, great View of pool. But the service was not so convenient. Everything was perfect except you couldn't call down to have valet ready your vehicle. The room service also extremely over priced.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you expected and much more”
Reviews.Author: Sandra R
Reviews.Content: We were in Orlando on February 11th, for Mardi gras in Universal Studios. Hotel meets all expectations, simply put a pleasure to stay there. Very clean, decor is outstanding, ducks are fun to watch and the Bee-line we have yet to find a breakfast that even comes close to it! Love, love this hotel :)

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Erin619
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 days in the new tower (Tower 2) in a lovely corner room on the 20th floor. The room was nicely appointed, but not lavish. There are motion-sensor nightlights at floor level next to the bed and in the bathroom that make night-time bathroom trips safe. Housekeeping happened at random hours during the day, so we were never sure when our room would be finished. One day it was finished before we came back from breakfast; another day it wasn't done until after 3pm. We visited the spa, which was nice. The B-Line diner was a good on-property restaurant. Pool facilites are well-manicured and nice for both families and single travellers. The front desk staff was friendly and very helpful. The "Papa Duck's Pizza" which can be delievered to your room at no charge - pass. It took 20 minutes on hold to place an order, and 45 to deliver. The pizza was terrible. It is always a treat to watch the ducks march to the fountain in the morning and back again in the evening. The location makes the Peabody very convienent to the convention center and to many restaurants at Pointe Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “peabody hotel”
Reviews.Author: pjl75d
Reviews.Content: The hotel is fabulous, very clean, excellent location. The I-Drive Trolley picks up in front of the hotel and travels to all shopping areas on I-Drive. Free passes for the Trolley was obtain from the concierge. The 2 pools are very nice. Big gym area also. There is a diner themed restarant in the hotel that is very good.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and clean”
Reviews.Author: ChrisNCarly
Reviews.Content: We stayed there two nights and had a great time! We were able to see the duck march our last day there which our daughter really enjoyed!! The bed was very comfortable and our room was really clean! We did not know there was a new tower when we made our reservation but where we stayed was newly renovated and very nice! We visited the bar which had live music and very comfy seating areas. Room service was quick and the food was really good! I would recommend calling for your car before you leave your room....we waited 15-20 min each time we needed to leave the hotel. Overall it was a very nice stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort and Modern”
Reviews.Author: Hinditina
Reviews.Content: We just recently stayed there for a convention that was across the street from the hotel. We decided to splurge and enjoyed the conveniences of the location to the Orange County Convention Center and the beauty of the hotel. We stayed in the new tower and it was nice. The room are average but the nice part of the hotel were the lights. I sometime have to use the bathroom in the middle of the night. Instead of feeling my way to the bathroom or turning on a bright light. There is a motions sensor on the bottom of the nightstand that light the floor to show you how to get bathroom. In the bathroom is the same was well. There is a motion sensor underneath the sink that lights up. There is a television inside the bathroom mirror. That was awesome. That how i get ready in the morning watching t.v. and putting on my make up and hair. The beds are comfortable and the pillows are great! The downside, my husband and I was out late on our last night of our hotel and we didn't get back into our room until 1:00 a.m. housekeeping was knocking on our door at 8:30 a.m.!! We set our alarm but forgot to put the do not disturb sign but still 8:30 a.m. That was no excuse.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: schumpi
Reviews.Content: Always good to stay there. The location is amazing (right in the middle of international drive). you have everything you need around. its fairly priced, good rooms, good beds, good service. It is not a ultra high end luxury hotel but it is a decent, very good 4 star hotel with the best location and price/quality you can get in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch hotel”
Reviews.Author: tsmlink
