Reviews.Content: Visited the Peabody on business, as it is located directly across from the Orange County convention center. This is clearly a top notch hotel. The rooms are in good shape, the bathrooms are spotless, although my shower light worked intermittently. (I don't hold that against the hotel, because if someone doesn't tell them about it, they don't know to fix it.) I didn't use the mini-bar or the dressers, so I can't comment on them. There is an automatic night light in the bathroom, which is pretty convenient. They have a number of restaurants in the hotel, which is also convenient if you want to stay in to eat. I visited the Italian steak house twice, one meal was very good, the other just OK. Overall, this was one of the better hotels that I've stayed in. If the restaurant was a bit better, I could easily have rated it five stars. You won't go wrong here.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, but awful view of the swamp...”
Reviews.Author: 15monthsapart
Reviews.Content: My husband and I vacation at this hotel almost every year. We love the location on International Drive and the amenities. The spa is excellent. I've never had a bad service. They have private cabanas at the spa and a heated pool outside. I love seeing the ducks parade in the morning. I fnally caught their parade in the evening. The food at Napa was great. Be warned that they no longer have a breakfast menu. I was looking fo rthe heavenly pancakes I had the year before and was shocked that they are no longer available. However, I tried the B Line Diner and found my pancakes! They're called Heavenly Griddlecakes now. Last year, I had a bad experience with B Line. Everything I ate there was nasty. So, I vowed never to eat there again, why with so many options in Orlando I didn't have to punish myself. But thank goodness I missed my trolley and decided to stay in an have breakfast at B Line. I still haven't tried anything else there though. I had my griddlecakes for the rest of my stay! The service at Peabody is great. Everyone you met is willing and able to help. We stayed on a high floor facing the back of the hotel. I had to keep my windows drawn so that I couldn't see out. The view of the swamp beneath was scary. I should have taken the bell man's advice and changed my room. This sort of put a damper on my mornings becasue I wanted to wake up and look out at the beautiful sky. All in all, our stay was fine. We'll definitely be back and will opt for a different view.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I've ever been to! Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: beccamarmalade
Reviews.Content: AMAZING. This is a nice large hotel. It is located near the Convention Center on International Drive. You have a choice of valet or self-parking in a parking garage. If you self-park your room key gets you in through the gates. Our room was located on the 13th floor. The rooms are very technologically advanced, it was amazing! The bathroom was wonderful equipped with excellent water pressure in shower and the bathtub was very spacious. The soap for the bathtub was shaped like a duck as well! Outside the bathroom is a little make-up desk with a bench. There is a huge flat screen TV in the room. There is also a refrigerator in the room. You can also select from a menu of food and drink items that they will stock in the refrigerator. There is also a writing desk located in the room. There is a spa and an adult and children's pools as well as several restaurants. This place is simply elegant. Easy check in and out. A turn down service, comfortable bed, couch in room, large flat screen TV with good on-demand movie selection, and iPod dock. (Me and my family were so shocked when we found this out, we thought it was AMAZING that they provided an iPod dock, nice extra detail.) I really enjoyed my stay here. I am admittedly extremely picky about cleanliness. This place passed with flying colors. And the most amazing thing was that there was internet connection for free! So at night when before going to bed, I could check on my family back home using skype & social networking sites. The staff were very friendly and excellently polite. They were all kind and if we saw them they would ask how we were and how are day was. Just generally being nice. Our valet was awesome too! We stay 7 nights and would be happy to return!! It was completely worth the money and would return at a hearbeat. Thank you to everyone who work at Peabody in Orlando/Florida and makes this hotel a very good place to return!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, great service!”
Reviews.Author: MishLyn
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Peabody Orlando on a business trip. The Hotel is a very nice high-end Hotel and it's across the street (walking distance) from the Covention Center. The rooms/bathrooms are spacious. There was even a TV in the bathroom mirror! The Hotel has a pool, fitness center, coffee bar, restaurants and bars. There are several great restaurants/night spots within walking distance. The service at this Hotel was top notch. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “It was nice...”
Reviews.Author: je1058
Reviews.Content: This is our third time staying at the Peabody in the last two years... All times have been for conferences at the Orlando Convention Center. This place is VERY close to the convention center and a BEAUTIFUL property! Problem is that they don't seem to do too well in sold-out situations. We booked a couple of rooms and the occupany of the other room arrived around 10PM from her flight only to be told there was no room available. After two hours of back and forth and arguing, she finally got a room. That's really unecessary. We waited a long time for the car to be brought around using valet as well... Use the self-park, it's a quick walk from the front door area. Our room was nice, but the bathroom was way too small. We were in the older tower this time and the room was nicely refurbished to make it match the newer rooms, but the bathroom door opens right into the toilet. There is no clearance under the door to allow for the floormat that they have in the bathroom, as it bunches up under the door when you open it. We also had to call to get our room made around 5PM on our first day since it was never made, after we had been out all day. This was a sold out convention that we were there for. Also, we hosted a bar meet & greet in the Mallard bar area and got horrible service from a younger bar tender who wouldn't serve us without having to go through the lady who was serving the area we were standing. The problem with that was she was too busy to keep up with everyone we had and so we went directly to him to get better service for our business guests, only to be told to order through her. It was embarassing to have this transaction occur in front of our clients. We ended up only spending a few hundred dollars in the bar, but would've spent more had we had better service! Anyway... We would definitely come back, but would re-think having an ad hoc function like this again and would REALLY be concerned about our reservations if we're there for another sold out convention.

Reviews.Title: “Great facility & staff.....Poor food”
Reviews.Author: AgentBob
Reviews.Content: The rooms were great with gadgets like a TV in the bathroom mirror and dedicated elevators to the upper floors. The convention facility was fabulous. My housekeeper seemed to pick up my daily routine in just a few short days and was tremendous! The wait staff were very friendly and eager to serve......But serve what??? The food was lousy! My suggestion is to stay here, have a convention or business meeting here, but eat somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, loved the ducks!”
Reviews.Author: BensMommy2010
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay. The staff were so friendly and helpful. Our bellman was awesome, helpful and so nice. We loved the pool area, our 10 month old loved the pool area! Watching the duck parade was a hoot! Room was spectacular and we had a view of the Disney fireworks!

Reviews.Title: “QUIET SIMPLY TE BEST!”
Reviews.Author: wjhill
Reviews.Content: HI WE STAYED AT THE PEABODY hotel i drive orlando at christmas with our 4 children for 14 nights and found immaculate clean freindly people,excellent,pools for the kids and myself there was a couple of issues though the $9 a day charge for making up your room is a con and kids are not allowed to sit near the bar lounge after 7 wich is upsetting when when you would like couple of drinks with your wife,$13 a day to park your own car is a ripp off consindering you have to walk a marathon to get back to the hotel appart from that priity good.

Reviews.Title: “Just ducky!”
Reviews.Author: vacationerBoston
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a business conference last week. This property was far and away better than others that we've used. I would also not hesitate to stay here personally. My room overlooked the Terrace Pool. It was spacious, comfortable and spotless. Others have mentioned the TV in the mirror, and I loved the sensor light under the scale in the bathroom. Everyone knows how disorienting it is to be in a different place in the middle of the night! There were also plenty of hangers, something I've found lacking in other hotels. Two free waters a day were a nice touch too. I always admire a hotel that doesn't nickel and dime for basics like water (maybe they charged the company :)>. The fitness center was top of the line, modern, loved it. Staff were pleasant, (I sat down for breakfast one morning and the waiter was right there sliding my chair in!) and the food was good with healthy choices at every meal. it was very quiet at night also. The duck theme was cute too, the hotel had some character vs being cookie cutter. Very favorable experience and would highly recommend to others for business or pleasure. It is not an easy task to cater to both business and leisure travelers, the Peabody has found the recipe for both.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Joana B
Reviews.Content: If you like be very welcome, you should stay in this hotel. Excelent for families! Very clean and pleasent. We stay 6 nights and we will return there next year for have again a very good vacations!! Thank you to everyone who work at Peabody in Orlando/Florida and makes this hotel a very good place to return!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay.”
Reviews.Author: TFUltimate
Reviews.Content: The Peabody is the one of the nicer properties I've seen in years of traveling. Stayed here over a long weekend visiting Orlando. Excellent location on International Drive very near the convention center. Self parking is easy, and accessed via your room key for unlimited in/out privileges. The property has two lobbies; the main lobby with attached main tower (newer rooms), and the Mallard Lobby (containing the famous duck fountain). The size of the hotel puts one in mind of a Las Vegas property, sans casino. Easy check in and out. Room very spacious, equipped with TV in bathroom mirror, excellent water pressure in shower, turn down service, comfortable bed, couch in room, large flat screen TV with good on-demand movie selection, and iPod dock. Outdoor pool I could not use due to traveling in January, but it is very large and well-landscaped. Several restaurants on the property with appealing looking menus. Hotel bar beautifully designed, although I was charged $42 for two scotch and waters (and it wasn't old or rare scotch, garden variety Lagavulin).

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay at the Peaabody Hotel in Orlando.”
Reviews.Author: Mercurio64
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Peabody Orlando between Xmas and New Year's Eve and we had a great experience. The rooms were really nice and luxurious with a great bathroom. The beds were very comfortable. All the ameneties were really good, the main pool is spectacular and very safe, especially when you have kids. We would go back in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Beautifu Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TallyWorldTraveler
Reviews.Content: This is a nice large hotel. It is located near the Convention Center on International Drive. You have a choice of valet or self-parking in a parking garage. If you self-park your room key gets you in through the gates. Our room was located on the 13th floor. It had two double beds. The bathroom was small, but contained everything you need including a TV in the mirror. The bathtub was very spacioous. The soap for the bathtub was shaped like a duck. Outside the bathroom is a little make-up desk with a bench. There is a huge flat screen TV in the room. There is also a refrigerator in the room. You can also select from a menu of food and drink items that they will stock in the refrigerator. There is also a writing desk located in the room. There is a spa and an adult and children's pools as well as several restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Prime Vacation Spot!”
Reviews.Author: Maikolo
Reviews.Content: I was dwarfed by the enormity of this beautiful creation. Probably the biggest hotel I've seen or had the pleasure of staying in. I had an awesome stay here while on vacation with my wife. So here are a few tips that will help all of you who are planning on taking a vacation here. I'm a little bit of a "cheapo" and the rooms here are not cheap so here is how I justified it. The hotel gave me free wi-fi which is a $13/day savings. The pool area looks like a water park so that could take a day of vacation in itself free of charge. Pools is complete with spa, jacuzzi's, water fountains and a slide. Walking distance from the hotel are some cheap eats like Denny's, Ihop, McDonalds, Ben & Jerrys and a Walgreens for anything els. The hotel offers free unlimited trolly tickets that will take you to many different places around the area. Sea World is a 4 minute drive, Disney World is a 7 minute drive, and Universal Studios is a 8 minute drive. All three locations are reachable by trolly which was free for Peabody guests! With all of this offered by the hotel, I was able to save a lot of money. Inside the Peabody they have a few bars that are always packed with people having a good time and live music. You know the bar is good when non guests come to a hotel for the bar scene. Restaurants are very good as well but a little pricey. I would recommend eating off site.The Gym is really spacious and clean, which is a big plus in my book. It is separated into 4 different rooms and has a luxury locker room complete with showers. Located next to the convention center ($35 cab from Orlando airport), the Peabody actually has it's own mini convention center. They were holding some sort of conference while we were staying here and there must have been 700-800 people. The meeting rooms here are huge. I was amazed to see how many people were attending the conference, yet the hotel still did not seem crowded due to its massive size and space. Rooms are very nice and have a lot of special features that you don't see very often in hotels. Underneath the nightstands are motion censured lights that work as night lights when it detects motion in the dark. Perfect for those middle of the night runs to the restroom. In the bathroom you will find a television in the mirror (Awesome!). 2 person bathtubs if you like that type of thing. Families should check out WonderWorks which is kinda like a family fun center. My wife and I had a great time there. It had tons of wonderful, affordable, family entertainment. Overall, very nice hotel that is worth the money. I would definitely recommend this hotel to vacationers.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous”
Reviews.Author: DraacoPendragon
Reviews.Content: The Peabody is for travelers with better than average pocketbooks. Its architecture is simply amazing in most instances, and you get a true "luxury car" feel almost everywhere you travel inside and out. Fountains, waterfalls, glass, marble, gold...and very high ceilings...all give the Peabody a very mighty ambiance. The lower end rooms area little unbalanced with amenities, in fact one style room has a TV in the bathroom mirror, but no coffee maker. That being said, the rooms themselves are all very beautiful. Soft, comfortable beds with down pillows, plenty of home away from home office space, and an old fashioned charm. Location...middle of everything. Definitely worth the extra to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Visited for a Conference, Would Stay for a Vacation...”
Reviews.Author: Bzuefishx
Reviews.Content: Really a top notch hotel, one that does not take its proximity to a huge convention center for granted. First, the quality of my room was excellent - not sure when tower two was completed or last renovated, but my room was in like new condition. Great view from 10th floor corner room and housekeeping was flawless. No idea of "value," as I was not paying for my stay, but felt like a $300 to $400 per night room, especially during Florida's winter season. Second, public areas are simply fantastic - pools, bars, restaurants, etc. Third - staff is great, friendly greetings felt sincere, eager to be helpful. Fourth - our large conference - 500+ - went off without a hitch. I'm sure there were issues - always are - but seamless to guests. Their catering and conference teams really know what they are doing.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, convenient for Convention Center”
Reviews.Author: MiloTheExplorer
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Peabody for a week while working a convention. As a Meeting Planner, I am pretty picky about hotels, especially when it comes to service. I was never disappointed and actually had a great time! Rooms: I was in a Standard King room and it was really nice. The bathroom was more than enough room for me, and I tend to spread my things out when I'm getting ready. I loved the TV in the mirror - unnecessary, but cool. The bed was super comfy and I had no trouble sleeping. Service: The staff and service was great for the most part. I did have one frustrating experience while ordering food from Napa. I was over at the convention center and wanted to order the fish tacos for lunch. I called over and was transferred to Napa by the hotel Operator. I spoke with the Hostess and told her I wanted to order food to-go. She told me the bartender took to-go orders and transferred my call to the bar. Bartender never answered, but my call was picked up by the kitchen staff, who transferred me back to the bar, but somehow my call was picked up by the IT Dept. (Seriously, no joke.) Eventually I was transferred back to the bartender and he took my order. I went to pick it up without issue, but no one seemed sympathetic to my frustration of getting the run around. Anyways, by the time I got back to the CC with my food, I realized they forgot to add the salsa. Tacos were bland and sub-par. Not worth the hassle. I understand they don't usually do take out, so maybe try it out..? Food and Bev. Outlets: I ate mostly at the B-Line Diner, since it was fast and I was working. I have at least 5 meals there and everything was really tasty. The bar, Rocks, was fun and had live music. I really liked the atmosphere there and it was nice to meet up with friends and colleagues. If you are going for a convention, I highly recommend this hotel, as it is steps from the convention center.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel, great pool, great restaurants and shopping nearby”
Reviews.Author: Lele32
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on a business trip. They have a brand new portion to this hotel. It is one of the largest I have ever stayed in. There was a t.v. built into the bathroom mirror. The pool is really large and beautifull. I would love to bring my family back to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Sales conference for work”
Reviews.Author: LisaEva
Reviews.Content: Just returned from The Peabody Orlando, spending a few days there for a work conference. The conference rooms were great - maybe a little cold for my liking, but it seems like all office/conference rooms are cold to me and not anyone else. The food was good, but the service was GREAT. I was so impressed by how friendly and efficient the entire staff was, My room was comfortable, but the view was rather dull - a tennis court, an extremely large roof and an empty field. If a view is important to you, ask before you book. Some of my coworkers had a pool view and it was very nice (facing the convention center I think). I've never seen a TV in a bathroom mirror (maybe I don't get out much), but I thought it was pretty cool...and I want one of those motion sensored night lights in the bathroom, under the vanity, like I did in my room - very clever! Oh, the housekeeping staff was top notch too! Although 98% of my time was spent all day in conference or dining rooms, I did have a short hour break each day and was able to squeeze in a quick run outside. The Concierge shared a map of different outdoor routes to run and as I ran down International Drive, I was surprised to find so many dining and shopping options, mini golf, Ripley's Believe it or Not Museum and so much more!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel!”
Reviews.Author: shanj6
Reviews.Content: We stopped here 2 weeks over Christmas & New Year to visit the Universal parks with the 6 park ticket. The hotel is AMAZING! It’s very big & glamorous - we were awestruck & mesmerised by the hotel & everyday you could find something new to explore – the decorative is lavish the chandeliers are enchanting . The 1st week was quiet & the 2nd week was busy with Nebraska fans which was fun! Our room was spacious – the views were amazing as we could see out as far as Seaworld!, the beds were very comfortable, the TV in the bathroom mirror was WOW, clean lush towels everyday & it was cleaned every day- only lacking tea/coffee making facility! The staff are very helpful & at the beginning at the day would ask us where we were going & made sure that we know how to get there – specially Manny who was always helpful. The duck parade is adorable! We used the Grotto pool area & it was excellent. We ate at the B-Line Diner & you can also eat locally on International Drive. The drinks at the Bars are reasonable. It has an I-Ride Trolley bus right outside so we had easy access to all the parks - if you get off at stop 7 Universal is a 15 minute walk away - & to the outlets shopping centres. We visited Disney & got a taxi there. It most definitely made our holiday extra special & we hope to go back someday!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice, Clean, Friendly Service”
Reviews.Author: borad
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. Went for business that took place in the adjacent/attached convention center so I'll let others comment on location and proximity to local attractions. The hotel however was quite large - almost Vegas style in dimension and presence. The public areas were very well appointed, contemporarily done, and quite comfortable. My assessments. Lobby/Check-In/Out: A- Very nice, spacious area with marble flooring. The folks at the counter were very helpful, friendly and quick to address your needs. Rooms: B- but might be an B+/A- if I were in a King. The room overall was a bit cramped but again, with double beds that's often the case. The bed itself was very comfortable, plenty of pillows. Nice flat screen TV and free wireless access. On the downside no drinks in the fridge. Typically I couldn't care less about this but in this case I came in late (midnight) and wanted to grab a beer while I was unpacking. You can order things to to room but would have been good to have something readily available. Secondly, the door to the bathroom was situated that getting around it when gaining access to the toilet wasn't a natural move. Again, not a big deal but would expect this to be a non-issue in an A rated room. The shower/tub was large but just above average - not "excellent". The room decor was nice, and well taken care of. Thus the overall rating. On site Dining - A-: I ate primarily at the B-Line which was quick, efficient, and the staff was very friendly. Food was good however the selection was a bit limited. That however isn't a problem since they'll make you pretty much what you ask for. Loved the traditional Lobby bar - adjacent to the light and airy lobby bar. I believe it only opens at night. Was very relaxing. Downside is again a very limited snack menu. Gym B+/A-: Great equipment (If memory serves Cybex), free weights and practically new. The cardio area was in a different room. Again near new equipment and plenty of treadmills for the times I went in. I did hear stories of a line forming in the morning. The gym opens at 6;00 a.m. and closes at 10:00 or 11:00 thus the queue in the morning. They also had a separate area to stretch and mens and women's locker/shower rooms. By most hotel standards this was well above average but the separate rooms and lack of 24 hour availability knocked down my rating a bit. Great place overall. The staff made my stay very comfortable and I'd definitely go here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: AndyRos
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is situated on International Drive - Very Centrally Located - Hotel Staff Excellent and very helpful - be prepared for an extra 10.00 per day service charge but this includes interned , daily newspaper and coffee in the mornings and all local phone calls - a Note ! watch what is a local call , call the operator to make sure , outside local areas are very expensive ....

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel, amazing experience!”
Reviews.Author: moha0018
Reviews.Content: Stayed here recently, this is just an amazing experience. Please ask for a room on a higher floor. Get to the duck ceremony at least 15 minutes ahead or it is hard to see!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SeattleMandM
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 4 nights at the Peabody. The overall experience was very satisfactory. This hotel is huge, but it offers a wonderful array of restaurants, coffee shops, bars and a terrific boutique/convenience store. Our room was tastefully decorated. The bed was very comfortable with cozy linens. The bathroom was lovely too. The TV screen in the mirror was a surprise. We didn't spend a lot of time using it, but what a conversation piece! The hotel is noted for its resident ducks that parade into the lobby each day. We had duck soaps in the shower and "duck butter" at a dinner event we attended. Very cute. The actual location of the Peabody is terrific. It's on International Drive across from the Orlando Convention Center, (also HUGE!). International Drive is filled with shops, restaurants, and all sorts of entertainment. There is a trolley that runs the length of the drive which ends at a high-end outlet mall. The staff was friendly and helpful, from check-in throughout our stay. Kudos to the Peabody Orlando for their first class service in a first class hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Barely average”
Reviews.Author: Innomen
Reviews.Content: I was really underwhelmed by this hotel, but perhaps my expectations were too high. The website has a very nice room featured, but honestly my room was no different than a Holiday Inn. I will say it is gigantic, and if you are having any kind of a function they will be able to accommodate it, but if you are trying to impress someone by the accommodations, you will fall short. Biggest complaint is no coffee in the room. This is a no brainer for any hotel that expects to have a business clientelle and they have nothing except what you will get after you make the trek to the lobby. The internet service was weak and confusing to access. I also found the food, at the little diner in the hotel, to be a bit ridiculous. I understand that it's a hotel and they have inflated prices, but for a salad and a sandwich with a lemonade $38.00 is crazy. I found nothing special about this hotel, and they make so little effort to differentiate themselves from all the other hotels in the area, with the exception of the ducks (which I didn't see, nor really care about).

Reviews.Title: “We had a great time here!”
Reviews.Author: hdl_jb
Reviews.Content: We stayed 9 nights here over Christmas and New Year. Everything in the hotel was open during the Christmas break, so we didn't have to worry about what to eat, what to do, etc. The rooms were quite spacious so 7 people stayed in two rooms. We had to ask for an extra rollaway bed, which cost us $15/night. Valet parking was expensive, but I guess it did give us peace of mind. The hotel was very quiet so we slept very well. The pools were well-maintained too. The only thing I would complain is that we did not have our own coffee machine, so we had to go downstairs and line up to get free coffee. I drink coffee every morning, but having to wake up early (before 8 am) to get my coffee was painful. Other than that, everything else was good.

Reviews.Title: “Newly Remodeled, Clean and Modern”
Reviews.Author: NateJ
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in the past for work before the remodel (it was nice then) so I am acquainted with The Peabody. The remodel is beautiful and somewhat modern. It is very family friendly, but still has space for those on a romantic getaway. What I would suggest against is checking in late. The staff (some of whom where clearly over their threshold for the particular shift at which we checked in) were friendly, but un accommodating as we booked a King size bed room and attempted to put us in a room that had a Murphy double about a foot and a half of the ground that they told us downstairs was a queen! BUT! When I came down the next morning they gladly moved us into a beautiful Junior Suite!!! Gave us Breakfast for our entire stay and covered our parking expenses!! Very Nice. The Junior Suite room views were ridiculously beautiful and the rest of our stay fantastic. The beds are not nearly as comfortable as The Westin Heavenly Bed, but nice.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: JudithCharming
Reviews.Content: Spent 9 nights here over New Year. Room wasn't ready on arrival, so they offered us a superior room which was extremely large, but not a great view. However, the day after they give us an equally large room on the 21st floor with terrific views. Hotel was busy with 'Corn Husker' fans down for the game, but that gave the place lots of atmosphere. The Hotel dd nothing special for New Years Eve, but it did't need to - Rocks bar was buzzing with dancing and a live band, although drinks and bar snacks were expensive. Found the service to be friendly and first class. Napa restaurant is mid-priced but has a nice, relaxed atmosphere. None of the restaurants offered a 'value' breaksfast, so we tended to eat away from the hotel. Only one minor criticism - no coffee-making facility in the room whcih means you either fgot to the coffee shop downstairs, or queue for the slightly hidden away free coffee available from 7-11am, which is a pain to get to first thing from the 21st floor. Coffee etcetera we found expensive and the coffee was cold. A $9 room chargfe covers wireless and downstairs coffee, which is reasonable compared to some hotels. The ducks are a really quaint attraction, incredible to watch The downstairs pool was lovely and warm despite the chilly weather. The upstairs pool was quiet. This hotel is probably more suited to couples than families I think though, so I would go as just the two of us, but The Portofino would be my choice with kids. The location was perfect for both the i-drive and Buena Vista areas. Overall, extremely satisfied and felt I got a real bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Nice facilities, same old service”
Reviews.Author: Harrison F
Reviews.Content: This is the hotel with duck shaped soaps that your grandmother may have in her bathroom. I like the new facilities, the new parking deck, and the architecture of the building. The elevators are quick, and the location is close to the convention center. The parking is over-priced when resorts like Disney charge nothing for parking. This is not the only place where they over-charge. I ordered from Papa Ducks - their pizza joint- and they included the service charges for room service on the bill. It said on the collateral in the room that there were no service charges for items ordered from it. Room service left a table in the hall for over a day at the room across the hall. I complained about it, but management took no action. The restaurant by the pool inside the hotel (Napa I think it was called) is delicious, and it has a great wine selection. I like the television in the mirror in the bathroom. The ducks were okay. This was my second visit to the property.

Reviews.Title: “Ducks, Great Food- Fantastic Value if you book right!”
Reviews.Author: merseydave
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Peabody for five nights over Christmas. This is a great property on International Drive, five minutes from Seaworld. We had booked a club level room via Expedia which worked out as £93 per night. Amazing as the room was fantastic on the 26th floor of the second tower with mirror to ceiling windows and even a TV integrated into the bathroom mirror! On the 26th floor is the club lounge which gave us free breakfast from 0700- 1000, snacks from 1730 – 1930 and complementary deserts from 2030 – 2130. Also as a perk for club guests is free valet parking which should have been $22 per night- so quite a bargain! Highlight at the Peabody is the march of the ducks to and from the duck palace and into the reception fountain. Led by the duck master in red and gold braid its quite a spectacle! We ate Christmas Brunch- book well ahead as its full of locals and we had to wait of a cancelleation the week before. It’ s a fantastic array of foods. Napa restaurant and the B Line diner are also worth a visit. In Rocks lounge and bar they have a fantastic duo playing soul music to set the atmosphere- chilled and sophisticated. A large pool is also available Great staff- highly recomended

Reviews.Title: “Most Memorable Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: Warren75
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were treated like royalty from the moment we arrived on the property. Our bellman was particularly helpful in explaning the view from our room, overlooking the pool from the 31st floor, and some of the highlights in Orlando. All staff were very friendly and helpful. The ducks provided a great diversion in our busy days. Eating in the B-Line was a special treat. The pancakes at breakfast were the best I have ever eaten. Pricey but worth it. All of the amenities of the hotel are first class.

Reviews.Title: “overpriced and overrated”
Reviews.Author: kathrynAberdeen
Reviews.Content: This hotel was nothing special.Our room 21736 was covered in dust, I do not think the room was vacuumed during our 10 night stay. Had to ask for toilet paper,bottled water.(would not mind but when you are being charged a resort fee of ridiculous dollars per day this is unacceptable !) Would never stay there again. This hotel is more of a business travellers place but they are trying to dip into the tourist market too.On the last night of our stay my husband was approached by a hooker (04/01/12) asking if he was looking for a good time ! Disgrace for a top class hotel .Security staff or whoever monitors your monitors need to get a grip.I witnessed the aforementioned hooker entering the lifts at half hour intervals with different men while her friend was pacing the lobby area ,mobile phone in hand ! If your security staff were as vigilant as the valet staff in ripping you off for 22 bucks per day for valet parking then perhaps your resident hookers would dissapear ! I also left a recently purchased jacket in lobby area on our last night ( we were last to go to bed that night! ) .On inquiring at lost and found next day it had not been handed in .Would not recommend this place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Just Ducky”
Reviews.Author: Daredevil3181
Reviews.Content: I have wanted to stay at this hotel for a long while. Located in the perfect area of International Drive between Disney World and Universal Studios, it shines like a beacon from the highway. And if I thought the outside grounds were gorgeous the inside was even better. We were promptly and courteously greeted by the staff to help in the check-in of the room. Self-parking was $12/day in an outside garage with a walkway with minor covering between this and the hotel (only major downside). Our room was spacious and amazing, complete with a TV inside the mirror of the bathroom. We wished there was an exhaust fan for the bathroom but this was a minor problem. Free wi-fi was a plus and I wish more high profile hotels would follow in their footsteps. Bar and food, even in the 24-hour diner, was fantastic. Gym was clean with plenty of machines and weights available for use and an extremely helpful staff. The Peabody ducks were also adorable and put on quite the show...do not miss this if you go! Overall this was a fantastic hotel and I would highly recommend everyone to try this out if able. They periodically have great specials and deals to bring down the cost and even throw in some extras (free self-parking). This is easily the best hotel I have ever stayed at in the Orlando area and I can't wait to return on future trips.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: puffcandy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is absolutely beautiful, from the moment you walk into the lobby until you get to your room, everything is amazing. Our only gripe was having to pay for parking, we have never had to do this before at any other resort and because we were there for 3 weeks we ended up paying nearly $500 for parking and resort fee, this is the only reason we would not stay at this hotel again as we like to rent a car to get about in. Special thanks to Marshall who goes beyond the call of duty to make your stay welcome. The Cullens

Reviews.Title: “"quack"ingly good time :)”
Reviews.Author: sineadandbrendan2011
Reviews.Content: stayed here on first leg of our honeymoon, stayed 6 nights in total on the 22nd floor. very well located for seaworld, aquatica, universal studios and islands of adventure, not sure about other theme parks because these are the only ones we went too. also ideally located for shopping malls/premium outlets. the staff were helpful and friendly and we experienced no difficulties in this department. we ate once or twice in the b line diner, no complaints with the food but not a destination for a special meal...capriccio restaurant had fantastic food and amazing selection of wines along with a very helpful and friendly waiter. our room was ridiculously big and had two walls of solid glass overlooking orlando.. nice comfy bed and large bathroom. ohhhhhh the ducks!!!! smashing, a unique selling point in itself. brings echoes of ohhhh and ahhhh from guests along with laughter and giggles, really is fun and interesting to see.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Good”
Reviews.Author: RichmondLily
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here over the New Year weekend. We were there to enjoy each other and the FL weather. I have no idea about convenience to parks and attractions, so if that's what you're looking for, this review won't be of much help. We had a basic room in the older tower of the hotel. Rooms: Our room was spacious, comfortable and nicely appointed. The beds were very comfortable. There are automatic lights under nightstands and in the bathroom which are incredibly helpful at night. The shower was also large with good water pressure. The view was overlooking the "normal" pool. Restaurants: We ate at the B-line diner. The Cobb salad is awesome. The burger was a frozen meat patty, overcooked and had no flavor. I did like the fries though. We also ate at Napa and were underwhelmed. Finally, we ate at the Italian steakhouse and were also underwhelmed. In fact, at the steakhouse, our waitress was lucky. She said hello and then we never saw her again. Others took up her slack and took care of us. Pool: We went to the pool right outside our tower. There were plenty of seats and it was quiet. A nice place to read a book. They could do with some service out by the pool. It would have made it a nicer experience, but it didn't detract from my relaxation. The bar there, which opens at 5pm, was a good place to sit and enjoy a really good beer. They have a good selection and the bartenders were very nice. Other - Our check in went very smoothly. There was no line and we were checked in quickly. We stopped at the concierge and he was useless. Absolutely useless. We tried to book appointments at the spa, but they didn't answer the phone. The store in the hotel is well stocked, but it's sooooo overpriced. There's a Walgreens right down International drive. Go there to get your sodas or water. I felt violated. The wifi was spotty. Be prepared. GO - to Oceanaire restaurant. It was great. Good service, amazing and fresh seafood and Scallops that made me want to cry. The Tommy Bahama restaurant had a good lunch menu and they had a Grilled chicken salad that was amazing and also truly wonderful fish tacos.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jacobian
Reviews.Content: I received top-notch service from the moment I called the hotel directly to make my reservation, until the moment I left the hotel. This is an exquisite hotel with all of the bells and whistles--gorgeous gym, lovely spa including the retail section, wonderful, helpful staff, lots of restaurants, a beautifully landscaped pool with a jacuzzi, kiddie pool and slide, and towel hut with a pool restaurant. The hotel stores are very reasonable and have beautiful merchandise. They offer a reasonably priced shuttle service that they use to go to the parks and this gorgeous hotel is well- organized, and totally professional. There is a trolley line right outside the hotel that goes up and down International Drive and for $1.25 one way (free for children with one paying adult), you can't beat the prices. The hotel parking is reasonable. This hotel offers incredible value for what you get. The beds were incredibly comfortable, with a pillow top mattress and great pillows. If you need a very firm mattress, you may not like the bed. The sheets were clean and crisp. This is a non-smoking hotel, so there were no unpleasant smells (I detest cigarette and cigar smoke) except in the outdoor pool area and when you walk outside of the hotel. I think the hotel should have a strict policy about smoking outside on the premises. The chain smokers make it smell like stinky bars and nightclubs. I had a salad at the pool restaurant and it was huge and delicious and not unreasonably priced, considering the ingredients. The bathrooms were spacious. I had a regular room with two queen beds in the newest part of the hotel, and the towels were of very good quality, but nevertheless, the exfoliating kind. Ha! Ha! The bathroom amenities were Gilchrist and Soames lotion, shampoo and conditioner and the trademark duck soap for the bathtub. The bathtub was double wide, the hot water was always available and the water pressure was perfect. The bathroom fixtures were Kholer, with granite counter tops, a lighted make up mirror and great lighting. The toilet was very quiet. We never heard any noises from other guests except through the walls of the bathroom--the guest next door was a very loud talker. The remote-controlled tv in the mirror in the bathroom was funny. It always worked and my child enjoyed watching cartoons in there. The shower curtain was great, it was clean and I really wanted to buy one to take home. The cleanliness of the room was above average but not immaculate, as others have stated. There was dust on the back of the base of the table lamp on the nightstand and behind the nightstand mainly, but the bathroom always appeared to be spotless (my main concern) as well as the counter surfaces of the room. The floor to ceiling window was spotless. The refrigerator was stocked daily with two bottles of water that were paid for with the resort fee. I really loved this hotel and won't stay anywhere else when visiting Orlando. It was convenient to the parks, quiet and luxurious without breaking the bank. Also, my husband left his prescription glasses and they have an amazing lost and found service that fed ex'd them to our house. I called the day that we left the hotel when my husband discovered them missing and the hotel worked it all out quickly and efficiently. The management is fabulous from start to finish and it trickles down to the fabulous staff who are friendly and approachable at all times! Great job Peabody Orlando! I highly recommend this beautiful property.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel... but the staff is not up to the task.”
Reviews.Author: R F
Reviews.Content: The Peabody Hotel in Orlando is a beautiful property with some great amenities. Unfortunately, the staff is not up to the challenge of running a quality hotel. For a hotel that advertises itself as perfect for special events, meetings, and conventions, the Peabody Orlando’s staff was ill-prepared to handle the Holiday crowd at the end of 2011. Upon arriving at the Peabody on December 29th, we found that the staff had allowed 500 guests to check out late that day. This created a wait for in-coming guests, and despite the fact that we arrived at after 6:00 PM, our room was not ready. We were not the only party with this problem, and dozens of travel weary guests dotted the lobby waiting for their rooms. This issue continued during the next few days and I spoke to many guests who had to wait for their rooms as they attempted to check-in. The next morning we left to visit the theme parks at 7:00 AM. When we arrived at our room at 6:00 PM that night we found that housekeeping had neglected to visit the room. Tired, and needing to hurry to make our 8:00 PM dinner reservations, I was made to wait at the front desk for twenty minutes to speak to a manger. The room was finally cleaned, and after some discussion a credit courtesy was extended, but the inconvenience was suffered. I was assured by the manager that this mistake would not be repeated. The next day we left our room at 11:00 AM. The housekeeping staff was in the room next door and we bid them good morning as we departed. Upon our return at 5:00 PM… you guessed it… no housekeeping staff had visited our room. This time I was made to wait at the front desk for twenty-five minutes as the stupefied front desk person called the housekeeping manager. As I stood there, I spoke to a poor woman who had been waiting in the lobby for her room which was not ready, in spite of the fact that it was well past check-in time. The housekeeping manger was very nice, and very apologetic, but she had no idea why the room had not been visited by her staff. After demanding a straight answer she simply advised that, “We are very busy.” Again, my family had to leave the room as the staff hurried to correct their mistake. Another courtesy was extended, and another inconvenience was endured. As I mentioned at the top of the review, this hotel is beautiful. The rooms, lobby area, pools, and restaurants are very nice, and I have no issues with the property itself. If the staff ever gets it's act together and learns how to handle their establishment during peak periods the Peabody will be an exceptional destination. For now, the hotel staff is operating at a sub-par level which is holding back this property from achieving its true potential.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Ameneties”
Reviews.Author: ChaShu
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel once before four years ago and we had already found it excellent. We went back this past December and found that they had added to the hotel. We stayed in the new tower and the rooms were excellent. The staff were very friendly and helpful, even when delivering our late night meal. If you will be in the Orlando tourist area, I would very much recommend this hotel if you wish to be pampered!

Reviews.Title: “Feel Special in a Wonderful Setting”
Reviews.Author: lharding456
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent three nights here for a Christmas "staycation" and stayed on the Club level. The room was lovely with details all the way down to the motion sensor night light underneath the bathroom vanity and TV built into the bathroom mirror!! They have a magnitified makeup mirror, good sized widescreen TV in the room, small table with two chairs, and floor to ceiling window in the room. The Club Lounge is nice although the complimentary breakfasts had too many children being allowed to dash about throughout the room for my taste. Also, if you don't like feather pillows, take your own! They do not have any foam pillows.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ruxandra M
Reviews.Content: The Peabody Orlando is a very nice hotel. Our stay was comfortable and there's several nice places to eat in the hotel. It's also conveniently located. We only had a small problem with one of the concierges who booked something incorrectly for us.

Reviews.Title: “Oh my!!!”
Reviews.Author: jewliana
Reviews.Content: My husband surprised me with a night in a club level room at the Peabody! They gave us a corner room with wrap around floor to ceiling windows. Every thing was beyond perfect! From the helpfullness and friendliness of the employees to having lighting brighten your path from under the bedside table if you happen to get up during the night to the high def TV built right into the bathroom mirror. Every luxury you can imagine...club level elevators access only by your room card, club level lounge with appetizers in the evening then a wonderous breakfast in the am. I cannot rave enough. You should not miss a chance to stay here if you are in the area!

Reviews.Title: “Great place, a lot of extra costs.”
Reviews.Author: Triglove
Reviews.Content: Great place, a lot of extra costs. Staff is extremely pleasant & helpful. Beautiful place and huge! Great proximity to trolley & Seaworld.

Reviews.Title: “Peabody for the Holidays”
Reviews.Author: Fauner1
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful property! We went to Orlando for the weekend and The Peabody was offering some great winter rates, so we decided to give it a try. So glad we did! The MArch of the Ducks was cool to see and the kids enjoyed it. We saw both the 11 am and 5 pm march. THe staff was very friendly and helpful, property nicely decorated, and very clean. We chose to self park which was a little walk, but we like to be able to get to our car whenever. I think it was $12.00 a day. THe parking garage was huge and easy to use. The only thing I did not like was the B-Line cafe. Food was not that good and was very expensive...I expected more...(but again, staff was amazing!) Would we go back??? YES!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Kim M
Reviews.Content: Great hotel! Great location with lots of restaurants close by. The pool is awesome with a separate area for kids. Even though our room was supposed to have a king bed..I am not sure if this is a king size...feels like a queen. The duck parade everyday is a special treat for kids and the family. Pointe Orlando is a 5 minute walk from the property and you also have lots of restaurants very close by. Will stay again....but this time have to check the size of the bed! :-)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic will stay again”
Reviews.Author: UkField
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from orlando and the Peabody, we stayed on the 27th floor in tower 2 for a week, the room was spotless, the staff were great very friendly and always helpfull. We stayed on the club floor (27th) and enjoyed the lovely club lounge (26th floor), with lovely snacks and food and lovely staff. I have absolutely nothing negative to say about the hotel at all. We have stayed in many hotels over the last 22 years in orlando and its the first time we have stayed here, this has now become our favourite and we will be returning, we have favourite hotels in many places in the US its nice to finally find one in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Great Anniversary Weekend”
Reviews.Author: FLMarine89
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I booked a Metropolitan Suite for two nights to celebrate an anniversary and loved everything. The service staff was incredibly friendly and helpful, in all areas, and the room was absolutely incredible. The view off the balcony was gorgeous, showing us both the hotel grounds as well as the nicely-lit parts of Orlando. We were able to watch the Disney fireworks and a few moments later the SeaWorld fireworks and light show. The floor-to-ceiling windows offered an exceptional experience, allowing us a view over a beautiful nighttime skyline from our bed. We treated ourselves to a 50-minute couples massage at the spa ($125/ea) and were granted access to the private hot tubs and steam rooms. The second day we had some friends over and spent the day in the pools and checking out Pointe Orlando, a 5 minute walk from the hotel. An overall amazing experience and we plan to be back next year for an even better weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel”
Reviews.Author: Martino52
Reviews.Content: Stayed on the Peabody Club floor - 27th floor. Great views across Orlando, including the Disney or Seaworld fireworks at night. Superb room. Impressed with the bathroom TV in the mirror! The club lounge with breakfast, snacks, deserts and bar is a very good touch, along with included (for club floor) valet parking and wifi. Staff friendly but unobtrusive. 24 hour diner style restaurant is very good. Haven't tried the fine dining restaurant yet. Lobby area was slightly noisy on a Friday night with various events, but not unpleasantly or intolerably so. Ducks are everywhere, and the real ones very cute! Very convenient for the convention center across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Much more than a business hotel - deserves to be ranked higher”
Reviews.Author: Toaster803
Reviews.Content: For any Orlando convention attendee this has to be your first choice. Vast, but comfortable and immaculately run, it is far and away the best option 'on site'. And whilst I didn't sample all the delights it looks like a good base for family too if they are doing the usual attractions (while you work to pay for it....) I will be booking in for next year's event.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven!!”
Reviews.Author: InternationalJunkie
Reviews.Content: The best service!! Great food options (a little pricy) & bar (limited hours). The rooms have a great tub & wonderful beds! I loved the separate vanity in the room. Fridge came in handy with the kids - so did the tennis court. Parking is expensive ($12 self park) considering it's not connected to the hotel (it was raining a lot during our stay which is unusual for Orlando) but overall a wonderful stay & not far from Disney (you do have to pay the toll but that's FL)

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant ,comfortable stay.”
Reviews.Author: travlife
Reviews.Content: The Peabody added a new tower. They now have 1600+ rooms. We chose the club level because with the parking fee included and the breakfast,cocktail hour food and deserts it was a pretty good choice economically.The breakfast was cold cereals,juice,fresh fruits,cold cuts,bagels,pastries,cheeses,coffee,tea,hot chocolate and whole fruits ie oranges,banannas,apples.On Sunday lox was servedl.The happy hour foods were quite substantial.Chicken roulade,bruchetta,cheeses etc. Sodas and bottled water were available during the open hours of the lounge. Fee for wine and alcohol.We never made it for desert.I know some people in our group made the happy hour food their dinner. We were attending a meeting in the hotel. The banquet service was extremely rushed. They were serving people at our table as soon as they finished a course,while the other people were still on the previous course. The desert was on the table when we sat down and was pushed over to us as soon as we finished our entree. I guess they were in a major hurry to get out of the dining room. Very very unpleasant. The room was large,bed comfortable ,though our sheets were Not changed on the third day. Did I count wrong? I would put my little card out on my pillow ,don't depend on them automatically being changed. Bathroom with a tub shower. New wing, Hey go for the separate shower stall and tub... No amenities. Qtips,cotton balls,sewing kit. Liked the vanity shelf. Nice touch. TV in the mirror. Seems to be the latest in hotel bathroooms now. Room TV was quite good HD. Some lower priced movies. Nice choice. Floor to ceiling windows,our view was nothing to write home about. Staff very welcoming,friendly. Decor pretty blah, not to my liking.Busy hotel,close to the convention center. Shuttles for malls,convention center,I drivel.Close to Pointe Orlando,large movie complex,restaurants,some shops.Could not believe no free Wi Fi in the hotel lobby . $9+ for it in the room . Unreal in 2011.

Reviews.Title: “A First Class Experience”
Reviews.Author: diningboy
Reviews.Content: This past weekend, my wife and I stayed at the Peabody Hotel in Orlando on business, What was impressive, from the beginning, were courteous valets, competent conciergies, and an array of roving hotel representatives who were quick to spot a confused guest. The lobby was gorgeous and quite spacious which quickly placed the patron in a resort hotel worthy of it's name. The room was "ahead of the curve," so to say, with technology allowing hidden nightlights to peek out from under the furniture activated by a sleepy guest who may have forgotten the location of the nearest lamp! The experience of staying at his hotel was special. It's location allowed us to entertain a wide variety of both on-site and off-site dining and recreational options only to be further enhanced by an eager staff, most willing, to insure that access and availability was sure to happen.

Reviews.Title: “Upscale, Beautiful Hotel, with a catch*”
Reviews.Author: MiamiDaddy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Peabody twice in 2011--a family trip and business trip. I was recommending this hotel wholeheartedly to friends and colleagues for years as one of the upscale destination resorts in Orlando. Most of the staff are friendly, helpful and the lobby, rooms and pool are well maintained. However, on the afternoon of December 4th I was taking pictures and about to use my video camera in this beautiful hotel. I was confronted and hassled by a "Floor Manager." He told me I was not allowed to use my camera in a public space in the hotel without prior permission from the management. [!] "J.T" explained that they are trying to protect what's "out there" about the hotel. I asked to speak to a supervisor, but it was a Sunday afternoon and no one was there who could help me. So I complied, but it left me feeling harassed and upset. I hope this is an isolated incident. I'm posting this here as a warning to anyone who plans to bring a camera along on their stay at the Peabody Orlando. ***I've also stayed at other upscale resorts in Orlando and never been hassled. These include: The Grande Lakes Ritz Carlton & J.W. Marriott (both on same property) http://www.ritzcarlton.com/en/Properties/Orlando/Default The Hilton Orlando Bonnet Creek (inside Disney World) http://www.hiltonbonnetcreek.com/hotel (My kids both loved these two hotels because they have a lazy river around their pools). If you're on business at the Orange County Convention Center, the Peabody is right across the street. Just as convenient is a Hilton also across the street (and only two years old--so everything is brand new): http://www1.hilton.com/en_US/hi/hotel/ORLOCHH-Hilton-Orlando-Florida/index.do Hope this review is helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Made our honeymoon perfect”
Reviews.Author: angel_pie141
Reviews.Content: The hotel was beautiful. The room was beautiful. We had a beautiful corner room on the club level in the new building. The pool was awesome and made us feel just a relaxing vacation! We stayed at the peabody for almost 3 weeks as the last part of our honeymoon. The view from our room was spectacular. The staff took care of us well and made sure we enjoyed our honeymoon stay. We had a little complication during our long stay (one of the nights) but the manager on duty (Liza) took care of us well with a little something to compensate us which made us feel warm and cared for. We also loved our breakfast (complimentary since we stayed in a club level room). The food selection were very generous and good quality food! There were practically no complains except for the carpet...we stayed there for 3 weeks but the carpet seemed not vacuumed through our whole stay. The reason we knew this was because we dropped some crust and crums on the floor on the 2nd/3rd day of our stay and it stayed on our floor till the day we left. Also we wore slippers in the room...the soles of our slippers were extremely dark from walking on the carpet. There was also one night where we came back to our room with our curtain broken and left broken for some reason till we called maintenance to fix for us... Other than that, this hotel was wonderful. Definitely miss it a lot. Keep in mind we stayed for a long time so experiencing a few "oops" is understandable (at least for us it was.) We loved staying at Peabody Orlando! BTW great location!! Lots of restaurant selections nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel, amazing experience”
Reviews.Author: danieldotcom
Reviews.Content: It's not usual to find a real 5-star hotel with 5-star service unless you leave your wallet on the desk. We arrived at Peabody with the expectations of a simple room but we couldn't believe it from the very first moment. First, before checking in, the clerk offered us to choose rooms with great views. Second, the room itself was great (very nice tv, embedded in the bathroom mirror, for example). Third, the service was really first class, having strawberries and chocolates upon arrival and chill-out music and the housecoats on the bed every night. Facilities are impressive, with a very nice swimming pool and shops in the ground-level floor. The staff was very friendly and made us feel very comfortable. I really look forward to stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Ducktacular!”
Reviews.Author: browneyebeauty
Reviews.Content: Everything was superb! The only complaint was the rooms were very DUSTY! The maid would come in and clean daily, we stayed over a week, but by 8pm, the room was filled with dust again. Even in the bathroom, the scale was never cleaned and when I went to weigh our suitcases...it was caked in dust! Kinda gross but over all the entire stay (over a week) was superb!!! BLine Express was soo good! Once, the cashier forgot our one dessert, when I got back up to the room, I realized and as I was putting on my shoes to go down to get the other dessert, she called the room and said she forgot it by mistake and asked if I would come down to get it....when I got down there, she actually gave me another one for the mistake. Great customer service!!!

Reviews.Title: “Surprising elegance on International Drive...”
Reviews.Author: Jane C
Reviews.Content: After staying in the Memphis Peabody several years a go, I had the opportunity to stay at the Orlando Peabody on a business trip recently. P-Orlando has a modern elegance with marble and glass that the P-Memphis has in history and ornate woods. I was impressed with the service from the moment I drove up to valet my car to room check in. Totally professional and accommodating to any service need. You will be truly captivated by the historical "March of the Ducks" along with the charming Duckmaster Donald. Rooms are well appointed, modern and total duck experience from the soaps to pillow cases. There is motion sensor lighting in the bathroom and nightstands which is a very nice amenity. Connected to the convention center and convenient to downtown, all Disney parks, restaurants and entertainment. Lovely place to stay...

Reviews.Title: “Just ducky!”
Reviews.Author: mizeb
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful experience - huge hotel with gorgeous spaces and the famous ducks marching down a red carpet at 11 am to the main lobby fountain. Be sure to call and ask for best rates- aarp, aaa, etc. We were able to get more than $100 off on a weeknight.

Reviews.Title: “A bit impersonal, otherwise OK”
Reviews.Author: SayafK
Reviews.Content: My wife, daughter, a friend and his family and I recently stayed at the Peabody Orlando for a quick getaway thanksgiving weekend 2011. After a couple u-turns trying to find the proper entrance (a couple of very large driveways around the building lead to various convention centers/meeting areas) we finally did, and were prompted by the very efficient valet to surrender the car ($20 daily :(). Self parking is available, but parking lot a bit of a walk (esp. for non-walking older folks). Lobby is HUGE, impressive, clean but cold and impersonal (Super Hotel style designed for large crowds). Check in was uneventful and efficient.... The room was well spaced and although furniture was adequate and appropriate in size style and comfort (very comfortable/clean beds and comforters), it did lack a few things (IMHO). First, there was no coffee maker, and considering the inclusion of Hotel breakfast would have added $90/day, an avid morning coffee drinker (myself included) who does not want to overspend for breakfast in a town were most Hotels include it in the rates, would have to dart and sprint to the coffee shop past the lobby for the morning Joe. Secondly, the toiletries were very basic (only shampoo/conditioner, soap and lotion offered) in the otherwise VERY IMPRESSIVE bathroom (automatic motion-detecting night lights, IN MIRROR TV and over sized soaking tub in shower). Thermostat was stuck on AC but was fixed w/in 15 min. after a maintenance call at midnight. Pool area appeared fantastic! Wished we had time to indulge :(. All in all, it was an OK experience, but nothing stood out as exceptional. Wouldn't mind staying here again, but with the competition being so fierce in a town known for Hospitality/Tourism, we would probably opt for diff. lodging next time around. Hope this helps! Happy and safe travels!

Reviews.Title: “HEAVEN ON EARTH!”
Reviews.Author: Dreamscape11
Reviews.Content: It doesn't get any better than this, kept saying to myself what can I do to become a permanent resident! The room was the size of a small condo located on the 29th flr with a corner location & 4 walls of ceiling to floor glass. Facing International drive & the pool areas we could see Orlando for miles. There just aren't enough words to describe the outstanding decor! Also enjoyed Thanksgiving at the B-line diner which was exceptional & couldn't ask for a better waitress.From the front desk, concierge, housekeeping & parking attendant we always felt welcome!

Reviews.Title: “Another Fantastic Experience at the Peabody Orlando”
Reviews.Author: TDoug38
Reviews.Content: My favorite hotel in Orlando is the Peabody. We stayed 3 nights in the new tower on the 17th floor from 11/18-21/11. The view was great. However, I must confess my favorite thing about the room, was the tv in the bathroom mirror. Wow!!! I've from my very first experience(2003) at the "P" been a loyal guest. After over a one year hiatus, I'm back. Everyone we encountered was genuinely nice, accommodating, and personable. The parking garge is very close to the hotel, so self parking wasn't an issue at all. Mr.Kelberman thank you. We will be returning in the very near future. The new tower is amazing, but I highly suspect the original is also.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury near the convention center”
Reviews.Author: NYCtraveler319
Reviews.Content: Don't be put off by the location near the convention center and the massive, sprawling lobby and grounds. The staff goes out of their way to be friendly and helpful, the restaurants are delicious (if a bit overpriced), and the rooms are luxurious without being stuffy. I highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, up there with the best”
Reviews.Author: gabrielle_316
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a holiday to Orlando and I cannot recommend this hotel enough. From arriving at the hotel (a special mention must go to Ryan at the front desk who was an absolute star) to the day we left we had such a good time. The hotel not only caters for the conference 'set' but also for people on holiday. The place is immaculate, the rooms superb and the amenities second to none. As somebody mentioned earlier, it is comparable (if not better) to the hotels that are on offer in Vegas. I will be back and this time for longer than the 10 days I was there for the last time.

Reviews.Title: “A First Class Experience”
Reviews.Author: robinstrapp Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The Peabody is a superb hotel oozing style and quality. It's just off International Drive and across the road from the Convention Centre. It's a large hotel but the service is superb. My room on the 10th floor overlooked the pool area which is vast and well maintained. It was large with a most comfortable king bed, spotlessly clean with some nice touches like a television built into the bathroom mirror and a small duck shaped soap by the bath. Of course The Peabody is famous for the march of the ducks a 11.am and this tradition should not be missed it's great fun for adults as well as kids. The B line cafe offers good value food with some great service and the major feature of the hotel was the attention to detail and the ease of gaining information all with a big smile! Car parking is on site and is easily accessed. Universal Studios is a short seven minute drive away - don't miss the Harry potter experience and the other theme parks are near by. There are good local restaurants nearby and although the hotel was exceedingly busy with conferences you never felt overwhelmed by people. I would highly recommend this hotel and look forward to returning again soon. It's a little oasis in the mad cap world of Orlando. Excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Very big but great location for convention”
Reviews.Author: seashore1826
Reviews.Content: It is very nice lobby bar and swimming ducks each day is cute. Place is huge now but so convient when attending a trade show

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: BobbyGolfs
Reviews.Content: Had a great experience. I was there for a convention. I was impressed that even the lunch food was excellent! Great rooms with all the amenities plus. I usually don't pay much attention to the doormen and bell service, but they seemed to go out of their way to anticipate my needs even before i realized I had a need. We arranged for golf and they took care of absolutely everything including transport, pickup, club transfer, cart procurement, etc.....I am hopeful that I can attend other conventions there!

Reviews.Title: “fabulous”
Reviews.Author: motherwellgirl
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for the Zumba convention in July and you would not get this kind of service or the price in a UK hotel. The staff were more than helpful. I only ate a couple of times in the hotel, it is not as cheap as places outside but that is optional. Tried both swimming pools. Only sorry I cannot afford to go back or I would be back this year for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Just short of excellent”
Reviews.Author: dolphoto
Reviews.Content: There are many good points about the Peabody. My room was beautiful and had great touches like motion-sensitive night lights. The call from the front desk to make sure everything was OK was thoughtful. The vanity-like ledge in the bathroom was a nice touch. There's a nice sense of humor about the place, possibly linked to having a small family of ducks as the star attraction. At the same time, the hotel fell short in several ways. As others have mentioned, the hotel is huge and it can be a very long trip from a hotel room to a meeting room. Conference meals were some of the least impressive I've had. I was charged $5 for "delivery" of a package that I had to go to the business center to pick up. Although the manager removed the charge immediately when I complained, both the charge and the "it's not our fault, it's a 3rd party" response greatly lowered my opinion of the property.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: beweiss6
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very nice. I was there on a business trip so I didn't get to see everything but will go back for personal use. First class place.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: gurfinkel
Reviews.Content: Our family (2 adults/2 kids) were in town for National Electronic Home show and stayed for 4 nights. We had to make changes to our room upon arrival and it was NO PROBLEM. The staff, the room, the location all combined to give us a wonderful experience. I could walk to Walgreens (very helpful when traveling with children) and many restaurants so the location was perfect The pool area is EXCELLENT. Of course the cafe prices are outrageous, but that is to be expected.

Reviews.Title: “Very large convention hotel, appropriate for business, but not for typical Orlando vacation”
Reviews.Author: russr
Reviews.Content: Just spent 3 days here and this place reminds me of the large hotels in Las Vegas for sheer size and diversity. From my room in Tower 1 to the conference area is a good 10-15 minute hike. Having said this, the hotel is well cared for and isn't overwhelming in terms of people and noise. My hotel room was very nice and comfortable with a very high quality Panasonic flat screen plasma TV. The only real issue is the adjoining room door. It absolutely transmits voices from the room next door. My neighbor is currently on the phone and it is almost as if he is in the room with me with virtually no sound insulation. It's not been a problem because I have spent so little time in my room, but it could be distressing if I had been trying to sleep late.

Reviews.Title: “great for a conference”
Reviews.Author: spaige1218
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay if you have a conference at the convention center. It is literally across the street. The pool area is beautiful, the beds are extremely comfortable and the concierge staff were very helpful. Only complaint was the lack of a coffee maker in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Who gives a duck!”
Reviews.Author: ivoroloughlin
Reviews.Content: This is a fabulous hotel. It has all that you would expect from a large upmarket hotel but the added attraction is of course the Peabody Ducks. What a spectacle.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay~”
Reviews.Author: je1058
Reviews.Content: In Orlando for a conference? Then this is where you'll want to stay!! Great restaurants, food, bars, service rooms and the grounds (pool, etc) are also amazing! Plus, it's right across the street from the convention center, connected via a walkway. Great restaurants in the area too! The Peabody "Dream Bed" is AMAZING!!

Reviews.Title: “We love The Peabody”
Reviews.Author: Whitby1964
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at The Peabody before, but not since the HUGE new extension. This time we stayed on the first and last nights of a Florida tour. The first night was better than the last as it was very quiet, so the staff had time (on the last night the hotel was full due to a conference and the staff seemed under pressure). The only reason I have said 4* rather than 5* was the ridiculously expensive coffee option in the morning and the mix up over our final bill which took an age to sort and put us under pressure to get to the airport. However, we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: sfirch
Reviews.Content: Very relaxing and enjoyable place to stay...Everyone was wonderful from the bellmen, to the front desk, to the overall hotel staff. The room was perfect, no complaints; beds were cozy and plenty of room. We had a beautiful view of the pool area. Used the fitness area which had a variety of machines and other items...went to the spa and had a relaxing massage, very pampering. I would definitely recommend this hotel for any type of stay!

Reviews.Title: “Meh... I was disappointed”
Reviews.Author: TravelingJonesy
Reviews.Content: Having stayed there in 2004, I was excited to return, but disappointed in their renovations. Seems like a downgrade from "luxury" to "business class" and slightly dysfunctional at that. Last time, I was in the original hotel and this time in Tower 2, so that might make a difference, but last time, it seemed MUCH more luxurious than this time around. I had trouble with my in-room safe upon arrival (promptly fixed) and didn't get a WiFi signal at all the first night, then a weak one on subsequent nights (I was there for 4.. for a conference). In the renovation, they did away with in-room coffeemakers and put in empty refrigerators (except for a couple bottles of water), with "feed the fridge" option from room service (overpriced and not too varied). They also added "electric mirrors" in the bathrooms.... mirrors with TVs embedded. Big whoop. The one in my room picked up about 5 channels. The room TV was better, but not by a landslide... very limited cable options, plus overpriced movies. Although I'm not a coffee drinker, I'd have preferred a coffeemaker to the newer amenities, as I'd have had the option to brew some tea without having to get dressed and go down to the lobby to get it. Heard the same complaint (only louder) from the coffee drinkers. Very dumb idea, they said... plus there's a surcharge to get the lobby coffee anyway. Really dumb. It's a huge hotel and connected to the convention center across the street, so one can walk to that without going outside, if desired. Their conference center facilities is what my group used. Nice, but nothing special, really. They placed glasses and water urns at the back of the rooms instead of having pitchers on the tables with glasses, as most other conference centers do. Same with pens and "paper" (actually little note cards). For the price, it was, again, disappointing. The first glass of water I got tasted like the urn had been used for coffee in the recent past, also... blech! Apparently, not well cleaned.. blech again! All in all, it's still a very nice hotel. The ducks are fun to watch. The restaurants in it have good food and service. The staff is friendly. The rooms are nice, clean and well kept. However, as I said earlier, I'd call it overpriced business class now instead of luxury...for Tower 2, at least. Probably won't return, unless a conference is there again and the boss picks up the tab. Maybe not even then. A colleague from another company stayed a mile away, took a taxi daily and still saved her boss over $125 daily... plus had a coffeemaker. I may do likewise in the future and would've done this time, if I had known what I now know. One item there I'd rate as excellent was room service breakfast. It was very hot and delivered very promptly the one day (my last there) I ordered. I was impressed with it, though it, too was quite expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel choice if attending a conference”
Reviews.Author: marintvlr
Reviews.Content: My initial impression was poor as the bellman ignored our group as we exited a taxi. However, the room, location and comfort of the room soon eased any initial misgivings. Room type: deluxe king on 22nd floor of the new tower Pros: Very comfortable bed Spacious bathroom with nice sized tub and excellent water pressure Quiet room - can't hear anything from adjoining rooms Heating and air con was excellent Good amount of drawer space Cons: Inconsistent housekeeping Carpet seemed run down No coffee/tea making facilities in the room Resort fee

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel bad customer service”
Reviews.Author: joanac2411
