Reviews.Content: the hotel is super nice location is excellent rooms are awesome everything about the hotel is super nice except for the people that work there i mean i reserved a suite so when the day came to check in they told me the hotel was completely full and that it will take a little time to get my suite clean up! so it took 4 to 5 hours for them to clean the suite really? and when i asked they would just be completely rude! also the air conditioner doesn't get too cold! i didn't like the customer service at all deff not going back there i rather stay at the ritz carlto or jw marriot.

Reviews.Title: “Turn down that muzak!!”
Reviews.Author: Radler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Peabody Orlando in August 2011. It is a GIGANTIC hotel - you sort of feel lost inside it. However, everything about it is top class: the rooms, the pools, the lobby, the ducks!! We didn't eat their so I cannot comment on that. The location is also good for all attractions. You can even walk to many restaurants on I-Drive. My only small criticism is the poolside muzak - it stays on all night. As I was jet lagged I woke up on a couple of mornings at 4am and I could clearly hear music. I thought it was a nearby nightclub but it turned out to be the pool area below our room. I didn't make too much of a fuss about it as I began to sleep later and later each morning. All in all I would recommend the Peabody and would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “One of Orlando's finest”
Reviews.Author: codysmomnow
Reviews.Content: The Peabody Orlando is quite a place to stay while in Orlando for a convention. The hotel has everything you need to make your business meeting a wonderful experience. The rooms are very well equipped with the little extra amenities. There is a bathroom TV, great refrigerator filled with goodies, and bathrobes for your comfort. The "March of the Peabody Ducks" is something to see. Be there!!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Service!”
Reviews.Author: SallyMaeMom
Reviews.Content: Always had a wonderful experience at your hotel. The JW management should learn from your staff how to treat guests! Will be visiting you again next time!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location, Poor Quality Housekeeping”
Reviews.Author: retinadoc52
Reviews.Content: We booked a suit for five days. The purpose of our trip was to attend a convention and spend a day with our children at Universal Studios. The rooms are large and nice, and the location is just across from the convention center. The only complaint is regarding the housekeeping. There is very poor quality control. Amenities were often not refurbished, laundry slips were not replaced. They do not supply electric kettles or coffe and tea in the room. When we emailed the management they promptly supplied us with a coffee maker and coffee as well as bath gel and shower cap.

Reviews.Title: “A very good hotel, one of my favorite business trip hotels.”
Reviews.Author: SawtoothinAmsterdam
Reviews.Content: Excellent beds and sleep quality, comfortable rooms, good service, no nickel & diming. Efficient staff and nice architecture.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous facility - delightful service...”
Reviews.Author: hollibird
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Peabody for a conference and found the hotel and conference facility to far exceed my expectations. The hotel is fully of lovely details: TV embedded in the bathroom mirror, separate vanity with seating for applying make up, small refrigerator, etc. When I checked in , the gentleman at the desk (I wish I had his name!), was great...he made sure I was located closer to the conference facilities, and ensured I had a room overlooking the fireworks at Disney! I will tell you that I thought the Peabody duck thing sounded a bit odd, but they were absolutely adorable. I'd love to come back to Orlando and stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not a luxury property- ok for a convention center hotel.”
Reviews.Author: PENSAC0LA
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the concierge level twice recently. This hotel does conventions ok, but stay away otherwise. They're simply not a luxury property.

Reviews.Title: “Kudos!!!!”
Reviews.Author: terps3
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Peabody Orlando for three nights, as part of a company trip. We had a fantastic time and have only the best things to say about the property and its staff. Location is great, easy to walk to lots of restaurants and shops. The pool was lovely. Of course, it poured most of the time we were there. We did manage to find a nook by the hot tub that protected us from the wind one afternoon. And the time it was sunny, we really enjoyed the pool. Lots of lounge chairs and spots to choose from. The bar staff came around for drink orders. They were super friendly and the drinks were very good. We spent one day at the spa. The staff there are just awesome! I've been to many spas througout the country and Carribbean and these folks were the nicest I've experienced. We had the couples massage with the bath ritual. The bath was so beautiful...candles and flower petals. I just wish the staff would have mentioned we should bring our camera in to take a picture...it was very romantic and the massages were great. We spent the day being lazy in the lounge area, reading books and sipping tea. The room was fabulous, very comfy bed and sheets. We asked for a high floor and they were happy to accommodate. We just had to wait a bit longer and they called us when it was ready. Gave us time to take a walk and have lunch. Yes, the ducks are a riot! People start lining up around the red carpet 30 minutes before the march. The ducks waddled alot faster to get into the fountain than leaving the fountain, we noticed. The staff take a lot of pride in this tradition. We had several corporate events during our stay and all were amazing. I was impressed with their service and quality of food when catering to over 2,000!!! Big shout out to Oseas, who was our server at brunch on Monday morning. He was the best...friendly and attentive. Our last morning I was wearing a Peabody Orlando shirt I bought in the gift store and numerous employees commented that they liked my shirt. I think you can tell alot about how an organization treats its employees by their attitude and enthusiasm for their own brand. It seems the Peabody Orlando staff are proud of their work and employer and it shows in their attention to detail and interactions with guests. We look forward to returning and bringing our children with us. (They stayed at home this trip.) I think this property is great for business, couples, singles, and families.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Kimberly C
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were here for a business convention. The stay was so amazing we stayed an extra day for simply pleasure. Upon arrival the front desk clerks were quick and very efficient. Because we arrived early, we waited about an hour to get to our room. We were upgraded free of charge for the inconvenience. The rooms were very clean, beautiful, spacious, and had a wonderful view. The duck walk and palace is a must see. The location to area events and restaurants is within minutes. By far this hotel is one of the best that I've visited.

Reviews.Title: “Best on I-Drive”
Reviews.Author: Toad143
Reviews.Content: Recently renovated and sporting a new tower thsi hotel is the best in the International Drive Area. You can walk easily to the convention centers. Great fitness room. I had a small fridge in my room which is nice if you are there for a few days. You will pay for parking, but it really is not needed if you are in town for a conf. They chargs for internet also. Room was spacious, clean and modern. Staff was wonderful from the front desk to the Rocks lounge. Beautiful pool area so are the public spaces. It is the place to stay if you have to be on or near I-Drive. I have stayed here a few times over the years. Safe travels!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous place”
Reviews.Author: RaimondsD
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for a conference. The place is stylish and very refined. Service is very good. The place has everything for an unforgettable stay.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best”
Reviews.Author: Knevel
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in a lot of hotels, but this was one of the best i've visited. I've stayed on the club level for 6 nights. The hotel has a new tower, and the old one is totally renovated. Every part of the hotel is spacious, really really spacious. I was on location for business, and it was easy to find quiet spots to talk. Staff was friendly, and there were plenty of them. They have nice bars, a normal dining and a really good restaurant. Rooms were also spacious, and had some nice touches, like a TV in the bathroom mirror, and automatic lighting if you stepped out of bed, which was convenient at night. I can't think of anything negative about this hotel, everything was top notch.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: Becky L
Reviews.Content: I stayed here from Sept.30th-Oct.10th,was in town to meet with construction team and design team for a home we are having built .The valet team was remarkable ,they came to know my schedule etc and always used my name,on the last morning one of the guys came up and said thank you to me and wished me safe travels!!!! My room was always ready for me on my early afternoon return,the pool people esp.one guy knew what my order was every time ..diet coke and a bottle of water!!The bell men who would carry any purchases I had up to my room were very caring and would tease me about my Olive Garden bag...As a single woman from out of country I felt safe and it was like I was returning home...thank you so very much..

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!!”
Reviews.Author: nbla
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at the Peabody for 7 nights while she attended a convention. Our first room was a little on the small side (especially the bathroom) with a view of the roof and the convention center next door. If staying for 1 or 2 nights, that would be fine, but since we were there for 7 nights, we requested a room change. The front desk staff was very accomodating and moved us to a larger room with a view of the new Grotto Pool area. The dining at the hotel was great. We had a chance to eat at Capriccio, Napa and the B-Line Diner. All were delicious, the service was great. The best meal was the Mojo Chicken Paillard at the B-Line. The entire staff of the hotel was very friendly. They should all be commended!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding property!”
Reviews.Author: PinkyPiePie2
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Peabody in October 2011 on the Club Level with our 3 children. We have stayed at many 5 star hotels, but this hotel property was really unbelievably beautiful. Kids really got a kick out of all the duck motif - you could probably do a scavenger hunt to see who can find the most ducks! They are everywhere from the elevator floor to the coffee stirrers. In addition, the staff was fantastic. All were beautifully uniformed, courteous, and friendly. The fitness center is truly state of the art. The housekeeping was impeccable. The pool was gorgeous with waterfalls and a slide for the kids, even a kiddie pool if you have really small children. The gift shop and lobby cafe were wonderful. Restaurant food, staff and ambience all unmatched. Best of all was the Duckmaster, whose name was really Donald! The kids loved visiting the ducks in their palace and then seeing them march to the fountain. BIG TIP: call ahead to see if your child can be an Honorary Duckmaster when the march to or from the fountain. Highly recommend reading your children the fictional story by Patricia Pollaco "John Philip Duck" about how a young boy started the tradition of the Peabody ducks. Right near SeaWorld parks and only a short drive to Disney parks.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Good Location, Awesome Pool”
Reviews.Author: TheMissAmosM
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a relative who was in town for business. We enjoyed the hotel but probably would not spend that much for personal travel reasons. The many restaurants in the hotel were lovely and weren't outrageously priced considering the hotel price ($15-20/plate). We noticed a lot of empty space in the hotel (seems to have been built very large, and wasn't that busy when we stayed there, which made it seem empty / dull). Very quick walk to the Pointe (upscale shopping plaza), and many restaurants. The hotel provided us with some free tickets to use the trolley shuttle that runs up International Drive. It was fun to watch the ducks stroll out twice a day like celebrities on their red carpet. The weather was bad during our stay, but the grotto pool area was very beautiful and I can imagine it would be tons of fun for families (lots of areas for kids and adults to play!). Overall layout and quality were on par or above for a hotel of this price.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: andrea
Reviews.Content: Eventhough I was there for business and they crowds were overwhelming the Peabody still ensured it took care of my every need. The room was very clean and a great size. Overall the property was lovely and food was good. I would definitely return again!

Reviews.Title: “Aweome”
Reviews.Author: jogall30
Reviews.Content: Stayed just one night. Totally great would stay again. The tv built into the bathroom mirror really impressed my hubby.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice!”
Reviews.Author: A J
Reviews.Content: I stayed here to attend a business conference. I was so amazed by the quality of this hotel. Amazing pool, facilities, rooms, grounds. The staff was extremely accomodating, especially the bell men, parking attendants and conceirge. Also has a very nice gym. Don't miss the duck marches at 11:30 and 5:00. I would love to visit this property again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: Walter O
Reviews.Content: I attended a large trade show in Orlando and stayed at the Peabody. It is a very nice hotel with all of the expected amenities but it was very crowded. The trade show probably had a lot to do with that but it was still an enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: drand
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Peabody and it is a great hotel. Good rooms, service and dining options. I think it is a great option either for work or vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience and Service in the Club Level!”
Reviews.Author: calfloridia
Reviews.Content: I was in Orlando to attend a political convention. As I was attending solo, I like to have the club level which allows a breakfast, refreshments throughout the day and evening food and honor bar. As this hotel is a large convention facility - I like the private access elevator and private floors, which are very quet. The Club Lounge is wonderful, very nicely appointed and very lareg room. Daily food and beverage choices were excellent and well prepared. It's has an honor bar so don't expect free wine or drinks. Water and sodas where free. Also, the $20.00 plus tax valet charge in included i0n the fee so it's well worth the additional charge. What is also a first for me was the television embedded within the bathroom mirror - very nice touch. I would definatley stay at this property again, having stayed at their Memphis property as well.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, But Crowded”
Reviews.Author: mgips
Reviews.Content: Robin Williams once did a routine in which he walked into a crowded audience of people sitting at tables. As he squeezed between patrons and tables, he would say "Human car wash!" As lovely--and as large--as the Peabody is, I often felt that my journey along the main floor was indeed a human car wash. With its huge conference spaces and proximity to the Orange County Convention Center, the hotel draws busfuls of conventioneers. And they seem to all converge along the length of the main floor, stretching from Napa/Rocks restaurant/bar on one end to the B-Line Diner on the other. It made moving quickly, or even at a normal pace, very difficult. Also, the mass of taxis, limos, cars, buses, etc at the various entrances made it difficult to unload luggage. The valets acted more like traffic cops, helping cars navigate the tangle of vehicles. My visit happened to coincide with the Republican Presidential nominee debates at the convention center and the Florida Republican straw poll. At one point when I needed to discuss something with a front-desk clerk, I encountered a line of at least 75 people trying to check into the hotel for the political festivities. Granted, it was probably an aberration, but it was inconvenient nonetheless. The only other real problem was that the concierge desk was understaffed in the morning. I waited 15 minutes just to be able to ask a simple yes-or-no question. In all fairness, I did notice 3 or 4 concierges at the desk in the evenings. Now that I've dispensed with the negatives, there is much to like about this property. I won't go into detail about things that have been discussed frequently on Trip Advisor, but I agree that the rooms were very nice and comfortable, the food was good, and the temperature in the hotel was easy to control. For me, the hotel stood out in two areas: the fitness facility and the pool. The surcharge for gym/coffee/newspaper is well worth it for the health club alone. It features a room with weight machines, an attached room with free weights, and a third "core" room, with bosus, balls, a stretching "cage," mats, and similar equipment. There is also a large cardio area with treadmills, bikes, etc. There are also a spin room and two exercise studios, though I never saw those in use. As for the pool area, it is vast, as befits this behemoth of a hotel. For kids, there is a twisting water slide that was very popular. The pool itself is large but shallow--more for wading and milling around in. There also is a separate kids' pool. In addition, I noticed out my window that there is a nice lap pool somewhere else on the property, but I never got there. Finally, if you park in the hotel's garage, take a ride back to the hotel with Carmelo in the golf cart. He is a lot of fun and is full of energy.

Reviews.Title: “Loved everything about it - Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: eckdish
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Peabody for 4 nights and loved every minute of it. The Room was beautiful and comfortable. The pillows could have been more comfortable but you could probably ask houskeeping for a softer one; I didn't think of doing that. I very much enjoyed the beautiful pool and hot tub. My room was on the 4th floor overlooking the pool which was perfect. To make it totally perfect, I would have liked to have a coffee maker in my room, but they had a nice coffee shop just off the lobby with some great breakfast pastries so I was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Excellant with some snags”
Reviews.Author: Bobsterson
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a family suite with a two bedroom and a center room with a couch and tv. Great views, good service, several snags, the one room phone would not work between the beds and the other room the phone was always on speaker and I could not find out how to change it. Our grandson loved the pools, slide and the waterfalls. We ate at the B-diner very good food for breakfast or any time. Good service. The duck walk was nothing special. My daughter paid for the rooms because they were attending a conferance, think God. They charge an extra $ 2.95 pp per day for your two bottles of water in the refrig, and phone service and any other items they can think of. I have stayed at many exclusive hotels but this is a first. I like coffee first thing in the moring but ofcourse you have to order room service for $9.00. I prefer the smaller hotels that have the coffee makers in the rooms, skip the extras. The beds were too soft for me, they seemed like the foam type and the pillows were too soft.

Reviews.Title: “An amazing hotel that goes that extra mile”
Reviews.Author: yellowbelly1968
Reviews.Content: I booked one night stay for myself husband and daughter July 2011 .as this holiday was a celebration of my daughters 21st birthday and my husbands retirement ,I got in touch with the hotel via email a few weeks before, just to ask for a nice room with a view.the minute we arrived we where greeted by such friendly staff with a very quick check in. Our room was on the 7th floor with a view over the wonderful pool .the room was lush with the most comfiest beds in the world ,but it was what was waiting for us in the room that put a huge smile on our faces, 2 personal cards ,1 wishing my daughter a happy birthday and the other for my husband there was also a bottle of champagne chilled in an ice bucket and the biggest chocolate dipped strawberries with Peabody logo. Apart from the bedroom the bathroom was really special with a tv inside the mirror a brilliant power shower and all the little soaps n shampoos .everything was just perfect.you also get a tram pass for idrive.defiantly a 5 star hotel , thank you Peabody

Reviews.Title: “Every possible amenity, super friendly”
Reviews.Author: FireMedicSteve
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Peabody Orlando to attend a conference at the Orange County Convention Center. The Peabody location couldn't be better. But, that's not what made my stay so memorable. I loved that every possible amenity could be found in the room. For example, there was a TV in the bathroom mirror. Yes, inside the mirror! All of the dresser drawers were the self-closing style that you find in modern up-scale kitchens. The nicest feature of the room was a motion activated nightlight under the bedside nightstand that turned on whenever your feet touched the carpet by the bed. That was VERY nice. In addition, the room included all of the other kinds of upscale features you'd expect from a really nice hotel. The service was pretty amazing, as well. The bellmen were almost over-the-top enthusiastic about helping, but since they work for tips I just chalked it up to eagerness for cash. The surprise came this morning when I went to the concierge for help and even after dealing with person after person, she treated me like I was her long lost best friend. She was incredibly helpful and friendly. Everyone I interacted with, from housekeeping to business center staff, were all very friendly and helpful. I would definitely stay here again even if I wasn't going to an event at the convention center.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel we have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: monhols
Reviews.Content: This hotel is absolutely fabulous! Everything about it is class, from the beautiful carpets and marble floors to the amazing chandeliers and waterfalls. The ducks are such a treat. We saw them many mornings and the duckmaster, Donald is such a lovely man! We enjoyed the vast choice of restaurants and the shop was so well stocked with everything that you could want! The staff could not be nicer! I cannot recommend this outstanding hotel and the city of Orlando highly enough. We are currently planning our next visit and we will certainly look no further than the Peabody. Thank you to all the wonderful staff for making our trip to America so memorable!

Reviews.Title: “Great pool area”
Reviews.Author: HamiltonSweden
Reviews.Content: Nice large hotel, great pool area, good equipment in the gym. Good but expensive food.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: rwboyd
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel. Visit was for a seminar. Can't wait to go back with my husband. Beautiful public rooms. Very nice, clean comfortable rooms. I can't think of one negative. Staff was excellent. Pricey but I think it was worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “If you can afford it, you definitely should!”
Reviews.Author: 500pools
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 4 days to chill until my friends arrived and we then went to a private villa. OMG everything exceeded expectations and the location is second to none. Staff were so happy to help and really friendly too. Now I've been I don't understand at all why it's not rated number 1 for Orlando on Trip Advisor. I've never stayed anywhere before as expensive and such good value at the same time! Find a dealonline and just book The Peabody!

Reviews.Title: “Great conference center”
Reviews.Author: Carlie
Reviews.Content: The Peabody is a fantastic conference center and so close to the convention center and many attractions. For the conference that I attended, we didn't have to step outside to reach the conference center. There were many amenities and the rooms were comfortable. The staff was helpful as we looked lost coming in and indeed we were. The B-Line Diner is convenient and the food was good. They have a fantastic selection for those with a sweet tooth. I'm sorry that we missed seeing the duck parade, but were able to see the famous ducks swimming in the fountain. For a three day conference, it was a great value, though unfortunately I didn't have enough time for the pool, the gym or the spa. Perhaps next time.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay!”
Reviews.Author: Joseph546
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Peabody Sept 13-18, 2011. The hotel was beautiful. Rooms and hotel was immaculately clean, staff was friendly and helpful, and the pool was great. My two granddaughters enjoyed the kiddie pool and play area. The front desk staff upgraded our room to club level, and the daily breakfasts, hor d'oevres, and desserts were wonderful. Parking was pricey at $12.00 a day, but the parking ramp was secure and convenient.

Reviews.Title: “The Place to stay in Orlando on Conferences”
Reviews.Author: BILMARAUS
Reviews.Content: Location is the only convenience offered to attendees when away from our families. The proximity of the Peabody from the Conference centre is but one of the best features of this fantastic hotel. The breakfasts at the B-line diner were tasty and timely, the Dinners at the more upmarket restaurant were leisurely and luscious. We had a view over the ground floor pool and were amazed after a strong wind actually blew all of the pool furniture and gazebos into the pool. The army of hotel staff were busy fishing everything out early the next morning and then business as normal. I was totally impressed with all the hotel had to offer, bar the business centre which had a few shortcomings.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Dannyitfc
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Peabody for 10 days and i must say the hotel is stunning! Spacious rooms,fantastic location and real value for money. From the 2 large swimming pools to the tv in the bathroom this hotel caters for everyone regardless of your visit and the staff were extremely polite and professional. By far the best hotel i have ever stayed in :) I must mention the Ducks were so cute!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Peabody”
Reviews.Author: GuatemalaMico
Reviews.Content: They gave us a room with a WDW view(we saw fireworks at distance every night). Comfortable rooms, beautiful bathroom. The spa is totally worth a massage. Great pool with relaxing waterfalls. Restaurant has excellent menu and great staff. Totally worth it after full walking days in Orlando!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Good Value.”
Reviews.Author: KeriSrq
Reviews.Content: The Peabody Hotel in Orlando Florida is a great hotel with luxury amenities at a very good value. The room had a great modern feel. The bathroom had a television in the mirror and robes were provided in the room. The pool was also a great feature of this hotel. The pool has a waterslide, a waterfall area, jacuzzi, and pool side bar service with great mixed drinks. The cafe inside the hotel is a little pricey but there are so many resturaunts on International Drive it really doesnt matter. Overall the hotel has a great atmosphere and friendly employees. I thought the value was definitely resonable for what your getting. I would definitely choose The Peabody for futures stays in Orlando!

Reviews.Title: “Nice but missing essentals”
Reviews.Author: lsobel
Reviews.Content: Nice spacious rooms and friendly staff. The rooms do not have coffee makers and only one waste basket was found only in the bathroom, which is nice but the door is too big and you can't close it from inside without smashing ones foot. A conference hotel without a coffemaker so you can get up for those ungodly early morning meetings is like screen door in a submarine.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury and duck lives to it's promise”
Reviews.Author: tripin_travel
Reviews.Content: great rooms, great restaurants and amenities. get pampered and just stay in the hotel. If you get tired have a nice stroll to nearby places or arrange for a trip to nearby SeaWorld and Universal

Reviews.Title: “Luxury Version of Orlando-Hotel Review”
Reviews.Author: HotelReviewTA
Reviews.Content: Adults have to enjoy Orlando, and after an exhausting day at the parks, ¿Why don't have the great feeling of returning to you luxury hotel? The Peabody is Orlando, Mega-Sized and Ultimate Swanky experience. A Wonderful Innovative Lobby with...Ducks! One of the characters of the hotel. Is really entertaining to watch them chilling in the Fountain. Kids will love that. Rooms? Ok, they are made for couples generally, so get your sons a room and enjoy with your wife or husband a night in the beautiful eccentric rooms, with modern bathrooms and soft warm beds that makes the night shorter. You are going to fell asleep just as you touch the fluffy pillow. The Pool is Enormous. I think that almost 100 people or more can enter there and have a party. Of course, G rated Party, remember, It's Orlando. So a day in the parks wanna make you go to your room and sleep, or watching naughty ducks, or some pillow fight, or some Pool Swimming, Or some....Well, let's say that in this foppish hotel, you definitely can.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: Family_Travel_Guy_11
Reviews.Content: We were in Orlando in July (I know Orlando in July) for my daughters dance comp. It was the host hotel as in the past so we stayed there. To my surprise, they gave us the new tower and it actually felt like a vacation. The new pool area has Cabanas to rent and the pool staff were amazing. You felt like you were at a tropical resort. The only negative we had was one night we were sitting in the lounge having drinks and 15 minutes before it was to close an way overzealous security guard told us to 'get out' . I actually laughed, we are not 21 year olds, nor had we been drinking more then 2, but he was kicking everyone out. I told him that we would finish our drinks and be gone before the closing time. At that time he said, 'start walking'. Overzealous, rude and so unporfessional, but the rest of the hotel staff couldn't have been nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Superb everything. This place is great.”
Reviews.Author: Mainecowboy
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very nice (stayed in new tower), conference area is a great space, food was great in Italian steak place, and all staff were superb. HIGHLY recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for OCCC shows”
Reviews.Author: jayregis
Reviews.Content: Without a doubt, one of the nicest hotel in the convention center district (nicest if you ask me). It may cost a bit more than other hotels in the area, but well worth it. Rooms are comfy and clean. I could see the Disney World fireworks display from my 24th floor room. Easy walk to several of the convention center buildings (West & South) via elevated walkways, some with moving sidewalks. Would definitely stay here next time I attend another show at the OCCC (Orange County Convention Center).

Reviews.Title: “The new rooms are great but, consistently poor service was the signature of my stay.”
Reviews.Author: tgdelb
Reviews.Content: The Rooms are great but, my stay at Peabody orlando was tainted by consistently poor service. When I arrived they said my previously confirmed king or double double room was unavailable and I would have had to have a murphy wall bed. I asked to re-check and only after another employee took a look did I eventually get a double double room. The room itself being recently remodeled was great. It has all the amenities you would expect including floor lighting that turns on when you enter the bathroom at night as well as a bathroom tv in the mirror and of course the requisite iphone compatible clock radio and great HD TV. Plus, I could actually use the TV inputs for computer/ Ipad video out. This is a huge plus. The second hotel screw up came when my breakfast room service arrived a half an hour before the scheduled window I was given. This was disappointing as my breakfast was cold by the time I had finished dressing from the shower. (also very awkward for all involved if you know what i mean.) And then the Valet. Oh the Valet. They should be ashamed as should the hotel management for letting this go on. They are terrible. When I called down to get my car they said that they were not taking call downs and that I would have to come down. After presenting my ticket at the window they said I have the wrong ticket for my stay and confusion ensued. When they got over this, they then said that it would be at least 15- 20 mins to get my car. Really why valet??? This is unacceptable for any hotel. Oh and get some signs, there are three entrance points to the hotel and the valet station is not marked. How do people know where to go? Well, sorry for the rant, that is really it. The hotel itself is a very nice. The management however is not making service a priority. They give Hilton Orlando a run for their money but they come up flat when it comes to service.

Reviews.Title: “The Ducks Waddle”
Reviews.Author: dealdog
Reviews.Content: Second overnight trip in two months at the Peabody....summertime in Florida, great hotel but construction on sidewalk to parking area was a pain and the primary restaurant was closed - Bartenders very helpful - adult pool was good for swimming laps - would recommend for convention business and high end for disney family trips - pretty big place and the duck waddle i thought was contrived at best and had no place in such a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful newly renovated hotel.”
Reviews.Author: EMcG88
Reviews.Content: Hotels in Orlando are easy to come by, but picking the right one is usually a task. This hotel is wonderful.we booked online the night of because we were taking a quick hour ride to Orlando to see a show at the improv Orlando at point Orlando which is within walking distance from the hotel. The check in process was a little slow but we did have a newer front desk assistant and it didn't much matter because he was very pleasant. The room was beautiful with a great comfy king bed,floors that light up when you walk by them and a television in the bathroom mirror. The hotel is huge and boasts many little bars two nice restaurants and the 24 hour b line diner. We did only stay for one night and did not interact much with staff. The only negative I have was valet parking is twenty dollars and self park in the garage is 12 dollars and that's daily rates for each. This is a wonderful fairly proved Orlando hotel that I highly reccomend.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, Good Service”
Reviews.Author: LionelDubai
Reviews.Content: The Peabody hotel is good and up to its reputation. At time the size of the hotel, which is huge, make it seems like a factory. I liked the experience but didn't find relaxing for vacation. Too many people comming for the exibition center makes it less vacation feel.

Reviews.Title: “The best we ever had”
Reviews.Author: scruffyofl
Reviews.Content: My Story is below... But the fast down-n-dirty facts are: The greatest service I have experienced at a resort hotel. The room size was +/- 450 Sq. Ft., but walk at night and the floor is illuminated where you are going with a soft light, turns on and off automatically. Inside the ample mirror in the bathroom that does not fog-up is another flat screen T.V. (my Wife Loved). The drawers close themselves. Each of these were practical luxuries we appreciated. The Club Level has comp. Valle Parking and with a nine month old, it was priceless. The "Continental Breakfast" was great , if fresh smoked Lox and Smoked Salmon with all the fixings with Fruit and assorted other wonderful cheeses and meats are included in your hotels continental Breakfast then I've been being robbed at other fine establishments . The evening was similar with many Tapas type appetizers and desserts to enjoy. Did I mention drinks? The famous Duck walk at 11AM was fun and the many pools, restaurants, art and elegance that is usually reserved for a snobby atmosphere, but it just does not happen here. Its the single most friendly place we've stayed, ever. Story: We were in need of a little get away, Labor Day was starting on Friday, it was Thursday night at Eleven PM and my wife and I were still working at the office. I checked our favorite haunts but none met our budget or liking. It occurred to my wife to go ninety miles to Orlando for our old and all-time favorite place were stayed many times, years before. The Peabody Hotel. We made our Reservations late at night and were on our way by noon the next day, I was a little concerned that Expedia, Oyster or Bookit (Idid not remember who we dealt with) had confirmed my reservation. I called the Peabody, Cheameil in reservations, who confirmed our stay and asked if this was our first time. I explained that it had be a while but we love the Peabody, however this was my nine month old granddaughters first trip. She asked if I could hold for a moment, came back and said that she had received authorization to upgrade our rooms and would see to it that a Baby Bed, full size Microwave and extra refrigerator were in the room. When we arrived we discovered that we also were given Valle parking and Club Level Rooms overlooking their new many acre new pool resort. The staff, from Jason at the front desk, Delores at the B-Line Diner, the Bellman who has been there for twenty four years were all exceptional at making you realize that you were important to them. Again and again they were so helpful and I would ask why they were so "over the top"? It was Kelly or Megan in the Club Lounge who when I asked that question; what was the Peabody difference? She said, " we are empowered to make our guest happy"! It's that simple , but it is not simple at all, because it is real. People who like what they are doing, doing what they like.

Reviews.Title: “Whats happened to the peabody”
Reviews.Author: wishingstar162
Reviews.Content: Went to the Peabody B-line diner last christmas, and I am going again to orlando in two weeks. Just had to write and say since the new block has opened the diner which was such a favourite has gone edown hill. Twice I went to eat there after many, many good experiences over the years, only to find sevice poor, no menu change except the prices have gone up. I am going to try again in October to see if my "Favourite Diner" has returned

Reviews.Title: “We loved it even though it's huge, just a few gripes”
Reviews.Author: ladyinspaing
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very nice with little extras like the tiny lights that come on at night so you can see just enough to go to the bathroom. The bathroom mirror has a TV in it, not that you would want to watch TV while you are sitting you know where. The staff are very nice, just a few gripes though, the place is huge so I expect kids would lose their way easily, the corridors look the same and it's so easy to take a wrong turn out of the lift. The "free coffee" is only available early so you have to be up in time. To try and find out where it is is another matter, not so easy, one day when I did find it the machine was taking so long to heat up again the people waiting behind me were getting very frustrated. The hotel should 1, provide signs to the location. 2, have more than 1 machine, 3 have a member of staff to watch and advise how to use the machine. The ducks are another thing, if you expect them to waddle slowly to the fountain forget it you have to be quick, they are hungry so they run so fast, quite funny though. Tip, if you go to the same floor as the duck palace there is a huge swimming pool, hardly anyone there but keep it to yourselves, would be great if it was adults only for some peace and quiet. Not a cheap place for drinks or to eat but it is within walking distance to many good places. No free internet, shame as when you pay these prices the net should be free with pc's in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “What a delightful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JCTraveller2011
Reviews.Content: What a treat it was to stay in this quality and good value Hotel. Rooms are spacious and clean. Wonderful views. Various outdoor areas and Pools. A variety of bars and eating spots. And ... best of all .. the Ducks!

Reviews.Title: “Really good hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: heather052
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week with 2 children aged 11 and 15. It was our first time to florida so didnt know what to expect. All in all we would return to this hotel as all the staff were very professional and very friendly. The location was great with only 11 dollars in a taxi to universal and the i ride trolley stopping near outside taking you to most places. The pool area was really nice and with lots of nice food from the snack bar which we thought was priced about right for a hotel as nice as this. We ate also in the breakfast diner which was equally as good. The kids enjoyed having a gift shop and a supermarket on site for sweets etc. The rooms were really spacious and the beds were the best iv slept in some mornings it was hard to get up!!! great value for money considering what we paid( booked through travel republic for a saving of over £1,200 compared to booking direct)!! The restaurants were a 5-10 min walk away a we ate in some lovely place such as maggianos italian, bahama breeze, cafe tu tu tango, tommy bahamas just to name a few! All in all with the excitment of the parks it was a great holiday for a family with so much to do, i will def stay here again . Also a special mention to a lovely lady who worked the espresso bar she was so lovely and friendly to chat too.

Reviews.Title: “Coming Back at Christmas!”
Reviews.Author: Gavin M
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Peabody for a couple of nights as a 'Treat' during our summer vacation. We had opted to keep moving around to 'experience' different hotels but the Peabody far surpassed all other hotels we stayed at in the area. The Peabody was an instant 'love at first sight' and we didn't want to leave! Everything about the hotel is 'First Class' and made our holiday really special. As we couldn't wait until next Summer to return, we have just booked for a Christmas Holiday (26 Dec to 3 Jan) - we couldn't think of anywhere better to be at New Year! Hopefully we get the same excellent service on our return - can't imagine anything less than Perfect at Peabody is acceptable! Having read other reviews, I just wanted to add that we had really good experiences enjoying the 'complimentary' morning coffee - a lovely relaxing atmosphere to start the day. Thank You Peabody and See You again Soon.

Reviews.Title: “First of many excellent hotels in Orlando that I want to come back to!”
Reviews.Author: Roy_Lincolnshire_UK
Reviews.Content: A long hard search of some excellent hotels in Orlando brought up a deal at the Peabody. Despite its skyline imposing visible presence I had never really taken much notice of this hotel and knew it only for it's reputation for the ducks! From the minute my family stopped the car outside the main doors to the minute we checked out we felt welcomed, important and totally at home in this massive hotel. Nothing was too much trouble for any of the staff and if anyone asked me to be critical I would struggle! The room was perfect, the view wonderful and facilities first (or better) class. My only word of warning is that if you do not like large busy hotels you may well feel overawed by this one but don't be - it is huge but even when a huge convention was booked in at the towards the end of our stay we didn't find it an issue (although there were too many to see the parade of the ducks properly lol!) For such a quality hotel I found the prices generally well within the range where I didn't feel ripped off. I have seen one comment regarding regarding room service fees and parking fees but everywhere I looked at this hotel those charges were never hidden nor did I find them unacceptable - indeed many of the better hotels were showing similar charges. I was concerned about , but accepted,the $12 per night self parking charge but was impressed and pleasantly surprised when that charge was waived as I was staying for a longer period (10 nights) - a very generous concession by the hotel. Normally I like to try a different hotel when we visit Orlando - now I just want to go back to The Peabody.

Reviews.Title: “Across from Convention Center”
Reviews.Author: mari0nette
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel exactly across the street from the Convention Center. Really enjoyed the amenities, and the pool. The drawback is that it is a bit pricey, considering the Rosen Center is just as close to the venue, but is definitely less expensive - if you are traveling for business, and will not have the time to enjoy all the amenities, it may not be worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Top Class Hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: gary c
Reviews.Content: travelling family consisted of 2 adults and 3 children under the age of 10 for 15 nights. Overall Hotel is immaculate and easily comparible with top Vegas hotels. Excellent location on International Drive. Lovely Pool area. Check-in We had a deluxe room booked and had ordered a rollaway direct with hotel prior to arrival. We got exactly what we asked for and had checked in in 2 minutes. Very easy and pleasant experience. Accomodation Room was superb. Very clean and very well equipped. State of the art TV - iPod docking station - very fashionable furnishings - bathroom with TV in mirror delighted the kids. Rollaway bed was bigger than a normal single (about a 1.5 size) and easily fit into the bedroom. There was a good size refrigerator also. The room was every bit as good as any top rated deluxe room I have stayed in at Las Vegas. Pool Lovely pool area. Could get busy at times but only had a problem getting a lounger once and that only took a couple of minutes. Food Didn't eat at any of the restaurants so cannot comment. Service Excellent - all staff were polite and friendly. We had no cause to complain about anything so cannot comment on how they handle issues. Things you should know 1) There is a daily car parking charge ($12 self and $20 valet if memory serves). This is a scam to me but is now practicised widely in orlando hotels so they are not alone. 2) There is a daily charge for Water/Paper/internet access/Helth Spa whether you want it or not - approx $15 daily. Another Orlando hotel scam practised by the majority of hotels. 3) There is a $15 daily charge for rollaway bed. We were aware of all of these charges before we travelled. 4) We arranged prior to arrival for all our kids to be duckmasters for the day. The Duckmaster contacted us via Email and arranged it all. The kids had a brilliant time and loved it. Quite nerve racking for them as there are a lot of people watching. Duckmaster was superb, a lovely man, who thoroughly enjoyed his job ( Management if you read this I hope you take note!!!) Negatives Only one which didn't affact the experience. As part of the daily service charge there is free coffee in a self service station. Well what a shambles day after day. The coffee machine they used was incredibly slow causing big queues and forever had problems or ran out of coffee. It was a real 'mickey mouse' operation. Sort it out Manager it was laughable. Would I stay here again - ABSOLUTELY!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Lots of walking, would have been perfect if they could resolve the coffee situation”
Reviews.Author: javabuz
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel. I travel a lot and this was very lovely. The maid service was exceptional. The room comfortable and even had a TV in the bathroom mirror. The conference center is GIGANTIC so you literally have to build in "commute time" to get some of the rooms from my room. If you had physical disabilities I imagine this would be a problem. I put on my pedometer one day and actually logged 4 miles!!! The only reason I could not give this hotel a perfect score was because of the coffee situation. There was supposed to be "free coffee" in the lobby, but of the 5 nights I stayed there it had run out of coffee or cream EVERY SINGLE MORNING I was there. It was like no one was maintaining it. Coffee at a hotel is a make it or break it for me. No coffee in the room, the coffee sold at the little diner in the lobby was so terrible (and expensive) I actually threw it away. It was my one disappointment of the whole place, but a big deal the duck march is cute. The staff was friendly. the pool was nice. All around a good experience

Reviews.Title: “Quality Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Al0eVera
Reviews.Content: Beautiful public areas, excellent pool facility, helpful staff, good choice of dining options including the sophisticated Napa restaurant. The aircon in our room stopped working and an engineer arrived within 5 - 10 minutes, despite it being 2am! He diagnosed the problem which wasn't a quick fix and we were offered a move to a room just along the corridor, and assisted with moving our things. I'm not sure we would have had the same outcome in other hotels. This hotel should satisfy the most discerning of travellers - it was certainly the best that we stayed in during our recent trip to the US.

Reviews.Title: “Nice option for conference or convention”
Reviews.Author: JHFIII
Reviews.Content: Great service, very friendly staff. Immediately across the street from the Orlando Convention Center and close to lots of good resaurant options. The property is an interesting architectural design and in good repair.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing honeymoon experience!”
Reviews.Author: reviewerC
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Peaboby for our honeymoon. Am absolutely amazing hotel - 5 star! Would recommend it to any couples considering going to Orlando for their honeymoon.

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable service.”
Reviews.Author: UltraNatasha
Reviews.Content: We live in Orlando, and have stayed at the Peabody twice for a romantic getaway/staycation and have had a great experience both times. Though a rather large hotel, with 2 different towers, the Peabody manages to feel warm and cozy thanks to its top notch service. Rooms are comfortable and nicely decorated and come with everything you need (mini-fridge and safe, but no coffee maker). Hotel restaurants are all wonderful and offer great service and ample choices for all palates. Don't miss the new Napa restaurant, even if it's only for breakfast! Walkable to a number of good restaurants on I-Drive. Also, the hotel will give you Trolley passes to use during your stay which enable you travel up and down I-Drive.

Reviews.Title: “Big conference Hotel with facilities to wow the family!”
Reviews.Author: Willywill
Reviews.Content: A relatively late booking, the Peabody was only one of a few hotels offered to us by Expedia. Upon our arrival, it is incredibly impressive with a separate multi storey car park and amazing swimming pools. The young lady who dealt with us at the desk was hardly a bundle of personality but was efficient and fairly quick. Any of six gleaming lifts took us to our room on floor six and they proved to be so available for the duration of our stay. The bedroom itself was spacious and well appointed. The TV in the bathroom mirror was a novelty with our son! From my point of view, the biggest plus point was the quality of the bed and of course the pillows. It was a pleasure to sleep on them! The (family) pool was just so relaxing with its beach side area. Just no need to worry about kids falling into deep water here. Perhaps being August, there may not have been a big conference on, but sun loungers were plentiful, along with towels and cold towels served pool side! I had a couple of cocktails and they were magic also. Whilst leaving the hotel ( to get to my hire car), the staff seemed rather perplexed that we should choose to walk the 200 metres or so in the heat, when for the price of a tip they would talk you there in a golf buggy. Those people that were driven, looked like they could have done with the exercise! The Multi storey car park was really clean and not threatening like some back home. I did sample the internet via the business centre one night, and also had dealings with the Consierge desk - both were first class. One night we wandered into the Conference area and it was truly amazing. The size of it, and the quality! I've struggled to find any negatives about our 10 day experience at the Peabody Hotel. The daily charge administered seems a bit bizarre when we really didnt experience any business like functions such as wifi or read the New York Times provided,etc. Oh yes, the toilet tissue (roll) did seem rather flimsy considering the status of the Hotel, but I may just be splitting hairs on this point. To conclude - brilliant Hotel but just where do we go from here? Buckingham Place!

Reviews.Title: “The Peabody Experience”
Reviews.Author: mr jacksonville
Reviews.Content: My wife and I decided to get away for the extended Memorial weekend. We received an astounding rate through AAA and booked a 3 night stay at the Peabody Orlando. I'm a frequent Orlando tourist and have read several reviews of this property over the years. Our stay met and exceeded all expectations. The valets and bellhoppers greeted me and my wife with a pleasant attitude. I opted for self-parking, so our bags were securely taken to the front desk area. The lobby was exquisite; more importantly, there were plenty of agents available, and check-in was efficient. The room was finely equipped with an I-pod deck/alarm clock radio, wired/wireless internet access, telephone, mini-fridge, complimentary peabody bath robes, ironing board w/iron, and a safe. The bed was very comfortable and the sheets were changed consistently. The bathroom was marbleous, with a mini-tv inside a mirror. The shower/tub was large and the toiletries and towels were replaced daily, although they ask that you conserve, if possible. I toured a good portion of the hotel, including some of the conference rooms. It's consistently neat and clean throughout the various sections. There are several dining options and we chose to eat at the B-line Diner for breakfast. The food was very good; however, as other reviews have noted, it is costly. My wife loves nature, and she insisted on seeing the ducks marching. While we missed their entrance, we did get to see them in their pond. The Duckmaster was friendly and extremely knowledgable. He angaged me and my wife for 15 minutes, while children and others were taking pictures. This definitely was the highlight of our stay. The pool, spa, and fitness centers were thoroughly equipped and had friendly staff. It was refreshing to note that the Peabody takes pool safety seriously, as there was always someone monitoring the pool slide. You could not go down until the other person cleared the immediate area. In summation, the Peabody was one of the finest hotels that I've stayed in. It's family friendly, an intimate place for couples, and ideal for business travelers. This is a hard combination to pull off, but the Peabody does it. I'm not sure how it was previously, but the renovations look incredible. The people are helpful and friendly. There are some things to know: there is a daily parking and hotel fee, dining at the hotel is expensive, the parking garage is separate from the hotel, but there are always shuttles running to accommodate guests and their luggage. Several hotels and shopping centers are within walking distance, and there are quite a few "entrances" into the hotel. Make sure you see valets and bellhops, otherwise you're at the convention side of the hotel, and a long way from check in. I will stay here again and throughly enjoyed my stay

Reviews.Title: “Sorry. Another 5* Review”
Reviews.Author: Khonsu
Reviews.Content: Where to start with The Peabody. Location. At the south end of International Drive, across the road from Pointe Orlando, bars, restaurants, cinema, shops etc. Am I allowed to say "the nice end" of International Drive. The hotel oozes professionalism and class. From pulling up on our airport transfer coach - more on that later - and being met by a group of bell hops/valet chaps for our luggage. Check in was a breeze. After a 6 hour delay at Gatwick, our arrival was 11.30pm. It may as well have been 1pm in the afternoon given the welcome we were given and the smoothness of the booking in process. Yes - there is a $9 a night hotel charge payable on book in. Get over it those who complain about this. Every hotel now has some kind of charge. For this you get your daily paper, 2 bottles of water, free internet (I checked into work regularly from our room with no performance issues) and i-Trolley tickets free daily. (Free shuttling up and down International Drive - a must do even if you have a car. You see so much more.) We were also given a free upgrade - nice. We were in tower 2 on 15th Floor. The room was gorgeous. Still a hotel room but spotless, up to date (others have mention tv and bathroom mirror tv) and roomy. 6 lifts to each floor, no waiting, express lifts meant you may have been on 4th floor. Free safe in each room is nice to have. Fridge is roomy - our always had a few beers, coke, powerade type drinks and chocolate - hey, it was 95 degrees most days at the parks... you needed to have energy. Room service were great. We had no complaints on the service on any day. Even if we left the room at midday. Do not disturb was always respected. Rest of the hotel. HUGE. Few key points. The shop in-hotel is beyond ridiculous on it's pricing - geared at business people with expense accounts I think. An example, a pack of 2 AA batteries - $6.99. In the theme parks they were only $6 for a pack of 4. $4 for a bottle of water. $6 for a small bar of chocolate...it was endlessly too expensive. The steak house restaurant in house was an average of $40 for an entree. No need when the very best steak houses outside the hotel were $30 for the most expensive steaks (16oz New York Strip at Cattlemans - oh my word....died and gone to heaven). B-Line Diner has been mentioned several times. Not cheap, not expensive. A lovely experience whether breakfast or a late night meal. Staff are great - we turned up needing breakfast at 11.30am when they stopped at 11am. Not a problem - breakfast menu re-appeared in a flash. B-Line is a great option when you literally crawl back into the hotel in the evening after a park knowing you will not make it back out. It is also good for take away should you want to be by the pools some day to recover (nice link eh!). We visited two pools. The ground floor pools, the curvy/water slides kind of pool was ok. Too shallow for swimming - great for kids. Coconut Shack for food and drinks was reasonable. We only went their once, no complaints - just too manic for a relaxing day. The terrace pool is fantastic. For adults peace time. No thrills, about 5ft 6" in the deep bit, 25m long. Great for throwing a ball, lane swimming, or just lazing around. Kind of hidden away so it was never crowded. I was in there on my own one day and a company had a "team building" day basically around it - very amusing to watch people suffering what I had many times. The Ducks.... well - you think "how silly I'll not bother". We caught it by accident and it was sweet/funny and very glad we made it. Disney Shuttles. There is a transfer/ticket desk. Not the friendliest of people but know their stuff. Cost $10 each way to any Disney park - compared to taxi's an absolute bargain. You're looking at $50 each way to Magic Kingdom. Buy your Disney tickets before you go to Orlando - tip if you know you'll only go to each park once - look for the Disney Base Tickets... you save about £80 a ticket. Oh yes - the Airport shuttle. We booked through Travel Republic - no complaints there. The actual shuttle was American Coach. Rubbish. We waited an hour at the airport for their minibus to fill up - and then a further 30 mins for the driver to then move. After a 6 hour delay, you don't need that. Worse than that was the return trip. We confirmed 24 hours in advance as instructed and were waiting to be picked up 15 minutes before. 15 mins after the pickup time we phoned and were told 15mins. Then phoned again - 20 mins. Then again. 15 mins. Then 10. etc etc. It was 1 1/2 hours late - obviously they shunted people to fill the mini bus. Not to be recommended - but then you may not have a choice. Tip would be to phone the confirmation number again 15 minutes before pickup time - that way they know you'll hassle them. If you're like me and have speed read the above, then take note that to us, The Peabody was the best hotel on the "Drive". By a country mile. Oh - and a lot of other hotels we looked like Doubletree were nice ...but nothing around them! You'd need a car. We most definitely did not. Any questions on getting around without a car - please ask.

Reviews.Title: “Five star hotel for a reasonable price!”
Reviews.Author: flprincess463
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for one night in an executive suite after a conference in Orlando. It is right on I-drive and connected to the Orlando Convention Center which makes it very convenient. There are free I-Ride Trolley passes included with your stay that goes up and down I-drive. It is however a short 5 minute walk to Pointe Orlando which is shopping, dining and nightlife in one convenient location. The room was nice and had some nice features you expect in a luxury hotel (motion sensored night lights,tv in bathroom mirror, spa robes, 24 hour room service, comfortable beds). We did not eat at the restaurants but they all looked nice and had great sounding menus. There are multiple pools, slides, a children's "beach" area, pool bars and restaurant. It's nice that the pool is open until 11 pm. There is a spa in the hotel, however we did not have any services done due to our limited time. The hotel bars are open until 1:30 am. The check-in was quick and simple. As was the checkout. My only complaints were that valet is $20 per day, self parking is $15 but quite a long walk. Also, my room was obviously not dusted when cleaned, and the tv in the bathroom mirror almost never worked. There is also a resort fee of $10 per day they inform you of upon check-in. We were told this covers the Trolley passes, high-speed Internet, waters daily in your fridge and a New York Times paper every morning at your door. But at least they tell you what the fee is for, a lot of hotels just charge you and give no explanation. Overall we were happy with our stay at the Peabody. The ducks marching to the fountain on the red carpet in the morning and evenings is always entertaining. There is always somewhere to get something to eat or drink 24hours. Your car is always ready for you if you call valet before you leave your room. There are also shops, fitness center, tennis courts, etc to keep you entertained. I would recommend this hotel if you are looking for a nice, upscale, romantic, luxury hotel. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “We are quackers about the Peabody :o)”
Reviews.Author: DeeferDavid
Reviews.Content: The Peabody has grown tremendously over the last couple of years. There is a new block (unfortunately we haven't been able to sample the delights there but am told it is 'well nice') The Peabody is located on South International Drive close to all attractions and restaurants. Mrs D and I and the rugrats have stayed there on numerous occasions and always have a good time there. The ducks waddling into the pool in the lobby still attracts huge amounts of tourists at the appointd times. The pool areas are now absolutely superb, with a new rock pool area which includes a small pool for the mini rugrats and a lovely bar area for the grown ups ;o). The hotel itself is superb inside. The reception area is huuuuuuuuuuuuuge and cool and inviting and the staff are very attentive and helpful. We have sampled the delights of the B-Line Diner on many occasions.. either for breakfast, dinner or midnight feast.. and have always come away totally crammed!! the portions are of shall we say 'truly American proportions'. We have also eaten out at the Ponderosa for Breakfast which is always recommended, Red Lobster which is YUMMMM for Shrimp.. spesh the Coconut Prawn!!, TGI Friday is always right on with the steak and prawn, and ohhhhhhhh the cheesecake factory at the Mall at Millennia.. hmmm <looks at waistline and ponders>. Huummpphh.. anyway.. getting onto more serious things.. Mrs D and the sprogs luuurve shopping so the Mals are a good idea.. specially as the aircon is always working.. ooopps just realised this is a review of the hotel.. ok .. the Peabody.. the only NEGATIVE thing I can say is about the parking grrrrrrrrr. There is a CHARGE for parking each and every day.. I dont recall what it is but I have to say it is irritating to see it on the bill when you check out. There are few parking options so really you have to lump it. On the whole I would thoroughly recommend this hotel even though it is really a business mans hotel (this often means the pool is quiet because the businessmen are at the conference centre).

Reviews.Title: “Wow! Amazing hotel, great value!”
Reviews.Author: hazyman
Reviews.Content: I got online to check out prices for hotels in Orlando and found the Peabody, listed at 4.5 stars. I called directly and they offered me a better rate (Florida resident) than I found online and an upgraded room. I was very impressed with the room, as well as the bathroom which had a tv built into the mirror. At night, when you step out of bed, there is a motion sensor by the nightstand which lights the floor, and when you walk in the bathroom there is another sensor so you don't even need to turn on a light. The pool looked amazing, but we didn't have time to go in. A couple of things to note: First, there is a charge for parking - $12 to self-park and $20 for valet. Also, there is a $9 fee for use of amenities, which we were not informed of at check in. Supposedly the $9 included a couple of bottles of water, which I never saw. The beds were comfortable and there were plenty of pillows. My son forgot his toothbrush, and within 2 minutes of calling the front desk a staffmember delivered a toothbrush/toothpaste kit. We'll be back for sure! This hotel should be listed as 5 stars!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful Hotel with added added splendor of the Duck March.”
Reviews.Author: CarmenFlorida
Reviews.Content: The Peabody is top of the line in terms of accomodations and service. Wonderful beds, linens, furnishings. The daily Duck March is an absolute for the kids to see. We would stay there any time!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, remodel is great.”
Reviews.Author: mrb342
Reviews.Content: The Peabody is a great hotel. The remodel is so nice. The meeting space is fantastic. I was there for business events and we had all the space we needed. Hotel is in a good location to restaurants and far enough from Disney where you don't think about it but close enough if wanted to go to the park. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great start to the holiday”
Reviews.Author: penlanspice
Reviews.Content: The Peabody was a great start to our holiday. We stayed here for the first 4 nights of our holiday and what a great place to start! we took the in-laws for a treat and everyone loved it, we got it at a really good price too. We emailed the hotel before our arrival as it was the in-laws anniversary and wanted to be in the new tower, we had rooms in the new tower and also a card and some fruit, a nice touch we thought. It is a convention hotel so you can expect it to busy, during the weekend we were there the Saturday and Sunday were really quite and it was like a different hotel. Both pools were great and never too over crowed, the feature pool was great but the bar was a little pricey The coffee shop in the lobby was great for early morning coffees. The only down side for us was the walk to the car park (used to having the car outside) we tried to valet but the valet was full on our arrival so after that we just kept self parking. The fee is a little steep if your staying for a few days but we knew this before we arrived. We will certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel - real fun!”
Reviews.Author: Nosowicz
Reviews.Content: Well we visitied for work as the Peadbody was a 5 min walk from the convention centre. Well whyat a real surprise this was an excellent hotel, with helpful & freindly staff and pretty good facilities. It was begining some rather large extension plan, but the place had a good feel to it We enjoyed the stay and plan to go there again when we are in Orlando

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!!”
Reviews.Author: potterfan99
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a conference in February. The place is amazing. Easy to get lost in; with multiple towers and multiple elevators. Some elevators only go to certain floors. The convention center floor seems to go on forever. There was a good selection of restaurants in the hotel/convention center from upscale/bar to grab a salad and go. The staff was very helpful and always had a personal touch. They seemed to really care about us. And who doesn't like the ducks - you have to catch the parade in the morning. It's very short but it's worth the crowd and the wait. As for the room - I've never had a TV in the bathroom before. It doubled as a mirror. VERY cool. Would not hesitate to stay there again. Very good, central location on I-Drive. Close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Huge...and expensive!”
Reviews.Author: IslandSnowSeeker
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautiful and very clean. There is a convention center attached, so it is always packed with groups of different types of people. We were there for a dance competition, so the place was overflowing with kids. The food is very expensive (about $15 for a regular sized sandwich from the one place that is open late). The new pool area is very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place for a meeting”
Reviews.Author: bergcarrie
Reviews.Content: I just finished a stay here for a meeting that I helped to plan, and I have to say, the Peabody was fantastic. Actually, all the Peabody's I have stayed in have been truly great hotels. I am a typical JW Marriott/Renaissance/Hyatt/Wyndham hotel user. I like the higher end, but not premium end hotels. I would say the Peabody falls into this category. My room was fantastic. Clean, roomy, lots of great and unique amenities, and I was in the main tower so I was close to my essentials (spa and gym). The convention facilities are wonderful I cannot say enough great things about the convention staff (Kevin was our CMP here, and he was wonderful). They really take care of you here. I will be suggesting this hotel for future meetings with my company, as this is a great location to Disney (close but not too close,,,I really don't care for Orlando because too many kids drive me crazy. Not a lot of kids at this place). Its also very convenient to and from the airport, and there is a grocery store and other restaurants near by. I would most definitely stay here if I ever come to Orlando for personal reasons. Like I said, just far enough from the crazy of Disney, but close enough to enjoy the weather.

Reviews.Title: “love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: glittergoo
Reviews.Content: wow,this hotel was awesome.the staff was very helpful.we stayed there for 8 days and my sister's and son loved it.we stayed in the old tower,it was perfect.we ordered pizza from papa ducks it was great.i heard the b line dinner was a little expensive but compared to other places in orlando it was not expensive to me.you have to see the ducks they are so cute.my son who is 7 wrote a note on our last night that said goodbye ninja ducks and maid we will miss you.if we come back we will stay there again. peabody we love you.

Reviews.Title: “Great venue for business or pleasure”
Reviews.Author: mercurysqueen
Reviews.Content: My company recently hosted a management retreat at this hotel. What a treat! From the rooms to the staff, I can't find one thing to "complain" about. The property is superbly maintained and it is clear that the staff puts customer service as #1. Located right near everything or an easy trolley ride away, this hotel puts the class in classy. Highly recommended by this road warrior! PS...make sure to see the ducks. What fun.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel, can't wait to visit again!”
Reviews.Author: Scooby65
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful one week stay at The Peabody Orlando at the end of May, the room was lovely with luxurious beds that were so comfy. Our children aged 11yr and 8yr loved the television in the bathroom mirror, such a novelty! We were on a mid level floor and had great views over the family pool complex complete with waterfall and wonderful slide! and then right across Orlando. Very friendly staff throughout the hotel. The Peabody has several restaurants all serving great food at very reasonable prices and we had breakfast and dinner at the hotel on several occasions. We liked B line diner and Capriccio Grill. We enjoyed watching the famous Peabody ducks waddle down the red carpet to the water feature. Our children said the hotel was awesome! and my husband and I totally agree with them. We had a very busy week doing a few of the theme parks and Discovery Cove (amazing). We stayed at the hotel and used it's wonderful pool complex on two seperate days as we needed a well earned rest from the theme parks! We bought our tickets for Seaworld and Discovery Cove on-line a few weeks before we went and purchased Hollwood Studio tickets (Star Wars weekend -Great time!), and Disney World, at the gate. We used public transport daily; a combination of the I trolley for Seaworld and I Drive, and had taxi's back from other theme parks if it was very late at night, though regarding the taxi's we found it easier and better to book Mear's taxi transport through the hotel bookings/activites desk. We left all our postcards with the concierge just as we checked out and they all reached home later that week. The hotel was just amazing, and we hope to go back there soon.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: 3DStiles
Reviews.Content: Rooms were great! Staff was great! B-Line Diner was great but slightly overpriced. Loved the ducks! Grotto pool was closed for maintenance, bummer, but glad to see this beautiful property is properly maintained. Would stay here again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Splendid Hotel”
Reviews.Author: disvaca01
Reviews.Content: It doesn't matter which tower you stay in they both are wonderful. All the pools are excellent & spa is top notch! Super fast elevators & complimentary shuttles to the parking garage. The staff were friendly & accomodating. You must try the B-line Diner while there.

Reviews.Title: “Something for everyone”
Reviews.Author: annehawk
Reviews.Content: I regret that I only had 2 nights at this hotel, and had family business to attend to. I would have liked to spend more time enjoying the amenities. that we peaked at during our tour upon arrival. We arrived late and after a day of plane and automobiles our first stop was food... We grabbed something to eat in the hotel and had plenty of choices. Our second stop was the pool, which was beautiful at night. The lobby bar was calling my name, but the bed was calling me more. The mattress, sheets, and pillows were dreamy and I didn't want to get out of bed the next morning. However, I was excited to see all the treats in the bathroom including a mirror/tv combo. We stayed in the older section of the hotel. Initially I was concerned, but it was wonderful. The only opportunity with this hotel is the walk from the self park to the entrance of the hotel, and there was a fee for parking. The hotel needs more directions on arrival to get you from the self park to the lobby; however, once we got the lay of the land everything was good. A nice little tram transports you from the parking lot to the hotel. I'm assuming that's due to the proximity of the conference center. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel! (with one disappointment)”
Reviews.Author: jenryleeryan
Reviews.Content: We just returned home from a family getaway at the Peabody Hotel in Orlando. The hotel is beautiful, very clean and all the staff is friendly. The reason I chose this hotel (and I did alot of research online) was for the "Grotto" pool area beacause of our two young children. The first day we got there the pool was very,very crowed due to a Zumba convention. Ok, that is understandable and we were fine with that knowing this is a hotel next to the convention center. I asked someone when the convention would be over and found out that was the last day. We were happy with that knowing we could enjoy the main reason we came and could enjoy the Grotto pool tomorrow. The next day we made our way to the Grotto pool with our two excited children! The Grotto pool was CLOSED! Not just for a day but for a whole week! How disappointing! And my husband and I are coming back to stay for our anniversary in three days! We booked these two getaways a month ago to have a relaxing weekend away. One with our children and one without. We did not come to use the older lap pool! The Grotto pool area is lush and tropical! You feel that you have escaped to a tropical island when your there. Would not have booked if I knew the Grotto pool was going to be closed for a whole week! Other than that it is a beautiful property! Would have given a five star if it was'nt for the closing of the Grotto pool for a whole week!

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel in Orlando !!”
Reviews.Author: KEEFER11
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect if your looking for a classy, luxurious stay in Orlando. It's near the Airport (15mins), Seaworld (5mins), I-Drive (5mins), Universal Studios (10mins on I-Ride to WetnWild - then 10min walk) and next to the Pointe Orlando shopping area. The hotel is amazing with top facilities. Our stay started of perfectly with Chocolate Strawberries and a welcome note in our room from the manager (Thanks Mr K). The pool area is large with additional kids pool & slide / grotto pool with waterfall & hot tub. The sun loungers are tops, not some plastic thing but proper canvas loungers - all towels are provided at the pool also ! There are various restaurants in the Hotel but we only went once to the B-Line Diner which was nice although a tad expensive. Other restaurants nearby are TGI Fridays / Olive Garden / Johnny Rockets & McD's (for the kids if needed !) We were in the New Tower (2) on the 23rd floor with a great view overlooking the pool area and most of Orlando - amazing at night - you can even see the fireworks from Disney ! The beds were just the most comfy bed you'll ever sleep in - huge bathroom with TV in the mirror ! + mini fridge & large LCD TV. You get 2 bottles of water everyday in your room + newspaper + I-Ride trolley tickets although you may have to ask at the desk for these but given gladly.
