The I-Ride trolley (Stop 26) is right outside the Hotel - perfect for going to either Outlet for shopping. (there are outlets both North & South using the RED LINE trolley). The only thing to keep in mind is this Hotel is adjacent to the Convention Centre and therefore can be busy with people staying for these conventions. We encountered a lot of kids who were staying due to some dance comp - then as we were leaving a Zumba convention was checking in - 500 of them !! but this hotel can cope no problem at all !! This is top of my list when I want to stay in Orlando again - Great Staff, very friendly, fantastic hotel - I will be back !!

Reviews.Title: “Overall it is great”
Reviews.Author: btaylorFla
Reviews.Content: Love this hotel !! The staff is great the bars are great and the food is outstanding. The bed is the most comfortable I have ever slept on. The area has lots to do and see, lots of places to eat, and lots of hotels. The cons are the parking I don't think you should have to pay $20.00 to valet park I can see $10.00 maybe $15.00 but for the rate to stay at the hotel I think it's not a fare rate. Also don't think it's fare to let people put towels on the pool chairs to save them for hours till your ready to use it.. Other than that I will come back really enjoyed ourselves very much.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel doing good for the planet”
Reviews.Author: kathy_mayberryusa
Reviews.Content: For our trips to Orlando, we stay at the Peabody. The new expansion is outstanding, the rooms are elegant and the staff is always more than accommodating. Of course the ducks are a neat experience! Also new: they offer free bottles of water in your room. Most hotels charge for things like that. I did ask if the water was actually free and was told "Yes, it is part of our green initiative and for each bottle of water the Peabody gives away, the bottler gives a donation to help conserve rainforests". (The label said 'ecospringwater' - so I assume that is who makes the donations.) Way to go Peabody! I have done research on the rainforests and do other things to help preserve them - so it was nice to add this to my list. When you stay there, make sure to get your free bottled water and, of course, you must see the duck walk.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: accounting123123
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our short stay at Peabody. It is a brand new hotel located next to International Drive (very good location). We didn't even leave the property much as we traveled with 15 month old baby and couldn't really go to the theme parks. It was fun. Pools are designed for children, ducks are great entertainment for kids, hotel hosted dance events and our toddler saw many kids. We loved it. Will be back:). Perfect hotel (clean) especially if you get a good deal. We ate at NAPA restaurant and tangerine french toast was one of a kind:).

Reviews.Title: “No Thank You is Correct!”
Reviews.Author: JSAA
Reviews.Content: Stayed at "The Peabody" over the 4th of July weekend after having visited the Memphis property several times...Memphis is truly an old world elegant experience. This is a "property out of control" trying to fill its 1600 rooms each night. Very nice rooms but the concierge was arrogant and unhelpful when asking what time an outdoor party would end on Saturday night. His answer was it would end when it ends. I asked him if things like that weren't scheduled and then asked to speak to the manager. While waiting on the manager, two "young adults" strolled through the lobby holding thier pants below their cheeks with their undergarmets showing! No one said a thing! When the manager arrived, I first asked what time the party would end and was advised 10PM...fine. I then asked if the hotel had any decency standards and was told there was "nothing he or anyone could do!" I told him I was dumb founded that a private organization couldn't require people in their public places to "pull up their pants!" The Memphis Peabody is so nice; but this Peabody demonstrated no concern as to the decorum and/or decency of those walking through their lobby. The rooms are extremely nice but the "guests" they will gladly welcome in order "to fill it up" are no more than 2-star! While walking in to the hotel, one individual overheard on a cell phone indicated that he was stopping by because he had heard that there was going to be a good party going on that evening....heard; not invited? And management doesn't care about your experience! Could never recommend and would never stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC HOTEL - A DREAM OF A VACATION”
Reviews.Author: paulinehickson1
Reviews.Content: I have just arrived back in the UK after spending 10 days in Orlando, Before we left the UK I checked with hotel that they had our booking and mentioned that the holiday was a 60th birthday present, when we arrived to check in we only waited 5 mins and were checked in by a cheerful young lady called Dannielle who noted that it was a special holiday she asked us to wait a minute and dissapeared into the back office, when she came out she said she had spoken to her Manager and the hotel would like to upgrade us to a suite. Wow it was wonderful so elegant. We went out for dinner and when we came back a box of chocs and a birthday card was in the room. I appreciate that the hotel cannot offer everyone upgrades, my husband and I were touched by this lovely young lady going that extra mile for us making this trip so special. The hospitality did not stop there, all the staff are friendly and helpful, the hotel was magnificant, all the little extra touches. We only ate once in the hotel and it was lovely. Would we recommend it - of course - would we go back again YES.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in a great location - will be back !”
Reviews.Author: gotogo
Reviews.Content: Overall a very comfortable hotel with generally excellent service. Pros: Check in lady exemplarily – we arrived at the hotel just after midnight, however within 5 minutes she had us checked in, upgraded to a balcony room for a reasonable price and already on our way to the B-Line. Large rooms, comfortable beds and a good sized bathroom. Beautiful lobby and well maintained grounds. Pool area is well laid out and very relaxing. Bell staff very attentive and not pushy – friendly and flexible, and they managed to completely avoid the usual bad taste that comes from dealing with staff that are only interested in tips. B-Line restaurant a big plus for the hotel – open 24/7 and food quality good – prices though are a little on the wild side - $17 for Bacon Cheeseburger ? The Ducks Smoking areas very well maintained. Cons: Shower/Bath tub combo – it’s practical, but u don’t come to a luxury hotel to shower in the bathtub ! No Coffee/Tea making facilities in the room While the room we stayed in was overall very clean, we did notice stains on the carpet around the minibar, which had not been addressed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Luxurious Hotel”
Reviews.Author: carrie0514
Reviews.Content: The Peabody is a wonderful hotel in Orlando. Very conveniently located for Seaworld, Discovery Cove, Aquatica, shopping and dining. The B-Line Diner inside the hotel is fabulous! They have amazing breakfast and desserts. My family did feel slightly uncomfortable going downstairs to go to the pool in our swim suits and towels while business executives in their suits and ties attended a huge business convention going on during our stay. The room was clean and well equipped and my boys LOVE the TV built into the bathroom mirror. They wanted to hang out in the bathtub anytime they were in the room! The room-service pizza we ordered was excellent! The Peabody is very close to Point Orlando, a wonderful place for shopping/dining. Don't miss the duck parade. 5 ducks (1 female/4 males) come down from their "duck palace" on the elevator at 11am, march down the red carpet, and swim in the lobby's marble fountain until 5pm where the march down the red carpet again returning to their palace! It is toooo cute!

Reviews.Title: “no better for a convention visit”
Reviews.Author: ptbooth
Reviews.Content: Attended a meeting at the convention center, and this was the absolute top option. Top notch hotel, right across the street from the convention center, but elegant with the Duck Parade and all! Several dining options from diner to Calfornia cuisine and poolside casual fare. The addition (new since I last visited Orlando a few years ago) has made this really quite the hotel destination for those wishing to stay in the convention center and I drive area. Not cheap, but there are plenty of cheap Orlando options...

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mikeyuk_Wigan
Reviews.Content: Where to start ......Travelling were my wife and me and two friends. The first people to greet us at The Peabody were the Valet parking guys...all very friendly and didn't hassle you if you didn't want there service. Next at checkin the staff were very polite and approachable.....We already had 2 rooms allocated to us ( Thank you ) They were on the 18th floor in the new tower and i can safely say they were the best hotel rooms i have ever stayed in. We had amazing views of Downtown Orlando right round over I-Drive to Downtown Disney and would sit there many evenings watching the incredible thunderstorms and fireworks from Disney. The room had a king bed, two comfortable armchairs and huge TV. Everyday the room was cleaned to an impecable standard with a turn down service in the evening where you room was serviced again and a few chocolates were left on the bed. The hotel has 2 pools one bieng a grotto style pool which our room overlooked. It is a massive hotel and i'm sure in our 14 night stay we missed something but we did see the March of The Peabody Ducks which you must watch at least once during your stay. The only negative thing i have to say is that i would like a coffee machine in my room...I did venture down for the free coffee and use the coffee shop in reception, but first thing in the morning i do like to laze about in my room and not have to get ready to get a coffee. There's loads more i could write but the best way to appreciate this hotel is to stay there i'm sure you won't be dissapointed....By the way i loved it so much within 24 hour of returning home I have re-booked and will be returning in December.

Reviews.Title: “EXcellent experience”
Reviews.Author: WPBTA
Reviews.Content: Excellent experience from the minute I pulled into the hotel. The valet was friendly and coudn't have been nicer- I felt as if I were pulling into my own home. This after a very trying day and drive, The check in experience was equally as good- very friendly and attentive staff. I was offered my choice of floor and location. The rooms are extremely comfortable, current in design and immaculate. Plenty of towels, beautiful modern baths. Every bit of luxurious pampering that I needed. Dinner at their Napa restaurant was delightful. The server there also very friendly and accomodating. I can't recall the last time I stayed or visited hotel where every encounter with staff was professional, friendly and so attentive. Much better choice than any Disney hotels in Orlando for business- even though my business in Orlando was on a Disney property. Only wish I could have stayed one more night and look forward to visiting this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel on I-Drive”
Reviews.Author: pandg1
Reviews.Content: Hotel is gorgeous, luxurious and very comfortable. We stayed in an Executive Room in the new tower which overlooked International Drive and the amazing pool. The room was exceptionally clean, modern and spacious. The staff are friendly and welcoming. The pool area and bar are fabulous. The food at the pool bar is very good quality and reasonably priced. You also get a complimentary ticket for the I Ride for 24 hours which was of great use. The location is superb with bars and restaurants close by (walking distance) and Seaworld just around the corner. The only disappointment would be the lack of transport to the themeparks. However, it is mainly a business hotel but this does mean that the pool is always empty and quiet. There is a great diner in the old building of the hotel which is open 24 hours. Overall, we had a great stay and will stay here again on our return to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Elegance at Its Best”
Reviews.Author: memphisgal
Reviews.Content: I am from Memphis, so I am very familiar with the Peabody Hotel and all of its charms. This was my first time staying at the Peabody in Orlando. I travel for business quite a lot and let me just say this hotel is exceptional. The staff was very friendly on arrival. No issues checking in a bit early. I only regret is that I didn't arrive earlier or stay later in order to enjoy all that the Peabody has to offer. I did take time out for a manicure at the spa. I recommend going to the spa even if it is just to browse the items for purchase. I found Moroccan oil which is amazing. I also purchased a wonderful eye mask that can be either heated or chilled. I am looking forward to staying there again, but this time with my husband and not for business.

Reviews.Title: “An incredibly comfortable room and welcoming staff!”
Reviews.Author: Ellengk
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 3 nights while attending a conference at the Orange County Convention Center. You can't get much closer to the OCCC than the Peabody - it's connected with covered walkways. The staff at the Peabody really makes you feel at home - they were around whenever I had questions or needed directions, etc. The room has been nicely upgraded and the bed was one of the most comfortable I have had in some time. While you are there, don't forget to eat at one of their in-house restaurants, the B-Line Diner. Casual but very customer service oriented, the menu options are outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Poor treatment”
Reviews.Author: ARC55
Reviews.Content: I have stayed twice at this hotel. The first time when it was in the midst of expanding and then more recently after the expansion. From the moment I arrived I was astonished at the treatment of their guests. When you arrive you are offered the choice of an expensive valet or an almost equally expensive self park option. Not different then the other hotels except the parking lot is a goo three or more minutes walk from the lobby entrance. The quickest way is along the driveway exposed to the elements and valet race car drivers. Who ever planned this should design an easier way to park and walk to the lobby. I guess they want you to valet. The. When I arrived at check in the. Line was long. They told us that the computer system was over loaded and we could either wait indefinitely or check our bags and sit at the bar. No complimentary discount just an hour wait and then you pay the bar bill, tip the bellman, and trudge up to your room. I had an old room. So so bur not as nice as the new tower's rooms. The was not unusual except for the one night when six of us decided to eat at their Napa restaurant. We arrived at 6 when the restaurant was mostly empty. We ordered our dinner at 6:15 and were promptly given our appetizers. By 7:30 we still did not have our main course. We asked the waiter who said that he would check. He never returned. We asked the manager to check. Fifteen minutes later she returned and said that it would be out shortly. By 8:30 our meal arrived. My steak was supposed to be medium well. It came out rare cold center. I asked for it to be cooked more. By 9:30 it still had not come out. Then a waiter carrying a steak looked lost and finally placed it in front of me. It was a different steak and it was raw as well. At this time all my guest had finished dinner and I only had a breadstick and water. The manager asked if I wanted a hamburger deliver as room service to my room and they would add it to the bill. At this time after 10 and four hours of waiting I did not want to eat. We paid the bill and then my party left and I asked for the manager. I told her the story and she said that they would take the steak off the bill. I said that this should have been done without my asking and that any quality restaurant would have offered a complimentary dinner the next night ( which I would have declined since I checked out the next day). After our stay we would NEVER stay at a Peabody again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tails_245
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 weeks at the Peabody at the end of May/beginning of June (2 adults and 4 year old twin boys). The Peabody is a fantastic hotel, with great facilities and really helpful staff. The outside pool area is amazing (especially for a young family) and isn't well publicised - it completly exceeded our expectations. It is a very large hotel, but the benefit of this is lots of onsite amenities (a good shop, various dining options etc). Location is good as we found a few (cheaper) places to eat and the Pointe is really near. We had a view of Disney from the room and watched the fireworks most evenings. We were slightly concerned about sharing a room with our 2 children but there was a fair amount of space and it was never an issue. Would certaintly recommend to any families travelling to Orlando and make sure you see the Duck March!.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but needs Sun Umbrella's around the pool”
Reviews.Author: Martynk
Reviews.Content: Great stay, nice hotel and very nice rooms, and a good location for the parks. More of a business hotel but caters well for holiday makers as well. Only criticism was that in 90f heat there are no sun umbrellas around the pool, except the tables where you eat, so you will just fry in the heat. You can hire a 'tent' for the day from $60 but they really need to just supply sun shades to the families using the pool. I asked an attendant who said they 'were on order' . Worth checking if you have kids and want to spend time by the pool

Reviews.Title: “Ultimate Luxury at a Resonable Price”
Reviews.Author: Tremdis
Reviews.Content: The Peabody Orlando was overall an excellent hotel. We went with our two kids (2 years and 6 months) and they accommodated EVERY request. We had both a toddler crib and an infant crib in our room! The kiddie pool area was awesome! We loved our bed. It was very comfortable. I am a Marriott Rewards Platinum Member and can say that the Peabody should be darn proud of playing with the big boys, and in many instances over delivering. It was 5 minutes from Seaworld (literally down the street), and 10-15 minutes from Disneyworld. I was not attending a conference, heard about the duck show, and wanted to stay on a non-Marriott property for comparison. I stayed at the JW and the Ritz locally. Peabody staff= keep up the awesome work! No matter what time I went to the lobby, there was someone wiping the glass doors and taking the scuff marks off the floor. Clean, clean, clean hotel. I did order 4 bottle water (small Fiji), a chocolate milk (which was too strong on chocolate for my daughter) and 2 small strawberry ice creams (a scoop each) and spent $46! The prices for the grill by the pool are A LOT more reasonable. The room even had a TV in the mirror of the restroom. Handy when it is your only "alone" time with two kids! Will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Too Good To Be True...”
Reviews.Author: Kattsmeow
Reviews.Content: We loved it. We got a deal on a discount site, which was pleasantly surprising. Everything was perfect, but the view from the rooms window, which is not a big deal. We stayed in the old tower; there was nothing old about it. Everything looked clean and new. We arrived a few hours early and went to the pool. The staff were very friendly and helpful, everywhere. We ate lunch and dinner at the B-Line, it was wonderful. The duck cookies are too cute! We did go and see the ducks; we watched their entrance in the morning. It was such a big deal and there were a lot of people, so go a bit early if you can. It was very fun to watch. The terrace pool was nice for people without children, quiet and relaxing. The main pool was also very nice, the water slide was fun. I had a drink in the Lobby bar, next to the ducks and it was amazing. It is their signature drink and it tasted like pineapple upside-down cake. It was a strong drink without tasting strong, so it was worth it. The down side was I could only have one. The room was neat and clean. It smelled like clean soap and the TV in the bathroom was just plain cool. The room was very big for a standard room and the only uncomfortable thing was sleeping with down pillows. (We don't like them but a lot of people do. Also, please know we didn't ask for other pillows, we didn't think of it for some reason.) Bottom line this was an excellent stay at a most wonderful hotel. I would gladly recommend it to anyone. I honestly can't wait to stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel for Business, Conventions, etc.”
Reviews.Author: James_Manktelow
Reviews.Content: This is a good business/convention hotel. It's just across the road from the Orange County Convention Center (100m walk to the front door), it's in a nice part of town, it's smart, the gym is fine, it has good restaurants, the staff were helpful, I had a good room, and so on... I'm searching for something fair but negative to say to give balance to my review, but nothing comes to mind. One tip is to get a room as high in the towers as possible - the views over Orlando are great.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, responsive air-conditioner.”
Reviews.Author: Sealfat
Reviews.Content: I attended an international programming competition here. Tacked on a few extra days of pleasure after business. Business side--excellent space, decent conference food, GREAT beds, helpful staff. Rooms--motion-sensored light under the nightstands and bathroom vanity for middle-of-the-night bathroom trips. Quiet and responsive air-conditioner. Conference food--appreciate moist scrambled eggs when it's buffet-style, dry French toast, abundant bacon. For dinner, delicious fried chicken and REALLY good European sausage. (High-quality, high-calorie meat is very important to software engineers.) Plenty of semi-initmate and public lounges for like-minded attendees to chat. Pleasure side--adult pool and family-friendly pools are separate. Very desirable. Spa--tried the sports massage--Kim was okay, but not a lot of experience compared to what I have had in the past. I get the feeling people are paying for the spa's steam rooms, hot tubs and mango-ginger juice, rather than the actual service. Did not appreciate the intrusive television show in the waiting room or the automatic 20% gratuity. Nice touch of chocolate truffle at the end. Restaurants--only tried the B-line diner and had breakfast and dinner there. They need to wipe their chairs and clean their tables better considering the rest of the hotel's cleanliness. Overall, excellent experience and would choose The Peabody again.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel at a great price”
Reviews.Author: NYKfan
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Peabody was very helpful, kind and courteous. I found a great deal on Expedia around $423 for 4 nights + Alamo rental. I called the hotel a week before to request to stay in the new tower. They were able to accommodate my request. We arrived around 12 AM this past Friday and were warmly greeted by the Front Desk. After check-in, we ate at the B-Line Diner (open 24 hours), which was delicious and very reasonable. The parking is said to be far from the hotel. It is not a bad walk at all (3-5 minutes) if you are staying in the Main Tower (new tower). The new pool area grotto is beautiful and it has a slide. The poolside staff was extremely attentive. It got windy one evening at the pool grotto so we switched pools because we noticed that it was much warmer up by the Mallard Tower pool (old tower 6th floor). It was nice for evening/night swimming. The rooms in the new tower are extremely clean. There's a TV, weighing scale and floor sensor lights in the bathroom. The toiletries are Gilchrist & Soames. The beds are very comfortable. We didn't get to visit the fitness room or unfortunately the spa. All the walking at the parks in the hot sun was a work out in itself! Driving to Sea World or Universal Studios (for Harry Potter Wizarding World!) is very easy (5-10 minute drive). We walked from the hotel to The Pointe shops for dinner at Cuba Libre (yummy). We noticed hotel golf carts offering rides but, the walk is very doable. To celebrate our anniversary we wanted to have a nice seafood dinner in the Disney area. The concierge recommended Todd English Blue Zoo at the Disney Dolphin Resort. What a great recommendation. The food was delicious and they greeted us with dessert champagne and strawberries. All in all the Peabody was the way to go! I'm glad I researched this property via Trip Advisor before going to Orlando. The hotel's ranking since February has jumped from #120+ to #67 and seems to be getting better. These reviews have been very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel chock full of amenties and nearby to it all!”
Reviews.Author: cooffwego
Reviews.Content: Our 18th floor room was very nice, except for one small thing. Could not open the bathroom door full way because it was so tiny! Had to step around the door inside just to close it. A towel or rug on the floor was simply out of the question and was in the way. The toilet was literally < 16 inches from the wall you faced, a real head banger in the middle of the night! I would also recommend that the hotel run more courtesy golf cart transportation to/from the hotel to the parking garage. Many times we walked because people movers were no where to be found. Staff was very courteous, room clean, all pools great, and be sure to check out the B-Diner = really good food, especially the bananna peanut butter french toast! I would definately stay again, but ask for a full bath.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, give it a shot!”
Reviews.Author: rockytherockstar
Reviews.Content: Currently staying at this hotel now (5/28-6/4). The hotel and grounds are immaculate. New pool is fantastic. Service is top notch. Housekeeping does a great job. Self-parking is $12 and the resort fee is $9. The resort fee provides you with wireless Internet, two bottles of water daily, two I-Ride trolley tickets, coffee, and use of the fitness center. Not a bad value for $9, although, these fees are a joke at any hotel. I-Ride tickets are $2.50 RT per person. Use the water, and they replace them – they do not stockpile the water in your room. The coffee provided is okay. I am not an Orlando hotel pool expert, but I’d have to guess that the new Peabody pool is one of the best in the area. The fitness center may be the best I’ve seen at a hotel anywhere. We took the I-Ride trolley to Sea World and it was great. Did not take long at all, and it drops passengers at the side of the front entrance. The rooms are very clean, and the beds/pillows are comfortable. Soaps are Gilchrist & Soames. We are staying in one of the original towers, and I was told the rooms were recently renovated. If you self-park, the garage is a short walk, or you can get a ride on a golf cart to the garage by asking a hotel bellman out front. If you are looking for a cheaper option to the Ritz or JW Marriott, then give this place a shot. We booked through a third party site that provided the name of the hotel after purchase. Our nightly base rate is $78/night. Our room overlooks the roof of the convention area, and two men painting the side of the hotel. I was told by an employee the hotel is at 30-40% capacity for most of the week. Our floor is very quiet, and uneventful, which is nice. Who would not want a better view? However, I’ve never been one to sit in my room and look out the window on vacation, especially one in this area. It is a convention hotel, and there were two going on when we arrived. The hotel is right next to the Orange County Convention Center, however there is nothing currently happening there now (holiday week). Convention goers usually don’t take up space at a pool all day anyway. My only complaint is that when I originally called the hotel to check my reservation I was told that the resort fee was optional. At check-in I was told that he resort fee was a mandate. When I spoke to a concierge I was asked if I opted into the resort fee, and then when I asked a customer service rep on the phone later about this, I was told it was a mandate. That is very annoying. I would have opted out as I already have wireless Internet with me on the trip. if you are paying top dollar to stay here, then get to the bottom of this "option". I'm guessing I was mandated to pay this fee based on the rate I booked.

Reviews.Title: “What a stay!”
Reviews.Author: MichelleRJ
Reviews.Content: This hotel was one of our high points of the trip to Orlando. We checked in at 2:00 am, since we had a problem with our flight, and the reception provided everything we needed, from a quick check in to a hygienic kit, since we had a delay in or luggage. The hotel counts with 3 restaurants and the dinner was a very good option for a great breakfast before going to the parks. There was also a snack bar, where we could have quick bites and a store with eatable products. It is a very big hotel, with a convention center, but an impecable assistance. The bellman were very helpful and helped us with our luggage every time we came from the outlets, parks, etc. We opted for the self parking in a garage building next to the hotel, but the golf cart picked us when we wanted. We did not have time to enjoy the pools of the hotel, but they weer often visited by the guests and it seemed very nice. The room was excellent, very modern and spacious. The ducks were well treated, but we also felt like we were spoiled too!

Reviews.Title: “Look Elsewhere--Not Up To Par”
Reviews.Author: LuvtoVisit108
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over Memorial Day weekend on the 5th Floor, Mallard Tower (old tower). The public spaces are beautiful, and the staff in general were very pleasant to deal with. However, the room itself (while remodeled) still seems very dated, with popcorn ceilings and older looking wallpaper. The soundproofing is poor, so you can hear people in the hallway and next door yelling/talking. We were put in the room at the end of the hall next to the Ice Machine so I could hear that noise all night long. The layout of the bathroom was cramped, but the worse part was our tub was CLOGGED when I went to take a shower. Gross. The metal cap underneath the tub faucet/spout was also broken and falling off. I would see the rusting and mildew inside. Worst of all, Housekeeping refused to change my bed linens even though I placed the "Please Change Bed Linens" card clearly and plainly on my pillow. The bed was re-made by housekeeping, but the linens were not changed and I could tell because my daughter had been eating crackers the day before and there were cracker crumbs on the INSIDE part of the sheets. Basically, housekeeping remade the bed and replaced the bed linen card so that I would think the sheets were changed. THEY WERE NOT. With so many families staying in Orlando---why is the smoking section outside the front doors of the hotel? Many families stand at the Valet turn around to wait for their rental cars. It is idiotic to put the smoking section near this area, where many kids sit and wait for cars. With so many hotel options in Orlando, you should look elsewhere. The hotel itself is nice, but major improvements can be made (especially with housekeeping and cleanliness). Be aware that this hotel charges a "resort" fee, which doesn't include parking but includes 2 bottles of water a day.

Reviews.Title: “Don't hesitate! The best place in Orlando!”
Reviews.Author: Megan0511
Reviews.Content: WOW! Where do I start? From the moment we arrived at the Peabody, we were greeted with smiling faces. Every single staff person we encountered during our 5 day stay not only smiled but said "hi" to us. The housekeeping is wonderful, they even rearranged my daughter's stuffed animals into cute little poses. We really appreciated the little things. There is a complimentary umbrella in the closet for those rainy days, and my husband forgot his toothbrush, and they brought one right up... at NO extra cost. And to our surprise it was a Colgate, not some dollar store toothbrush. Concierge did a great job directing us places and was VERY knowledgeable and friendly. The B-line diner was to die for and is open 24 hours! On our last night we were approaching the hotel from a long walk and one of the staff gave us a ride on a golf cart the rest of the way. I cannot say enough good things about this hotel (and I have a BIG mouth!). We had very comfortable pillow-top mattress beds and nice fluffy pillows. The TV in the bathroom mirror was a wonderful added touch. Another little thing that was much appreciated was the bathroom scale that we found under the vanity. Little surprises around every corner. The room was very spacious with a beautiful floor to ceiling window view of the pool. The pool was great and my 11 year old had a great time on the waterslide. Definitely check this place out, you will NOT be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Everything and more....”
Reviews.Author: Smotel
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my brother for five nights from May 22nd -27th. Can't say anything negative. The rooms were great, the b-line diner was very good. It is in a great location to explore I-drive and the resort fee is reasonable considering you get newspapers, free wi-fii, and bottled water every day. The duck march was nice but it is very brief. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE this hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: NCAlice
Reviews.Content: My husband had business and I had leisure time for this trip. There is absolutely nothing I could say negatively about The Peabody. Beautiful in every way and the entire staff of the hotel was friendly, helpful and engaging.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels!”
Reviews.Author: Josephine_k
Reviews.Content: The only and really only negative aspect of this hotel is the air conditioning, which for a european, is set very low :) Excellent hotel indeed. Very, very good service, large and elegant rooms, great views, 2 beautiful big pools (Tip: the old one is more quiet). Everything needed was in the room, from hairdryer to a bathroom scale (was very usefull to determine how much overweight i have in my luggage!). Enjoyed every day there!

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best”
Reviews.Author: AmyAmyBoBamy
Reviews.Content: I have absolutely nothing bad to say about the Peabody Orlando. From check-in to checkout the service was impeccable. Workers were friendly and diligent. Even housekeeping went the extra mile so that I walked into a spotless, organized room each and every time. As far as amenities went, the pool was gorgeous-- and warm! There was a zero entry section and a waterslide-- something for everyone. The gift shop was convenient and the coffee shop was delicious. But the restaurant, Napa, was divine. Every course (and drink) made us forget we were in a hotel restaurant. Our family was in town both to attend a conference at the conveniently nearby convention center AND visit Magic Kingdom and Universal Orlando. The parks were all a quick and easy drive away. Completely satisfying experience. Thanks again, Peabody!

Reviews.Title: “FIRST CLASS PROPERTY”
Reviews.Author: PittsburghRose
Reviews.Content: This property is fabulous -- beautiful rooms, beautiful grounds, exceptional, friendly, accommodating staff -- this property has it all going on. Loved the location -- easy walking distance to some great restaurants, utilized the International Drive trolley -- top notch hotel.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING HOLIDAY”
Reviews.Author: Jen1330
Reviews.Content: We have recently returned from a 14 night stay at the Peabody , the stay here was fabulous and the hotel is beautiful. The rooms, restaurants and pools are immaculate and the staff go beyond their roles to help you out. The daily duck parade gives the hotel such a lovely character and charm. I would recommend anyone travelling to the Orlando area to pay that little bit extra to stay in such a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch in all ways!!”
Reviews.Author: lisaspup
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Peabody for 7 nights in April of 2011. I was in Orlando for a conference for 4 days. I decided to bring my sister and son and extended the trip to 7 days to make a vacation out of it. The Peabody exceeded our expectaions in all ways. The room was beautiful and very clean. The staff was helpful and pleasant. The ducks were a delight to watch each day. The location was perfect. While I was in the conference, my family was able to take the I-Trolley to explore International Drive. They also spent hours at the grotto pool which is comparable to the best pools in the Disney resorts. On my free days, we were able to arrange easy and reasonable transportation to Disney World and Universal Studios. Since the hotel is so close to the conference center, I was unsure if there would be enough activities to keep my family entertained while I was in the conference. I am so glad that I decided to bring them. I turned out to be an excellent business and leisure trip!!

Reviews.Title: “Best stay ever”
Reviews.Author: tash070707007
Reviews.Content: I have been to a lot of top class hotels be this one has to be to best. It has classy room,a beautiful pool and fantasising ducks.it is the best choice in a hotel but the valet parkers are sometimes annoying.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: lovey6571
Reviews.Content: Service was excellent; everyone was friendly and efficient from check-in to check-out! My room was fantastic; tons of pillows! The decor is incredible. I loved all of the welcoming lobby seating and the chandeliers! The ducks are the best; wonderfully cute! And the Duck Master is AWESOME! We teachers ask tough questions and he handled us like a champ! He's very knowledgeable, thorough, and patient! Just as nice and gracious as he could be! My only complaints are: Self-parking could be more easily accessible. Just kind of felt like there could have been a more direct path to the garage. The fountains outside the entry areas are too loud. However, I do understand this is due to the "tunnel-effect" of the covered entries; it just echos. My final complaint: I COULDN'T STAY LONG ENOUGH! :) Back in reality there's no waterfowl pillows, no Peabody Dream Bed, no marching ducks, and no soap duckies in my bathroom! Sometimes reality stinks! LOL!

Reviews.Title: “The Gracious, Friendly Staff Lend a Personal Touch to this Huge Hotel”
Reviews.Author: We'reReady!!
Reviews.Content: This hotel is absolutely mammouth and one gets a workout just walking around the place! Upon entering it does seems a bit cool, with the vast rooms, shiny marble, and sparse lobby furniture. The place grew on me, however. The rooms are spacious and have comfortable, warm furnishings. These beds are among the best I ever slept on in any hotel; the mattresses are the perfect balance between plush and firm. A refrigerator comes in handy too. By the way, opt for to pay the modest resort fee; it is worth it to receive wireless service, two cold bottles of water daily, vouchers for the trolley system (stops right outside the hotel), and the New York Times. Those that qualify for Club Level service will enjoy the wonderful array of continental breakfast choices as well as delectable evening hors d'oevres. The pools are wonderful, especially the one which is equivalent to about two and one half Olympic pools! One complaint I do have is that the hotel has not opted to erect a large awning at either pool. It seems negligent not to have that feature in sunny Florida, with damaging UV rays. While there are a few cabanas to rent, shade from the sun should be a right not a privilege. Finally, the staff at the Peabody are exceptional! Their smiles were genuine and their advice helpful. Somone from the concierge desk even assisted me in printing out a boarding pass from my laptop; that is really going above and beyond. The Peabody is still a family hotel and guests really do get that feeling of family when they stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: EurofilesfromBeds
Reviews.Content: I am attending a convention and the Peabody is a huge hotel. I have absolotely no complaints about the rooms or the service. The only gripe I having to queue to get into the Bline restaurant, there must be a more efficient way of meeting the needs of its customers.

Reviews.Title: “Love, Love, Love it!!”
Reviews.Author: Joolsandlyla
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through Alpharooms havng watched it being built over the last few trips to Orlando...the price we got it for was unreal but we would be prepared to pay the going rate to come back. Staff were all lovely and service was fantastic. We got a room in the new tower which was fantastic and overlooked the pool area. Cant recommend this hotel enough.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, but with a few issues (e.g. wi-fi)”
Reviews.Author: JohnnyPx
Reviews.Content: In short, this hotel was excellent! But, with a few minor issues detailed below. Good things: + We requested a stay in the new building, and got it. + They responded quickly to our e-mails prior to arrival (generally a good indication of the service level you can expect at a hotel). + Rooms were nice and clean with good AC. + The hotel was sufficiently staffed and staff was friendly. + The B-Line diner in the hotel was the best breakfast place in the hotel area (~$20/person incl. tip). Things that could be improved: - The wi-fi wasn't working properly in our room. It would work if you stood at the door, but the further into the room you went, the more issues it started having. When you reached the bed it usually wouldn't work at all. Hopefully they will fix this soon, they probably haven't had time to set it up properly in the new building. - No vending machines in the hotel, and the hotel store was closed late at night! - The business center was really expensive (ended up costing $5 to be online for a couple of minutes to print a couple of pages), so you absolutely need to bring your own computer. - The hotel's own website is really expensive, you can get rooms half the price booking through e.g. hotels.com. Nevertheless, the hotel was excellent. I've been staying in tens of hotels during the last couple of years and I can say that the only better one in this price level was the Signature at MGM Grand in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best, most amazing hotel I've ever seen!”
Reviews.Author: Mark-nole
Reviews.Content: Our group has an annual conference, usually held in Orlando. We were at the Peabody in 2009, but tried another nearby property the following year. It was nowhere near as nice as the Peabody, so we returned this year. (Thank goodness!) Most reviewers (and hotel guests) are leisure travelers, and New York 1974's review is right on target for the lucky folks on holiday. My comments are directed towards the business and convention crowd; you simply can't find a better, more accommodating venue. From the initial planning phases, through the "pre-con" event walkthrough, until the after-conference survey of our members, we were amazed by the professionalism, friendliness and special touches that made this our best, most memorable conference ever. A good hotel knows the answer to your questions; a great one anticipates these questions in advance and can suggest best practices they’ve gleaned from hundreds of previous events. That is what we found at the Peabody - a dedicated and personable staff that was as committed to our success as we were. The location (directly adjacent to the Orange County Convention Center) is certainly a plus, but we found the facilities at the Peabody to be far superior, and only needed to use the Convention Center for a half day. The spacious (and spotless) meeting rooms for our plenary and breakout sessions were superior in every way. From the catering staff to the A/V technicians, we were simply amazed by the level of competence and ability. Folks, these people know how to put on a winning conference, and we WILL be back!

Reviews.Title: “WOW - What a hotel!”
Reviews.Author: bishoparc
Reviews.Content: I normally don't rate places I stay this high but there is not really anything I can say bad about this place. I was there for 4 nights for a business conference and boy was I impressed. The staff was absolutely the most friendliest staff at a hotel I have ever seen. They put Disney to shame. Everyone there was so very helpful and made our conference a huge success. All of the food prepared for our daily breakfast, lunch, and dinner was fantastic. The hotel has 2 bars both of which were very upscale and even for a non drinker provided a great atmosphere to catch up with colleagues. Close proximity to all the theme parks. Sea World and Universal are both right next door and Disney is only about a 10-15 minute drive. Also about 10-15 minutes from the airport. Rooms are very well appointed. HUGE flat screen TV and a TV in the mirror in the bathroom!! I stayed in the "old" tower but nothing about it said old to me. The room was extremely clean and very comfortable. Free internet access. Beds and pillows were very comfortable. If I had one negative thing to say it would be that the doors slam very hard so if you have a lot of people near you when they leave and come back the doors can be heard quite loudly. The entire hotel was clean. Both pools were very nice although the pool off of the lobby is probably the nicer of the 2. If you have a chance to stay here I would highly recommend it. I normally stay in a condo when visiting Orlando for personal trips but the Peabody is on my list to bring my wife to sometime in the near future! Valet parking is $20 per day or $12 for self park. The garage is a little ways away so I recommend valet.

Reviews.Title: “Maybe our Favorite Hotel yet!”
Reviews.Author: LovedToronto
Reviews.Content: This just might be our all-time favorite hotel, and we've stayed in some very nice ones, including several 5-star ones in Vegas. I "won" this off Priceline and was thrilled, as we have visited this hotel in the past just to see the duck "parade". We arrived Friday, April 15th for a 3-night stay, and did not want to leave! From the moment we arrived, we enjoyed every minute. Everyone was so friendly and helpful! We got a room in the new tower, which was awesome! Loved the built-in tv in the large round mirror in the bathroom. (which doesn't get fogged up) What a nice touch to have the sensored nightlights that come on as you step around the rooms in the dark. The bed and pillows could not possibly have been more comfortable! Speaking of comfortable, they really have thought of every need...robes, a refrigerator, a safe, even an umbrella. They have some really cool "stock the fridge" packages you can purchase. (which didn't appear to be as outrageously expensive as you might expect) Absolutely adored the duck theme everywhere...from the cute little duck soap in the bathroom, to the ducks on the bathmat...every time you turned around there was another cute duck to admire. And, of course, the duck parade is not to be missed! (Be advised that children might see a part of nature they might not have seen before...we've witnessed this a couple times with the amorous ducks). We tried the Beeline Diner a couple times and found the food to be pretty darn okay, although a tad expensive. I will say that I enjoyed a chardonnay that I feared would be ridiculously expensive there, then was very pleased to see it was only $6 per glass. Also, saw some earrings in the gift shop that I liked and was stunned that they were just $9.99! Yes, you heard right! ( the protein drink my husband bought there was $5 though...who got the better deal? HAH!) Valet parking was $20 per day plus tax. Service was quick and friendly for it. There is a "resort fee" at this hotel, which is pretty darn typical for the nicer hotels in Orlando, so it was to be expected. It was nice though that this meant internet was available. This was invaluable to us when we found out that tornadoes had hit our home town while we were gone! Would have loved to stay longer and try out the fitness center, perhaps the spa, and some of the other restaurants. Rocks Lounge had live music Friday night when we checked in, but we were too tired to go enjoy it. We spent two whole days in parks, so we spent way less time than we would have liked in the hotel itself. I might add that we are not pool people, but seeing the pool from the hall window near the elevators from our 13th floor made us want to be pool people and have the time to experience it. Water-slide included! The ONLY thing we disliked about The Peabody was that we only had 3 nights there! Now please excuse me while I go check our lottery ticket to see if we can go back tomorrow!

Reviews.Title: “Fab Hotel”
Reviews.Author: roundtheworld53
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week. Its a great hotel on International Drive with fantastic facilities. Its located about a 5-10 min walk from Pointe Orlando which has lots of restaraunts and a few shops. The i trolly stop is right outside the door and its about 20 minute drive from the airport. They have a 9 dollar a day resort fee but its worth it because you get the paper every morning, bottles of water in your fridge and wifi which is excellent. There is also an ipod docking station in the room which was brilliant. There are two pool areas one with slides and smaller pools and another fifty meter pool with loads of sun loungers around them. There is a nice fitness centre there with facilities to shower and freshen up if you have a late flight and have already checked out. We found the staff including the conceriege to be very friendly and helpful. The duck parade which happens at 11 and five every day is wonderful and a definite must see!! I would recommend viewing it from upstairs as it can get a little crowded downstairs. Will definatley stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Now I understand why this hotel is not within the top 50 in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: hoxtonbabe
Reviews.Content: I was originally booked at a different hotel on Idrive for 14days, but due to the rooms being unsuitable to my needs I checked out after 4 days and stayed the remaining 10 at the peabody. I managed to get a fantasic rate and called reservations before actually booking to make sure I would not encounter the same issues like the previous hotel. I called reservations and was helped by two exceptional ladies call Stephanie and Diana, I can not praise these ladies enough, excellent in every way and more importantly very understanding to my needs. So off I went kids in tow for my 10 days, now this hotel is as beautiful as the website pictures show, infact I dont think the website pictures do it justice as it really is nice and modern (even the older part looks good for its age) Check in was ok, although reception need to tell guests upon check in what ammeneties are included, I booked very last minute and I forgot it was only until I got up to the room after some hours and I read the in room info that I remembered that the trolley pass, local calls, ect..are included, but if you dont read the info in room or booked way ahead so not likely to remember you will never know this due to recepion not telling you and if you booked via a 3rd party like expedia then you are really stuffed as that info is not always in the description. I am a creature of modern comforts and this hotel, especially the rooms has it all, the bathroom TV was a delight, the bed super comfy, lots of space, nice decor...however I stay in an awful lot of hotels and most of them are 4-5 star, so seeing a glitzy room can no longer cloud my judgement and I base a lot of my opinions of a hotel on service rather than style and this is where this hotel falls short. Concierge : Pretentious and snooty are the best words to describe them, the Peabody needs to figure out if they want to be a business or family hotel, I was speaking with a staff member who explained for many years they were more more a business client hotel which would explain the "professionalisim" to the point of frosty and cold from nearly all the concerige staff, but if they are trying to pull familes in they really need to drop the attitude. I asked "Nathan" on concerige if they had an ice machine, I was told "Well of course" with a tone that suggested I was some kind of hill-billy for even asking, now bearing in mind there is nothing I could find in the room to tell you where the ice machine was located I just assumed like some 4* deluxe and 5* hotels in the UK, they did not have a ice machine because it is usually sent up to you free of charge through room service. That was just one of many attitude issues I had with concierge,I also had an issue with being given wrong information by another lady on concerige who equally had a stinking attitude, and ended up speaking with Marlina the duty manager, who was a total delight, professional, friendly, bent over backwards to help sort things out. I think the majority of the concerige staff are straight out of college as they all seemed a bit young and inexperienced and you could see hints of attitude and diva strops coming through if things got a bit tough for them. Housekeeping: I am still unsure if I just got the short straw in the housekeeping department or if this is how the whole HK team operate. The first 4-5 days were ok, but by day 5 I realised that the room had not been hoovered (1 adult and 2 children with one being a toddler the room by the way) or if it had been it was a very bad job, lots of smear marks still left on tables, thick dust around bedside lamp, ipod stereo and TV and also on the shelves where they fold and put the towels, bathroom not being mopped (my toddler cant quite aim well so lets just say when he misses you know about it after some days if not cleaned properly) fridge not shut properly after refilling with water (they did this 3 times by the way) which caused my sons milk to go off as the cupboard the fridge is located is very warm, some days I got shower gel, some days didn't, this kind of stuff should not be occuring in this level of hotel, how can you have a guest stay for 10 days and midway through their stay not give the room a deep clean?!? Clearly they do not have many long stay guests as I had to call up housekeeping twice about this as the room was getting pretty dirty (the first time fell on deaf ears) but in fairness I blame the supervisors, they are the ones who are supposed to inspect the rooms and they are the ones who are allowing this poor standard of cleaning to go on. Bell Hop: Overall they were pretty friendly, but upon check in not one of them even bothered to try and help me (and one guy actually looked over at me) with my 2 large suitcases, pram and kids, so was left to struggle with this up to me room on my own and neither did the lady at reception ask if I needed help, but at that stage I was just happy to be out fo the other hotel. Reception: Other than chek in and check out I did not have much contact with reception, I have mentioned about check in, not the best as they lady who check me in could have been more informative but nothing could prepare me for the receptionist named "Britney" She has no business working front of house, and she should be kept on switchboard back of house! the most sour faced, miserable rude receptionist I have had the misfortune of encountering, she gave my son a scornful look becasue he was making some noise, she asked to see my ID as they was some credit on my account and she inspected my ID more than immigration did upon enty to the USA, I understand the need to do this, but you really had to be there to see how far she took this as if I was some kind of criminal..yes Britney, that kind of behaviour is going to really want guests to back to the Peabody!?! There was no "how was your stay" no "goodbye" nothing, just processed me out in silence...total utter disgrace of a receptionist and whoever hired her ought to be ashmed to have her there! On a postive, the pool guys were all really nice, Britney who worked in the B-line was lovely and always friendly and helpful and as I mentioned for the most part the bell hop guys were usually happy and polite, the guys who worked in the coffee shop next to the main hotel shop were all nice also so there are the odd diamonds in the rough at the Peabody, but the really good staff who truly understand customer service are all sadly back of house for the most part, but if all the staff had the attitude of the likes of Marlina, Stephanie and Diana, I see no reason why the Peabody can not be one of the top 10 hotels in Orlando. Would I stay again? I am still unsure, but one thing is for certain is if I do, it will be 7 days or less as housekeeping seem to just give up after day 5!

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant surprise.”
Reviews.Author: RJAllard
Reviews.Content: Stayed here while in the area visiting colleges with my son. We wanted a location with easy access to the main highways and this hotel was perfectly situated. I found it on Trip Advisor to begin with, but I was still very relieved with how great everything was. We stayed in the main tower that just opened in January, so everything is still brand new. The lobby was really impressive-lots of marble and beautiful details. The room was fantastic with a couple of details that impressed us, even though we're pretty seasoned travelers (a motion sensored night light under the nightstand and vanity and a tv in the mirror in the bathroom!). The pool was really nice, but we didn't spend much time there. And, I agree with the other reviewers about the staff-every person we encountered couldn't have been nicer. One other thing to note could be either good or bad, considering your perspective. There wasn't much theme park influence here-barely a Universal or Disney memento in the gift shop, if at all. For us, that was great because we weren't going to be able to hit the parks, but I could see some people having a problem with that. Overall, this hotel was a great find.

Reviews.Title: “LUXURY HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: WZ4M1H
Reviews.Content: This is a luxury hotel. We requested a room in the new tower and it was gorgeous. They have numerous restaurants and bars and a great outdoor pool. There is a $10 daily room charge and $12 daily parking charge on top of the taxes and fees. I got the room with a priceline bid, so even with the extra charges I felt it was well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “The nicest employees”
Reviews.Author: Snowdog1960
Reviews.Content: Stayed here three nights with my teen. The hotel itself was fine - quite busy and the main pool was crowded - with clean accomodations. Food was excellent both at the pool and in the B-Line diner. The standout was the employees in every department, almost all of whom went out of their way to be helpful. A superb staff is what makes a stay memorable. Honestly the location near the convention center would not not my first choice when not traveling on business, but I would stay at this hotel again because the staff was so excellent.

Reviews.Title: “A 'Ducktastic' Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jakeylad
Reviews.Content: We've driven past this hotel hundreds of times but never stayed until last week. We got a great deal on the internet for £66 so we gave it a whirl, we could not have more pleasently surprised, it was fabulous, the place was out of this world with a beautifull room overlooking one of the pools and i drive, it was a view I have never experianced before exept in a Hellicopter. The hotel is of Las Vegas size and grandure and within walking distance of Pointe orlando and twenty decent restaurants/bars. We used the self park option for the car which was $12 a day to use the carpark as many times as you like.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel - Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Miked1129
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a two night stay for our wedding. We also had several family members and friends book there. The hotel is beautiful and I found all of the staff to be friendly and helpful. Everyone in our group raved about the stay. I will say that food and extras can add up, but at a discounted rate (went through bookit.com) it is a small price to pay for such luxury.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC STAY AT THE PEABODY ORLANDO”
Reviews.Author: devits
Reviews.Content: 2 years after my first stay i when back to the peabody , there addit a new tower , pools , bars resto , registration lobby ..........enz , its now a huge hotel still whit exellent service ,good friendly en helpfull staff , dinner at NAPA first class , breakfast at B-LINER open 24 h whas good , at the NAPA bar live music intertaiment & elegant service , rooms at the old wing have had new makeover , large rooms , 2 tvs , 2 phones......enz. , transportation to the parks can be orderd , busses ,taxis and i-trolly at the street level . For me its one of the best hotels , and your hotel to stay when you visit ORLANDO. Patrivk Van Acker .BELGIUM.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jendawg11483
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Peabody Orlando for 5 nights recently. We were wonderfully surprised with how beautiful the hotel is as well as how gracious the staff is. The staff there did everything they could to make our stay amazing. The pool and restaurants are really nice, not to mention the rooms. I would come back to this hotel in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Peabody exceeded our expectations---but not the Napa Resturant!!”
Reviews.Author: connecticutjoe
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 6 beautiful days at the Peabody. My husband surprised our family with a last minute trip for a little R&R. We have stayed at many 5 star hotels both here in the US and abroad-and I can honestly say the Peabody Orlando ranks among the best!! The staff including the bell hops, waiter/waitresses, housekeeping, cashiers, front desk attendance and even room service answering line were AMAZINGly cordial and compleltely professional. The food was top notch at all venues EXCEPT Napa resturant (which I will touch upon after the positives!) We are true foodies-infact we spent a few hours each day at Sea World and Aquatica and made it a point to round out our days by @Noon so we could have lunch at the Peabody. Not to be missed are the Coconut Shrimp with a peanut Thai salad, Beef Empanadas with homemade salsa, Chicken Quesadillas (which are made with fresh grilled chicken on a spinach tortilla) served with homemade mango salsa all poolside at the Coconut Grill. Room service was also terrific with a Orange infused brioche french toast. Breakfast and lunch at the B Line Diner were equally delic as well. Our dinner at the Cipriccio Grill was one of the best of my times with Kobe beef and a Filet with blue cheese that would knock your socks off. Our waiter there-Luis was fabulous and made our experience just a really special night!! Now I want to warn patrons of the Napa resturant which is seems is tauted as a "high" end venue at the Peabody. I only write this now, so that you do not spend $250 on a meal that is below acceptable. We do not mind spending twice as much as that on a meal that is superior-but ours was far from it. We ordered Mussels as one of the appetizers, they were not only cold but the broth they were served in was a bland red tomato sauce perhaps out of a can? One person is our party ordered "Halibut" and as avid fishermen, we knew that this was stripped bass at first taste. We guessed correct when our bill came it listed not Halibut but Stripped Bass-go figure. Two people in our party ordered the Ahi Tuna-terrible as well and served with I believe white minute rice??? We walked away hungry-and dissappointed. The next day upon checking out we just gave an FYI to the Front desk when we were asked about our stay-lovely except for the meal at Napa-I believe my husband is writing a letter to the manager so he/she could perhaps experience a meal at Napa "undercover" so that the could rectify the chefs short comings??? With that said, ifyou have the opportunity to stay at the Peabody you really should-amazing accomodations and folks down there in Orlando-and the ducks too!!

Reviews.Title: “Best spring break ever !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: acooke123
Reviews.Content: We are just home from a week long stay at the Peabody Hotel in Orlando. We decided to give the hotel a try despite the mixed reviews. so glad we did. My 17 year old teenager looked me in the eyes and said this was the best trip ever. We came here to visit Universal studios and Seaworld. after a long day at the parks it was so refreshing to be greeted by smiling faces and a beautiful hotel, from the grounds, front Lobby, all the staff. and not to forget our beautiful room with the t.v in the mirror in the bathroom. we had a few problems at check in but The assistant manager Mrs. Archibald was very prompt, professional and relentless in solving our problem, she was greatly concerned for our family and wanted to make sure our stay was comfortable, she straighten everything out and checked in with us a couple of times to make sure all was well. Alberto our bellman was knowledgeable about the area and the hotel, he answered most of our questions so we did not have to see the concierge. My husband and I are shameless Snobs when it comes to vacations, we only stay in 4-5 star hotels. In my book the peabody is an easy five, if you are thinking of booking this hotel, do it and dont worry, the hotel has beautiful grounds, swimming pools, bars, restaurants and is surounded by restaurants and shops all in walking distance. yes there is a $9.95 daily resort fee that will give you daily trolley service, 2 bottles of water in your inroom fridge daily, wifi internet, swimming pools and state of the art fitness center better then any gym Ive went to. self parking is $12 daily and valet is $20. we used valet and got good, fast professional service everytime, so worth the money while on vacation. and dont forget to see the duck march 2 times daily @ about 15 min to 11 a.m. and about 15 min. till 5. go early. it gets crowded. you 'll love it. give the peabody a try youll love it....

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for Business and good for family too.”
Reviews.Author: MOMHANKS
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Peabody for a conference and brought the family along too. The hotel is great for buisness and good for the family. My son enjoyed the ducks in the lobby which the Peabody is known for. The rooms are extremey nice and the restaurants were good as well. It rained while we were there so there was not alot for our son to do indoors. There was not an indoor pool however all in all was extremely nice. We would definetly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect home from home”
Reviews.Author: Sheila88
Reviews.Content: We have just spent 6 wonderful nights at the Peabody Orlando with 2 young children ages 3 and 1.5 yrs. The perfect and courteous service, with smiles all round, was also quiet and efficient throughout. The rooms were fresh and clean and with the floor to ceiling windows you could have endless conversations with a 3yr old about all that is happening outside. It was very interesting having the TV in the bathroom mirror and the bonus of a wide width bath for the kids to play in. There was never a dull moment for them at the hotel because it is equipped to cope with them. The Pool area was large, very well kept and well designed. It has a lovely kids pool with a large sand pit and safety gates round it therefore there is attention to detail. B-Line was also child friendly. Therefore, although its main function seems to be to serve as a hotel for conventions and business, be assured one can also have happy family holidays there too! Thank you Peabody Orlando for making our stay such a welcoming and happy time!

Reviews.Title: “Best in the area”
Reviews.Author: PixieK_16
Reviews.Content: We visited from 26th march for a week and was pleasantly surprised with the hotel. We were given a double room, so twice the size, rooms were clean and modern and provided bottle water every day. We were in the new part of the hotel. The weather was unpredictable but we managed to get 4 days of hot weather and no rain. On the days it was raining we were pleased to have a nice hotel we good relax in. We found that our hotel was probably the largest and nicest on i-drive or in the area. The gym has every equipment you'd want. The pool is great although we didnt get a chance to use it due to it being sanitised the day we went. The hot tub was great though. The spa has a whirlpool and jacuzzi outdoor and they are great. The hotel provides free i-ride bus tickets so you can travel up and down i-drive all day long! The hotel is 10min walk to a McD's and walgreens, and also in opposite direction you can find pointe orlando with some shops and restaurants. Also close to Pointe Orlando is an ale house which is good and reasonable. You can get to wet and wild easily using the i-ride bus, also if you get of there, you can also walk it to universal studios which is about a 20 min walk, otherwise a taxi is $15 with tip. Taxi to airport cost us $35 with tip. There are a couple of outlets on either end of i-drive and a taco bell there too! :)) We went downtown orlando, nothing to do there, there's a lake with boating available. Local buses cost $2 one way or $4.50 day pass. As for eating, there are plenty options available depending on preference. The hotel has good restaurants and bars. You can buy theme park tickets from the hotel concierge and also get maps from there too. We watched Sean Kingston at Universal Studios as part of the Mardi Gras festival. You can get the eat all day pass if you intend to spend the whole day there. If you want entertainment, bars and restaurant, downtown Disney is where it's at! All in all a good stay and would definitely recommend the hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and convenient ....”
Reviews.Author: mjmurray60
Reviews.Content: Spent three days. Great location especially if you are attending meetings at the convention center. Close to restaurants and other attractions. Food was very good and service in the hotel restaurants was excellent. Don't expect a lot from the front desk but the concierge was helpful and smiling. My room was in the new tower which is where you might prefer to stay. Rooms are clean and spacious enough. You do get charged $10 a day to get two bottles of water and a paper at your door. Valet parking @ $20 per day the best way to go. Pool area is great but beware that when they decide to treat the water, the pool shuts down for the entire day. The duck parade is hysterical and only takes less than a couple minutes. All in all, it's a nice hotel but it's nothing out of the ordinary and if you are looking for elegant, this isn't it. BUT it's clean, convenient and reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Not very customer service oriented”
Reviews.Author: redsoxfan2012
Reviews.Content: We received a room through a discounted website and as soon as the women behind the desk saw this, she handed us our keys and pointed to the elevators. No explanation about hotel services, no map of the grounds was given, nothing! Don’t they realize that we did pay for the room AND we might be using their restaurants, spa and other services? We are frequent travelers and use a lot of these websites to book travel but never have we been treated so poorly. Front Desk Staff: It would have been helpful to understand that they gave us a room in Tower 1 (the old tower) and that there is a different entrance for your car/valet and 2 sets of elevators. Rooms in Tower 1: old beds, ink-stained carpet and very small bathrooms. Our room overlooked a dirt parking lot to the convention center. If you do stay here, ask for a room in the new tower. Valet Service: Day 1 we tried calling down for our car but were told that they were too busy so we walked down and waited for 30 minutes. The valet mgr acted like he did us a favor by getting our car. Day 2 we were able to call down and we let them know that we wanted the car pulled around to Tower 1. We waited there for 20 minutes and finally my husband went to the other entrance and found that they pulled the car around to wrong entrance. Restaurants: stopped by the B-Line Diner for breakfast at 11 AM and the hostess rudely told us that we were too late for breakfast. We drove to the “First Watch” restaurant on Sand Lake Road and had a great breakfast.! The hotel pool grill/bar was a lot more pleasant. Pros: nice pools and plenty of upscale restaurants in the area. Cons: All-around poor service. Valet was $20. I don’t mind paying that if there was service to back it up! No coffee in the room. We stayed at the Hyatt Regency Grand Cypress for 3 days earlier this year and wished we had returned.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice for business travel”
Reviews.Author: gem21
Reviews.Content: Spent four nights here while working an event at the adjacent Convention Center. Stayed in the new tower building in very comfortable accommodations. Extremely comfortable bed with luxurious linens and pillows. Ordered room service out of work schedule necessity -- all I can say is, thank goodness I was on an expense account! It was extremely expensive, and the food was just OK. The service was fantastic, and the food always arrived within 30 minutes of ordering. There was a cheerleading convention going on at the hotel the first night of my stay, so it was a little noisy at night (loud people in the hall, people thumping around in the room above me). But once that group cleared out and the hotel was filled with business people, it was nice and quiet. I did not use the spa or gym, so I can't comment on those. I had to buy a few toiletries in the gift shop, and I had to look the other way as I paid $10 for a bottle of eye drops and about the same for Advil. But it was very clean, and I actually took baths in the tub each night to de-stress from my work days ... this is something I never do when staying at a hotel, but the tub was so new and clean, I really couldn't resist. I would not really recommend this hotel for a recreational traveler. It's really at its best for business travelers, with friendly, efficient staff and service, extremely comfortable and clean rooms, and prices that are meant to be paid by corporations! ;-)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect, perfect, perfect, perfect.....”
Reviews.Author: Yamagatagirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for with small three children ages, 4-11. It's spacious, clean, contemporary. The king sized bed was roomy and extremely comfortable. The linens were high quality and the down comforter was an added bonus. We stayed in the two bedroom suite and the walls on one side were all ceiling to floor windows. The kids slept comfortably on the pull out sofa - agin with a down comfortable. The food in both restaurants B-line and Napa were to die for, however breakfast ran 95 bucks with tip, so it was very expensive for our family. The staff was so very helpful and prepared for almost anything except locating someone to detail my car, which was fine. We will stay here when we will return. My husband said you don't wanna leave everything here for you. It's simply perfect......

Reviews.Title: “Had high expectations, and they were exceeded!”
Reviews.Author: nic0lew
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked this hotel wanting a romantic getaway. The Peabody truly exceeded our expectations. First, the hotel is HUGE with 2 different pool areas and a gym that rivals your neighborhood fitness complex. There were at least 3 large rooms of equipment with nearby locker rooms (that were stocked with shampoos, lotions, etc.) with steam rooms. There are also a few restaurants and bars to choose from that are located within the hotel. We spent several hours near the lap pool and would recommend that pool area over the resort pool if you are looking for peace and quiet. If you have children with you, the resort pool would be the way to go with its waterslide and splash pool. If the hotel itself isn't impressive enough, the Peabody continued to awe us with the room. Cleanest hotel room we've stayed at in years. Extremely updated and even had a tv in the bathroom mirror. The bed was truly amazing and is making me consider upgrading my mattress at home.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: johnkim575
Reviews.Content: Top notch hotel. Did not try the restaurants because we were at the theme parks most of the time. Have lots of cash because you will have tons of people assisting you as soon as you arrive. They do charge for parking for valet and non valet. Theme park tickets can be purchased on site .

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms (in the new tower) but Horrible Service”
Reviews.Author: luvcuba
Reviews.Content: I was here for four nights in February for a conference. We had just spent a few days at Disney's Beach Club. While the Peabody is a nicer hotel with much nicer rooms, the service pales in comparison to what we received at Disney. Our first issue came right away when we tried to find the entrance. With no signs indicating that there were two entrances to the hotel, we took the first one. There were bell hops outside of this entrance so it looked valid. Stepping inside there was no check-in desk and no one around to ask (and again no signs pointing the way). After wandering around I found a concierge who was entirely unimpressed at having to answer my simple question as to the location of the check-in desk. Turns out there was a new entrance... quite a ways from where we had came in. The bell hops that we had first seen had not mentioned anything, they had not bothered to greet us and had in no way indicated that we should be going further down to check in. Check-in at 8pm took 45min. For that time of day the length of time is absolutely ridiculous! When we found the new entrance the bell hops did not offer to help us with luggage but rather were more concerned with talking among themselves and acted as if they were too good for any of the guests at the hotel. The room (in the new tower) was very spacious, very comfortable and well appointed. The bathroom was the largest that I have seen at a hotel. Overall, very, very nice rooms. Unfortunately, that's the best thing that I can say about this hotel. Maid service during the day cleaned the room around 3-4pm. I've never had maid service come that late anywhere that I have stayed before. Food at the hotel is outrageous - $8 for a large latte, it's not gold and the people making it are certainly not skilled barristas since I can make a better latte. Luckily there are plenty of restaurants on International Dr that are a short walk away. Perhaps I would not have been so disappointed if I had not just come from Disney (where my room was cheaper than at the Peabody at one of the Deluxe resorts) but I was completely underwhelmed by the service here. I found that the employees were very rude, had no concept of service and really did not want to be there. If you only want a great room and don't care about rude service (or none at all) then this would be a great place for you. (And yes, I would have tipped for good service... if there had been any.)

Reviews.Title: “Compare rates”
Reviews.Author: GoodFood5000
