Reviews.Content: Had an issue with hotel offering same rates as reservation line. Be sure to get res # and name of agent when quoted low rate. Actually called while at front desk and saved several hundred per night. Aside from that, hotel is recommended. Spacious, beautiful common areas; rooms have nice touches - tv in mirror in Metropolitan Suite, baseboard nite-lights. Great views from large windows and suite has balcony! Prices are extreme, but what isn't in Orlando. Half hour from Disney, but walking distance to some nice restaurants. Pool seems to be a kid's haven. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Big and very Comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: wingnut5
Reviews.Content: Went there on business for a week. The hotel is a very beautiful hotel and is very quiet! The area is a very nice area with plenty of shopping and dining spots. You can walk to the convention center as well. I would say it is about a 15 minute ride from the Airport. As for the Hotel itself, it has a very large beautiful pool, tennis court, a gym, several places to dine, and a friendly staff. Keep in mind, this is a very large hotel, so if you are there for meetings that are held at the hotel, you will have some walking to do. The rooms are quite, spacious, and well appointed! Most import for me is a comfortable bed, which these were. My room had a TV that was built into the bathroom mirror, so while I shaved, I was able to watch TV. Bottom line, if you can afford it, you can't go wrong here! Not a thing to complain about!

Reviews.Title: “The Peabody Exceeded My Expectations!”
Reviews.Author: LBeavers
Reviews.Content: It had been many years since I last stayed at the Peabody and when we made reservations we were hoping to repeat the wonderful time we had experienced. The kids (Harry Potter fans) wanted to visit Universal Studios so we had lots of choices and recommendations. Most suggested on property hotels, but I wanted to stay at the Peabody. After reading some of the reviews a hint of doubt crossed my mind. Lots of good reviews, but a few rather negative ones which gave me some pause. We decided on the Peabody and never looked back. It was great from the minute we pulled up to the valet to our departure as they gave me the keys to the car and asked if I needed directions and to hurry back. Everyone was attentive, friendly and accommodating. The food was very good, the service outstanding and the rooms quite comfortable. We enjoyed the pool with its slide and waterfalls after our days at the parks. There were a number of nice restaurants just a short walk away when we needed a change of scenery. For me the best part of this trip was not the rides, attractions and fun. It was relaxing at the Peabody with my family afterward.

Reviews.Title: “Too many hidden fees”
Reviews.Author: jsn_beery
Reviews.Content: They lured us in with a one night stay with a 150 dollar spa credit deal for 269 dollars a night. I feel like my wife and I did not get what we paid for in value at this spa. 25 dollars for pleasant smelling massage oil each person? The two massages ended up being almost 400 bucks. Not even the Ritz Carlton charges that. 20% automatic tip? What if someone wasn't happy? They would still have to pay that? By the time we had one dinner there and we both had a massage the total bill was almost 900 dollars. When they brought my car around they had parked it next to a reclaimed nasty water sprinkler and it dried on my car. They made no effort to do anything about it. Nice hotel with neat rooms but beware of the bait and switch method there at this place.

Reviews.Title: “Upscale hotel, with a few flaws.”
Reviews.Author: LoveToDineAlbany_NY
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Peabody for a conference in February. The bell service and the front desk are your first experience with the hotel so they should be top-notch. The front desk was not, having little personality. The room however, was beautiful and clean. The beds were filled with very comfortable pillows. Paying these prices, complaints should be few if any. We did have some complaints. The worst offense was on the morning of our departure, housecleaning beat loudly on our door to come in and clean our room. It was 8:30 am and check out wasn't until 11 am. We were still sleeping! When I called down to the front desk to complain, the operator said they were too busy with people checking out to take my call. Also, we were not given our bottles of water each day that we paid for and our shampoo and lotion supply were not replenished each day. We did eat lunch at the BLine diner and had a very good experience there with both the food and our waiter. The pool area was very nice, but there were not enough lounge chairs, and there were many people smoking by the pool. For the price, the room was clean and comfortable, we really did feel relaxed, but the service could be improved in the areas mentioned.

Reviews.Title: “Incredibly rude door staff, ambivalent front desk, poor resturant service”
Reviews.Author: Chuck47909
Reviews.Content: We were excited to be staying at the Peabody, but upon arrival our cab driver made the mistake of going to the wrong entrance. The greeter yelled at him through me. We had another cab driver yelled at for a different reason later. The desk person we talked to did not smile and seemed unimpressed with any issue we might have. Finally this same day we tried the cafe right just outside the hotel but not in the pool area. It took forever to be waited on, longer for our drinks. When our meal arrived (mine was a $21.00 hamburger, sides extra), they were incomplete and barely warm. My wife's roll arrived at the time she finished with her salad. This all happened the first day. The rooms were OK. They did have nice under bed and undercounter motion lighting and a TV in the bathroom mirror, otherwise I would put in on par with a decent Holiday Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home!!!”
Reviews.Author: VacationsRus2011
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and our family have stayed at the Peabody Orlando on several occaisions over many years. We have always enjoyed our stay there, and have never had a complaint. There are many restaurants on and off property a short walk away on International Drive. Point Orlando is about a five-ten minute walk with a few shops,nice restaurants, theater etc. Also there is a Walgreens a bit further down from Point Orlando, not a far walk at all for any extras you may need. After the construction, it only gets better. The new rooms are comfortable, clean, well lit and very quiet, and the beds are too die for!!!. Love the TV in the mirror while getting ready for the day. The lights that illuminate when getting in and out of bed at night under the night stand and the bathroon vanity are a very nice touch. While staying on the Club Level you will be treated like royalty, well staffed, courteous, very freindly and very much worth the upgrade. The pool was warm. beautiful, clean and well staffed. The lap pool which is one of our favourites was under construction but while making our most recent reservation I am told it will be open soon just prior to our visit. The valet staff are very accomadating and efficient. My family and I always look forward to our yearly visits to the Peabody. The Peabody may be a little more expensive on every level but beleive me when I say, you get what you pay for. That being said I would recommend The Peabody Orlando in a heart beat, enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Everyone's a VIP”
Reviews.Author: Travelgal999
Reviews.Content: The Peabody is newly renovated and beautiful. The rooms were clean when we arrived and were cleaned daily. The bathroom was spa-like and even had a tv in the mirror. The beds were incredibly comfortable. We had massages at the spa which is calm and serene. Since we had had service there, were were allowed to use the spa hot tub and steam room for the following 24 hours. The pool area is beautiful. There is also a lap pool that was under construction while were were there. The best thing about the hotel was the service. Everyone, from the front desk, to the gym, to the waitstaff was helpful and friendly and professional. We were treated like VIPs. The location is very close to Universal Studios. ( A cab ride will cost you about 12 dollars). It is also close to many restarurants, but the bars and restaruants are so nice at the Peabody, you might not want to leave. I recommend the diner for quick, good meals at a reasonable price. If go to Orlando, I would definitly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but not memorable”
Reviews.Author: cyberluddite
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Peabody Orlando because I was attending a conference there. Upon check-in I was told that the room class I had reserved, a regular king, was unavailable, but the desk clerk offered to upgrade me to an "executive" king at no additional cost. He told me the bed in the room was different in that it was "low," which sounded OK. In reality the bed was a pull-down, Murphy-style bed, which seemed odd and not really accurately described. The bed was comfortable, though, and the room was HUGE--much larger than a typical studio apartment. It was a nice room, though somwhat soulless and boring.. One thing that displeased me was that the desk clerk "upsold" me into paying an extra $10/day "service fee" which he said included a couple of bottles of water per day, two all-day passes for the International Drive trolley, and high-speed wi-fi internet. I figured that was worth it for the wi-fi along, but actually, the internet would've been free even if I hadn't opted for the "upgrade;" housekeeping kept forgetting to leave me the bottles of water so I got them only one day of the three (when I spotted a maid in the hallway and asked for them); and the trolly passes are only worth $1.50 each--and for this I paid an extra $30 over the 3-day stay. This is an ENORMOUS hotel, with a property comparable in size to the large Las Vegas resorts. I didn't get to take advantage of the hotel amenities such as pool, because the weather was bad during my stay. I did eat at a couple of the restaurants, the "B Line" (which the desk clerk dismissively but accurately described as "an upgraded Denny's sort of place," which was true because the food was completely forgettable) and Napa (which aims at a "California Wine Country" sort of menu but, to a Californian at least, misses that target pretty badly, though the prices are compable to or higher than what one would pay at most genuine upscale Napa Valley restaurants). There are some nice bars and lounges, though the prices are fairly absurd ($8 for a domestic beer, for example). The location is on a busy major thoroughfare with nothing nearby except the convention center, other large hotels, and some strip malls. Unless you have a car or feel like taking a taxi somewhere, you will feel relatively stranded there. Nothing of interest is within walking distance. In short, the hotel is comfortable and clean, and fairly luxurious, but the experience is neither unique nor memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Restaurants are high”
Reviews.Author: boating2010
Reviews.Content: Great location across from the convention center Rooms and services were great You must eat at the B-Line Diner! The other restaurants in the hotel cost lots of money!

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant Conference Stay”
Reviews.Author: akoser
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Peabody Orlando in Feburary 2011 to attend a conference being held at the hotel. I arrived at what was a very busy time for the front desk resulting in a long line for check in, however they were staffed up to handle the surge and the line moved quickly. No worries. Check in was a breeze and I was generously upgraded to the next level room simply by showing my I Prefer membership card. My 10th floor room in the original tower was very pleasant and overlooked the pool area. The bed was very comfortable and there were plenty of pillows, great for propping up to watch TV. I slept very well and heard no noise from the hallway or adjacent rooms even though the hotel appeared to be very full. My room and bathroom were spacious, exceedingly tidy and very well kept by housekeeping. Parking valets were pleasant and on the ball. Each time I called for my car from my room, I hung up the phone and walked directly to the front of the hotel just as my car was being pulling up to the front of the hotel. No waiting in spite of a very busy scene in front of the hotel. I did not use room service or the hotel restaurant however, I did enjoy the group meal at my conference. The standard chicken breast dinner was excellent indeed from salad to dessert. The food at group functions like this is usually pretty forgettable but this meal was well above the norm. I did not use the fitness center or business center. The concierge was kind enough to print boarding passes for my departing flight. I received excellent and friendly service from every hotel staff member I encountered. This is an excellent conference venue. I did see some families at the hotel and agree that the International Drive location and the large pool area make the Peabody Orlando an excellent alternative for those who wish to visit the Orlando area without staying at a Disney resort. Quick access to the freeway and only a short drive to the airport also make the Peabody an excellent home base while staying in Orlando. I would without question recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Orlando for business or leisure.

Reviews.Title: “Unacceptable noise level from the hotel's very own lobby bar”
Reviews.Author: MoChinY
Reviews.Content: Being a frequent traveler I really don't expect much from hotels these days other than a bed for the chance of a good night's sleep so I can conduct business the next day. I am typing this frustrating review at midnight, after trying to sleep for 3 hours, due to the piano playing at the hotel's very own lobby bar. The front desk told me they MIGHT stop at 12:30. Two things I am sure about. 1). I will probably have a very difficult day tomorrow due to lack of sleep. 2) The hotel is violating the law, specifically Orlando City ordinance 42.04, which states "It shall be unlawful to play any radio, phonograph or any musical instrument or operate a sound-amplifying device within the City in such a manner or with such volume, especially during the hours between 10:00 p.m. and 7:00 a.m., as to annoy or disturb the quiet, comfort or repose of persons in any dwelling, hotel or other type of residence, except as more specifically set forth herein.". The Orlando Police website suggested calling 911 to complain. If this keeps on I just might. In my years of travel I've never had a hotel that's so inconsiderate with noise. 4 stars? Seriously? You guys fail at the basic requirement for a hotel - give the guests an environment for a good night's sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ray Goldberg
Reviews.Content: From arrival until departure service was absolutely amazing. The hotel is massive yet modern. Rooms were very good. The pool is amazing. All in all pretty good value for money. Eating at Napa Restaurant was extremely good. Watch the cocktails. They have one heck of a kick being 4 oz's instead of the usual 2. The only down side of the entire stay was breakfast. Whilst it was tasty, be prepared for around $50 for 2 people which is simply ridiculous for breakfast. Walk to Ihop or somewhere else for breakfast. Shuttles are $19 a person just about anywhere you want to go. Would I stay there again? Absolutely yes

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed and would definitely return!”
Reviews.Author: goodgirl123abc
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Peabody for four days - this was my first visit. Got a great deal through Travelocity. The hotel was just wonderful. Wonderfully situated on International Drive. Gorgeous lobby, beautiful plantings outside. The room was just great too. Very quiet and no issues with anything. Bed was wonderfully comfortable. Big screen flat t.v. and an embedded t.v. in the bathroom mirror (which was pretty darn amusing). There was a small fridge in the room, but no minibar. I had a beautiful view of the pool and was on the 20th floor of Tower 2, which is brand new. Some minor complaints (but really not complaints). No coffee maker in the room was a bummer. Most hotels offer that and I hope that will reconsider that decision. Speaking of coffee, the quality was bad throughout the hotel. There is a coffee cafe and the coffee they served was really subpar. It was also lousy - basically undrinkable - in their upscale restaurant (I can't recall the name). The B-Diner's coffee was great so if they make that the standard coffee throughout the rest of the hotel (I understand they use different blends) that would be a big help. The restaurants were more or less what one would expect pricey and generally good food. Every meal I had in the B-Diner was just fine. Hotel service and staff were just wonderful - friendly, professional, very courteous. The lovely pool and hot tub was definite highlight. The pool was heat (thank goodness) and the hot tub was huge and wonderfully warm. The hotel also provides a New York Times outside your door every morning - I really appreciated that touch. There were lovely robes in the room too. Also, I went to their new spa for a eyebrow wax - they took me right away and the woman who treated me gave the best and most professional eyebrox wax I've ever received. She took her time and it felt like a mini spa treatment because she was so terrific at what she did. What a fabulous stay! And I hope to go back again next year to escape the frozen north!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but housekeeping service left much to be desired”
Reviews.Author: ktravl411
Reviews.Content: We returned after a day out shopping ready for a nap and the room had not been attended to. We had to wait for a housekeeper and then suffer thru watching her take her time puttering around the room. Further, the small refridgerator was not working and it was a complete drama trying to get that resolved until finally we abandoned that idea. Then housekeepers walked into the room THREE (3) times without knocking on THREE different occasions. This was totally unacceptable in a hotel of this or any other caliber.Also, we were stuck with a $9 per day fee for amenties we did not use except the 2 bottles of water! All of the disruptions and inconveniences put a damper on an otherwise wonderful and long awaited Valentine's getaway. Next time we will head to the Ritz where the hospitality standards are guaranteed and employees properly trained.

Reviews.Title: “pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: ethan1999
Reviews.Content: had a quick 1 night trip to Orlando on business. I was quite impressed with the overall quality of the hotel, particularly the staff. Food was above average for a hotel as well.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!!”
Reviews.Author: Gongstar
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at The Peabody Orlando for the third time this past January and is planning on visiting again twice before the summer is over! This hotel is one of the best and is by far my favorit hotel in Orlando. It's clean, chick, luxurious and the staff is amaxzing and uber friendly. It's definitely well worth the money!

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel that could be great”
Reviews.Author: stowne1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Peabody for 4 nights. When we arrived our room was not ready but they were willing to upgrade us to a bigger room for an extra $180 a night. We declined. The hotel was huge and felt like it was attached to a convention center. The pool area was fantastic. Beach entrance main pool with a side pool and waterfall. There was a hit tub and a baby pool that had a sand area next to it. When the pool staff saw my 2 year old playing in the sand they brought over toys fir her. When we got to the room it was very big and accommodated the pool out couch and a full size crib. The room was in the shape of a C which worked well when you are traveling with family. The room did not have a coffee maker so your only option was a $10 latte from downstairs at the mockbucks which sucked. When we checked out they forgot to charge us for parking and when I brought it to their attention they comped it which was nice. The hotel also offered infant or toddler cribs for free and our room had a fridge. I also got free wifi in our room. Overall the hotel was great and I would stay there again. But with a few tweaks this hotel could be great. Need in room coffee and they need to get rid of the master aweigh. I would leave my phones and computers to charge and the maid would flip the master switch and all the electricity would stop to the room. Including the fridge. Other than that I liked the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Monster hotel with lousy food”
Reviews.Author: PalmBeach9
Reviews.Content: Anybody who would ever design a hotel with more than a thousand rooms should be legally barred from ever designing hotels. The distance between my room and our meeting room was about half a mile, through a maze of dismal looking hallways crowded with other meetings. Only Orlando and Vegas build these awful hotelzillas, outside the now defunct USSR. Hopefully, they'll follow suit. The food was just about the worst I ever had in a hotel, the steak chewy, the fish like a hockey puck.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but not for sleeping”
Reviews.Author: BusinessTravel50
Reviews.Content: I was staying at the hotel because I was attending a legal conference being held in the convention center inside the hotel. The convention center space was very nice, and I enjoyed speaking at the conference. Unfortunately, it was nearly impossible to sleep in this hotel. The first room I started in was extremely hot and stuffy. I called the front desk and they sent a maintenance person to the room. He took a needle nose plier to the air vents wiggling each one, telling me he needed to re-direct the air. He then replaced the air filter, which did seem to increase air flow, but did nothing to cool or de-humidify the air. A few hours later, around 10pm, I called down to the front desk and asked to be moved to another room. The front desk sent up a bellman with keys to a new room. We went to the new room, and he admitted that our choices were limited because the hotel was nearly full. He conceded that the new room wasn’t much cooler. I decided to gamble and make the switch. The new room was slightly cooler, but still unacceptable. I woke up the first night sweating. I was confused because during the night the room became much hotter than it was before I went to sleep. After a little internet research, at 2AM, I was able to determine this was because the thermostats are controlled by motion sensors. If there isn’t enough movement, the system shuts off. Fortunately, I was able to figure out the sensor override code. If you search the interne t using the name on the control panel you should be able to find it without much effort. This at least keeps the air on, but still didn’t adequately cool the room. I called the front desk the next day to complain about the room temperature again, hoping that there was something that could be done. They sent another bellman up to the room, the front desk had claimed that he could help me out. When the bellman got to the room he said this was the second room he had been to that shift which was set to 65 degrees, but was obviously much higher (I would guess at least 75 with high humidity). He started hitting the fan speed button on the thermostat, and then left it at medium. He said, there, I set it to medium, so that should cool down the room quickly. I also asked him if he knew about the over ride code, but he claimed he had never heard of it. I figured I wasn’t going to get anywhere with him, both because he didn’t know about the over ride and because I had long ago figured out how to adjust the fan speed. I thanked him for his time. Throughout this ordeal, I was told numerous times that this was a green hotel, so they were required to have the motion sensing thermostats. I am sure that is true, but I would imagine you can be green and still get the temperature in the room to a comfortable level. There are a number of hotels in the area and I will be checking out of this hotel and going to one of them tonight. Even if you conference is being held at the Peabody, I would recommend staying at one of the nearby properties.

Reviews.Title: “First Time Ritz!”
Reviews.Author: xsouthernbellx
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I took a trip from Pennsylvania to Florida for the first time. We only had a few days to enjoy, and wanted a classy hotel for once. We chose the Peabody for it's beautiful building structure. When we arrived, we did not realize the Peabody was undergoing construction. That was fine, but it lessened the physical appeal of the building. The inside was beautiful; I could not stop taking pictures! And the duck fountain was so quaint. Our room was a bit of a letdown; the carpet color and style threw off what would have been a classy feng shui. The bed was out of this world comfortable!!! The pool area was luxurious and exciting for us newcomers, and the water temperature was just right. Room service was fast! The boys who were valet were a bit rude to my boyfriend and me. We left them $5-8 tips every time, and they turned up their noses at us and made us feel depreciated for even thinking to give such a "small" tip. During our stay, the construction workers were drilling early every morning, which led to an unwanted early rise on the days we wished to sleep in. And on our last night, we heard the guests above us jumping up and down for many hours. However, the latter problem was fixed immediately when we called to the front desk. Overall a great stay; a bit on the pricey side for those on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for theme parks. Friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: antzero
Reviews.Content: Warmly greeted by Zach on reception. We arrived in the evening so there was no queue. It took very little time to get the keys and go up to the room. The rooms were light and a good size, and well insulated from noise. The aircon was reasonably quiet. The TV was big, plenty of plug sockets. We stayed in the new tower overlooking the pool. There aren't really any sights to see from the hotel so the choice of room should only be dictated by how big a room you need. We ate breakfast in the B-line diner at the hotel every day. Wonderful service and friendly people. The portions are generous, although expect to pay more than you would outside a hotel. The room makeup times varied throughout our stay. It was nice to bump into the housekeeping ladies though, they were friendly, as were the people on the concierge desk which was well staffed. The pool was a good size, and despite record low temperatures people were still swimming in it! The hotel has free passes for the i-Ride trolley bus, which is a bonus with stops a short walk from the entrance. We used the trolley to get to and from the Outlet Malls, Sea World and Universal, although we also swapped to taxis for quicker trips. For British travellers I would recommend against ordering tea. It's not what you get back home (honey and lemon). There's no coffee/tea making facilities in the room either. The fridge in the room had complimentary water (ideal for a day at the theme park), and a special menu so that you could stock the fridge with food and drink. Looking at other hotels nearby I would wonder what they could offer that you couldn't get at The Peabody. There's a pharmacy/store nearby, The Capital Grille steak restaurant is a short walk away. Rooms are comfy, staff are friendly. And the ducks seem to like it too.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at the Peabody”
Reviews.Author: RRamanathan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Peabody for 5 nights late in December and found the hotel to be everything a classy hotel like it should be. Not only was the room in the new tower excellent but so were all other aspects of the hotel including the outstanding service. We will be back again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good stay”
Reviews.Author: nofake
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel , large and well equipped room, friendly and extremely professional staff, nice breakfast. Memorable the " duck show" a must if in Orlando The only bad note was that some floor were under contruction, so kinda messy and dusty, but I assume they sholud have finished by now.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Stay”
Reviews.Author: Bartique
Reviews.Content: No words can explain the service, cleanliness, rooms nor amenities we got at the Peabody. We stayed in one of the club level rooms located in the new tower and trust me when I tell you, its worth the extra $$$. Best hotel in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “New Year's Eve was on Fire!”
Reviews.Author: effluxlife
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous hotel, comfortable bed, quiet room, welcoming staff and delicious food. There was plenty to do at the hotel, though the fitness center steam room and whirlpool were broken. "Free" trolly tickets (included in daily $15.98 fee) allowed us to travel to places along International Drive without having to move the car, (parked in the garage for another $12 daily fee/ $20 if you want to valet). We took the trolly to Cafe Tu-Tu Tango, a favorite, and to the Outlets. The completely remodeled 26th floor room in the "old" tower was lovely. Loved the bathroom and separate area for changing and luggage. You could use the fridge, but there is no coffeemaker or microwave in the room. Great TVs in bed and bath rooms. The downside, and this was an issue that may be just seasonal, was as the college bowl team hotel, the entire fan base stayed there. Never a free time to use the hot tub outside, the pool was so crowded that we had to sit on the edge of the pool deck with our feet in the water to "relax". Enjoying a relaxing afternoon by the pool on a warm New Year's Eve day was not an option. We ate at the B-line diner for breakfast which was decent but overpriced. They have spectacular desserts and I would highly recommend the chocolate mousse cake...heavenly. There we were able to get our $3 regular coffee. If there was free coffee, I am not sure where it was since there was nothing in our room about anything ...no in room directory aside from a magazine. The beautiful, trendy Rocks lounge had $20 sliders that were insanely good {did we really pay $20 for three sliders? oh yes we did} with great drinks. We chose to do Neew Year's Eve there and enjoyed the balloon drop and lounge band enough, though it was lacking some energy. As we were unwinding, I had to walk (in heels) down 26 flights of stairs as the fire alarm went off for a false alarm around 1 a.m.! That really was disappointing (and painful) after such a nice evening. As for the ducks, they are cute, but maybe better to see on a less crowded day. When the hotel gets finished with the second pool on an upper level, I think the recreation problem will be better. I would look forward to visiting in the summer or if I had a conference or event in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Great Orlando hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Princeisking
Reviews.Content: We are just back from 1 week at the peabody & apart from a room change required by me due 2 a major fear of heights, we loved everything about this hotel. Overall staff we friendly & helpful, nice pool area, iride tickets v useful, nice bar area (the one that kids can go in, couldn't go in the other 1!) great location with some really nice restaurants just a short walk away! I missed the peabody when we went 2 our 2nd hotel ( near the coast) could have stayed for 2 weeks no problem. We def recommend the Peabody to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel - Very Pleased.”
Reviews.Author: SDSpartan
Reviews.Content: We returned from a New Year's Eve stay (2 nights) at the Peabody Orlando and loved it. One thing I have not seen mentioned in the reviews I read was the great location on International Drive. Coming from San Diego, CA, I wasn't familiar with this area and only choose this hotel as it was the chosen "team" hotel for Michigan State University, who was playing in the Capital One Bowl. While I wasn't happy with my team's performance in the bowl game, I thoroughly enjoyed this hotel and my stay, even despite a 1:30 a.m. on NYE fire/fire alarm and evacuation. The hotel is situated right next to a lovely shopping area with many bars, restaurants and shops - I think it was called the Pointe. Great and easy to walk to and lots of options. Our room's view was lacking - but the furnishings more than made up for it. The bed was so comfy I didn't want to leave it. I traveled with an injured back and was a bit anxious regarding the bed - but it more than lived up to my hopes. The room (king bed) was actually pretty large, with a sitting area, lounge chair and ottoman and a separate desk and chair. The TV was probably 42 inches, flat screen and nice. I LOVED the digital TV in the bathroom mirror - I want one at home now! The bathroom was a bit "tight" on space, but fine for the two of us. No separate tub and shower, they were a combo. I liked the 'feed the fridge" program versus the usual mini bar. You order what you want from a menu and they bring it right up. Prices were reasonable. I found the pool area, which was nice, was crowded and we had trouble finding a chair. That was disappointing. The roof top pool was closed for repairs (we weren't warned about this at booking or check-in, so I deducted on the rating). Also the valet parking was OK - I found the valets a bit difficult to deal with). We ate at Napa restaurant in the hotel on NYE and it was delicious! It is new, opened about 4 months ago. The service was excellent and the pricing reasonable. The bar/lounge above Napa (I forget the name) was nice, had a band. The hotel is large, but we found it easy to get around. We booked through a consolidator web site and got a TERRIFIC rate. I liked the free Wifi in the room and the morning paper (though why the New York Times?). There is a daily resort fee of about $15 - which I believe covers the wifi and 2 free bottles of water per day and the pool usage. There is a very nice gym facility as well.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, classy hotel, beautiful accomodations, and superb service”
Reviews.Author: ID273
Reviews.Content: Our first stay at The Peabody will NOT be our last! My husband and I spent Christmas Eve/Christmas Day at the hotel as a gift to ourselves, and we were not disappointed! From the moment we arrived until the time we left, we were treated like "VIP's"; we were surprised to learn that our special booking allowed us free valet parking, we were also given a free buffet for breakfast, and afternoon hors d'oeuvres; and the specific room location we requested was honored as well. The hotel is HUGE (a large part of the hotel is a convention area, and there is even an over-the-highway walkway that leads to the Orange County Convention Center next door) and beautifully decorated with paintings/sculptures/artwork throughout (the colossal chandeliers are fabulous!). The new pool area is large, the heated pool (a "no-entry" pool) is gorgeous, with a big slide for the kids, and an oversized hot tub, with easy access (although unfortunately it was too COLD outside for us, we're Floridians, to swim); and, there are multiple restaurant/cafe/bar facilities throughout the hotel and pool area that serve anything from a quick snack to sandwiches to a full-course meal (our favorite, with the best price for the value, was the B-Line Diner). There is also a shopping/restaurant area within a block's walking distance (includes B.B. King's, Maggiano's Italian Restaurant, Regal IMAX CInemas, WonderWorks, shops like Victoria's Secret, Chico's, Ciao!). We stayed in the "new" tower area (just opened in 2010). Our room was spacious, and the beds were oversized, and VERY comfortable (love the SOFT sheets/bedding!), and all the room amenities provided (including a mini-fridge, wet bar, and even a TV in the bathroom MIRROR!) were great! And, one of the best things about the Peabody is the "DUCK MARCH" that takes place twice a day; what a wonderful tradition to continue over the years, it's a LOT of fun (just watching the people react to the ducks coming down their "red carpet" from the elevator is hilarious)! In a nutshell - if you want a moderately-priced, classy, elegant, extremely comfortable hotel, with a professional staff that looks to provide you with all that you'll need during your stay, you can't beat the Peabody, and we HIGHLY recommend it! It's only drawback is that, because of its location on S. International Drive, should you plan a trip to any of the theme parks, it's best to have your own transportation (the hotel's scheduled transfers are minimal), but otherwise, it's perfect for anyone, of ANY age, and we plan to return ASAP!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel but Beware of other guests!”
Reviews.Author: bbb92
Reviews.Content: We actually booked the Peabody through Hotwire. A fantastic deal for a luxury hotel. The bathrooms are very small- but the rooms looked recently renovated and were very plush. I was very please with the accomadations. The stars of the Peabody are the ducks that you can see in a lobby fountain. They have a duck parade in the late afternoon where you can watch the ducks walk from the fountain to a waiting elevator. I was seated on the ground waiting closer to the elevator. I couldn't see what was happening at the fountain because of all the people. Once the ducks began their march- other guests started following the ducks on the red carpet! I was shocked to see grown adults STEP OVER ME to follow the ducks to the elevator. It was complete nonsense. Management should set up rules or announce rules BEFORE the ducks begin their march to control the crowds. It is also a bit of a walk to the self park garage. However- on the day we checked out- we got a golf cart ride over to the parking garage.

Reviews.Title: “This was one great experience”
Reviews.Author: D-Coyle42092
Reviews.Content: My wife and I traveled to the Capital One Bowl and stayed at the Peabody for 4 nights as part of our tour package. It could not have been a more delightful stay. The staff was unfailingly polite and helpful. We had a beautiful corner deluxe room with floor to ceiling windows from which we had a sweeping view of the city wide new years eve fireworks display. Our room overlooked the beautiful pool area. Everything was perfect ,from the "duck walk" to the "electric mirror " in our bathroom [what a nice surprise] . The restaurants were very good with nice varied selections and reasonable pricing. The hotel itself is beautifully appointed. This is the first time I have taken the time to write a hotel review but wanted to share our wonderful experience. Kudos to the Peabody and staff. Dave and Carol Coyle

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Rooms, Nice Hotel Staff, Lounge Lacks Class, Diner Yuck!!!!”
Reviews.Author: kirbey38
Reviews.Content: Took my mom back for her Christmas present on New Year's Eve, as we had a lovely experience the first time. This time we still feel the rooms were so very clean, beds heavenly!!! Hotel staff for the most part very nice. The Lobby Lounge however, the waitress was very rude and nonaccomodating. We asked her to run a tab for us, she took our drink order and our room number, returned with our drinks, and we never talked to her again. We attempted numerous times to flag her down, and even tried to run after her a couple of times, but she just kept on walking! Tables all around us with different waitresses received attentive service. Very dissappointed, as mom and I don't do New Year's Eve very often. As for the B-Line Diner, VERY expensive, and extremely poor quality of food for breakfast. Cold, over cooked, disgusting. We even discussed at the table we would have been much more happy going to McDonald's and getting their breakfast sandwiches Please Peabody, we would love to go back, but will be very hesitant, as when mom and I go somewhere for a girl's weekend, we don't just want to be impressed by the room, but the overall ameneties. If your lounge and restaurant standards come up to par, we would love to come back.

Reviews.Title: “I would not stay here again”
Reviews.Author: bredaTraveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 7 days over the Christmas period. The hotel was fully booked, but the staff were not prepared for their guests. The pool area was overcrowded, the restaurants were overwhelmed, and the maids were unable to clean all of the rooms. The facilities were not as advertised: for example, although the hotel boasts a spa, there is no facility for manicures or pedicures. The staff will give a mani on request - on a rickety table in the massage room. The staff were overworked, and the attitude was "be grateful for what you get". My margarita was not prepared properly - and the waitress said : Be glad that you got one. My room was dusty and dirty and the garbage was not emptied: and I was told by housekeeping: Be grateful -some rooms did not get cleaned till after 5pm. There was a 2 hour wait to get our car from the valet. This hotel charges a daily fee for amenities and services - too bad they don't provide access to the amenities or ensure that the service is delivered.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel.Services average.”
Reviews.Author: Tilap
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel last week. Good location. Services must be improved. Paul

Reviews.Title: “Peabody Orlando is terrible”
Reviews.Author: BingUF
Reviews.Content: We have been staying in Peabody Orlando for 4 nights (Dec 25-29, 2010) and had a terrible experience. The wall is paper thin and you can hear everything outside including noise of elevator, people walking down the hall and the worst, housekeeping. We were woke up 8am in the first morning by housekeeping and I had to ask them for a door tag ( we did not have one in our room) for "do not disturb". Surprisingly, the housekeeping still tried to get into our room regardless the door tag while we were catching some sleep. I had to complain to the concierge but nobody cared and I never got any feedback for this issue. We were trying to have some hot water after a freezing day and realized there was even no coffee maker. I called the housekeeping and they said they will CHARGE me for hot water!!! Not even mention additional 30 bucks for parking and resort fee. The Peabody Orlando completely ruined our holiday trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: drl1983
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel and we loved our stay in it. The rooms were spacious and clean. The staff were friendly and courteous. The location is convinient with plenty of restaurants around. I really can't say enough good things about this place.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Wait To Return!”
Reviews.Author: 1Travelingon
Reviews.Content: I reserved this hotel on Priceline, it really was "the luck of the draw." I only paid $64 a night saving a lot of$$$ The purpose of this 3 night stay was to finish off our cruise with a day or two at Disney. The Peabody is huge and caters to conventions, we just happened to be in the 3 days in between conventions. The rooms were immaculate and modern, in fact our bathroom even had a flat screen t.v. built into the mirror! The beds were extremely comfortable with at least 5 feather down pillows/comforter. Our room looked over the pool part of the resort. There was a lap pool & gym but we did not visit those. However, the lagoon area with palm trees and heated pools were phenomenal, there were rock formations, bridges, waterfalls (including in the pool), kiddy beach area, tunnel slide, and more. The grounds were impeccable, the service was first rate, there was PLENTY of staff which was SO good to have! I am so tired of going places that are short staffed apparently due to the economy yet the places are obviously in need of more help-Anyway, there must have been a dozen Christmas trees decorated, wonderful art decor everywhere, a large clean and well equipped business center. In fact, I accidentally left my purse in the business center, the staff called security (about the time I was calling from my car) and they simply delivered my purse back to my room. Then there are the "Peabody Ducks" where every morning they walk in on the red carpet to spend the day at one of the indoor fountains, at the end of the day to music they march back out on the red carpet, a nice treat for all to enjoy. There many restaurants and lounges in the hotel to choose from as well as being located on International Dr. near theme parks, restaurants and shopping. Our room had a fridge but not a microwave which I would have appreciated~ however they have different room types (including suites) to choose from. I cannot say enough about this place, valet was sharp and on the ball, there were never less than two and often more at concierges, and the entire staff was friendly and helpful. Parking is $12.75 a day ($20.00 for Valet), and there is a $15.00 resort fee. I did not mind the resort fee whatsoever, it was very well worth it . We feel the parking fee is too high, but again minor compared to all The Peabody has to offer. We would definitely stay again. One last thing, their website (at least the one I saw) does NOT do it justice.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious Accomodations in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: BigFish78
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Peabody Orlando for a night in late October while visiting the Universal Studios Halloween event. The Peabody hotel was a very nice place to stay. We found the accomodations to be luxurious, the lobbies and pool areas were beautiful. The staff was friendly and accomodating, and the restaurant that we ate at (kind of like a diner theme) was great as well. The pastries and baked goods on display in the restaurant were fantastic looking and so good that you wanted to eat them all! Really the only negatives were the added costs that you will incur (resort fees and parking), which is not out of the oridnary for a hotel of its caliber, but perhaps out of the oridary for Orlando accomodations. So if you're coming here - just be aware that its generally a step above other hotels in the area - and be prepared to pay as such. Its also rather close to the Universal Studios - we took a cab ride there and it was only about $10 each way, which is another great positive. The resort fee also gets you on free to the I-drive trolley, so lots and lots of dining and shopping options are quickly available to guests. If you stay - be sure to check out the duck parade in the lobby! The ducks are the signature of the Peabody, and the parade did not disappoint. Quite a treat to watch them march down the red carpet to their waiting elevator. But get there early! It gets rather busy around show time.

Reviews.Title: “convenient”
Reviews.Author: brooksie22
Reviews.Content: A nice hotel, very convenient for the conference centre which is just across the road. The staff were helpful. Not so sure about the Duck Parade but at least they seem to enjoy it!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel--Great Staff!!”
Reviews.Author: FloridaKate101
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the Peabody Orlando, I wasn't sure what to expect, but I was plesantly surprised! The hotel is huge with so many amenities to offer and plenty of dining options. Gabrielle checked us in and she was so helpful and gave us such a lovely room! The rooms were beautiful with a huge bathroom and very comfortable bed. The only thing was housekeeping starts early in the morning and they allow the doors to slam very loudly repeatedly, but other than that, everyone was so friendly from check in to check out! We really hope to visit your property again soon!!

Reviews.Title: “New York Palace Prices with unsophisticated service”
Reviews.Author: reviewfromtwo
Reviews.Content: The good - great location across from convention center, beautiful views of the lakes, friendly employees, clean rooms The bad - cigarette smoke blowing out of ac vents into our room, inoperable desk telephone, one of tvs couldn't change channels, barely edible food at the empty restaurants, 20 minute waits for valet service, concierge sent me to offsite salon (as the one advertised in the Peabody room docs is not open yet) at another hotel who would not call me a cab to return to the Peabody even though their own cabs would not take my fare either as it was too short at ten dollars....had to call my own, wait 25 minutes for it and was consequently late to an event. For $600 a night plus parking, that was one of the poorer hotel values I've had.

Reviews.Title: “terrible experience from check-in to check out”
Reviews.Author: Larry3830
Reviews.Content: This hotel did not have my dates correctly listed on their reservation system. thankfully I had my confirmation as they were very rude about the dates I needed to stay. I was then directed the wrong direction to the wrong tower to get to my room. The internet service did not work, the hotel signage is very poor, the restaurant, Capriccio Grill had the rudest bartender I have ever seen. He ignored me for quite some time as I was alone and wanting to order a drink and dinner. He was busy plaing around with some sort of problem with the register. Finally I asked if he knew I was there and the reply was "Yeah, I have to fix this first." I was there for a very large convention that was held in the hotel and on several occasions had meetings in the Rocks Bar as it was convenient to meet for attendees. On the 3 occasions I was there, 2 around 5 PM and one at 1:00 PM, each for 30-45 minutes, no one ever approcahed to see if drinks were needed. The waitresses were busy hanging around the bar and chatting. I could go on and on about service related issues over my 4 day stay but suffice to say I would never return to the Peabody Orlando and would never recommend a stay here. For the price of the hotel one would expect much higher service.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel at Orlando Convention Center”
Reviews.Author: celesteram
Reviews.Content: Overall, we enjoyed our stay at the Peabody. You can't beat the convenience to the convention center across the street. Our dining experience in Carpaccio was good but long. The ducks didn't disappoint. I though that the lobby was striking, with the water features and modern lighting and decor. Our first room had a wonderful view, but the air condition unit was not working, and could not be fixed by the hotel engineers, in a reasonable amount of time, so we were switched to a king suite. Massive hotel with very nice rooms and everything was very, very clean & modern.

Reviews.Title: “Good for business but probably not so much for pleasure”
Reviews.Author: scantx
Reviews.Content: This is a decent hotel & it's conveniently located across the street from the convention center. However, here is the bad: it is extremely busy (tons of people everywhere all the time), very noisy & the service is terrrible! The bar tenders in tower 2 bar are very rude. Restaurant service was very slow. Our dinner turned into a 3 hr event. My room was never cleaned until after 3 p.m. And this was usually when I needed back into the room to do some work on the computer. The good: valet guys were great; there's a t.v. inside your bathroom mirror in hotel room and the ducks marching @ 11 a.m & 5 p.m. daily. You can even sign up your kids to march w/them. I personally would never stay here for pleasure (due to the constant noise, chaos...etc.), but for business, it served it purpose.

Reviews.Title: “rough on the edges”
Reviews.Author: danfrank7
Reviews.Content: Rooms are large and comf . but weird noises come from the walls and windows as building is still settling?. had to change rooms as first room sound like tehre was construction close by but there wasn't ! room was clean but not super clean . biz. center only 1 computer at 0.50 a min ! one of the restaurants 70% empty but would not let me in saying its overbooked , a glace an hour later , still 70% empty , short staff I guess .

Reviews.Title: “The new tower is wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: MMGoldstein
Reviews.Content: Just months before, I had stayed in the "old" (original) tower at the Peabody Orlando because the new tower was still under construction. The older room seemed "tired" and not what I would've expected from a renowned hotel; however, my recent stay in the new tower redeemed the Peabody! I was confused when I walked into the bathroom and found a remote control that didn't appear to belong to anything. Upon closer inspection, there was something "weird" about the mirror so I pointed the remote at it and hit the "on" button. There in the middle of my mirror was a TV! I loved having the news on while I was getting ready each morning. And I loved that the mirror never fogged up after a hot shower! The rest of the room was nice--nothing mind-blowing--but nice. I had a great view of the new pool, which was beautiful. Food at the B-Line Diner was great. Concierge, Bell Stand and door personnel were all very pleasant. The location was extremely convenient, as it was across the street from the Orange County Convention Center, where I spent 8 days working. The hotel was walking distance to shopping and great restaurants. All in all, a pleasant stay!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel at a affordable price - plus all the perks”
Reviews.Author: Trevelling_Macs
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Peabody for 4 nights. The hotel was wonderfully located within walking distance of many major attractions. The rooms were really spacious with a lot of luxurious amenities. The clincher was a TV embedded in the bathroom mirror. Rooms were very clean and the bed comfortable. Since we had a special conference rate we had many perks that included free bottled water, free Wi-Fi (awesome!!) access to the fitness rooms and free I-Ride (trolley that takes you to almost all attractions in downtown Orlando and Disney area) trolley coupons. I was told that with an additional $18 all of this could be yours if you don't have a special rate. So if you are in Orlando don't pass this hotel by. Enjoyed the service from the polite and wonderful staff. Additional things are a 24 hour snack bar and the lovely duck pond.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous and Luxurious”
Reviews.Author: waterwoman09
Reviews.Content: This is a very lovely place to stay. Very clean and comfortable. You feel like royalty here. However, unless you are royalty, it is very pricey. No in-room coffee which is a big strike for me. Had I known, I would have brought a coffee pot along. Coffee is $3.50 for small cup - juice is $6.00 - desserts $7.00. Fine if you have a big expense account. Hard to tip well for good service when the bill is $50 for breakfast for 2 - and this isnt a buffet! Didnt mind a bit leaving tip for housekeeping - they did outstanding job everyday! Very comfortable bed with luxury pillows. A tv in the bathroom mirror!! That just blew us away! Awesome and quiet room. The famous ducks are a must-see!!! I really enjoyed my stay here. Just couldnt afford to eat or even drink coffee here. Oh, I will say that the Feed the Fridge room service is very nice and wallet-friendly.

Reviews.Title: “High Hopes based on Other Peabody's but Orlando Just Didn't Measure Up.”
Reviews.Author: CityofAngels3167
Reviews.Content: Others in our circle had excellent experiences with Peabody Hotels in other cities. We stayed in the new tower "2" which had only been open 3 weeks. When we arrived, our reservation paperwork said " 1 king bed" . Upon checking in, they only had two doubles available. What upscale hotel still offers two doubles? After 45 minues of arguing, we were given a room with two queens which was okay. When we entered the room, we noticed that it was dusty. My fiancee was able to write her name on the bathroom mirror in the dust. The remote control had stickcy stuff on it and was covered with dust. I went for ice and couldnt find the ice machine so I asked the room attendant. She told me that she had no idea where the ice machine was so I wandered the floor for a while until I found it. There were many other issues that should have not happened at a higher end hotel being a seasoned traveler. Hoping not to have to write a review, we met with Mr. Marshall Kelberman, the manager of rooms for the Peabody. He was very polite and assured us that he would make things right. He did take some money off of our bill. Unfortunately, immediately after that evening, when returning from several work events, we returned to our room and found that the room staff had forgotten to place the 4 glasses in our room for beverages; although they did take the dirty ones away. After calling, they did bring us glasses after some time. Upon check out, when leaving the parking garage, unfortunately our key card became demagnetised at the cross arms. We pushed the help button and no one answered. We pushed it again and again and nothing. After a while, we called the Peabody main desk and they sent a bus staff member to let us out. Why do they have help buttons in the parking structure if there is no monitoring? Overall, the hotel needs quite a bit of help. This was just a quick summary. Lots of other less than positive experiences over the 4 nights we were there. I would suggest somwhere else to stay. I truly hope that the Orlando Peabody can sometime measure up the othe others in the same chain. It clearly didn't this trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Spa coming soon to the Peabody”
Reviews.Author: bettyIllinois
Reviews.Content: The spa at Peabody will not disappoint. Wilkadyz gives the best massage ever. I also had a facial which was very good. The spa is large and has great features but I would not book a reservation until the spa is completed. The prices are high and they are not offering discounts to make up for the fact that there is no steam shower or use of the outdoor garden tubs at this time. They told me the facility should be completed in December or January.

Reviews.Title: “Staff very friendly.”
Reviews.Author: dooley22
Reviews.Content: This hotel is HUGE and yet the staff is really great and attentive. The new gym is BEAUTIFUL!!! The gym staff is knowledgeable and helpful. They offer classes (yoga and pilates) that apparently are quite new. Highly recommend looking into them. The spa was very nice. The location was perfect for the Convention Center and a walk to The Pointe which has many restaurant choices. And yes, the ducks are a hit.

Reviews.Title: “Nice new expansion - but pricey”
Reviews.Author: brianz09
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 days for a work event so I was not out of pocket personally. Don't think I would stay here for a family/personal trip, as the location is not too close to Disney and there are cheaper options for Universal. Construction noises that many complained about were pretty much over in early Oct, so I had no issues. The room was spacious enough. Bathroom was a beauty- very modern and clean. The B-line Diner had great breakfast and lunch selections -pricey, but expected for a convention hotel. Concierge staff were very helpful in helping with dinner and entertainment selections. Frint desk, cleaning staff, and bell men were also very fiendly, professional and polite.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Great - New Napa Restaurant BEWARE”
Reviews.Author: David12815
Reviews.Content: All great at the hotel. The ducks are always a hit. The new Napa restaurant that had been open for a week was a mess. The friendly staff could not make up for the poor menu choices and over cooked fish offerings. Over priced and needs a lot of work to come up to the Peabody standard. Unless assured that it has reached the high standard of the hotel, give this place a miss as it was well wide of the mark.

Reviews.Title: “A place where ducks feel at home”
Reviews.Author: halycon-1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the new tower that opened one day before we arrived. The service is outstanding for an American hotel and did not except less from a Peabody. Our room was very comfortable and very clean. I am bothered that we had to pay for the $15 per day charge to use the gym, coffee til 8:30 am which makes no send for us from California because we are just waking up by then, or the crazy Itrolley system that was useless since the wait is too long and when they do arrive it is full. I'm not a big fan of Orlando but I do like this hotel because it is quite and safe. Definitely will stay here again but I wish they would have coffee or tea in the room. I had to ask for hot water at their coffee shop every night OCR my night time tea. Oh well you can't win them em all. I'm just a spoiled Asian used to the comforts of Shangri La hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: 4RedEyes
Reviews.Content: The outdoor swimming pool is on top of the car port area which provides fantastic views of Orlando! The outdoor spa area is huge and NICE ! (You could fit a whole football team in it...in fact, I believe we saw college football players, maybe not the whole team.) We really LOVED the pool area & could live out there, it was beautiful! The suite rooms are large and perfect. GREAT place!

Reviews.Title: “I LOVE The Peabody!!”
Reviews.Author: Cappylove
Reviews.Content: I traveled most recently to The Peabody hotel for a weekend getaway with the company I work for. My husband and I only live a few hours away so we travel to Orlando frequently and have stayed in many different hotels including the Hard Rock and the Crowne Plaza. I have to say The Peabody is far and away the best hotel we have stayed in! The room was beautiful, comfortable, and modern. Flat screen TV, Dream Bed, Robes, Ipod Radio and more. The Peabody ducks are adorable and we enjoyed watching them in the fountain as we would come and go. The best thing about The Peabody though is the staff. From the moment we arrived to the moment we drove away at the end of our stay the staff was phenomenal! We felt very relaxed and would have loved to have stayed longer. I can't wait to return to The Peabody. I can't imagine staying anywhere else in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Eric3179
Reviews.Content: Was a bit dubious before arrival after some low rating reviews on this site. Had an excellent stay, staff were great, room was fine clean and provided all needs and great bed. No noise at night and slept well. Teenagers with us were allowed to use gym and pool was excellent. Good location for Sea World, Universal, Wet & Wild etc Would recommend booking a 'club room', extra money is worth it with additional services like valet parking and light breakfast included,saving money in the longer term. One down side is that wine is expensive at hotel bar and a newer TV in room would not go amis. However, no hesitation in recommending this hotel or returning in the future.

Reviews.Title: “A little above average......”
Reviews.Author: Brownie0022
Reviews.Content: I was in town for a conference and stayed at the Peabody and attended a conference next door at the Convention Center. I stayed in an updated room which was nice. The good aspects of my room was the oversized bathtub, comfortable bed with nice linens, flat screen tv, nice toiletries and airconditioning (not too loud like some can be and kept a steady temperature once set). The major downside was the noise coming from the hallway. Unfortunately there is a large gap underneath the door and the floor and also the walls are fairly thin. So as guests would walk down the hall talking, you could easily hear their conversations (even over the airconditioning). So as guests would come in at a late hour, even though they were not talking loud, I could hear everything they were saying and it would wake me up and I am not a light sleeper. There was also still construction noise which went on all day. The hotel staff that I encountered were friendly but by no means "above and beyond" which you would expect when you hear the name "Peabody". I called the front desk to ask if I could check out an hour later than the normal check out and was told "no" with no other options. I have stayed in equivalent hotels that would at least give you some options even if it did involve paying a little extra for the benefit. Overall, it was just "ok" which is not what I was expecting from the Peabody. My main advice for future guests would be to bring earplugs for a good night's sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Completely Shocked”
Reviews.Author: apple289
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Peabody on average 5 times a year, typically for long weekends in Orlando and every now and again for business. The hotel usually takes care of me beautifully, however, the last two trips have been borderline at best. This last trip was meant to be a nice weekend with my son and out of town family (they stayed at Disney while my son and I stayed safely far enough away at the Peabody). The room was a newly renovated room and still smelled of fresh paint. Perfectly appointed, except for the remote that worked when it sensed it was close to being launched across the room and the TV that would intermittently lose audio for 5 seconds at a time every 10 minutes. Coincidentally, right about the time the local weather was being broadcasted. Typically, the hotel leaves a kind note and chocolate covered strawberries in the room. Not that they are on my diet, but my teenage son rather enjoys them and the touch was a thoughtful gesture. By not having them in the room when we returned late from dinner and my turn down service request ignored, I see this as an indicator that the level of service is not quite being the same as in the past years. The valet was completely understaffed and even with a call ahead 10 to 15 minutes prior, they always seemd to take an additional 5 minutes to bring the car around. The final "F" on this experience has to do with their lack of total customer service. My son had left an important item accidentally in the room. When it was noticed (within 24 hours of our departure), I promptly called the hotel and was hung up on and transferred around until I finally was connected with someone in "Lost and Found". This gentleman assured me that the item would be returned, but would need a credit card to pay for the shipping. As if I hadn't paid enough all ready for "services", but not being one to quibble, I provided my credit card information and was told that it would be sent out by the business office, Fedex ground, that day. I live 3 hours from Orlando, it would have arrived to me in 2 days at the most if it was sent out within reason from the day I called into the hotel. Over a week later, and after going through the same rounds of calling in, being hung up on, and transferred I finally have a tracking number that shows it really takes over a week to ship something 3 hours south. I should have just gone back and picked it up myself. If you are used to or are looking for an exceptional experience, this hotel would no longer be my first choice. If you are looking for a nameless, faceless experience with a bar in the lobby, there are plenty of other properties in Orlando that can cater to those specifications.

Reviews.Title: “Not at the Calibur of a 4-Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jsmallfl
Reviews.Content: I should start by saying that this hotel is currently under construction, and I know that is the cause for many inconveniences to guests, understandably so. Service and value, however, should have been stepped up in order to accommodate for these inconveniences, and it simply wasn't. Guests are certainly paying for convenience here--- the menu prices for drinks and food items were outrageously priced for the lack of atmosphere and just-so-so quality of food. We encountered several issues during our stay. First, although we were told to call down 15 minutes in advance of needing our car from valet, we could not do this because both of the phones in our room were broken. The two phone lines were all static, and we could place no calls, even to extensions within the hotel. We walked down to valet, requested our vehicle, then as we waited we decided to report the phone problem. We were assured that "someone from engineering" would enter our room while we were out and repair the phone. We were then told that if the phones were not fixed to simply dial 4-4-4-4 from our room, to which we asked, "But if the phones have not been fixed, how can we dial this number?" We were assured again that the phones would be replaced within the hour. We waited over 20 minutes for our car to be pulled around, then left the property for about an hour and a half. Upon our return, still no phones. When we reported the issue again in the morning to front desk upon checking out, we were told there was "no record" of our prior request on file. That was frustrating!! Our second and thirs issues happened on the morning of checkout. Although we had the "Please Do Not Disturb" sign on our door, and Check-Out is not until NOON, Housekeeping started banging on our door at 8 a.m. We were not only jarred awake from sleep, but were forced out of bed to answer the door and tell them that we were not checking out for four more hours. At this point I would have most certainly complained to the front desk about this disturbance, however since we had no phones, this was not a simple task! My husband and I attempted to fall back asleep, when less than a half-hour later, impossibly LOUD fire alarms started going off all over the property, but most directly into our ear drums from right above the bed. The loud speaker then announced that a series of drills would be performed (at 8:45 a.m. on a Friday morning?!?). The alarms continued intermittently for about 45 minutes, each time just as incredibly loud and shocking to the system. We checked out of the hotel exhausted and anxious from the many nuisances and disturbances which had taken place during our stay. Our final issue came about as we were driving home and realized we had left something in our room. We phoned the hotel and were transferred to Housekeeping. The contact there informed us that Housekeeping does not take inventory of Lost and Found until later in the evening, and that we would be called if our item was found. Because I received no phone call, the next day I called back. Housekeeping had no record of our item, so I was transferred to Lost & Found. Our item was never turned in by the staff, which most probably means that it was taken. We take responsibility for leaving this item in our room, but most 4-Star Hotels employ staff that may be trusted to turn in items that are left behind. This was very discouraging, and certainly says something about the lack of training and low quality of staff that are employed at The Peabody. A star in the midst of all the dust- the Bellhop ( I believe his name was Adolfo- cursing myself now for not writing it down!). He greeted us by name each time we would enter the hotel, was very knowledgeable, had pride in his work, and should be commended for his excellent work ethic and what he gives to his position and to the hotel. My suggestion for this hotel would be to look at other 4-Star Hotels such as the JW Marriott in order to study and learn from their systems and staff training. I would really rate this hotel as 3-Star until it focusses it's spotlight on service and customer satisfaction.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Ever”
Reviews.Author: Sage49
Reviews.Content: I reserved our rooms at the Peabody in May 2010 for 9 days beginning July 30th and leaving Aug. 8th. I was never told there was construction going on when I made the reservation nor was I told about the "Service Fee". I made a reservation for 2 adjoining rooms. When I called back the Monday before our arrival to confirm our reservation, again no one mentioned the construction. I did not learn of the construction until I went on this website, Tripadvisor.com, and read about it. On the Tuesday before our arrival, I received an e-mail with a different confirmation on it. I called to find out what had changed and was told they didn't have any adjoining rooms available but we would be upgraded to a suite at no extra charge. (This turned out not to be any great upgrade). I inquired about the construction and was told that "it was not noisy. They were just moving in beds and putting in final fixtures." The person I spoke to also told me she would request a "quiet room" for our stay. I was also told the construction was only going on Monday through Friday from 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. Upon our arrival and after a 7 hour flight, when we checked in, the front desk wanted us to sign for the $15.98 a day "Service Fee" for 3 rooms. The "suite" consisted of 2 rooms with a palor in the middle. The services were for items we weren't even going to use: Wireless Internet (we brought our own), local and long distance use of the telephone (we had our own cell phones to use), 2 bottles of Peabody water (we bought a 6 pack at Walgreens for $3.79), I-Ride tickets (we purchased 3 - 1 all day pass for $12.00 and we didn't even end up using them), use of the fitness center (we never used it), and shoe shining (we were wearing tennis shoes and didn't need shoe shining). We were told at check-in that this "Service Fee" was "automatic". After much complaining, they finally waived the "Service Fee". We awoke on Saturday morning to construction noise and on Sunday morning we were awaken to jackhammering and construction noise at 7:45 a.m. We complained at the front desk and were told they would change our room. I also mentioned that I was told the construction was only Monday through Friday from 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. and the front desk told me that the construction was 7 days a week as they were trying to finish the hotel for the upcoming convention season. When we arrived back at the hotel later in the day, they had changed our room to one on a higher floor when we complained that we were still on the side of the hotel where the new tower was being built, we were told it didn't matter where in the hotel you were, you were going to get construction noise because they were now doing work in the main hotel. Our new room was just as bad as the previous room. Little did we know that there were some brand new rooms in the hotel but we didn't get any of them. We found out when our friends arrived to spend a few days and they had been given new updated rooms. Our rooms had old furniture that had nicks in them, old drapes and old dirty looking carpets. When we complained again, after spending a lot of money to stay at this hotel for 9 days, they refunded us 2 days for 1 of the rooms we booked. We also had to endure 2 power outages, 1 in the middle of the night and one beginning at 4:00 a.m. and going on and off until 11:00 a.m. The person I spoke with in Reservations should have been honest about the construction and the "Service Fee' when I made my initial reservation or at least when I called to confirm my reservation. I was lied to and this hotel ruined our vacation! I can honestly say that I will NEVER stay at another Peabody hotel ever again and will never recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel with exceptional staff”
Reviews.Author: littlemissleek
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travelled to Florida for our honeymoon in July. We were welcomed by a wonderful check-in agent (Stephanie I think) and a new starter who were both welcoming and friendly. I had called in advance to check that we could leave luggage in the reception as I knew we would arrive before 3pm. However, upon our arrival at noon, our room was ready. We appreciated the I-ride vouchers although we didn't use them everyday. The hotel location was great for the restaurants and bars on International Drive and is a short walk to Pointe Orlando. Our room was a newly renovated one on the tenth floor. It was a good sized room with a really comfortable bed, good sized bathroom and a view of the pool. The location of the room meant that it was quite dark. The motion sensor lights saved me a couple of bruises walking around in the dark and my husband loved the TV in the bathroom mirror. Our room was cleaned to a very high standard every day and whenever we saw housekeeping in the corridors, they were always friendly and polite. The pool area was well maintained with plenty of space for everyone and the pool itself was lovely and warm and there were plenty of towels easily available. We used the concierge just once to ask for directions and again Candi was very friendly and as well as offering the directions we needed, she suggested different methods and prices for getting there. The only downside we experienced with the staff was one day when waiting for a taxi, we were not assisted by the doorman so proceeded to get into a waiting taxi without their help which was fine by us but made the taxi driver uncomfortable as it was not the way to do things. I cannot say that we were ignored by the doorman, I think there was a coach full of people arriving at the same time so they were busy. We followed the same steps when getting a taxi to the airport and were helped by both a doorman and a bellboy. We also ate at the Capriccio Grill on the first night. I made my reservation on the same day and the assistant who made the reservation was fabulous (I can't think of her name but she was happy and friendly even addressing me by name when we returned at 8.30 for dinner). Our server, Maryann was excellent - she talked us through the whole menu, giving her personal favourites and recommending some sides (including advising us to share!). Lastly, we had a problem when we left the hotel in that we discovered when we arrived in Washington that we had left some things behind at the hotel. I called lost and found who were very quick to offer assistance - our belongings had already been found and they were waiting for some instruction from us. We were only in Washington for a couple of days so waited until we were in New York to arrange the onward delivery to our hotel there. I called lost and found again and provided the details and was told delivery would be by the end of the week. Unfortunately, that did not happen. However, I contacted the Peabody again when we returned to Europe and Maryellen in reception and Glenda in lost and found were both very efficient and fast to solve the problem. Glenda in particular deserves praise from me here - she called me at work the next day to offer her apologies for any confusion and to confirm the despatch etc. My only disappointment is that we missed the duck march as we were simply not there at the right time. If we return to Orlando in the future, we would come back to The Peabody without hesitation. And I'm hoping to see it once all of the building work is finished.

Reviews.Title: “Great Beds but No Rest During the Day!”
Reviews.Author: kealexander
Reviews.Content: Last week I stayed at the hotel while at a convention. The hotel was selected as the executive hotel. Prices were very high but I was given little choice. I did find a better price than the convention rate on Expedia but it was still over $250 per night. I was there 5 nights. Upon check-in, I was told that there was a mandatory $15.95 per day service charge which included wi-fi in the room. My biggest problem, however, was the number of interruptions during the day. I tried to rest in the afternoon on 2 days in a row, having been at meetings since early morning and having others to attend later that day and into the night.
