A series of fire alarm tests were conducted both afternoons with the very loud, over the bed, fire alarm accompanied by a recorded voice reminding us this was "only a test". On the second afternoon, I called the front desk and was told a manager would call me, this never happened. The next morning, while getting ready, the alarm sounded again! My other problem was the unpredictability of the maid service. On those days that I attempted to nap, the housekeepers didn't come until around 3 (while I was trying to nap). Other days they were there before 9 in the morning! The beds were fabulous and the room pleasant but for that price I'd like to be able to use the room for more than a bed to sleep in at night!!

Reviews.Title: “It's a really nice place, especially if you like ducks.”
Reviews.Author: SunshineSeeker71
Reviews.Content: This was a really nice hotel. Very fancy. I really liked all the waterfalls and fountains. They have ducks in the fountain in the lobby from 11-5pm- pretty neat to see. The pool was really big, and they also had a hot tub. Pool is open until 11pm which is nice. Their poolside bar was closed the night we went out there, but it looked like the servers were going out there and taking drinks during the day. The theme everywhere in this hotel was ducks- everyt detail down to the duck shaped soap. Negatives - Parking fee (12 self park, 20 valet) and Resort Fee of $15. At least with the resort fee you did get some perks- free internet, free acess to their fitness club, free all day trolley passes (trolly stop about a block away), free bottled water, free coffee... Also, the hotel is going through some construction. We were not bothered by it until the morning when we started hearing pounding upstairs from our room- woke us up. I think once that is finished, this will be a great place. But, ask about the construction before you book a room & make sure you get a quiet room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, nice location”
Reviews.Author: funflamom
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Peabody w/10 in my party (7 kids under 11). We required 2 rooms which they were very nice to make adjoining. Thought it was rediculous that a room that pricey did not have a coffee maker in it and that the microwave was an addtl $15.00 charge per day. Beds were AMAZING and I want to know what kind they were. We stayed in room 530. All the staff were very helpful. Shuttle was convienent and you get passes for that and young children travel free. Parking kind of a pain but they are nice to give you rides to and from in a golf cart if they are there when you arrive. We had a very less than pleasing caesar salad in the restaurant downstairs. The hummus app was horrible and didn't even have olive oil on it. ASked for it and got it about 14 minutes later, they were not busy when we ate there. Kids meals decent.

Reviews.Title: “Did not live up to reputation”
Reviews.Author: squid1959
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed 4 nights during a convention. Our reservations were made months ago, yet 2 of the rooms were not according to the reservations. Instead of 2 rooms with two double beds, we were given a king and a roll-away (not what you want to sleep on in a 4 star hotel). Rooms were not ready at check in time - had to wait several hours for all of our rooms to be available. Jack-hammer drilling started early each morning. Had to wait at the front desk 25 minutes once to get an additional key. Rooms were not cleaned until very late in the day. It was as if this hotel across from the convention center had never had this many people at one time before. VERY disappointing. Additional charges for amenities that are usually provided free of charge at other hotels was also disappointing. While there was fitness center, there was an additional charge to use it.

Reviews.Title: “Elks National Convention -- Enjoyed The Peabody”
Reviews.Author: pilotgirl310
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about the concierge staff, and the rest of the staff for that matter, at The Peabody Hotel in Orlando after my carry-on bag, with all my makeup, jewelry and other essentials, was stolen recently. We had flown from the West Coast to Orlando to attend the national Elks convention and arrived three days early, staying in a one-bedroom suite hotel near the Orlando airport. Did Disney and Kennedy Space Center for three days and packed up the rental car to move to The Peabody for the convention. Returned the rental car to Payless, hopped into a cab and arrived at The Peabody to find my bag was missing. Hubby thought I had it, he thought I had it......you know how that goes. Telephoned Noel, the Town Car driver, who happened to be returning to the airport area, and asked him if we'd left the bag in his car. "No," he said, but he would be happy to stop by Payless and see if they had it. Called the suites hotel and Payless no fewer than four times each that day and, of course, no luck in finding it. Totally upset and depressed, I stopped by The Peabody concierge desk and they were very sympathethic, giving me the telephone number for the Orlando Police Department so that I might file a crime report. They also directed me to the nearest mall so that I could buy makeup and other essentials. I didn't have so much as a toothbrush! Our room at The Peabody was not a remodeled one but was clean, offered a very comfortable bed and met our needs, as we were rarely in it. The woman who cleaned our room each day was especially good, friendly and we tipped her well. The pool area is nice and large and offered a respite from the busy days of the convention. Staying a week, we were able to try out the restaurants within the hotel and within walking distance, as well as room service, which was always good and arrived within a half hour of our order. The Red Lobster down I-Drive disappointed. Jack's in the Rosen Hotel, just down the block, was especially good. We have now stayed in both the Memphis and Orlando Peabody Hotels and enjoy them very much. We wouldn't hesitate to return.

Reviews.Title: “Great new rooms!”
Reviews.Author: BobnCris
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 1 night in a new remodeled room and were amazed at the details. The room had motion detected nightlights under the dressers so you could see without turning on lights on your way to the restroom. The grout and carpet were immaculate (I looked due to past reviews). There was a tv in the bathroom mirrior and the room decor was very nice. I would say the room was5*. You could see they hotel is remodeling, but the new room says they're doing something right!

Reviews.Title: “BPOE National convention in the house of noise with no warning”
Reviews.Author: augeringin
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 week there were renovations going on and air hammers went at it all day long every day. They never gave any indication that this was going on when we reserved, or we would have went some place else. All I got from them was "we're sorry" that sure is an underestatement to say the least. I can't think of anyone that is a sorrier excuse for a host. I guess for their apology and $1.00 I could have gotten a cup of coffee from McDonalds. If your planning on coming here I suggest you beat your head against a wall till you think clearer. What a hell hole

Reviews.Title: “Capriccio Grill - The best restaurant in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: AZGUY99
Reviews.Content: The Capriccio Grill restaurant in the Peabody Orlando hotel is a phenominal establishment. From the service (my server Maryann) to the food (lobster bisque, filet mignon and the peabody signature coffee), this restaurant is over the top fantastic. Hats off to this fine dining signature restaurant for a job well done.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Peabody”
Reviews.Author: DAexptravel
Reviews.Content: I am a very frequent business traveler who stays more than 200 nights per year in hotels across the world. I visit Orlando several times a year for business and once or twice per year for pleasure. I stayed at the Peabody for a convention across the street, location was unbeatable. The pros- location, service, room finishes The cons- not too many other than the construction which did not impact me as I was out of the hotel working before they started Some reviewers seem to complain about Valet parking or resort fees, I am not sure where they are used to staying but these are quite normal for a property of this type located adjacent to a convention center. The construction appears almost done and that should make the property even more impressive. An amazing fact that does not often happen at any hotel, anywhere in the world- on my first day (of 3), the housekeeper saw me leaving in the AM and asked me my first name and room #. Every morning thereafter she greeted me by name! Quite impressive and well done by a member of the staff who obviously cares. If you understand the resort fees, use the wireless and health club (which I do) there is no issues and I love the property!

Reviews.Title: “Room and Service disappointing”
Reviews.Author: ryanjulia
Reviews.Content: The lobby of this hotel is very nice, valet was very nice (although expensive $20), front desk check in was easy, bellman service fell short.... one room key didn't work,he said he would bring up another and never did. Room was raggedy. Carpet was in very poor shape, tiles/grout in bath tub looked like they were going to fall off the wall. Dining was very good. Had dinner and breakfast at the hotel. Last day had breakfast in the morning, went back to the room and the key did not work..... very annoying to have to go back to the lobby to get it reprogrammed. It was terrible, but overall very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive but very nice”
Reviews.Author: lazylaura77
Reviews.Content: To my thinking this is a very expensive night's stay. However it is very charming and the ducks are so memorable. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!!”
Reviews.Author: kikiwhite69
Reviews.Content: I am staying at this hotel right now and it is wonderful. This is my second time here and it is as lovely as I remembered. The staff is amazing and the new rooms are gorgeous. The rooms have some very cool features including lights that come on under the furniture so you aren't walking around in the dark in the middle of the night. I will be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't need to bring your alarm clock”
Reviews.Author: JungleJohnny1
Reviews.Content: Major construction (jackhammers) going on seven days per week causes this otherwise very nice hotel to become a noisy residence. There are very nice amenities at The Peabody, but several service fees ($15 per day for trolley service whether you use or not) and taxes applied by the hotel to your bill takes the bloom of the rose. Charges for self-parking too. Our rooms were prepaid with Expedia so these charges were never explained to us up front. Will be trying to rectify with Expedia and the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: mrtravelman8989
Reviews.Content: This place is a huge convention hotel and I had a very nice stay there. Of course, I was charging my room to the company so the high price wasn't really my concern. The pool area is nice and I liked the littel duck soaps they leave in your room. It's a great hotel if your stuck going to Orlando for a convention and the boss is paying.

Reviews.Title: “Good Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mbrebnor
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Peabody Orlando for business purposes in May. The hotel doen't really leave a lasting impression, but it did have some nice touches. The marching ducks are cute and the singer/piano player is nice to see. Other than that, the hotel seems kind of old. They have a nice pool area and a decent fitness center. It is very convenient if you have to attend meetings at the convention center because you can just walk across the street. The prices are a little high, but nothing you wouldn't expect from this type of hotel. Although the service was good, I probably will not return. I prefer a hotel that has a little more energy.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Feelings”
Reviews.Author: michtraveler1969
Reviews.Content: I left the Peabody with very mixed emotions about the property. Pulling into the hotel you're met by an extremely friendly valet who explains that your choices are walk a half mile in stifling heat with all of your luggage or pay: Fee #1 - $20 valet charge. At check-in you're also greeted warmly, quickly and professionally by the front desk staff where again you're hit with: Fee #2 - $15 mandatory "amenity" fee. The public areas, hallways and elevators were all very well maintained and very nice. The room was also quite nice with new updated carpeting, bed and furnishings. The bathroom was good sized with a nice shower, sink and even a television inside the big mirror above the sink. The food in the restaurant was of fair quality but it too was ridiculously overpriced. When weighing the good vs. the bad at the Peabody i'm afraid i'll have to pass on a return visit. I suspect the added fees (which amount to over $35 per night) is why they accept ridiculously low prices on Priceline.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!!! Don't listen to occasional negative reviews”
Reviews.Author: JaxSparkles
Reviews.Content: I won bidding on priceline.com at $65 per night. After I found out the hotel name, I immediately went to read reviews and had mixed feelings about the hotel. I call the hotel and requested non-smoking room (con: smoking is allowed in certain rooms). I knew that I had to pay resort fee $15 per day plus parking (valet $20 per day or self-park $12). With self-park you'll pay $12 each time you come back to the garage. When we arrive we were greeted by friendly valet staff who informed us about the parking options (we, of course, chose valet). There is currently construction of new tower going on, so self-parking is too far away from the hotel entrance. We were greeted by friendly staff at the reception desk and were asked if we wanted to upgrade to concierge room. Upgrade includes a room on one of the top three floors (exclusive access to the floors with your room key); continental breakfast (7-9am M-F; 8-10am on weekends) and heavy o'rderves 5:30-7pm; valet parking; access to gym; sauna. We chose an upgrade at $55 per night. It was soooo totally worth the money, because we didn't have to think about our breakfast and dinner (for some of the evenings). We traveled with a child who also enjoyed every bit of this stay. This hotel is known for duck march, which occur daily at 11am and 5pm. Our kid got selected as an honorary duck master to guide ducks on the red carpet. For a kid, this is an unforgettable moment. Pools are also great, not too crowded. Kiddy pool is also excellent. We didn't use the gym (didn't feel like working out on vacation). Room is average size, TV needs upgrading. Rooms size reminded me of a cruise cabin (the one that has a balcony). Overall, I would definitely recommend this hotel to my friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Almost ruined our honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: shauny2k3
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Peabody Orlando with my pregnant wife in May 2010. The hotel is very clean and has lots of amenities, but ruins itself by nickle and diming and having the worst parking setup of any hotel i've ever stayed at. At check in we were told that only smoking rooms were available, and that we'd have to pay an extra $35 a night for a non-smoking room. We agreed to the extra since neither of us could stand a smoking room. They then told us we had to pay a mandatory $15 per night service fee for 2 bottles of water in our room and passes for the bus that goes down I-Drive (which we have no need for). After this I went to park, the parking lot is about 1/2 miles away from the main entrance, and you have to walk thru a construction site with no side walks. It was raining, so I had to walk uncovered all the way through a flooded road. They then charge $12 per night to park. Ordered a cheese pizza from room service for the advertised $13.95 since they advertise no delivery fees (figured just add tip and tax.) After taxes and (hidden) fees, but before tip, it came to just under $19. Rooms are nice and clean, but outdated with a very basic television and no amenities such as fridge or coffee maker. Coffee is $5 from room service and very poor quality.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel service fee not a bad thing”
Reviews.Author: CarpeDiemMelbourne
Reviews.Content: A few Trip Advisor contributors have complained about The Peabody's 'hotel service fee', but don't let the extra charge put you off if you plan on using the wifi, buying a bottle of water or riding the International Drive trolley. You do pay an extra $15 every day of your stay, but this amount gives you unlimited internet access, two bottles of water, day tickets to ride the tourist trolley, and a few other things, so if you were going to buy these things anyway you will still come out ahead. I stayed in another Orlando hotel before moving to the Peabody, and paid $15 a day just to use the hotel's wifi. The Peabody Orlando is a lovely hotel, and the ducks in the lobby fountain are a delightful feature -- you can't help but smile when they waddle home to their Duck Palace at the end of another hard day splashing around in the fountain. The location is great if you want to spend your Orlando stay on and around International Drive, as you can use the tourist trolley which has a stop right out the front and passes most of the tourist attractions and shopping spots. Meads offer a shuttle to and from Orlando International Airport, which will cost you $29 for a return ticket. I can't say the staff were particularly friendly, they were efficient but I never felt I was anything more than just a customer. The bed was lovely, the store in the lobby was convenient for a cool drink after a long day shopping at the outlets, and there were a few options for eating and drinking without having to leave the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Too many hidden fees”
Reviews.Author: natureswild
Reviews.Content: Management was horribe! She needs to take a course on customer service. They also want to charge you to park, but you have to walk 1/2 a mile to the parking garage or pay even extra for valet. What a rip-off. Never will return!! There are too many other nice places to stay in this area.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: elsalawy
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed very much my stay at the Peabody, an excellent hotel that I recommand without hesitation. I was attending a meeting at the hotel, service and facilities were superb. Staff everywhere was very pleasant. There is some construction (expansion) that is underway and I was told that it should double the hotel size, and should be over by 09/10.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't pay me to go back!”
Reviews.Author: mjharrah
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed there at the beginning of the April. The hotel was ok. Higher star rating than was deserved. They charged fees that we were not told about until we arrived at the hotel. Between what seemed to be mandatory valet at $20.00 per night, as the parking garage was too far away to walk to and through a construction zone, and the resort fee for two bottles of water and internet access that we didn't even use at another $10.00 per night, our bill went up an unexpected $30.00 per night. The valet WRECKED MY CAR! We didn't notice the damage until we had already left the hotel. We immediately returned to the hotel. The person who told me they were the valet manager proceeded to blame me for the damage and deny it was their fault. The hotel security came out and took statements from my boyfriend and I and sent a claim to their insurance company. The adjuster did come and take pictures and gave me a estimate of $618.00 to fix my car within two days. Needless to say.... two weeks later I get a letter in the mail that says they "do not feel our insured can be held legally liable or negligent for your damages as a result of this incident." In other words.... you can't prove we did it so we're not going to fix it. Like my title said... you couldn't pay us to stay here again!! After paying an extra $648.00 after fixing my car this hotel was totally worthless!

Reviews.Title: “the ducks were superb....hotel staff even better”
Reviews.Author: geezer715
Reviews.Content: While the Peabody is famous for the walk of the ducks, this property can be even prouder of it's service. From check in thru check out.....each person was simply superb. Property is very conveniently located to convention senter, Seaworld, Universal, and Disneyworld. The steakhouse, Capriccio, lived up to it's motto " the best steaks in town, any town". New addition and meeting space being built, but with very minimal disruption or noise. Great stay everall.

Reviews.Title: “After 20 years of admiration, the reality is a let down”
Reviews.Author: Leightnite
Reviews.Content: I guess I should break this down in the typical "good, bad, and the ugly" format. I have called Orlando "home" since 1986. While the military has allowed me to travel all over the world, and the ability of staying in some of the best hotels, I have always regarded the Peabody to be one of the best hotels in Orlando. After staying there the first weekend of April, I am highly unimpressed. What they do right: SERVICE, SERVICE, SERVICE! Everything from the great front desk service to Al the bellman, to Hercules the gentleman by the pool. In my opinion, these people were saving grace for the Peabody. I felt that they showed genuine concern for customer satisfaction, not that it was just a job. The only exception to this rule, and I think it's the standard with most of the hotels now in Orlando was the Valet. Whether it's the upscale, arts hotel, or the luxury, chain hotel downtown Orlando, or the Peabody, the Valet service seems very cattle rustler like. Get in, get out, no customer connection. I will say that they "arts" hotel probably does the best out of all that I have experienced in Orlando. The other thing that shines at this hotel, are amenities. Check out the HUGE pool or the fitness center. The equipment is a little dated, but still effective. Which leads to the bad... What could be done better: While there is ongoing construction for the new tower, the original hotel is VERY outdated and stale. When we first walked in the room, the first impression that we both had, was "La Quinta" until we noticed that the tv was still a glass tube vice a LCD/Plasma screen, but a lot of stations were included. The furniture and carpets are very worn and the standard rooms are very small. Self parking is about $12 and Valet about $20. I understand the prices, because of the Convention center right across the street, but I would imagine that hotel guests, should be able to get either validation or a reduction. We went with the valet, mainly for the reason that the self parking looked like it was at the other end of I-Drive the way some people looked walking. Now the AWFUL: We arrived around 4(our fault, running late). My childhood friend was getting married that evening at 530. I thought plenty of time to grab a quick shower and be there. Boy was I wrong. It took an hour and seventeen minutes to get a ready room. Which is shocking for a 4 star to have 1) such long room turnover and 2) for ANY hotel to be holding on rooms an hour after check in time. It was almost 530 by the time we got to our room. When we got there, there were clumps of hair still in the shower, and stains on the sheets on the bed. I went back down, and was given an immediate upgrade to another room, but by the time we got in that one, it was after 6. A full TWO HOURS after we checked in. UNSAT! Full disclosure: We could have immediately checked in if we wanted to be in a "smoking" room. Peabody, please tell your staff, to not suggest someone a SR with the caveat, "that doesn't mean they HAVE smoked in it, just that they CAN." First a non-smoker will smell it and be affected by it, no matter how long ago it was, and two, if the floor is smoking, then it doesn't matter what the room is. that's why many hotels are now smokefree. While my situation may not have been typical, I feel the way that it was handled, was. Overall I would still recommend the Peabody, because there are more hits than misses, but when it misses, IT MISSES...in style. Those two hours really put a sever damper on our weekend. That had nothing to do with any individual person as much as it had to do with the organization of the hotel as a whole. I would stay at the Peabody again, but I feel that next time I will consider one of the Rosen properties first

Reviews.Title: “Good stay, price a little high”
Reviews.Author: KrysyGT
Reviews.Content: Great stay at the Peabody, not sure I would want to pay the full price rate for a stay outside of business purposes. Walls were a little dirty and beat up in the room and also paper thin. I could hear everything my neighbor did. Hotel lobby was a great place to relax, get a drink or snack. Bline diner was outstanding. Loved the ducks and the history. Not many higher end hotels have any fun nuances like this anymore. Pool was outstanding as was the location to great restaurants and the convention center.

Reviews.Title: “2nd stay.. Great stay once again..”
Reviews.Author: damigs
Reviews.Content: Last minute booking and must say glad we stayed here again. I sleep as I would at home. Very comfortable beds and feel comfortable everytime here. Excellent location right on I drive. Love the new Point Orlando location which has many new restaurants and things to do. Took trolley to Sea World one day and wow what a convenience! They are doin a major renovation and upgrade to the hotel which is goin to be impressive. Can't wait to come back again!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mat342
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I recently stayed at The Peabody Orlando for 5 nights while on business. We were working a show at the Convention Center which is a very short distance away. The Peabody is a classy hotel. The entrance is beautiful as well as the entire lobby/lounge area. Our room was awkwardly shaped, but nice none-the-less. We had plenty of space. The bathroom was clean and the bed was comfortable. Basically this hotel had everything we could have wanted for our purpose. The location is the best part of this place. It is a very short walk to the convention center buildings and to the pointe. We walked every night to dinner as the selection of restaurants were fabulous and mostly very good. We had one opportunity to sit by the pool during our stay, but the facilities were nice. Also the duck march is a must. My couple of complaints were that the one time I had a question for the concierge she had no clue what was going on. Also the diner within the hotel was great, but very expensive. So beware of that. Overall it was a great trip.

Reviews.Title: “besides the parking, it was great”
Reviews.Author: xxlita611xx
Reviews.Content: our first room was on the 12th floor but the noise was unbareble, it wounded like there was construction right above us, we called and they chagned our room , that room was perfect. we didnt hear any construction noises at all. the beds are very comfortable. there was a tv in the bathroom. nice. the first night, we could hear the people lext door, everything they were saying. they stopped talking though after 10 minutes. our rooms were connected by two doors, maybe thats why. that was the only minor bad thing. but the major bad thing was def. the parking. we did the self parking and had to pay 14. def do the valet! it will be worth it! the pool and jacuzzi were perfect considering it was windy, we didnt feel it at all. the gym was small but there isnt many people in there so its fine. staff is friendly. the resort fee is another about 15. so make sure to budget in the parking and resort fee. they give u 2 trolley free rides but we didnt use them, they dont take u directly to universal. overall it was great, it would of been excellent if it wasnt for the parking. and since i got this room through hotwaire, it was good for the value.

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother upgrading to a Club room”
Reviews.Author: PotterMoose
Reviews.Content: This hotel seems from its website to be competing at the top of the market: it is not really there. We had booked a Club room over the internet, but were told on checking in that we hadn't, and were charged a $50 upgrade. The following morning I had found our confirmation page and went back to reception - the same receptionist credited our $50 back, but seemed more interested in the fact that their system had gone wrong than in apologising. Anyway, the Club Lounge was not worth the upgrade. It consists of a smallish room, with the corridor effectively running through the middle of it; alcohol is available only for a couple of hours in the evening and is charged for and the food presentations were disappointing. When we went for a cookie at 8:45 (service advertised until 9pm) we were greeted by a plate of crumbs. When we went to get a hot drink before going to bed, all the cups were missing - we eventually procured two from the restaurant downstairs. Our room wasn't bad: on the 26th floor, it was quite large with superb corner views over Orlando. The WiFi connection was very fast. The public areas are very smart and well kept; the gym is big, but the equipment is quite old, and it is not well signposted (and the staff member I asked on the same floor didn't know where it was either!); the ducks are an interesting diversion, but very quick!

Reviews.Title: “WORST HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Angel060
Reviews.Content: We came to a convention like every year.. .Two yeasr ago we stayed in this hotel and everything was ok.., but this year we made the reservation through expedia one month ago and everything looked ok...but we arrived today for the convention and the front desk people told us that they didnt have any more rooms, because the hotel was oversold, so they just send us to the hilton near the convention center, which is brand new...very nice and with friendly people..and Peabody people just didnt care if we made our reservatiion ot ime and fully prepaid..They just said we have to leave ande they didn care at all if we liked the other hotel they sent us..We travel a lot all over the world and we have stayed in very good hotels and this had never happen before...we felt humiliated.....I can not believe this could happen...and they did that because we made the reservation through expedia and they were prefering the guests who booked directlly with them...First time in my life I see something like this...Thank god Hilton hotel is very nice, so we were lucky..Too bad for the other who will come later, because Hilton now is almost full...Who knows what is going to happen to them...so think twice before chossing this hotel..because they dont care about you.. Of couse they are going to pay ut for a regular room at hilton..but, I made the reservation with them, because I wanted to stay in there...I would rather prefer they sent me a message before, so I could choose whatever I want...not what they want... As I said before...thank god we got a room at hilton...so, your choice..but beware...

Reviews.Title: “You'll sleep great at the Peabody.”
Reviews.Author: MomofonesonVermont
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for seven nights, and although the hotel was under construction, you wouldn't know it at night! The place was so quiet, and the beds were so comfortable!! The in-room breakfast was fabulous. The staff really goes out of their way to make you feel comfortable and welcome. The drinks in the hotel were expensive, but generous. I'd rather pay top dollar, than get a weak drink, so it was okay with me. Bonus: The heated outdoor pool is huge, and is actually heated by something other than the sun!! One day was quite chilly, but we were able to swim just the same. I would not recommend this hotel for young children. Sure, the ducks are cool, but you won't feel comfortable allowing your child to run down the hall shouting like kids will do. I was traveling with an adolescent, and felt like I had to "shush" him alot. The staff is genuinely helpful and pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “A Classy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: davidbruce
Reviews.Content: The Peabody Hotel is certainly a classy hotel choice in Orlando. I stayed there for several days for business and don't have any major complaints. The hotel's staff and service were top-notch. My room was nice, clean and comfortable and very quiet, which is always important to me. There were a few early signs of wear and tear in the room, but I happen to know that they are updating all of the rooms and hallways as we speak. My only complaint about the room, which is a minor one, is that it there is no coffeemaker in the room. The hotel's restaurants are excellent, and there are lots of other great restaurant choices nearby. The Peabody is soon going to open a huge new tower, and I fear that some of its charm and first-class service will get diluted, but I hope that won't be the case. I used the valet parking, but I was told by some people who self-parked that it was a hassle. The current parking lot is quite a distance from the hotel (although I was told that this was due to the construction of the new tower and won't be a problem once the new tower is open). Overall, if you can get a decent rate at this hotel, I would have no problem recommending it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Peabody Orlando, Duck`s Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CintiaPasini
Reviews.Content: My husband, our son and I went to Disney and stayed at Peabody. The Hotel is quite large, the entry shows a lot of nature with waterfalls, the large and spread lobby transmits privacy and luxury. The ducks show is charming and unique! The room is very spacious and clean, the bathrooms have exclusive TV for those who is having shower :) Well located near the best shopping, restaurants and Disney! We loved and want to come back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Orlando Peabody”
Reviews.Author: PeterD26
Reviews.Content: Great people, restaurants and location. The B-Line Diner is a must!

Reviews.Title: “There are better, cheaper hotels in better locations”
Reviews.Author: lizzieliz2
Reviews.Content: There is nothing horrible about this hotel, it was clean and generally nice but its really too expensive for where it is and what you get. In addition to whatever price you paid there is a $15 daily resort fee plus $20 daily fee for valet parking. There is also a self pay lot for $12 a day but it is at least 200 yards from the hotel and there is not really a walkway...you have to walk through a poorly lit construction area which didn't seem safe at all. It seemed like most of the other hotels on international drive had free parking. There is no coffee in the lobby or in the room. The walls were pretty thin and I could clearly hear my neighbors speaking even at conversation levels. The pluses were free Wifi and nice staff. My friend stayed at the courtyard mariott down the street which was cheaper, nicer and had free parking. My flight got cancelled and instead of extending my stay at the peabody I moved to the radisson lake buena vista which was also nicer and cheaper. Again, the hotel is not bad but there are basically no perks and lots of added costs in a location with a lot of other options.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful staff but the rooms show their age”
Reviews.Author: Diane999UpstateNY
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights. I switched rooms after the first night when a king bed became available. Both rooms were in need of a make over. Old TVs, dated furniture, leaky bathroom faucet and carpet that was pulling up in some corners. I also listened to the elevators zoom up and down all night (in both rooms). All of the staff was very helpful. I had issues with the the internet and the tech support offered to come to my room to resolve it. Overall, it was a clean hotel, but for $250.00 per night, I think it was overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Fine Service, Great Location, Signs of Fray”
Reviews.Author: rbirds12
Reviews.Content: The Orlando Peabody is a luxury mainstay on International Drive. The facility is magnificent, the staff unfailingly polite and helpful. The public areas are inspiring. The rooms are large and clean but I could see signs of age: Table lamps with signs of wear; old TVs with remotes so used that the numbers had worn off. Otherwise the rooms are perfectly acceptable. Be sure to watch the duck walk in mornings and afternoons.

Reviews.Title: “Attractive and Responsive, but needs help!”
Reviews.Author: celebrationtiger
Reviews.Content: The first issue is that of parking. Self -parking is garage a block and a half away. Unfortunately at night you have to walk past a construction site on uneven pavement with only one street lamp the whole way. Signs directing you to go to a distant sidewalk are unreadable in the dark and the side walk itself is not visible because of vegetation. It is a situation ripe for an accident. They charge $12.00 for this and $20.00 for valet. I mentioned it to the night manager in charge of the hotel and they did comp my valet parking. They need lights and some security! The Restaurant in the hotel ,Capriccio Grill, serves the best lobster bisque I have had in long while. The bread is excellent. Unfortunately the prime rib was really only cold meat with an attempt to warm it up on the grill and put hot au jus over it. I left a message with the restaurant manager and was called the next day by the executive sous chef apologizing and saying it was a mistake that would not happen again. The prime rib was removed from the bill and wine and chocolates were sent to the room. So they are responsive, but if you don't have the time to help correct the problems, you may be frustrated. The amenities did not include a shower cap....surprising in a Preferred property. The location for the convention center is excellent and all the staff I interacted with were responsive and attentive. They have an unusual service charge waiver or acceptancce when you check in for water and the internet..It is not a pleasant approach nor is it customary at this level of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Just what one would expect.”
Reviews.Author: HonestJon
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week, on business. This is a famous hotel. It is also, probably, the most expensive on International Drive. It is all that I would expect from a 4 star hotel. Special mention to the "front door crew" who were great and genuinely helpful rather that just seeking a tip or commission. This is not true for some of the places I have stayed at in that area. There is free coffee available for an hour in the mornings. It is one of the worst coffess we have ever had!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the price we paid”
Reviews.Author: travr_2010
Reviews.Content: Stayed here between the 24th till the 29th of Dec. We booked via price line for $67 a day. We were greeted with a $15 resort fee and $12 parking fee (Self Park). The issue with the parking is that once you park your car you have to walk all the way to international drive and then back into the hotel which we thought was annoying. There is no walkway within the hotel to get to the parking garage The pool was great and the rooms were clean. On the negative side the TV was old and everything is falling off (maybe that’s why they are building the new building). The sound proofing of the room was bad and we could hear the elevator zooming up and down. There is no coffee pot in the rooms so you have to walk to the lobby to get you morning cup of coffee before 9:30 AM which was a big negative for us All in all for the price we paid it was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Ace Hardware Spring Show”
Reviews.Author: MrPeab
Reviews.Content: Excellent Hotel, Fine Rooms, Restaurants, Great Pool area, Also helped that my last name was Peabody. They jumped everytime I asked for anything

Reviews.Title: “Always a great hotel, but needs some renovation”
Reviews.Author: Vanecita
Reviews.Content: I always enjoy my stay at the Peabody, but I think it is time for some needed renovation, hopefully with the new addition they will be able to work on the "old" part as well. If you go with children make sure to stop by concierge and have them to be "honorary duckmasters". It is a great experience for the little ones!

Reviews.Title: “a very comfortable and wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: brit000
Reviews.Content: a very spacious and well maintained hotel with staff that were attentive and helpful.We stayed for three nights ,the ongoing renovation and building work did not affect our stay in any way.We had a room on the 14th floor with a balcony and wonderful views.We were provided with e-ride tickets. Its agreat location within walking distance of shops and restaurants.The christmas decorations were fabulous. I recommend this hotel,the ducks that spend the day in the fountain in the lobby are a real novelty

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: GRJ34
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Peabody hotel for the DEMA conferance. We booked a club room with a kigsize bed and what a great move that was. The hotel was great and the duck parade cute. The only problems we had were housekeeping:- The suite was superb despite the bathroom not having been serviced properly on arrival. Arrived back at 5pm on the second day and the room had not been serviced at all. Spoke to reception and the room was serviced within the hour. I think housekeeping did not know there was anyone staying in the room. Included in the club rooms is valet parking which was always very quick. Not sure the $15 daily resort fee for 2 bottles of water, morning coffee and wifi is good value. I would have liked tea or coffee facilities in the room - even Days Inn provides these. All in all a great hotel with just a few niggles

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel with Outstanding Service and Great Food!”
Reviews.Author: mariejolie
Reviews.Content: The Peabody Hotel was an okay hotel which is perfectly situated across the street from the convention center. What made the Peabody Hotel excel was the great service from wonderful employees and really delicious food made in the B-Line Diner. The rooms were basic, not luxury by any means, but the beds were superb, luxurious comforters and sheets so that made up for the somewhat standard room. Our meals at the B-Line diner were absolutely delicious, and the desserts were superb. The waitstaff did a great job and took care of their customers. Kudos to the management of the B-Line. We also ate at the Cappricio restaurant which was more upscale and the food and service both were wonderful. We heard a little noise from the construction next door but it was not terrible considering the scope of the project. The pool was large enough and well maintained. All in all, a really nice stay at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good locationfor business and some pleasure”
Reviews.Author: nextstay
Reviews.Content: Very happy with stay. Lasting impression is of staff that was helpful, professional, and seemed to actually enjoy the work they do. From waitstaff, frontdesk, bellman, to bartender...good job by everyone. The duck parade was cute...not sure if I would change my schedule to see it, but if you are on property at the time, check it out . There is construction going on next door as they look to be addinga large wing to the hotel. There was virtually no disruption or evidence of any work being done (except for the workout room - which wasn't a big deal) so I give them kudos for seamless service despite a significant addition. I would certainly return if I travel to the area again.

Reviews.Title: “Well....”
Reviews.Author: amyane
Reviews.Content: If we had known that the extension was going on, we would have NOT stayed here! During the first night, we was placed in a small room, which could not acomadate 5 of us. We were moved asap, to another room, which seemed ok. At 7am the next day, we was awoken by the drilling, which lasted till 1pm. It was also hosting a convention, so the hotel was full of noise. I would come back AFTER the work has been completed!

Reviews.Title: “Highly disappointed...Will come back when renovations are over!”
Reviews.Author: loverbunny
Reviews.Content: First I would like to say, if you want the best sleep in the whole world stay here at the Peabody Orlando. That being said, I was highly disappointed in the parking situation at the hotel. It definitely overshadowed the trip. As you may or may not know, the Peabody is undergoing a huge, massive expansion. Complete with a bigger better hotel and other things. I was completely surprised to find out that the parking lot was gone and replaced with an open area construction area. They now charge for parking which is $12+. You can park your car in the garage and WALK not be shuttled but WALK back to the main hotel. I could not believe it!! They are spending hundreds of millions of dollars on the expansion and didn't bother to add a shuttle to the budget. If you can take the walk and can find this hotel at a good price then I would say by all means stay here. It's nice, the beds are totally comfortable. There was no construction noise over the weekend. To overcome this I would say stay on the opposite side of the expansion hotel and definitely ask for a high floor.

Reviews.Title: “Never again.”
Reviews.Author: daria31
Reviews.Content: I booked that hotel thinking 4 and a half star rating-I got to go! What a mistake. On line it did not say they are building a bigger addition next to it ,the noise ! Forget about relax and you scream to each other. The rooms have old TV. Bathroom sink pluming totally messed up,also flushing the toilet is messed up. Pool very basic , fitness and locker rooms very outdated and very small. You do have to pay for parking and shuttel to parks plus u need to make a reservation 2 hours before. Shuttel to airport 18$ per person one way! same is the cost of taxi but faster and with no reservations.The only good thing about this hotel - great location. One more thing- no coffe maker in your room,you have to get your butt down stairs to get a free cup of coffee.But it is not there for too long.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: ChristinaBrazil
Reviews.Content: One of the best experiences. Wonderful staff, cozy and elegant bedrooms, huge king size bed. The duck march is very cute. We got an excellent rate through a hotel site and were extremely pleased at everything.The swimming pool is great and the jacuzzi right beside it is just paradise. I have already recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Peabody”
Reviews.Author: LilLinda
Reviews.Content: We were recently in Orlando for a convention/vacation, and we spent 8 nights at the Peabody. Upon our arrival, I was impressed with the beautiful foyer and friendly staff. We had a bit of a rocky start getting to a satisfactory room (the first one smelled strongly of paint), but when we called the front desk, they immediately sent someone up to help us move. Once we were settled, we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The room was quiet and clean, and the beds were comfortable. We had access to two flat screen TVs (one in the bedroom and another in the bathroom). The bathroom was a good size - large enough to fit two adults trying to get ready in the morning. We also appreciated the bathrobes, daily bottles of water, and nightly turn-down service. We stayed on one of the club level floors with access to the lounge where continental breakfast, hors d’oeuvres, cookies, and drinks were served throughout the day. Every time we had the opportunity to, we took advantage of and enjoyed the yummy continental breakfast. We also had access to the well-equipped fitness center which my husband enjoyed thoroughly. Also, during our stay...we had an excellent dinner at Capriccio and several good meals at the B-Line Diner. We took advantage of the complimentary I-Trolley passes and used them at least once a day to get around Orlando. And, we were able to catch the duck march a few times. Very cute! (So cute that I had to purchase a duck toy from the gift shop for our baby boy. It became his favorite toy on the airplane home!) Overall, we really enjoyed our time at the Peabody and recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Luxury Hotel - you'll forget your in the tourist capitol of USA”
Reviews.Author: LaurenV
Reviews.Content: What an elegant hotel - the staff is great, the rooms are so comfortable (I wanted to take the bed home with me). The food is amazing too. We did the wine course dinner on Friday night - full of locals which I love on vacation. Make sure you catch the march of the ducks!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BJL
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Peabody for two night in July 09 for a trade show at the Orange County Convention Center, which is conveniently located directly across the street. This was great because I could run back to the hotel for lunch since trade show food offerings are less than desirable, as well as dump things I'd picked up in the morning out of my bag to make more room for the afternoon. Also convenient was the beautiful, sunny, spacious lobby where I could meet up with friends & colleagues at day's end. I highly recommend the hummus as a snack while sipping. A fun bonus was getting to watch the famous Peabody ducks that are in the lobby fountain all day do their red carpet waddle as they returned via their own elevator to their penthouse pond suite. I dined in the restaurant Capriccio both nights of my stay. It was excellent and reasonable overall. I had breakfast in the B-Line Diner and found it to be good as well (I would, however skip the oatmeal). At the entrance to the B-Line diner there is a handy take-away counter where you can grab pre-made sandwiches, snacks & drinks. There is a good pool-side grille also. I hadn't stayed in this hotel for a few years and recalled the rooms being much nicer. Maybe it was my room (#767), maybe it was that I've stayed in some even nicer places since, but as nice as the rooms are, I felt mine was a little tired and likely in need of an update in the next year or so. The halls smelled a little old too. Here's what I liked about the room: The bed was comfy with a down comforter under the sheet for extra cushy feeling. I liked that they offer you the option to not have your linens changed every day and to reuse your towels if you wish in order to help save resources. NY Times outside the door each morning. Fairly well-stocked mini bar (just in case :-). Despite the fact that there was a dry cleaning box & chlid's ball under the TV cabinet when I checked in, the room was clean. Here's what I didn't care for so much: No magnifying mirror in the bathroom. You have to expect some noise from other rooms, but the plumbing from the other rooms was excessively loud. There was a TV on the bathroom counter taking up precious space. (I realize some may find this a plus; I'd rather have a magnifying mirror). I had received a good rate through the convention I was attending and was told that a variety of services would not be available to me with this rate unless I wanted to pay for them - I don't recall what all they were because I didn't really care about any of them, but I recall Internet Access, International Drive shuttle, gym access, morning lobby coffee being on the list with a few others. Nobody stopped me from getting a cup of coffee in the lobby :-) which was good since there is no coffee making equipment in the room. I was also charged $20+ tax per night to valet my car which I felt was a little excessive. I could have self-parked, but it was quite a hike, it was very hot, so I gave in and valeted. Service throughout the hotel staff was excellent. I discovered rather late in the evening on the first night that my TV remote did not work. It was late and I didn't want to deal with calling down to get it fixed, so I called the front desk and reported it the following morning. When I returned to the hotel later that day it was fixed and there was a message on my room phone telling me it had been done. I would stay here again if I had a convention to attend or a special event at the Peabody itself. Overall, it is a beautiful hotel at which to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good but, not great”
Reviews.Author: lakecity211
Reviews.Content: I am currently staying at the Peabody. It is a nice hotel with comfy rooms. The lobby is elegant with marble floors and granite countertops. There is live music going on in the lobby. The bar appeared busy along with some activity going on in the lobby. The hotel also has some restaurants in it. The room I am staying in is very clean it has some wear and tear. The carpet has stains and it is fraying against the wall. The room is in need of renovation because the wear and tear is not acceptable for what this hotel normally charges a night and defiantly not for its stature. The bathroom has a nice granite countertop with a t.v. The bathroom was clean but, I found several stray hairs. The tile around the bathtub is also starting to grow mold. The bed is very comfortable with lots of pillows. I received a rate of $87 on hotwire. Honestly the hotel is worth $87 but, not more. The hotel charges an extra $15 a night for a hotel service fee. All that is included in this fee is 800 calls, internet access, shoe shine, coffee in the lobby in the morning, two bottles of water, trolley tickets, and access to their fitness center. The average person will never use any of the above except for the bottled water. Their website states that the room was supposed to have a refrigerator and microwave in it which it does have a refrigerator however; it is only for its mini bar. Their website doesn’t mention this but, to have a refrigerator and microwave for you to use it is an extra $15 a night a piece. Then you have to either pay $20 for valet parking or $12 to pay in a parking garage. After taxes along with the parking and hotel fees it is almost $150 a night. If you need a refrigerator and microwave it will be almost $200 a night. Most hotels in Orlando offer all the above for free with lower rates and also have very nice rooms. Orlando has a very large selection of excellent hotels so there is no need to settle on this one considering what they charge. I am not saying this is not a nice place to stay but, I don’t highly recommend it either.

Reviews.Title: “They saved my vacation!”
Reviews.Author: bandman
Reviews.Content: We had booked into another hotel in St. Augustine. While the other hotel was a "nice place" on this trip they did not have their act together. We decided to move to the Peabody in Orlando and spend a couple days at this beautiful hotel. The rooms are great, the service wonderful, and they were very accomodating by placing a small fridge in the room to hold some medications. Don't miss the Duck Parade! If you have a small child ask if they can be an honorary duck master! There is construction onsite, but there was no noise that bothered us at anytime during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Peabody”
Reviews.Author: Smp81
Reviews.Content: This was my second trip to Orlando in which we stayed at the Peabody Hotel and it won't be our last. Perfect location on International drive with an 'I-ride' trolley stop straight outside the hotel, + included with our stay @ the Peabody we received free I-ride pass for each day of our stay so we were able to travel for free our entire trip. Also it's location is a short walk from Pointe Orlando which has a selection a nice shops & restaurants. Great location and a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Convention Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ppmac
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right across the road from the convention center & ideally located if you are attending a congress (which we were). The rooms were of average 5 star size with 2 double beds. Internet access was free. The breakfast was not included but it was reasonably priced at their diner. The restaurants were all pretty good especially the Italian. A very friendly hotel to stay at especially if attending a convention.

Reviews.Title: “Sweet!”
Reviews.Author: Simplycuban
Reviews.Content: The Peabody is an expensive hotel but while pricey, the service is outstanding!! Beds were great I felt like I could sleep for a week, pool is super, and the food is good as well,but again it is $$$$$.All staff extremely courteous, and helpful, remebering names,etc. I would stay again. The only small complaint I had was the pillows, they are so soft, they don't give any support,but other than that, they are A++++++

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, but horrible conference experience...”
Reviews.Author: NaptownChica
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and overall very nice. However, everything was VERY pricey. I was there for a conference and because the hotel was so unorganized, it took us 6 (SIX) hours to check into our hotel room. The line literally wrapped around the lobby. There were several other hotels in the area that had no problem checking in, so this was completely inexcusable. They did refund us one night's stay but the damage had been done. Also, the hotel boasts that it is across the street from the convention center, make sure you know what area of the convention center you wil be in. The main one can be kind of a long walk for those that may be a little older. Overall, the hotel was clean and we had no problems the rest of the time; however, the hotel left a very bad taste in my mouth - I will NEVER go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - didnt want to leave”
Reviews.Author: karensolihull
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights at the lovely Peabody this week. In my opinion its one of the best in Orlando and certainly the best on I drive. As the hotel is mainly used be people at conferences it had a lovely, quiet and calm atmosphere with lots of space around the pool in the day. Nothing to complain about except perhaps that the public rooms in the hotel and the restaurants were freezing = warm clothes required. Lots of people complaining about the $20 parking fee. We left our car in the car park at Pointe Orlando. Only a 10 min walk away and faster and cheaper than the valet. They charge $6 per night but if you leave in the morning before the shops open there's no charge - ideal if you're going to the parks. We also got a validation sticker from one of the restaurants in Pointe Orlando so ended up not paying anything at all. Overall a great place to stay - my daughter loved the ducks and watched all the duck parades - none of us wanted to leave. The only place to stay on I Drive and when the extension is completed it will be even better.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service - Pricey Extra Fees”
Reviews.Author: Mark-nole
Reviews.Content: My visit to the Peabody Orlando was for a weeklong conference. I wasn't disappointed. This is a 4-5 star property, with the facilities, services, (and prices) to match. Other posters have lamented the $20/night valet parking fee and extra "resort charge". With 150+ people in our group, we were able to negotiate these rates into our package. Other larger groups might want to look into this before booking. Outside of this, the rooms were spacious, clean and modern with some great views. (Ask for an upper-floor, west-facing room to view the Disney and Sea World fireworks displays.) Most striking is the attentiveness and sincere friendliness of all staff; front desk, bellmen, concierge and restaurants. All in all a great stay at a higher end hotel. I'd be willing to return as a tourist to take advantage of some of the facilities that our schedule kept us from enjoying.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Stay at the Peabody”
Reviews.Author: smithe2008
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed the service and comfortable surroundings during my stay at the Peabody last week. We (seven co-workers and I) were there for business and were pleased that our conference was directly across the street from the hotel. Upon arriving at the Peabody late one night, we were struck by the kindness of everyone we encountered from the valet person to the bell hop to the front desk workers. Everyone greeted us with a smile and each person was quick to offer their help. Each time I exited or entered the building, in fact, the valet people and bell hops were friendly and helpful. I was very impressed with them. I was also pleased with the services offered by the concierge. We needed their help on several occasions to get directions to attractions and advice on different modes of transportation. They were always friendly and helpful. The rooms at the Peabody are beautiful and well-appointed. The bed was the best hotel bed I can ever recall sleeping in. The room was spacious enough for the three of us ladies to get ready in the morning without crowding each other. Of course, we loved the LCD tv in the bathroom, too! We ate at the B-Line Diner twice for lunch during our stay. I highly recommend the chicken caeser salad and chicken noodle soup. Both were absolutely delicious! Everyone at my table enjoyed their food on both occasions. The service was not as good in the diner as it was in the rest of the hotel, though. But it didn't stop us from returning. My biggest complaint about my stay at the Peabody is the parking situation. I understand that they are undergoing major renovations, but that is not the fault of the traveler. I believe much better accommodations should be made for people who bring cars. Currently, you have two options. A) Allow valet to park your car and pay $20 per day or B) Park your car at an off-site parking garage and ride a shuttle bus back to the hotel for $12 per day. It seems very unreasonable to me to charge such a high amount when the hotel is inconveniencing its customers. I was not happy about this at all. However, the valet people and shuttle bus drivers were always very helpful and friendly and we never tipped. In fact, the first day I was there the bell hop told me that they do not work for tips...I'm not sure if he was being honest or just trying be nice, but I believed him! It took about 20 minutes for us to get the car back from the valet and about 15 minutes to get to the parking garage and back on the shuttle. We never had to wait for a shuttle. We did see construction going on, but never heard it. We were not disturbed by the construction other than having to deal with the frustrating parking situation. Overall, I would stay at the Peabody again. The service was great and the hotel itself was beautiful. I can only give it four stars, though, due to the very inconvenient parking situation.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected”
Reviews.Author: mimi1234
Reviews.Content: I found The Peabody to be okay. Not what I expected. The rooms were clean but kind of dated. The parking situation is terrible. Beware of the $20 a day valet fee. There is no self parking. There is also a resort fee of about $15. The kids enjoyed the pool and the staff were very nice. We had dinner at the B Line Diner. It was just okay. They do have a bakery that is amazing. I don't think we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fun hotel--I would return!”
Reviews.Author: Queenston
Reviews.Content: I was quite surprised to see some of the negative reviews when I returned from my trip to the Peabody--I am glad I did not read them before I left! This was our conference hotel, and although this is only the second time I have written a review for a hotel stayed at for business purposes (as they are usually dismal!), I had to write about the Peabody. I usually hate large hotels, but I loved this one. It was charming and classy. In fact, it made me think about movie stars who live in hotels--this would be a good candidate for a prolonged sojourn. I was able to see the duck parade on three occasions, and it was great fun. The staff were amazing--very rarely do you encounter such consistently high quality people and service. The food was exceptional at their bristo style restaurant, as was the service. It was also fun watching the chefs--I ate there three times. The diner breakfasts were delicious--they actually know how to poach an egg which is a good indicator of the quality of the chefs. The room was nice, lots of space and well organized. The bed was extremely comfortable. I liked the fact you could put a card on the bed to save them changing the linens daily. The recreation level with the pool was fun, and I had lunch out there one day. The bar around the fountain allowed for interesting people watching and meeting colleagues in a pleasant environment. So, all in all, I can't find anything negative to say about this place, and given how much I travel, that is in itself quite amazing. Regarding the additional charge, I declined it because I didn't have a car or a computer with me (I used the business center instead). I used the two bottles of water daily and was not charged. I did not think the hotel rates were bad (although the local taxes are) compared to Europe for example where you would get much less for much more. So I guess it all depends on your perspective. I went over to Winter Park one day to the Morse Museum which was a real treat and walked around that neighbourhood. This is certainly a much more interesting outing than theme parks if you are not travelling with children. The Morse is a really amazing small museum with the best collection of Tiffany lamps and windows in the world, and is certainly a gem of Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “The Peabody Was Nice”
Reviews.Author: 15Chitwood
Reviews.Content: I was in Orlando on business for eight nights and the Peabody was a very nice home away from home. My room was nice, though not any more so than other hotels. The entire staff though was very helpful and really made my stay enjoyable. The parking isn't ideal, but I never waited more than 10 minutes for my car to be pulled around (and then, I just called early so it was almost always ready by the time I got out front). The location is ideal. I would definitely stay at the Peabody again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel *****”
Reviews.Author: devits
Reviews.Content: this hotel his magnificent , very clean and large rooms , friendly and helpful staff , nice restaurants (3) and bars , pool ,... enz ,no car , no problem you can order transportation and ticket for a lot of attractions in the loby of your hotel, if your next visit his ORLANDO , your hotel must by THE PEABODY HOTEL ORLANDO

Reviews.Title: “Not the posh Peabody as expected”
Reviews.Author: pebblelake
Reviews.Content: The Peabody markets itself for business and as a high-end hotel but my experience was more neutral and all the business features I expect would be included in the basic tarif were extra or not available. The room is a standard issue hotel room with no upgrades a 5-star would merit. The furniture, tv and armoire are average late 90s and the bathtub needs an overhaul - and that small tv in the bathroom BEHIND the toilet?? For business travel, I expected at least a small fridge and en-suite coffee maker, but neither was available. I asked that the mini-bar be emptied and they would not do that so an additional fee for a small fridge had to be paid (families should keep that in mind if you need to keep food or beverages chilled for children). I asked that a small coffee maker be brought to my room and they would not do that for 'hygienic' purposes. The DAILY additional fee of $15.00 covered my .50 newspaper, $2.00 worth of water, i-train passes (which cost $1.25 per ride) and very weak coffee that I had to trek to the lobby to get for myself. The gym is off-limits unless you pay AN ADDITIONAL $10.00 DAILY and the fridge will be delivered to your room for another DAILY charge of $10 or $15. So add about $50.00 per night to the already high per night fee to get the basics that are already offered in other hotels as part of the per night cost. The hotel staff I dealt with was nice enough and professional, and the lobby and pool areas were certainly clean enough. The location is convenient to the strip given it is not smack in the middle but only a walk away and still quiet enough. And a short drive or bus-ride away from the major attractions. So it is obvious that my main gripe are the additional fees that are not necessary when the basic room tarif is high to begin with at an establishment that is not yet upgraded but cites itself an almost 5-star. There would be no reason for me to stay here again given there are other much more reasonably priced places in the same area that offer more to their clientele.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite what I was expecting”
Reviews.Author: hkleinberg
Reviews.Content: When we booked two nights at the Peabody we were expecting a romantic stay at a top quality hotel. Perhaps my expectations were too high... First, the primary complaint - the daily fee. The fee is supposed to cover internet access (Hello! This is the 21st century and even low budget hotels now offer free Wi-Fi!) and valet parking which is an unfortunate neccesity. At first it may seem posh to have to use valet services, but it quickly grows old as you have to plan your every move in advance because you really need to call for your car before you wait 10 minutes to receive it. Construction was being done on the hotel so self-parking is not really an option unless you want a LONG walk, and also note that their 24 hour diner is closed for renovations too. This hotel really seems geared more toward a business traveler who just has the company pick up the tab for all the little extra expenses, but as a vacationer, it would not be my first pick again. Don't even get me started on the Business Center and how much they wanted to charge for printing. Total rip off. To boot, we thought we were getting a really nice room for what we spent, but ther only thing that distinguished the place at all from a clean room at the La Quinta was that they had a TV behind the toilet. It would be a nice amenity if the tub was big and nice enough for a bath, but unless you are a man, it's hard to really see it - if you get what I mean. We also ordered a Pizza from room service late at night. It had just passed the time for the regular kitchen to make it, so we ended up with their different late night Pizza options. To be honest, I've had better pizzas from the freezer section at the grocer, and for the price and time it took for it all, I wouldn't do it again - not that I'll return to the hotel. To be fair, the room itself was very clean and had some cute duck details like the doorstop and duck shaped guest soap. The bed was large and comfy. You could tell it was a higher quality accomodation, it's just that my expectations were for much more considering the price. The staff - especially the valets - were always more than friendly, and it was fun to watch the ducks swim in the fountain in the lobby. As long as you are expecting to pay through the nose for the convenience of a clean hotel on I-Drive in Orlando, you'll enjoy it fine, but for me, well my money could have been put to better use.

Reviews.Title: “good conference hotel”
Reviews.Author: woodzey
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Peabody Orlando for a conference this past October. Overall it was a good experience. I used the fitness center, the spa, room service and the pool area. First of all, the hotel is under major construction, so it is noisier and not as nice as I imagine it will be. I actually ended up changing my room *twice*, first because of the noise and second because the lock on the door to my second room broke. The staff was very accomodating even though a large conference was going on and I ended up in a really nice room. Room service was prompt and curteous. There are no coffee pots in the rooms so if you are a coffee addict like me you need to order room service or go down the the lobby and purchase coffee - for me, this is quite a negative. The lobby and other public spaces (including the pool) are very nicely appointed and spacious and are quite popular. There's the daily duck march (referenced by other reviewers) which I though was a little weird bu other guests liked it. The fitness center is musty and small - needs an overhaul. The spa was fantastic - it is a small space but I had one the best massages I've ever had as well as a great pedicure. Both the massage therapist and nail person were *really* nice and very competent.

Reviews.Title: “NIce Property”
Reviews.Author: Krissy1983
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, with clean rooms, calming decor and good service. The pool is great, the lobby is a nice area to have a drink and people watch. I enjoyed my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of the Valet parking!”
Reviews.Author: kirby11
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel, generally. But they are currently adding on, apparently losing their parking lot, and insist everyone valet park. Everyone must valet! So the front entry is chaotic, and in busy times you cannot call ahead to requst your car. We had to come to the front door, ask for our car, and wait another 25 minutes for it to show up. Be prepared for a stressful, long wait. The only other down side to this hotel, why don't they have coffee pots in the rooms?

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ShropshireLisaChris
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from an amazing week in the Peabody. We booked last minute, and had read some good and some bad reviews, so were a little apprehensive. When we arrived, the staff could not have been nicer or more helpful. We stayed on the fifteenth floor, and although the room was a little dated, it was spottlessly clean. There was a lot of construction work next door, but as it was still at ground level, was of very little intrustion, hearing only the occasional noise in the morning, but as we were up and out of the room about 9am most mornings (as there was so much to do in Orlando) it never bothered us. We didn't have any bad experiences, the pool was lovely and warm, the bar staff were particularly friendly, and they even offered us a late check out at no extra cost. To top it off, the Peabody ducks were an unusual attraction, definately worth viewing their arrival and departure during your stay. One thing that guests should note is the tax of $10.65 a day that is payable to the hotel upon departure, for which you get free I Trolley passes, a couple of bottles of water in your room a day and a few other things. Top tip - use the I trolley to get up and down international drive, it takes you to Sea WOrld and Aquatica one way, and to a couple of shopping outlets the other. Overall we would highly recommend this hotel and we will be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Great even with a 2 year old!”
Reviews.Author: DC-Duffer
Reviews.Content: I had always thought of the Peabody in Orlando as a business hotel, but was pleasantly surprised when I stayed there with my family. We stayed on the club level, which is tremendously convenient with kids - there are often snacks available when the kids just need a little bite to keep from getting cranky. Of course the cocktails are also lovely, but they do charge for the grown-up drinks in the club-area lounge. It is convenient to the parks, so if you are thinking of visiting more than one (ie. Disney one day and Universal the other), this may be just as convenient as staying at one of the attractions. I have to admit, we stayed here because we went sort of last minute and the nicer resorts at the attractions were booked. However, I may very well stay at Peabody next time even if there if availability at the attractions since the caliber of service seems quite high and the rooms are comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible experience!”
Reviews.Author: gallv
Reviews.Content: The hotel appeared to be very nice. The rooms were great with a beautiful view. We had 2 adjoining rooms. Our toddler grandson was with us and we noticed bites on him when we changed his diaper. We didn't give it much thought untill the next day when we found more bites on him and then his Dad complained of having bites. We then inspected the mattress, though it was clean we found bed bug feces, then to our horror a live bed bug! We were horrified. Here our little grandchild slept with his parents and had to get bit by these things. I realize they are not from dirt, but measures should be taken by the hotel to enclose all their mattress in plastic.....as that is the only way to get rid of them and prevent guests from being bitten.

Reviews.Title: “Its not a 5*, but it is an excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: dwcoolit
Reviews.Content: We booked at the last minute through Hotels.com and paid $150 for a superior room on the 24th floor with a view to die for. At 10 pm we had Disney, Universal and Sea worlds fireworks all going off at the same time it was stunning !! The front desk could not have been more helpful, i had asked for all feather pillows to be removed and a high floor, both were sorted with no fuss. The rooms are probably in need of a upgrade, but that can be overlooked considering the rate. We dined at capriccio and that was faultless, the pastry's at the b-line diner were unbelievable, try the chocolate malt !!!! The pool was almost Olympic sized with 3 tennis courts round the back. The only thing i couldn't get my head around was the biz are ritual of marching a few ducks through the hotel in the morning and the again in the evening. People seemed to love it with videos and cameras going mad. We just watched in amazement at the site of around 50 grown men and women getting so exited about a few ducks getting herded into a lift then some poor guy had to go in after with a mop and bucket. Maybe I'm just missing something ?? We got everything we asked for, late check out etc and even the much maligned vallet service was pretty good, they did try and tell me it was a 30 minute wait to get the car when we were checking out, you just have to shout loud enough and as if by magic our car was waiting for us when we got down. This is not a 5* but comes very close, it is an excellent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: rangeley
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night in December and two nights in March. The hotel is pretty big and not resrt-like at all - good business location. Close to "The Pointe" which has upscale shops and restuarants. The rooms are nice but bathrooms need updating. The shower curtain is too close to you when you shower and the gold fixtures need to be replaced. Their restaurnat, Cappricio, was great - pricey, but the food was delish. The duck march is kind of silly but people seemed to enjoy. The looby is open and airy. The staff was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Really need to work on some things”
Reviews.Author: CrzyRdDvl
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Peabody for a very large Sorority National Convention and although the hotel is nice they had a lot to be desired. First of all there is construction going on at the hotel. The majority of us arrived on Thursday and unfortunately the hotel either wasn't prepared or equipped to handle such a large crowd converging at one time. Many of us stood in the registration line for 3 hours or more waiting to check-in and get keys for our rooms. Upon our departure the hotel did acknowledge that something happened, but they weren't sure what it was and was working to determine what the problem was and to fix it. They did give all of us our final night stay free of charge, so I guess some concessions were made. I also self-parked and asked how often the shuttle service ran.
