I was told it was a constant circulation. However, I attempted to catch the shuttle at 4:15 on Monday morning so that I could to take someone to the airport. The shuttle didn't come back to the hotel until 4:43...again, no one can explain that one either. For the price of our "group" discounted rooms I really expected to at least have coffee, a refrigerator and microwave in the room. None of those exist and an additional "hotel service fee" is charged to you on each day to partake in continental breakfast and coffee in the lobby. A refrigerator can be "rented" for an additional daily charge. The hotel staff was pleasant and the rooms were very clean and well kept. It is on the trolley route and you can get to a lot of locations up and down International Drive without having to drive. There are several bars and restaurants in the hotel lobby as well. The stay here was okay, but unfortunately the bad overshadow the good.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: DiCanio80
Reviews.Content: We stayed there over July 4th. The room was bright and spotless and the 3 year old liked the duck-shaped soap in the bathroom. All staff were very friendly. Check-in and out was quick. Re. parking, we elected to self-park. This means going to a car park about a mile away. You can enter and exit as often as you like and it costs $6 per night you stay at the hotel. It presented no problems since there was always a shuttle bus waiting to take you to and from the car park. One minor item is the lack of a coffee maker. You can of course use room service or a bar but this adds to the cost - which is likely the intention. Overall, it was a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved everything about the Peabody”
Reviews.Author: Our_Cats_Mom
Reviews.Content: We could not have been happier with our choice to stay at the Peabody. It is right across the street from the Convention Center, which was the purpose of our trip. Before we left we had read the unhappy comments from people who had used the valet service. We did not have or need a car for this trip. But we also noticed that the parking arrangement had changed to a shuttle service to Pointe Orlando. For anyone (like us) who did not have a car, having a shuttle to all the restaurants and movie theater at Pointe Orlando was a real plus. There were so many reasons why we loved our stay at the Peabody. Everyone was so nice to us! The room was beautiful. The beds were extremely comfortable. Our window overlooked the fireworks at both Epcot and Sea World every night. And the display case of baked goods! They have the biggest and softest Snickerdoodles we have every had! The ducks were so cute we looked forward to each time we could see them. The staff repeatedly went to extreme lengths to see to our comfort. We each had a white terry cloth Peabody robe to wear while there. And each day we got little white duck soaps in the bathroom. And it was quiet, so we could sleep! The concierge, the duckmaster, the check-in staff, the guys out front, the maids, the room service fellow: all made us feel appreciated and welcome. We honestly look forward to going back to the Peabody.

Reviews.Title: “Cute!”
Reviews.Author: Lin-z-b
Reviews.Content: Very nice place, close enough to restaurants, convention center and sea world. The duck march into the pond is absolutely priceless!!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A330Ryan
Reviews.Content: Where do I start? I travel a lot to Orlando with work/leisure and usually stay over the road at the Rosen Centre which I adore. Anyway tried Priceline and got the hotel for £40($85)per night If I can repeat this deal I will never go back. To start witharrival was faultless, outside with the mini waterfalls to the ice cold a/c and the impecable check in staff, who greeted me by name, took time to talk to me whilst checking me in so felt like they were not just treating me as a number/"duty" The rooms were great, bigger than the Rosen Centre and better appointed, the bathrooms were bigger and with their own TV. There is also a seperate dressing area near the wardrobe with plugs and mirrors. The windows also open which unlike some other hotels in the area, Which I like- sometimes you just want fresh air rather than stale uniform a/c air!- may just be a "British" thing though! A nice little touch when you lose your room card they ask for photo ID- I stay at 4-5star hotels around the world and I have never been asked this- definately adds security value to your stay. As for previous comments re:piano noise, I was only on floor 7 and didn't hear a peep. Yes there is a $10service charge but for this you get wi-fi,bottles of water,gym access and free rides on the I-trolley- now I know some hotels in Orlando you may get one/some or even all of these facilities thrown in free, you definately get what you pay for and the hotels that do give these things away free are not to the quality of The Peabody. After paying $24 for one days internet access the previous week in the Westin Cancun, $10 seems reasonable. They seem to have got their act together with the parking issue, and offer Valet or off site parking at the Pointe- $6.00 per day with constant shuttle- as one departs one arrives. Yes again I know other hotels offer it free but not hotels of this standard. If you want something for free or cheaper... then go to the holiday inn further down I'drive. I may have got a bargin, but I would genuinely pay their published rates the service is spot on.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, in the midst of a disaster”
Reviews.Author: redsoxfan11
Reviews.Content: My motto is comfort and luxury for less. I was able to book the Peabody Orlando, FL on priceline.com using the name your own price feature. A great way to save money! The hotel is in prisine condition; newly renovated lobby, rooms and pool area. The duck walk, which the Peabody Hotel is known for, occurs in the lobby twice a day and is quite entertaining! The lobby is a nice place to relax in the evening. They have a piano player and plenty of seating. The pool area comes is clean and has plenty of lounge chairs, clean towels are located by the pool. They have poolside cabanas for a charge, but I didn't see a single person using them. Now for the disaster? The parking lot at the hotel was under construction and all cars parked overnight were parked valet at a nearby field at no extra charge. Overnight it rained extremely hard and the field with the parked cars were flooded, with cars completely stuck in the mud. The staff on hand was extremely appologetic as it took between 45-90 minutes to get your car from the valet. In near riot conditions, the staff did a great job controling the near riot crowd of people waiting for their cars. I would definitely stay here again, as long as the priceline.com rate stays the same!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, parking is a pain”
Reviews.Author: jlsheff
Reviews.Content: Just completed stay at this property. Facility is very nice. Rooms are nice sized as are the bathrooms. Closets are very small, but there is an in-room safe. The staff at the hotel is generally friendly and seem to be concerned their guests have an enjoyable stay. Everyone is charged a $10/day resort fee. This covers 2 bottles of water per day in the room, towels at the pool, and Wi-Fi. The charge is not that bad, but the Wi-Fi did not work the last couple days and calls to tech support were politely handled, but the sense of urgency in resolving the connection issue encountered was less than adequate. While not expecting 1 hour turnaround, it is not unreasonable to hear something in 3 - 5 hours. Waited almost 15 hours to hear the matter was "resolved". When login was attempted, the problem with access still existed. The restaurants are OK in the hotel, but are expensive. The gift shop is small and stocked at a fair level. Best bet is to go north on International Blvd and pick up what you need plus there is a nice assortment of restaurants for all budgets. Note: the hotel is under construction. The building stayed in is not affected - yet, but the immediate surrounding areas were being prepped with sewer and water lines during our stay and could be heard throughout the day. They are in the process of constructing a massive new tower scheduled for completion in the Fall of 2010. A model of the expansion is on the Recreation Level outside the Tennis Pro Shop. With the construction, their parking is gone. If you drive there or rent a car like we did, one will need to drop off their passengers and then drive about 3 blocks away to the deck in the Pointe Orlando Mall and then get shuttled back via bus. If one wishes to go to one of the many attractions in Orlando, the driver will need to reverse the process. You get the privilege of paying $6/dayfor this incovenience. You do receive a card that allows you unlimited in and out of the garage during your stay. The signage is decent to get you to where you need to go to pick up a shuttle bus. If there is any consolation, this "fun" is spread to all The Peabody Orlando employees as well as their guests that choose to self park. Needless to say, this process gets old fast. Valet parking is available, if you wish to pay for it and there are plenty of taxis as well. Fun note: the ducks attract sizeable crowds at 11 a.m. and 5 p.m. It's pretty interesting to watch the 4 ducks (1 drake and 4 hens) make their way from the fountain in the lobby bar to their "palace" on the Recreation Level. If you have young ones (5 - 10 years), you can have them act as an "honorary duckmaster" for one of the ceremonies. My son (9 yrs old) got to do it and pretty much "ran the show" (the ducks are so conditioned to the routine there is very little for the honorary duckmaster to do). You sign up at the Concierge Desk and there is no charge to you. The honorary duckmaster receives a nice certificate and a small gift from the hotel for helping continue a long tradition at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Be Prepared for Nickel and Diming”
Reviews.Author: dulcineahong
Reviews.Content: I just came back from an extended weekend stay and wanted everyone to be aware of the pros and cons of staying here. Needless to say, the valet parking is big problem but there are others. I've tried to summarize the likes and dislikes below. Pros: 1. The hotel is very nice and rooms are clean and comfortable. We especially love the mountains of pillows! 2. If you're staying at rooms facing towards Disney, you'll get a nice view of the Disney fireworks at night. 3. There are two nice restaurants within the hotel - the B-line diner and the posh Dux restaurant. More on this later. 4. Proximity to I-drive a great Chinese restaurant called Ming's Court. I've dine at alot of great Chinese restaurants in NYC's Chinatown and Hong Kong and this one ranks near the top. Cons: 1. Nickel and diming! We were charged a $10 per night resort (service fee) for wireless and pool access, 2 bottles of water and I-trolley vouchers. To add insult to injury, we were also taxed on the $10 per day fee! 2. No shuttle service to the theme parks so we spent alot of money on Mears shuttle service. Expect to pay $10 RT per person to Disney parks and $14 RT per person to Universal Orlando/IOA. 3. Construction next door. The Peabody is expanding so there will be alot of construction going on until 2010. Be warned! 4. Restaurants in hotel are expensive! At the less expensive B-diner, it's $3.50 for one plain bagel with butter or cream cheese and $3.75 for cup of yoghurt you can get at Shoprite for 50 cents! Outrageous! We ended up walking the 5 minutes to have breakfast at Denny's. All in all, our stay is pleasant but we wish we had booked at the Crowne Plaza or some other hotel with free shuttle service instead.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Terrible Valet”
Reviews.Author: Ibuko86
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great, we even got the King bed we requested, front desk staff was courteous and polite, Karina, i think that is the correct spelling was very accomodating giving us an early checkin. The only downfall was the valet service. Upon registering at the hotel, they never gave us a ticket for self parking, so we had to pay at Pointe Orlando's garage or take the shuttle to the hotel to get a ticket, then ride the shuttle back to the garage to pick up the car. Luckily, the garage attendant just let us through after explaining the situation. Initially, he did not think we were guests at the Peabody. Once the parking situation is straightened out, it will hopefully be much better. The shuttle however was convenient, we never waited longer than a few minutes for a shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay at the Peabody”
Reviews.Author: lillotis
Reviews.Content: I was attending a convention in the North Hall of the Orange county Convention Center and the Peabody was one of the official hotels. I picked this hotel because it had a high star rating plus it was supposed to be walking distance to the convention center. While I loved my stay at the Peabody, it ended up being a good 20 minute walk in the humidity to the North CC, but oh well- not the hotels fault. My stay was great. I checked in at 10 am with no problem, except that they had me reserved fpr 2 queens and I thought I had booked a kind through the show travel arrangements. The only available king was the murphy bed- and while I was hesitant, i decided to go for it anyway- and it was great. A little low to the floor- but super comfy! The beds are great. The room was a decent size and had nice waffle bathrobes, and more importantly the a.c. worked really well. My only real complaint about the room was the hairdryer was one of those small travel sized ones attached the wall- and at a 4 plus star hotel, I expect a full sized one. As for parking- I did taxis all the way and did not drive- which worked out well for me. My coworkers were staying at a house and came over for dinner a few times, 1st time valet took about 10 minutes (pretty standard) and second time they faced some issues- and in return asked that my room service breakfast would be comped the next day- which wprked for me. Easily accessible wireless was a real bonus. I went to the pool for a brief 2 hours before I had to be anywhere on day 1, and it was a zoo- a lot of young teenage kids running around, pushing each other in the pool and yelling. On my last day, I had another 2 spare hours and discovered the "kids pool" Now this was a real treat. It was like a full sized swimming pool with a waterfall- and 1 foot deep tjhroughout- gated off- and I was the only one there! It was so hot out and I was able to actually sit in the pool and read my magazines in peace which was glorius.

Reviews.Title: “Fire the Valet Company!”
Reviews.Author: MaryOConnor
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel, but definitely should be boycotted based on the shoddy valet service. Here's the nightmare: valet company "lost" our car. They had no idea where they had parked it. We waited over an hour for our car -- and then they gave us cab fare to meet the rest of our party. The car was eventually found, but the valet company's remedy was to refund us the one-day parking fee. (No remedy was offered to others in our party who were also staying at the hotel and who were waiting to get into our car.) The hotel management is strangely indifferent to any concerns/problems with the valet service. And of course, the valet company never returned any calls made to the valet stand or to their regional headquarters in Florida. Save yourself the headache and stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, but beware of FEE$$$”
Reviews.Author: cchri1p
Reviews.Content: For the price I paid ($70 thru Priceline) I can't complain about the room- it was beautiful and has a great view of the pool. And the staff (even the valet parking staff) were very courteous and professional. But the fees are simply unacceptable. First of all, the hotel used to have free self-parking. But since the hotel is being expanded, they have switched to all valet parking for $18. Let me get this straight... they are expanded, and I have to pay for the privilege???? How about FREE valet parking as a way to apologize for the inconvenience???? And the hotel charges an "activity fee" of $10 for use of the internet, pool, and 2 bottles of water. So if you don't use the pool or internet, it's $5 per bottle of water! Of course, neither this fee or the valet parking fee are disclosed on the website. So for a 2 day stay, the fees came to $59 (yes, there is sales tax on the fees!!!!). Better choices include the Sheraton Altamonte Springs (has pool, free internet, and free parking, and is one of the nicest Sheraton's that I have stayed at), Hyatt MCO (beautiful hotel, $12 parking, but free wireless internet via the airport), and the Grand Bohemian (you can park on the street to avoid valet). Maybe it's the ducks that have inspired the Peabody to act like an airline, with fees for everything!!!!

Reviews.Title: “You've read the bad reviews about the parking...it's worse!”
Reviews.Author: rockyhilltop
Reviews.Content: I read the bad reviews about the parking situation at the Peabody Orlando but I stupidly went ahead and booked a special rate anyway for a 4-day stay over Memorial Day weekend. I won't go into all of the details (unless you want to e-mail me), but the hotel managenet is certainly aware of the series of horrible events that occurred on the Saturday night of Memorial Day weekend. I asked for, and received, a full refund of all parking charges for the duration of my stay. One has to wonder if the Belz family (who owns the Peabody) cares about all of the complaints about parking? The fact that these issues have continued for months without being addressed is a matter of true concern. If you are invited to a dinner party at the Belz family home, I would not give your mink coat to the butler upon arrival. Because upon departure, you will undoubtedly be left out in the cold on the front portico while they try to find your wrap! If you must stay at the Peabody for a convention, I would advise a cab or shuttle from the airport. The parking situation and the constantly stalled traffic on International Drive should be avoided at all costs. For a vacation experience, a true 4-5 star experience would more likely be had by booking the Ritz or the Grand Bohemian.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Hotel, Terrible Service”
Reviews.Author: neverplainjane
Reviews.Content: This hotel was one nightmare after another. Let me explain. After a nice day at Epcot, my husband and I checked into the Peabody around 8PM. Pulling up to the hotel, I felt like I was at a busy airport, dropping someone off. It was loud and noisy and chaotic. A man approached our car and told us to give him the key...that it was mandatory valet. Great, I always valet anyways, so we handed the key and waited for him to give us our valet ticket. He didn't. Instead, he ran off with our key and yelled to us about finding him after we check in. Very strange and unprofessional. My husband and I were worried someone would steal the car, so he stayed by it until I checked us in. When we went up to the valet stand, they told us they didn’t have our key and blew us off. It was awful. I was in tears over the messy situation. About an hour later, someone finally was able to locate our key and parked our car...for $18 dollars. That really should have been waived for our ordeal. We went inside, un-packed and changed clothes to go out to a nice dinner. We had reservations at Vito’s, my husband’s favorite. We asked the concierge to call us a cab, he was very rude and told us that there were too many cars out front (it was a valet disaster) and we could either walk to dinner or walk down the street to hail a cab ourselves. He also said that it was getting late and the only place probably open was Denny’s or Friday’s. Uh, it’s like 10:00 on a Saturday night in Orlando….everything is open. A 4 star hotel concierge should know better. Needlessto say, we missed our dinner reservation because of the transportation nightmare. In the morning, it took almost 2 ½ hours to get our car out of the valet. Unorganized and unprofessional. Checking out, they charged us another $17.98 for some movie we didn't watch. I think we turned the weather channel on and that was it. The hotel is very pretty and clean but not worth the bad service.

Reviews.Title: “How is this Valet service acceptable???”
Reviews.Author: JamaicaBRIDE08
Reviews.Content: First of all, I want to start off by saying that this is a very beautiful hotel... My husband and I booked for priceline and got a good deal for a 4* hotel in the Orlando area. When we arrived, we were confused by the mayhem of the valet parking, as I had read ahead of time that self-parking was an option. Apparently there was construction going on, so 100% of the cars had to be valet'd for 18/day plus tax. This wasn't the end of the world, but we hate to waste money on something as simple as walking to your car. We arrived at 3:15 (checkin is at 3) and were told that there would be a slight delay and they would call our cell phone when the room was ready. No problem, we'll check the property out. The hotel was kind of a zoo because there was a big modeling "workshop/casting" going on and kids were all over the place. It wasn't what we had in mind, but at the end of the day, it was great people watching. We waited in the lobby area and had a few drinks, watched the ducks march, etc. Around 6pm (3 hours after check-in time), we got the call that our room was ready. Room was nice and pretty much like the pictures posted on this site. THEN, we went down about 6:25 to get our car from valet. We had previously made reservations at 7pm at a place that was literally 5minutes drive away. After waiting 1/2 hour and no sign of our car, I rescheduled our reservations for 7:30. We didn't make it until 7:45! It took about an hour to get our car, which was apparently good compared to the 2-3 hour waits described in another review. Next day, we reserved a cabana at the pool for $75/day. Good deal for shade/chairs/towels/beverages, but the wireless wasn't working and our tv didn't go to ESPN which was a disappointment for my husband. All in all, that was a great deal for a cabana. By the way, we left our sunglasses in the car the day before, so decided to buy new ones at the gift shop rather than deal with the chaos of valet...we kind of felt trapped! All in all, it was a good stay. If we had paid full price, we would have been much more irritated with valet. At the end of the day, we probably wouldn't stay there again due to parking situation, which is a shame because it's a very nice hotel in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Valet parking nightmare!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: trip46
Reviews.Content: We stayed from May 23- 25, and while it is a beautiful property, the parking situation is out of control. First, it cost 19 bucks a day to park, then it takes FOREVER to get your car. We went downstairs Sunday morning at 9:30, and asked how long it would be. We were advised to give it 1 hour. My husband went at 10 :30, and was told now it would be 1 1/2 hours, We had to get to the airport, and at 11:30 my husband was able to get someone to get our car, but we were jumped in the line, to tell the truth. People were angry and I don't blame them!!! Not a way to spend precious vacation time. We also did not get cleaning service Saturday , but they took the 10.00 service fee off our bill, For an expensive resort that likes to nickel/dime you. they really need a better plan to take care of their customers.

Reviews.Title: “Parking Disaster - Dont Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: miamiskyboy
Reviews.Content: I am an elite member of almost every frequent stay program and travel about 200 nights per year. I can honestly say this is one of the WORST hotel stays I have ever had, The once fantastic Peabody Orlando has gone to hell. Its a shame really - because in its day it used to be one of the best. 2008 is a different story for the Peabody. The 20 something year old hotel is showing its age. The rooms are dated, my faucet leaked, the carpet was frayed and torn, the wallpaper in the bathroom was stained , the grout in the tub is dark and moldy. The place needs some major remodeling and attention to bring it back to the standards they claim. Upon check in I was checked in to room 2147. Within 1 minute of entering the room. I went to use the bathroom. When I raised the lid. There was dried urine and fecal matter all over the seat. Looked like it had been there for over a day. It was disgusting. When I called downstairs to complain. The front desk manager was very arrogant about it and did not handle the situation with any class. She was so bold as to suggest that maybe I had done it. I was appalled !!! They finally changed me over to 2145 (next door and same housekeeper). They made me wait over 20 min for the new keys. It was not a pleasant experience. I went to use there spa facility. It is dated, tired, rundown, dirty, and also in need of attention. The shared Jacuzzi looks like it was installed in 1980 and has been painted so many times there are 2 inches in layers of paint. The tiles are cracked, moldy. stained, and in now way does this resemble the spa facility of a 4 star hotel. Furthermore about 30 min before closing. The employee on duty went inside the shower area, undressed, and showered in the guest area. This looks terrible and should not be allowed. I had lunch at the dinner. While the food I have to say was excellent. The facility is crying for help. It looks like a retro space age dinner that got stuck in 1983 in a time capsule and was never let out. The place is greasy. dirty. outdated, the blinds next to the window where my booth was where dusty and greasy. It needs to be torn down and redone. Even the menu I was handed was old, battered, and greasy to the touch ! But the worst part of the stay. Is the Valet service. The hotel is building a new tower right next door. (This is probably why they are investing "0" dollars into making the current tower nice for guests) The parking garage is torn down and gone. The only option for parking during the construction is valet. The charge is one of the highest in all of Orlando. Furthermore the wait times are INCREDIBLE. On the evening of May 24th. I waited 2 Hours and 28 Minutes for my car to come around. I missed my dinner show and lost the non refundable tickets. I was not the only person in this situation, It was so out of control. That guests called in the Orange County Police Dept for help. Out of desperation that the hotel was not bringing them there car. Hotel management handled the situation in a horrible manner. They ruined many peoples evenings and vacation. They showed a complete lack of respect for guests and in my thousands of nights in hotel room stays. Can tell you I have never seen this situation in a hotel ever. There where hundreds of people stranded without there vehicles because the Peabody Orlando refused to bring them there cars. I am a diabetic patient. I explained them that if they could not bring my vehicle. Could I at least walk to it, or have someone go to it to get my medication. The staff and management at the Peabody Orlando REFUSED to honor my request and made me wait 2 hours and 28 minutes to gain access to my vehicle and medication. The next morning. I waited again over 45 min for my vehicle to be delivered to me. The car was delivered full of mud and grime all over the carpets and exterior of the car. The vehicles are parked in a mud swamp. The hotel provides no mats or any safeguard to keep the cars clean. I will now have to pay to get my car detailed when I leave here and shampoo the carpets. I can see the swamp where the cars are from my window and its very muddy and dirty. After endless complaining. All I got was a valet refund and false promises that this would never happen again. That for the rest of my stay the car would remain on the ramp for my convenience. The truth is that never happened and the hotel, its staff, and management not once EVER kept any of there false promises to me. Furthermore I never received an "Im sorry" or "I apologize" from anyone here. Except one of the mangers "Ms. Tara Tate" whom I have to say was very polite and professional. But in the spirit of the Peabody Orlando, was full of lies and false promises. The actions of this hotel are shamefull. In some cases Ilegal (denying a guest with a chronic disease access to his medication for over 2 hours), and a disgrace to the Orlando hospitality industry. All I can do is hope that other guests will read this and re consider ever staying at this hotel. Specially if you plan to use your car. Id wait till after 2010 when the new tower is supposed to be ready. Maybe then they will care about there guests and the service. But for now. This is just another Holiday Inn with a fancy lobby and ducks.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel - HORRIBLE Valet Service”
Reviews.Author: paradigmwg
Reviews.Content: It is amazing how a bad 2 hours can quickly destroy an entire image of an organization. After a very enjoyable stay, we left around 10:30 on Sunday morning. As we entered the lobby, it was obvious that there were problems outside. There were in the neighborhood of 100 people standing outside trying to get their cars from valet parking. The first employee we saw told us to get in the line to the valet window. Once there, we were told to go to the "little black girl taking the list of valet parking ticket numbers." The guy behind us told us he'd already been there over an hour. The employee behind the glass, looking completely exhausted apologized and told us that 'they'd been taken off guard by the rain last night and were having to wash down every car before bringing it around and that they were going as fast as they could." I asked simply to give me my keys and that I'd walk around to the car myself. That request was refused, saying that they couldn't do so as they needed to make sure every ones car got out safely. Once on the list, I was told by the girl that we were looking at about a 1 1/2 hour wait for our car. Surely enough, it actually took 1 hour and 45 minutes for the car to come around. While waiting, (and the mood of the crowd was getting nasty), I ran into another couple who had already been waiting almost three hours. There was a hotel employee working with them to try to figure things out but when we left, they were still there waiting. We also ran into a guy who was upset because he'd been through the same issue the previous day - taking almost 2 hours to get his car out of valet. For those who needed to get to the airport, the hotel employees were offering to pay for taxi rides and for the hotel to take responsibility for getting their rental cars back to the correct place(s). (Yeah, right, I'm going to walk away from a rental car???) The most aggravating thing - even beyond the delay - was that there were no options. There is NO self-park and the valet park is $18 (PLUS tax) per night. So, for two nights, I paid over $38 (with tax) and asked for my car once. That one time took 1 hour 40 minutes. I was so glad to see my car finally pull up that I didn't even complain about the mud that coated the front quarter panels ... it'd obviously been parked in a grass or dirt lot!!! The Peabody itself was a wonderful hotel. It's clean - the staff is extremely courteous - and the room was very quiet. After reading past reviews about valet parking problems - and hearing about the same issue occurring two days in a row - I would be hard pressed to return to the Peabody in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Don't trust them with your car”
Reviews.Author: GlobeHop2006
Reviews.Content: The Peabody is a comfortable property that clearly focuses on customer service. Its staff at the front desk, concierge, housekeeping, and particularly in the restaurants are extremely attentive, well trained, well informed, courteous, and helpful. The level of service is very close to what one would expect at a Ritz-Carlton or other similar, much more expensive hotel. The ancillary charges, including internet and gym access, are reasonable. UNFORTUNATELY, the hotel has inexplicably not applied the same level of quality to its parking service. The hotel has no self-parking facilities (it is currently beginning a massive expansion project, so the former parking lot is now a construction zone), and it has outsourced its valet parking service to an incompetent vendor. On three nights, I waited up to a half hour for my car. The valet parking phone line went unanswered on night, and on an other night I was unceremoniously told that they were "too busy" to take my car request at the moment. Then, when I was checking out, THEY LOST MY CAR KEYS! The parking manager offered to provide a taxi to take me to the airport and said he would return my rental car to the agency; as I was about to get into the taxi, one of the valets found my keys lying around somewhere. As if to rub salt into the wound, I discovered afterwards that they had overcharged me for parking -- the expected $120 (outrageously overpriced at $20 a night), plus an additional $60 for 3 of the same nights. If you drive, stay (or at least park) elsewhere. Then you might be able to enjoy your stay at this very nice hotel. Mine was ruined by all the aggravation with the car.

Reviews.Title: “First class hotel, great stay!”
Reviews.Author: colomomof2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Peabody Orlando for a weekend trip to Discovery Cove and Aquatica. Had read good reviews of this hotel, so expectations were high. The Peabody did not disappoint. Everything was first class at this hotel. The room was immaculate, grounds were beautiful, service was fantastic. Concierge level offered a nice selection for breakfast, and cookies in the evening. Even our kids had a ball, loved the duck march! Aside from the mandatory valet parking, we loved every single thing about the Peabody and would stay there again if given the opportunity.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: rondonnas
Reviews.Content: Very fancy hotel, not a place for uncontrolable kids. A few problems with parking. Their public parking area is under going construction so you have to park in the back 40 and walk up or have valet parking take your car. I will say this again and again whenever I run across it, they put a $10 surcharge on the room for 2 bottles of water and parking. Once a hotel gives a price a surcharge should not be added... how much can a hotel put on as a room surcharge? $20, $50, $100????

Reviews.Title: “Don't "Duck" the Peabody!”
Reviews.Author: cwcharacters
Reviews.Content: Another fabulous trip to the Peabody Orlando. This is no "Disney" hotel. Adults will find it soothing and "grown up" in an area full of kid-themed hotels and attractions. For the kids (and photogs) there is a parade of live ducks through the lobby at 11AM and again at 5PM. A tradition started in the 1930's. Pomp, circumstance, and fun. Adults will love the selection of bars, including a piano bar in the lobby. The rooms are bright and pleasant with all the modern amenities. Even a TV in the bathroom. My room had a view of the lovely pool area and the convention center across the street. This is a great location for a short walk to your convention or meeting. A new hotel tower is being built, scheduled to open in November 2009, and a planned convention/meeting space is to be built shortly afterwards. The present tower will then see an upgrade. Capriccio restaurant is an Italian Steakhouse with great food, and a great menu and wine list. Budget eats can be had at the Bee Line Diner, 24 hours a day. Good food in a fun atmosphere. There is also a restaurant called Dux, but I haven't eaten there. After many stays at the Peabody Orlando I'd highly recommend that you give it a try. Not cheap, but then again, it's not Disney either.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant experience”
Reviews.Author: stevenvCaveSpring
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the Peabody Orlando for 4 nights while visiting Disney World. The common areas are sparkling clean and beautiful. The room was very clean and spacious although somewhat dated. The staff was great and the valets worked very hard and were always pleasant. The Hotel is undergoing a major renovation and valet parking is required. $18.00 per day for the valet service. Due to construction your car is parked offsite and it sometimes took 10 to 15 minutes to get our car. I believe the average rate for this property is $400.00 per night. I would be hard pressed to pay that much for any hotel room. However, we found a $99.00 per nite rate on the internet and were very pleased with the hotel at that rate.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cat09Ohio
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel 5 star for sure. Very clean, excellent service, friendly staff. Parking is expensive 18/day + taxes...19.50/day + a tip. There is no option for self parking. Conv center is too far away to park.

Reviews.Title: “Not sure why everyone is raving”
Reviews.Author: clawbean
Reviews.Content: I don't know if the hotel recently changed it's policies, but most of the amenities everyone talked about are no longer free. Firstly, each day you are charged a $10 fee which I was told was for WIFI (even if you don't use it), 2 bottles of water per day, tickets for the trolley (worth $1 per ride) and free coffee in the lobby. Come to find out, the coffee is only available from 5-7 AM! Also, the gym is another $10 per day. There is not a shuttle to any attractions...it costs yet another $10 per person. If you do rent a car, beware, it will cost you $18 per day for parking! Yes, the ducks were cute, but once you got past the lobby, the rooms were just average. One more thing, they closed the pool for 3 days to clean it during our 4 night stay.

Reviews.Title: “Overall great, with some fine tuning needed”
Reviews.Author: isamara
Reviews.Content: My husband, two children and I just returned from a five night stay at The Peabody Orlando. Overall, the hotel definitely has the four-five star feel. I am extremely picky (I mean extremely) and it met my expectations for cleanliness - no easy feat. They accomodated my initial requests - high room, away from elevator, fridge in room, facing pool. It was clear they were professionals. That being said, there were some issues which bothered me. Let me start by saying that we had a GREAT rate for the room - via Bookit.com. At 99 dollars a night I really shouldn't be complaining, however.... The room was made up very late each day. We had to ask for our bottles of water each day - there is a mandatory 10 dollar per adult guest service fee which includes several things, including two bottles of water per day (and internet among other things). Not an awful thing, but it was kind of annoying to feel petty by having to call and ask for them - not once, but every day. The worst was the parking. I wasunder the impression there would be free self parking - mostly from comments on this site about the fact that the spaces where narrow. Well, I would have been happy with narrow spaces. Instead, there was no self parking and I was faced with an 18 dollar a day valet charge, plus tips each and every time I came and went from the hotel. Which would be tolerable, except that it was simply AWFUL. We had to wait at least 30 minutes on several occassions to get our car. And when we would call ahead from the room to have the car pulled around we were told that it was too busy so we would have to come down in person (if it wasn't so busy I wouldn't have minded coming down in person - that was exactly the point). I understand they couldn't have cars just sitting there, but even after I assured her I would be down in a few minutes, knowing they were backed up by about 20 - 30, they refused to do it. Additionally, every day I was told it would get better, that it was a new process, that the hotel was unusually full, etc. yet there was only one day when I did not have to wait a ridiculous amount of time. I have two small children and it was very disruptive to have to have these waits, but to have to pay so much for it on top of the terrible service was just insulting. Other than apologies, I only received one day's 18 dollar refund upon checkout. Also, the pool was closed for 3 out of 5 of my days there. i don't know if it was scheduled maintenance or not, but a big part of our plans included just relaxing by the pool. They did have an arrangement with a nearby hotel to use their pool, but you know it's just not the same as being able to run up to your room each time. Particularly as I have two small children who wouldn't have wanted to walk to the other hotel, and so the thought of having to get the car to drive there (see above) wasn't appealing. We ended up spending time near the kids pool - which was OK, but not the same. So I hate to complain, but it really bugged me that we had to pay for such a horrible service. I mentioned it to the checkout staff when I received my bill (and parking cost me about another night's worth of stay) and they refunded me one of the days of parking. Not a huge effort in my opinion. But if you are considering the hotel, and are picky about cleanliness and like a business-like feel, this is a great place. Also - the duck march was very cute. My kids were honorary duckmasters for one of the marches and Duckmaster Dave was just amazing with them and it was a great experience for all of us.

Reviews.Title: “Love For The Peabody”
Reviews.Author: ajsworld
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed seven nights. The first two nights were not so good because of a large and rather noisy convention. However, the staff was eager to please and provided us with a room upgrade that worked out well for us. We found the hotel to be beautiful inside and out, every twist and turn brought beautiful art, gardens and tranquil fountains. Our children were able to march the ducks and splash in the very large outdoor pool. Easter brunch was a sight! The whole lobby was transformed into a spring wonderland. The lobby also has a beautiful bar that you can relax in. The lobby can also be used for a meeting place and you can eat there as well. The piano player was an added benefit. I cannot say enough about how he made our experience so memorable. All of the restaurants are awesome, and they offer high tea daily. We took our children and had a very unique afternoon. The staff was so happy and went out of there way to say hello and greet us everyday. The peabody is not cheap but well worth it for a quality vacation. No need for a car as there are cabs everywhere. The guys outside will get you in a cab and out of there quickly with a smile. There is a nice area in walking distance with additional restaurants and shopping. The walk is paved and the area is very well maintained. Close to Sea World, Discovery Cove and Acquatica. My husband and I will go back Many many times. I was sad to say goodbye to the Peabody. Fantastic memories.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Peabody!”
Reviews.Author: Big_Travelin_Fam
Reviews.Content: We booked the Peabody through Priceline and absolutely loved our stay. The rooms, though a bit older, were clean and pretty. The sheets & pillows were extremely nice and the beds very comfortable. The bathroom, although small was clean and nice. It had a tv in there which my children enjoyed. The public areas of the hotel were beautiful and the flower arrangements gorgeous. We have stayed at many 5 star hotels and this was definitely a 5-star experience. The marching of the ducks was an added pleasure. The duckmaster was very kind, inclusive and informative. If you call in advance, you can let your children be honorary duckmasters & they can help bring the ducks down in the elevator and help them march to the fountain where they eat and bask all day until they march back upstairs around 5pm. The B-line diner was excellent! We ate dinner and breakfast there. There is a good children's menu and my sons enjoyed their french toast every morning. It was more than just a diner, there was definitely a chef back there as well as a first rate pastry chef. The pool was a highlight. It was nearly Olympic sized and was heated! There was a huge spa that was heated very nicely at around 103 degrees. Perfect! We also loved the complementary robes. The only downside to me was that we had to pay $18.00/ night for valet. We would have liked the choice to self-park but there was not a choice. In addition, upon your arrival they inform you of a $10.00/ night charge that you must pay. It's supposed to cover 2 bottles of water per/day and internet access. Kind of piling on, I think. But since we were Pricelining it, not a big deal. The parking and $10.00 charge would really bug me if I were paying full price! Overall, excellent experience and we will definitely be back whenever we visit that area.

Reviews.Title: “express elevators”
Reviews.Author: retiredincyprus
Reviews.Content: Actually a really friendly hotel for it's size,smart modern and the restaurants were excellent--but,and it's a big but,They have these express elevators which make the sound of a jumbo jet taking off.Like other reviewers i don't think it's a problem they can easily cure.For all the nice beds the nice staff etc. you can hear the elevators wherever you go in the building so I cannot recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Peabody!”
Reviews.Author: kirbey38
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel from Bookit.com, under the title mystery hotel, for a great price of $98 night. This was well worth the cost of this higher class hotel, I do know that the rooms run more than double this price. Staff was extremely friendly, rooms, you could tell were older, but bed, pillows, extremely comfy, loved the down comforter and pillows! Enjoyed the duck march this am, very cute! We enjoyed a predinner cocktail in the lobby bar. Great people watching, nice piano music, very relaxing, although two drinks, including tip came to $20, but worth it for a treat. In walking distance to restaurants, or you can take the trolley unlimited through out your stay, very easy to use. The B-Line diner, although, a little more expensive than your usual diner, was EXCELLENT! We enjoyed lunch there upon arrival, and breakfast upon departure. DELICIOUS! In summary, maybe very expensive, and not so worth the extravagant prices if paying full price, but if you can land a deal, you will definitely feel like you more than got your moneys worth.

Reviews.Title: “Peabody is Elegant, Easy to Access, & Expensive!”
Reviews.Author: riopelle
Reviews.Content: The Peabody Orlando provides luxurious rooms and great service. The hotel is within walking distance to the convention center and offers easy access to the Universal theme parks. The hotel is maintained well for its age, but is a little pricey still. After paying over $400 a night I was disappointed when I was billed $5 to borrow a corkscrew. Be prepared for the service charges and don't expect any extras - unless you're willing to pay for them.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for business trip”
Reviews.Author: nlamborn31
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for the International Builders Show. This hotel is right across the street from the convention center. The hotel is modern and offers a lot for a wide range of travelers. Courteous staff made the stay very comfortable. Upon a return to Orlando I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: ian_omnet
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from the 1st to the 4th of January, at end of fortnight touring Florida. My better half had always wanted to stay here, basically because of the Ducks! Hadn't booked, just turned up at reception and got a room. Choose a Club room on the top three floors. This gives you a variety of extra benefits such as Continental Breakfast and pre and after dinner snacks. Having said that, you could eat as much as you want at each of these, so you possibly didn't really feel the need to go for breakfast or dinner anywhere else. We did try the Cappriccio's Grill one evening and both the food and the service were very good. You also get free travel on the local trolley bus and free valet parking in the hotel car park. There were probably other benefits, but I can't remember them. Our room on the 25th floor was spacious, although it could have done with a second comfy chair. The tv in the bathroom was a nice novelty, but the interest quickly wore off. Found all the staff very friendly and helpful and had no problems at all. My only gripe was the cost of the Internet access and associated printing in the Business Centre. The ducks in the lobby are a really nice touch. They draw a crowd at 11 when they waddle in, and the same in reverse at 5 when they go back out. Made my partner's holiday seeing them. The hotel is right across from the Convention Centre and a lot of the hotel guests will be going there, but it is handy for everything and I would recommend Peabody's to anyone looking for a really nice hotel in the Orlando area.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in the orlando area”
Reviews.Author: Nature_Enthusiast
Reviews.Content: By far the nicest hotel I have stayed at in Orlando. The room was terrific, our view of the pool was gorgeous and the staff went above and beyond what was expected. When we arrived there was a personalized welcome note and a large basket of goodies (nuts, pretzels, chocolate) waiting for us. Will definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “In need of better maintainence”
Reviews.Author: Froggggie
Reviews.Content: Peabody is located on International Drive with easy access to most activities. 4 star hotel which was comfortable for most needs, however in desperate need of better carpet fitters and better sound proofing. The carpets in my room were really badly fitted, such that the concrete floor can be seen between the carpet and the walls. Also very poor sound proofing with very noisy pipes in the bathroom. The whirlpool was very warm. Good size swimming pool and 4 tennis courts. For residents there is a daily $10.65 (tax inclusive) resort charge. For this you have access to wireless internet, local newspaper, two bottles of water in the rooms and a voucher for daily unlimited trips on the i-trolleys which run up and down international drive. Duck parade was cute. Didn't try the hotel restaurants as there were excellent restaurants at a cheaper cost on international Drive......excellent Sushi, Lobster, Crab....etc etc...............mmmmmm!

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: JPinJupiter
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a weekend at the Peabody and absolutely loved it. It is head and shoulders above other Orlando hotels in the same price range. We did have one complaint about time it took to get seating in one of the Peabody's restaurants, but overall the staff was friendly and very attentive. The room was clean, well-appointed (even down to the duck-shaped soap) and the bedding was comfortable. I would strongly recommend the Peabody for anyone looking for a reasonably priced luxury hotel in Orlando. You could stay at a Ritz or a Four Seasons and spend hundreds more while experiencing just a slight difference in customer services. My only regret is that I never got to see the ducks!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great service”
Reviews.Author: travelking123
Reviews.Content: One of my best stays. Hotel staff is extremely courteous. hotel has range of amenities and is very well located. They provided me a room exactly according to requests I made in Expedia reservation. Whatever problem I faced was attended to fast. Swimming pool, whirlpool. tennis courts and ducks were extra benefits. Only issue was extremely narrow parking spots which made it difficult to even park a compact car with big turning radius

Reviews.Title: “Ok but not great”
Reviews.Author: RealEstateAgent7
Reviews.Content: Oh boy, I wish I had read the reviews first. They are on the mark. They charge for everything after the monster price for the room. We were promised king and we got double next to the elevator. Which do not stay within 100 ft. or stay awake, you choose. The rooms were nice but no coffe maker. Is it me or does anyone else need coffee without going all the way downstairs between 5 am to 7am for coffee. Well , I am not happy but some are. Just will not go back. In fairness, the hotel was very well kept and had a lot of things going on. Dan

Reviews.Title: “Friendly people”
Reviews.Author: TNTGL
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed for 3 nights at the hotel on one of the Club floors (Floors 25-27). The room itself is nothing spectacular, but it's well-furnished, the beds are very comfortable, and the robes and toiletries are nice. A small TV in the bathroom keeps you entertained at all times. As a guest on a Club floor, you get to enjoy free valet parking, as well as a continental breakfast, evening hors d'oerves, and a dessert hour. Continental breakfast included fresh juices, yogurt, bagels and breads, cereal, and plenty of fresh fruit. The evening snacks included an array of cheeses and crackers, mini meatballs, small shish kebabs, empanadas, antipasto ... the selection changed each night we were there so we never were bored. The dessert hour includes an array of after dinner drinks as well as petit fours, all tasty. Everyone at the hotel, from the guys who parked our car to the front desk and concierges, were uniformly friendly and helpful. We enjoyed the Parade of Ducks at 5pm in the lobby, and for the holidays beautiful gold and silver decorations made the hotel public areas sparkle. The hotel has easy access to the freeway so it's easy to reach theme parks. Food in the hotel - we ate at the B-Line Diner and the Capriccio Grill (the steakhouse) - was pricey but good and the service was very good. The array of desserts at the B-Line Diner are worth a stop just to take a look and be tempted. Soundproofing seemed very good - we never heard other guests. The pool was huge and beautiful, and there is also an outside whirlpool. The gym has a good selection of bikes, treadmills, elliptical trainers, and free weights. We would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “What A Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: linpom
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for the fantastic price of £59 a night through Roomsnet.com - what a bargain. Talk about 5 star luxury. - the beds were so comfortable, and the room was large and spotlessly clean. The staff were friendly and helpful. We had breakfast in the Bline diner and paid no more than if we had gone into a Perkins. The parade of the ducks just made it a perfect stay. We will definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “best hotel stay”
Reviews.Author: michaealkomalley
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for 2 nights on our honeymoon. We were given a free upgrade at check in to an international suite; the hotel then sent to our room a complimentary bottle of champagne. Although the hotel was quite busy, the room was exceptionally quiet. We ate at the diner three times and the food was remarkable. We also had dinner at the capriccio and were given a private booth, and two free desert courses--the food was incredible and the service was excellent as well. I have stayed in many hotels for both business and leisure--this was perhaps the best stay I have ever had. I highly recommend the Peabody Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Just ok, not impressed”
Reviews.Author: Bahadir
Reviews.Content: Although the hotel seems to have a lot to offer, I can't say it was an enjoyable stay. I had to change my room because my first room was just next to the elevators, and elevators made enormous noise at night. Even after I moved at least 10 rooms down the corridor (thanks to guy in reception who has arranged this) I could hear the elevators. The room service was not great, although I warned them in advance I had to settle with cold pizzas. Internet connection was very very slow, and the food (and the breakfast) in the diner was far from being impressive. Very convinient location for the convention centre and the Disney world attractions. Would not stay here again unless someone else pay for it :)

Reviews.Title: “Greatest hotel in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: laine310
Reviews.Content: After checking into a disgusting hotel near the convention center and immediately checking out, The Peabody Hotel was a warm welcome. The staff is attentive and the hotel amenities are awesome. In spite of the rain, I had a great time using the giant Olympic sized swimming pool and largely oversized hot tub. The B Line grill restaurant was awesome for a quick lunch and breakfast, and Dux restaurant was one of the best restaurants I've been to- period. The room was pretty nice- the bathtub small, but the in room amenities were good and the bed very comfortable. The duck thing was funny and cute, and we had a great time hanging out at the bar watching a piano playing singer one night. The hotel is pricey and I'm surprised to read people paying only $85/night on Priceline. I paid over $200/night booking directly with the hotel, but it was worth it. It was fun, relaxing, nice and made being in Orlando tolerable.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: flridaz
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Peabody Orlando with my husband and three children. The facility was gorgeous and the staff was very helpful and friendly. Check in was a breeze. There is a 10 dollar resort fee which covers in room water and free trolley tickets. The kids loved the ducks and there are tennis courts on site. The room was very clean and the beds were amazing! There was enough space in the room for a full size cot so we were very comfortable (all five of us). The room was bigger that the typical disney room. I "Pricelined" the room for 85$ and at that price it was an amazing bargain. Would stay again in a second.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel- Beds are Fabulous.”
Reviews.Author: hedwigowl73
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful and the ducks were not to be missed. The only drawbacks were the number of amenities that we did not use, a dated feel to the guestroom, and price overall. We can usually find a room onsite for around the price we paid. In the future, I will elect to stay on property wherever we are visiting. (we did not this time as a minimum night stay rule was in effect at Universal properties) I would recommend the Peabody as a nice, clean, conveniently located hotel for those who do not wish to stay on property at Disney or Universal.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service, Clean Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Derby1Florida
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights in a Club level room. The room was clean but not spotless. The air filter was covered with dust. The carpet looked like it could use a good shampoo. The bathroom was clean. The bed was uncomfortable - it was so soft that it sagged in the middle. Coffee shop food was good and the service excellent. Drinks in the lobby was great and the service excellent. When we checked in, the receptionist was friendly and helpful. She even called us in the room to make sure everything was ok. The gym was great - good equipment that was well maintained. The free breakfast on the club level was very good. If the bed had been comfortable and the room a little cleaner, I would have rated this hotel excellent. However, I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Love the ducks and elegance!”
Reviews.Author: Budger_roo
Reviews.Content: I love this place. I have stayed here twice and both times were excellent! The hot tub is fantastic and the pool area is simply wonderful. The food in the B-Line Diner is really good, a bit pricey, but really good. During this last stay we were greeted by our room staff with a small plate of chocolate covered strawberries. I felt very pampered, welcomed and happy I decided to stay here. The ducks with the duckmaster ceremony is a lot of fun too! I love this place, it's swanky and a great place to relax for people at any age.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: kb239
Reviews.Content: We stayed in an executive room, and it was really big. It felt more like a suite. The rooms were clean and the service wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “A Duck's Best Friend”
Reviews.Author: travelduck111
Reviews.Content: Folks, for a Travel Duck, this hotel cannot be beat. We obtained the hotel on Priceline for the bargain rate of $85. We arrived at the hotel about 10:00 a.m. and our room understandably was not ready. We checked in and went to the outdoor mall next door. About 1:00 p.m., our room was ready and it was excellent. Duck soap, duck coffee stirrers, duck shampoo, and the most comfortable bed. We watched the daily duck march where the ducks are led into the fountain for food at 11:00 a.m. daily. My only complaint is the $10 service fee for water and internet. It should be included in the room. Okay, now for some Orlando travel duck tips: 1. You will get bombarded by toll booths on the way from the airport to the hotel. Have your change and dollar bills ready. 2. Who here likes a good deli? Too Jays on Dr. Phillips Blvd is the place to be with reasonable prices - packed with locals. Ask the hotel for directions - also a great breakfast away from the tourist traps - but just minutes away. I got a free mini black and white cookie at the end of the meal while my wife was using the facilities. 3. The outdoor mall next door charges $2/hr to park and is not that great at all. Take a quick drive to the outlets for some fantastic shopping and bargains. I bought a new pair of sunglasses as my wife made me throw out the $6 pair I bought at Rite Aid. Concerge will give you good directions to this shopping mecca. 4. The pool area is fantastic - enjoy a nice swim in the morning before it gets too crowded. Watch your little ducks as it gets deep in some parts. 5. No need to leave the hotel for a nice cocktail in the evening. Both the lobby bar and Mallards inside of the hotel are a great place to have a drink. 6. Parking is free which is a nice touch - I would highly recommend renting a car in Orlando. 7. Gift shop had some amazing deals 50% off some clothing. Stop in for a set of duck cookie cutters or a stuffed duck. 8. Restaurants inside the hotel appear expensive. I did check the menus and I am pleased to report there is no duck dishes. Okay, that is all the travel duck tips for now. Enjoy your stay! TD

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great area of the city!”
Reviews.Author: bchbm3333
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a weekend at the Peabody Hotel. I liked the drive up to the hotel. It was a nice entrance with a lot of tropical plants. I really felt like I was at a luxury resort. We were greeted immediately by an attendant who was friendly and helpful. He advised us that we could self park our car if we wanted and recommended getting a card from the lobby desk for the dash board so we didn't have to stop and get "checked in" each time we came to the parking lot. We were amazed at the size of the hotel and the cleanliness of everything. When checking in I was slightly unimpressed with the lady behind the counter, she seemed like she really didn't want to be there and didn't really impress us as a super customer oriented person. That was okay, she wasn't offensive but just not what we expected based on some of the other reviews here. We got to our room, the room was clean and neat, the view was fantastic. We did notice that we did not get a mini-bar key so we went to the front desk and encountered the same lady that checked us in. She wasn't any friendlier but did appologize for not giving us the mini-bar key. When we got back up to the room, we then realized that we never got the card for our dash board but decided to wait and get that before we left. Other than that minor incident, we had a terrific stay. On the second day we rented a cabana at the pool. It was very nice; it gave us shade when we needed some and the sunshine otherwise. The pool was clean and spacious, the landscaping was nice. The attendant at the pool was marvelous. I did read many comments about the $10 service fee so I was prepared for that. There were no surprises. I got exactly the relaxing weekend away I was looking for. I didn't have a chance to eat at any of the restaurants in the hotel, we ventured along I-Drive and enjoyed some of the many restaurants there. The next time I may try one of the hotel restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!”
Reviews.Author: Whit2810
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here one night on our way to Miami for a cruise. We didn't get to use the pool or anything but it was still a very nice pool and we walked around and checked everything out. The room was extremely nice with very comfortable beds. The bathrooms were nice, elegant and very clean. We made a point to see the Peabody ducks and they were absolutely adorable. If you are visiting with children, I would make this a must see but even if your without children its still fun. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed...”
Reviews.Author: hemingways_girl
Reviews.Content: We ended up changeing our honeymoon to Florida do to Hurricane Dean . We picked the peabody which turned out to be very nice. The upgraded us because of our honeymoon. When we had gotton there our room was not ready we waited for 45 min went back and asked if it was ready yet. It was not yet so they gave us another upgrade to a room that was ready. Which made us very happy. I can't say enough about the staff they were GREAT. If you needed something they were there . The conciege servive was top notch. I Must say that I would stay here again . Rooms very clean we had nightly turn down service in our room. Room were always clean . The bed was great. Close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: LadyGeorgia
Reviews.Content: The service was wondiful. Great staff. The food in the hotel was very good. I was disapointed in the room, especially the bathroom. I expected it to be more upscale. It definitely need to be remodeled. Overall it was a nice hotel, I would visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cschlunt
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights in August. The hotel is fantastic, the rooms are beautiful, the staff is extremely courteous, and the food is delicious. The pool and hot tub area is also very nice and relaxing... although pool temp was really hot. The only problem was that a nightly stay did not include access to the gym! They wanted $10 per day per person to use the treadmill. Whatever! So I went for a run outside instead - bad idea in August heat - but the staff gave me a running map and when I came back, they offered me a towel and bottle of cold water. Now THAT is service. Other than the rip-off gym, the place is great.

Reviews.Title: “Loved The Peabody Orlando”
Reviews.Author: Kika25
Reviews.Content: Overall service was excellent we were totally satisfied with the whole staff everyone was very helpful, the march of the ducks at 11 am everyday was so cool, something amazing how those ducks march on the red carpet to get in the fountain located in the lobby. The food in the restaurants inside the hotel were so delicious, I really recommend this hotel and 100% sure that I'm going back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel -- no complaints!”
Reviews.Author: LovethebeachFlorida
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel with great service. It's clean, conveniently located, and the "duck march" is very cute. We got it for $75 per night on Priceline (selecting Universal Studios and Sand Lake areas as the criteria).

Reviews.Title: “Peabody Was Ducky!”
Reviews.Author: Vic55
Reviews.Content: We traveled to the Peabody Hotel for a national youth convention. Everything meet our expectations and more. The staff was very efficient and made sure all of our needs were met. When we lost a key or needed something, it was quickly taken of. The rooms were very clean and the beds were extremely comfortable. The hotel had several restaurants to choose from and even though the hotel was filled with thousands of teenagers at the time, the restaurant staff worked very hard and served everyone in a timely manner. The food in the B-line Diner was all excellent and the desserts were wonderful! The famous march of the Peabody ducks added to the fun. Each day their trained ducks marched across the red carpet to the lobby fountain. The lobby also had a nightly piano man. The location was right next to the Orange County Convention Center on International Drive. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The Peabody, a spectacular hotel, ruined by teen religious psychoticness”
Reviews.Author: swamwithdlophins
Reviews.Content: CALL AHEAD AND ASK ABOUT THE CONVENTIONS BEING HELD!! I stayed at the Peabody from July 29 - August 2nd. First of all this was my first trip so I did not know what to expect. The check in was easy, and we proceeded to our room. The first problem we encountered was that we were not given the King Bed we had requested. We didn't complain and went right out to a theme park. Upon returning we encountered what seemed to be 400- 500 teenagers in the hallways, on the elevators and basically overunning everthing. I was tired and only had 2 hours sleep because of an early flight. I looked down to the pool. We counted 218 teenagers in the pool and over 50 teenagers, unsupervised, in the hottub sitting on each other(because there was no room) and acting crazy. I was 20 floors up and could hear the screaming and yelling for over an hour and could not sleep. I went to the pool and asked the one parent I saw what she thought about the 50 + boys and girls sitting on each other in a hot tub on a religious trip. Teens were ,seriously, riding up and down the elevator and calling it a party elevator as we tried to get on the elevator. I was unbelievably upset and it was ruining my trip and my stay. The teens and some parents would just continously shove you out of the way and you could wait 1/2 and hour to get on an elevator packed- end to end- with dripping wet screaming teens- coming from the pool. I showed the manager what was going on around midnight. We were upgraded to another room as the people in the last review said. The other room was awesome. I was very impressed with this room, but I can only imagine what it would cost, had not thousands of teens kept me up all night and taken the room had had been promised(I had even paid to upgrade to a king bed. The accomadations for the second room were second to none, but my original room was basic and not what I asked for. The Superior Room is no different from the Delux except for a little T.V. set and the fact you are moved a few floors higher. On a positive note, room sevice was good, we had a blow dryer and iron and ironing board. If you stay in the fron part of the hotel you can see both the disney fireworks and the Seaworld Fireworks simultaneosly at 10 p.m. There is also a 10$ daily charge that they will bill you for at the end of your stay for water and an I trolley pass. The internet is 10 $ more a day. It is close to Seaworld, Universal and Discovery Cove. Discovery Cove is awesome, but you can skip Seaworld and Island of Adventure. Universal is cool too- but you MUST have the express pass. The marching of the ducks is cute and be sure to take a duck soap for a souvenier. Again, I would definatey call ahead and ask what conventions are here because they will ruin your stay. The last day the teens had gone and we enjoyed a pianist and the marcing ducks. I belive the would be one of the BEST hotels you can stay at if there were not a giant convention.

Reviews.Title: “Peabody was Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: touristtogo
Reviews.Content: I stayed here recently while working a trade show at the Orange County Civic Center across the street. This is by far the most convenient hotel to the OCCC, you simply walk across the street. The hotel was lovely and the service was terrific. Three days after helping me to my room with my luggage upon checking in, the porter greeted me by name in the lobby. Quite impressive. The hotel is beautifully decorated, with ample and comfortable common areas and lovely rooms. The pool was large and had plenty of loungers. However, I was with my husband and children and there were very few families staying at the hotel, so there were no other children to play with at the pool (a plus for adults looking for peace and quiet, but overall the hotel is not geared to children). My kids were invited, however, to be duckmasters and lead the duck parade one day. Duck Master Dave was terrific and so kind to us. It was the highlight of the trip. My only complaint with this hotel is that there are no coffee makers in the rooms. You have to clean up to go downstairs and wait in a very long line to buy your $3 cup of coffee. For what you pay for these rooms, a coffee maker should be provided. Overall, a very nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, Nice rooms, Attractive facilities”
Reviews.Author: brytpa
Reviews.Content: I live in Florida and my partner and I head out to Orlando on a fairly regular basis to just get away and hang out for a weekend. I'm brand loyal to a fault, and usually stick to Starwood properties. But SPG's Orlando selection is pretty bad for those of us not lugging a huge family behind us. So I ventured away from SPG and gave the Peabody a try. I was quite happy I did! Check-in was fast and easy, which was pretty fortunate given we'd pulled up just as droves of conventioneers were doing the same. The Peabody's website has a rather odd (to me, at least) room reservation process - rather than check certain selections and such, you just write to them telling them what you want and trust they'll make it happen) and so I was a bit concerned I'd not get the kind of room I wanted or would but I could actually tell they paid close attention to all that and got us exactly what we wanted. We asked for a suite, which we got. And we asked for a smoking room - which they didn't have, but they did give us one of the few rooms with a balcony and so that was taken care of! The furniture was all in good shape and the rooms were decorated nicely. The bathroom itself was rather small, but there was a large vanity with dual sinks right outside the bathroom so that more than made up for it. Plenty of closet space, and there was also a wetbar, minibar, sitting area, dining table. There are quite a bit of dining options on property, and all of the ones we tried out were pretty good - including room service. We did get up early (hey, 10am is early for some of us! hehe) to see the Duck March. It lasts all of a few seconds but was pretty cute - who doesn't love ducks? Certainly, Orlando is a very family-oriented town and a lot of the hotels in and around the city cater to large familes for extended stays. So it's great to find a hotel that could cater to a family perfectly well, as I'd imagine the Peabody can, while at the same time being a perfect fit for adults, young couples, and business travelers alike.

Reviews.Title: “Very average”
Reviews.Author: CBerri
Reviews.Content: In a nutshell, I really just wouldn't bother. We had been looking forward to staying at the Peabody for a couple of nights at the end of a brilliant two week stay in Florida. It was throughly disappointing. We were there at the same time as hundreds of teenagers who were attending an event at the convention centre, which faces the hotel. Needless to say, we were kept awake by the inconsiderate shrieking, screaming and shouting of the other guests from their rooms and from the pool at midnight. It was more like staying in an expensive youth hostel. This may not have been the hotel's fault, but they weren't remotely bothered when I mentioned it in the morning. You also pay a 10 dollar service charge for water, local calls and an I Ride ticket, whether you want them or not. It's clean with a very impressive foyer and TVs in the bathroom. It is also handy for Pointe Orlando. However, we won't be staying there again, it was all just a bit below par.

Reviews.Title: “Very Noisy - No Sleep!!”
Reviews.Author: GautamStamford
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights in July at the same time that 700 rooms(!!) were booked by teenagers attending a conference on religion. It was extremely noisy and we did not get a full night's rest on any of the 4 nights we were there. The hotel should decide what it wants to be - if it believes itself to be a 4 star hotel, it shouldn't be selling 700 rooms to hordes of teenagers who end up behaving like they are at a mega frat party. Or, they should close the hotel to other guests! Very disappointing stay, especially since there are so many other excellent accommodation options in Orlando!

Reviews.Title: “not the best”
Reviews.Author: rec913
Reviews.Content: the rooms are old with only 4 draws no coffee pot. prices are a way too high for this type of room. it is very hard to eat inside the hotel due to the very high prices they charge which makes it a pain to have to go out and eat. the staff were very nice and helpful. they rave about their beda i did not think they were anything special. would not stay there again if i had a choice.

Reviews.Title: “Really Nice Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ronlord
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 days to attend a business conference. Proximity to the convention center is excellent, an easy walk. The hotel is spotless and terrific service. Don't miss the march of the ducks each day!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay at the Peabody!”
Reviews.Author: Lucyspoileddog
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Peabody this month was lovely. They had our room ready for check in at 10 am which was unexpected and even accommodated my request for a room on a higher floor with a view. The elevators are amazingly fast and always available. The staff were all very helpful and friendly, especially the concierge and Chris the pool bartender. Only strange thing was the bathroom which was very small and cramped, with the toilet sitting out on the floor and you had to stand very carefully in order order to shut the door. The shower/bath was also very small. It may have been because our room was the first next to the elevator, but it was still fine. The B-Line diner was great and we ended up eating there for breakfast every day and also a few lunches and dinners. The beds were very comfortable and the room kept very clean. Keep in mind that with the daily room fee and the many different resort taxes added to the room rate, prepare to add about $50 per day to the price you are quoted. That's Orlando for you.

Reviews.Title: “Have stayed there many times...”
Reviews.Author: TwiceInALifetime
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Peabody Orlando four times over the past few years, once for business and three times for pleasure. I live in Orlando, but love to 'get away' every once in awhile to a nice hotel. The Peabody is a very formal looking hotel - lots of marble and polished brass, etc. One would expect great service (which I've always received), but what is somewhat surprising is the genuine niceness of the staff. Every request I've had has been met. Parking is free, unless you valet. You might expect a bit of a walk, especially if there is a big event going on in the convention hall. I usually drop my bags off at the valet and then self park. (if I have a companion to watch my bage, of course). There are several places to eat if you looking to just stay at the hotel.
