The B-line diner has good food, albet expensive for what it is. The kids meals are a good price, though. (Yes, 'expensive' is so subjective... so I guess it depends on your budget.) There are more than enough places to eat on International Drive - you can get a good recommendation from the concierge, or just hop in your car and explore. If you don't have a car, then you can take the I-drive trolley. But... I digress.... The pool is so nice - very large and well maintained. The hot tub is also large - very nice! There are lots of shaded chairs if you don't want to sun. The poolside service is my favorite indulgence. The burgers are really good (I don't usually eat burgers, but for some reason they taste better poolside)... and the drinks are tasty. I usually stay in the most economical (cheapest!) room available. The beds are so comfy, and and the bathrooms are clean and very elegant. The view can be nice (if you are up high, facing sea world or disney you can expect a fireworks show every night), or kind of plain (a low level room above the pool). I like the lobby - a grand piano is surrounded by small cocktail tables. You can sit and relax or order snacks/drinks while someone plays the piano. The last time I was there I was in shorts and birkenstocks - and I was treated as well as the folks next to me, who were dressed in tuxedos and ball gowns. It's a nice, comfy place.

Reviews.Title: “If you like real ducks...”
Reviews.Author: nosymonky
Reviews.Content: I and my hubby went on vacation between may26 and june2.The hotel itself was very nice, orchids and marble everywhere, cute accent was that they had a “duck march",every day from 11am to 5pm the hotel had real ducks swimming in the fountain. Hotel rooms were very clean, nice clean bathrooms and you get a cute duck shaped soap too, the sheets were changed every morning and the staff was really pleasant and polite. We didn’t get a chance to try the high end restaurants located in the hotel, we only had a chance to try the one called the B-line, it was ok kind of like a 60's diner, the staff was treating us poorly because we would only order desert so I guess they didn’t think they would get a big enough tip, the deserts though were really really good,you should try "better than chocolate" cake and cookies'n'cream ice cream, very deliciuos.The hotel had an almost Olympic size pool, kiddie pool,cabanas,an outdoor bar and some souvenir shops. We liked the bar called "Mallards" i believe its called, its located close to the duck fountain right in the middle of the hotel. I don’t have any complaints about our check in or check out, we checked in got our room keys and were on our way. If you do get your room on a higher floor, you will get a very nice view of the surrounding buildings, or the pool. The overall experience was pretty good, I think the rooms are a bit overpriced. The $10 per nigh fee was a big surprise, nobody told us about it, they charge you for internet, no matter if you brought your laptop with you or not,2 bottles of water and a newspaper and no, you cant choose either you want those things or not the fee still applies. We were tired and didn’t feel like arguing so we paid, but we think its kind of ridiculous to be charged extra for that, I suppose they could just add the fee to the overall room price, but not just surprise you like that. Be prepared to pay the fee. So overall the hotel was nice and our vacation went smoothly. Good luck with yours:)

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: burdog
Reviews.Content: We flew down to Orlando two days before leaving on a cruise, just planning to hang out before the ship left. Not knowing the area, some friends there recommended the Peabody, and they sure didn't steer us wrong! We loved everything about the hotel. It was very comfortable, and we had a corner room with an absolutely gorgeous view on the 11th floor. The staff were all friendly, and we enjoyed the quiet atmosphere in the hotel. The location was so central to Universal and Disney. We never used the free trolley tickets as we rented a car. There was plenty of self parking close to the hotel. The duck show was just an added treat. We would definitely stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in a Great Town”
Reviews.Author: DutchCat
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Peabody hotel as part of our trip in Florida. Originally, I booked it for two nights, but we soon made it 4 nights, as the price was fantastic! (via priceline) The hotel is centrally located at the big 'strip' and a trolleystop is directly at the street. This trolley takes you either way to a lot of fun shops, restaurants, malls and themeparks. You have to pay a service fee at the hotel but this provied you with free bottle of water and a free pass for the trolley every day. Make use of it! Location is great! Facilities are also great. I found the hotel very luxurious, but keep in mind I am European and therefor maybe used to other standards. The decoration was nice and the ducks in the lobby a nice touch. After informing them we were on a special sort of trip for us, they upgraded us to a deluxe room, with a LOT of extra space! GOOD beds (they even sell these for those who have some money left after florida...), a nice bathroom and a nice sitting area. A filled minibar with very expesnive prices though. The pool is lovely at a higher level and warm enough. Enough comfy sunbeds around it. The thing I loved most about this hotel, was the 24 hour diner in the lobby! A real american style diner which was open 24 hours, which was great for me with my jet lag!!! I sat there every night at 4 or 5 am when I woke up early. Went down there with my book and had some cake and milk; lovely! The diner had good breakfast, lunch, dinner and snacks for OK prices. Off course elsewhere in Orlando, food is much cheaper then at the hotel... The other restaurants at the hotel we did not try, we found them expensive. Service was good, every question or demand was answered quickly. I can't find a lot wrong with this hotel if I tried!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: da_coolestofall
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for a conference and checked in quite late due to a flight delay. Check-in was smooth and was asked for a choice between higher or lower floors. The front desk tried finding me a non-smoking king but were unable to so I took the double on the 18th floor. As expected of a hotel of this caliber, there was a $10/day fee. This gave me access to the hotel Wi-Fi, 2 bottled waters, and vouchers for the I-Ride trolley. Self Parking was free and abundant. The only gripe i had was that the wi-fi was painfully slow, it took me up to 5 minutes at times to connect to my corporate VPN, this is unacceptable for a hotel that attracts such large business crowds. There are no wired ports int he room, so it wasn't just a matter of my choosing the wireless network

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with some major issues (for me at least)”
Reviews.Author: meandering_minstrel
Reviews.Content: I am currently staying at the Peabody for a convention. This is without a doubt a well-maintained, upscale property in a location convenient to the Orange County Convention Centre. The staff is friendly and service is prompt. The rooms have nice beds, linen, etc but are nothing exceptional. The outstanding feature - or omission - in the room is the lack of a coffee maker. Can't remember the last time I stayed at a hotel without a coffee maker in the room. Thankfully, there is 24 hour room service but there is no excuse for no coffee maker in the room. My other gripe with the hotel is about the health club. When I travel for a convention, I like to get my workout in early to beat the crowds. At the Peabody Orlando, you cannot get into the health club with your room key and the club does not open till 6 AM. It costs $10/day (or $25/week) which is not surprising for a hotel in this class. However, the hotel should allow guests to access the health club 24 hours with a room key like every other hotel I have stayed at does.

Reviews.Title: “Well Run Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ivanciment
Reviews.Content: Well-run hotel; food was decent and service was uniformly friendly. They do nickel and dime you a bit in terms of the resort fee but it's really not a big deal. Very convenient to the convention center.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, but pricey”
Reviews.Author: travelerMelbourne
Reviews.Content: Location is excellent, especially if you're a conventioner, with the convention centre across the road. It's at the quieter end of I-drive. Top-notch hotel in very way from the check-in, lobby, public facilities, room & amenities. Friendly knowledgeable staff. However, it's pricey & they do charge an extra $10 per day for wireless access, 2 bottles of water & I-ride all-day pass. Huge carpark on-site. Plenty of taxicabs and I-ride stop just in front of the hotel. 3 on-site restaurants or multiple others across all price range within walking distance of hotel. Would definitely stay here if price is right.

Reviews.Title: “Hugely Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Mighty_Road_Warrior
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Peabody Orlando during a conference held at the hotel. The rack rate was $300 and the conference rate was $200. My company just about had a cow over this price. For this money and 4 stars, I expected an all inclusive resort type atmosphere. Boy, was I wrong. Check-in took 40 minutes (it does have 25 or 30 stories, with but one desk). There is no complementary airport shuttle like many lowly 2 and 3 star hotels, so I had to rent a car. Breakfast is not complementary. In fact, I spent around $20 for an omelette, hash browns, milk, and juice at their restaurant. That's just rediculous. They charge a fee for a "health club membership" of $7/day instead of having a complementary gym. In fact, just about everything at this hotel costs extra that is included at hotels costing 1/2 to 1/3 as much. The room was no different from those hotels, either. I would expect a whirlpool, suite, and kitchenette for this price. I kept shaking my head trying to figure out what makes it a 4 star hotel. I even asked the management, and their answer was that they have all these facilities available on site (but for and additional fee). Even the duck parade was a major let down. How lame! On the positive side, it does have a pretty lobby, but its size just makes it that much farther from the parking lot (a 5 minute walk to the elevators) to your room. Stay somewhere else unless someone else is paying your bill.

Reviews.Title: “Duck fountain”
Reviews.Author: garven2810
Reviews.Content: A superb hotel with outstanding staff. Excellent room. Popular with conference delegates because of its proximity to the convention centre, however this does not affect its appeal to holiday guests. There are 3 restaurants, a lobby bar and a more private bar, all with excellent surroundings. The tennis courts and gym offer an exercise opportunity, and the swimming pools some refreshing relief from the lovely warm weather. We will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: clsmit
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Peabody Orlando over Easter weekend. The hotel is right across the street from the Convention Center on International Drive, so when the Center is busy it's busy at the hotel. But, when the Center is empty the Peabody's rooms go on sale! The beds are very luxurious and comfortable. We got the Executive King room for our 2 kids and 2 adults. The room was very large and the bathroom was huge (almost too big). The kids liked the TV in the bathroom. We had a really good view of all the attraction fireworks in the distance. The staff were very helpful with directions and luggage. The B-line diner had good breakfasts. We watched the duck entrance and exits -- a huge production number and a lot of fun for kids to experience. The pool is nicely heated. We'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as last time!”
Reviews.Author: JensDiversion
Reviews.Content: I gave this hotel a very high review the last time we stayed there about a year ago. This time i was not as impressed. After returning from Mardi Gras at Universal Studios around 10:30pm-11:00pm, the vallet service was horrible. There were other just small issues but nothing worth mentioning. Just an unimpressive visit for the HUGE charge per night.

Reviews.Title: “Peabody ROCKS !”
Reviews.Author: TampaMan07
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Peabody over the weekend starting on 4/6 for 2 nights. The Peabody is listed as a 4 star hotel and I would say that is about right. The location of the hotel is excellent if you are going to Universal or Seaworld. It is on the quite end of I drive directly across the Orlando Convention Center. I wanted to be on this side of Orlando instead of staying at near Disney. I feel there are better restaurants and shops in this area compared to Lake Buena Vista. Check In- Check was easy. Pulled up and had the bellman take our bags. Nice feature of the hotel is free self parking. Most resorts in this area charge for self parking which is just an extra change and a waste of money if you ask me. Self parking is right next to the hotel and they have another “main” entrance near all the self parking area. The hotel check in line was about 10 people long but moved quickly. Lots of families checking in with kids. Which kind of surprised me for this type of hotel. Because of all the people in line the hotel staff added extra people to speed up the process. I asked for an upgrade on the room as it was a special weekend for us. The clerk said she did have a nice room on the 17th floor facing Disney so we could see the fireworks at night. Hotel Lobby & Elevators- The hotel lobby is kind of chopped up. It is not a grand entrance like some of the reports type hotels in this area. But more sectioned off in different areas. The bellman grabbed our bag cart and we headed up to the room. The ducks were just making their match out from the center pond so the center area was packed with people. How can you tell when you are staying in nice hotel, the speed of the elevators! The elevators at the Peabody FLY. Our room was on the 17th floor and they moved us up there in seconds. We never had to wait for more then a couple of seconds for elevators the whole time we were there. Nice! Room- Our room was 1760 which was facing Disney and the Orlando Convention Center. Below us was the pool. The room it self was shaped weird. It was not your standard square box but more of a U shape. The entrance of the room had the bathroom on the right side and the king bed on the other side of the U. Windows went all across the facing the pool. Lots of natural light! At first I did not like the shape of the room but after a while it was great to open your door and not see your bed. Bathroom was very nice and even had a little TV in there. Bed was great. One of the most comfortable beds I have ever slept on. TV was standard TV not a flat screen. Everything worked great and was in good condition. $10 a day report fee. Yes, they charge it. You get 2 bottles of water with it, free I drive trolly tickets. We takes cabs so did not use the I drive trolly. The water was nice to have each day but I would rather not be charged the $10.00. But what are you going to do. They do give you free shoe shine service! Which I did take advantage of. Overall Comments – Hotel staff was very nice. Everyone went out of the way to make you feel welcome. Room service was quick and not as pricey as other hotels. Never went to the pool are because it was to cold. Point Orlando is a complex next door that is being fixed up. New places are going in and when it is done it will be a great place to hang out. It is walking distance from the hotel right around the corner. The hotel is a 4 star hotel. Not a resort. It lacks the big grounds most reports have and large pool areas. But the location is in the middle of everything and is very easy to get to I-4. We got a special rate at the hotel for $95.00 a night and I think it was worth it. I would differently recommend this hotel to anyone staying in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic experience”
Reviews.Author: jamvir
Reviews.Content: What an incredible place - we found this by doing a desperate google search from a horrible hotel in Orlando and a wonderful reservationist was able to "save" us. For a luxury hotel, the prices were more than reasonable and the service was extraordinary. The famous peabody ducks are fun, and the restaurants were great. Kids meals were tasty and inexpensive. The hotel itself is gorgeous and they could not be more accomodating or friendly. The pool is clean and luxurious. You can rent a private cabana for $75/day which includes a full frig, snacks, television and cushioned lounge chairs. We felt pampered in every way, and will only stay here if we go to Orlando. You won't be sorry!

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel, check-in disorganised”
Reviews.Author: Alison_traveller
Reviews.Content: Myself and my husband decided to stay at the Peabody Orlando for 2 nights from March 16th 2007, after reading reviews of this hotel. We had stayed the previous 2 nights in The Ritz-Carlton Grande Lakes and had an almost perfect stay there, so we were realistically not expecting the Peabody to be as nice as the Ritz and we were right! The first problem we encountered was checking-in: We arrived at around 4pm and were told by the valet staff there was a short line to check in. Unfortunately this turned out to be a very long line, made up mainly of delegates checking in for a conference at the nearby conference center. After 15 minutes of standing in line my husband went to the bar area & sat down so that he could keep an eye on our luggage which had just been abandoned on a trolley in the reception area. I continued to queue and it took about 45 minutes to get to the reception desk. There was a full quota of reception staff on, an apology was offered for the delay but I felt it would have been better if one receptionist could have dealt with non-conference check-ins. There was another long delay to get the bags brought up to the room. The room was adequate, quite spacious and clean, windows could have done with being cleaned. Good view over Orlando area. Food in hotel was good, we ate in both the Capriccio Grill & B-line diner. I don't think I would return to this hotel as I know Orlando has nicer hotels to offer but it is probably a reasonable option for conference delegates, not for a holiday destination.

Reviews.Title: “Not that Friendly”
Reviews.Author: Holliday
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Orlando Peabody for 4 nights. The hotel is in a great location for the Convention Centre and is very much a business hotel - it is though well placed on International Drive for the usual tourist attractions. The check in took for ages and the check in agent was not that friendly. The room was spacious and comfortable - our room looked over the back of the hotel. I found the hotel very unpersonal - the staff seemed distant and uninterested and I did not feel like a valued guest. The pool area is very quiet during the day but I found the pool and the whirlpool to be quite dirty and it stopped me from entering the pool too - by the lack of people in the pool too I guess this also put people off. I would stay at the Peabody again if I had business in Orlando though I do feel that even though its a very comfortable centrally located hotel - I would prefer to stay somewhere that values you as a guest and makes you feel welcome. I felt neither of those things.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for I-drive”
Reviews.Author: rahulp
Reviews.Content: My wife I wanted to stay at one of the nicer hotels on I-drive and the Peabody fit the bill perfectly! I-drive is convenient for both Disney and Universal, making the location a great base for us and the hotel itself was great. The bright open lobby is a relaxing, comfortable place to sit down and chill out and the hotel staff we encountered during our time were all professional and helpful. The room itself had a kind of 'lived-in' feel to it, but otherwise we found the bed to be comfortable, the room big and decor was nice if a bit bland. Our biggest issue was with the A/C, it was pretty useless. Even in the middle of March, even leaving the A/C on all day, our room would get far too hot and sleeping at night was quite uncomfortable, I can only imagine what it would be like in the height of summer. Overall though, a great hotel for couples or families on holiday. Oh yeah, keep an eye out for the duck parade – very cute!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: belugalove
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 3 night stay at the Peabody Orlando, and I was quite pleased with the property. The staff overall was friendly and the rooms were modern and spacious. I really had no complaints about the hotel at all. The food at B-Line was overpriced, as is expected at any 4+ star hotel, and was nothing to write home about. I did not get to eat at the other facilities. Public areas are spacious and well-lit. Only downside was the pool area did not have enough chairs and poolside service was very slow, but the server was rather nice. This hotel is really not for families as it caters to the convention going crowd. I would recommend this hotel to business travelers and singles and couples looking for all the basic amenities you would expect in a 4 star hotel. I had the opportunity to check out the JW and the Ritz as friends were staying in both properties and while they have more of a resort feel with large pool complexes and activities, the service levels were about the same as I received at the Peabody. Overall I would return if I didn't want or need all the bells and whistles associated with a large resort.

Reviews.Title: “A bit disappointed”
Reviews.Author: travelallover
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel, but do not book a room on Priceline, because at this hotel, you get a "Priceline" room. The lobby was very nice, and I can imagine they probably do have some really nice rooms. I found the staff to be friendly, it was not snooty, the duck march was great, the rooms were clean and the beds were comfortable. I have stayed in many hotels, (4 and 5 stars) and many 4 stars through Priceline. Some places give you great accommodations and others give you the worst rooms, this is the risk you take and I was fully aware. I can tell you that if I had payed full price I would have been really upset. It is a 4 star, maybe. For the price (full price $250.00 a night), I would recommend staying somewhere else. Our room was really loud, all night we heard slamming doors, and the ding of the elevator woke me a few times. None of the electrical outlets worked in the bathroom...neither did the TV (in the bathroom) or hairdryer. We didn't find this out until morning when it was too late to change our room. I informed the front desk at checkout. My advice is if you do want to stay at The Peabody, do not Priceline a room. As for me, the next time I go to Orlando, I will definitely stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Peabody- grace under pressure!”
Reviews.Author: koala2
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this Hotel while attending a Conference at OCCC. The Hotel was at capacity for the duration of my 5 day stay, but I was impressed that the level of service didn't falter despite the crowds. Check-in/out was drama-free with no waiting. Room was excellent & the bed dreamy. No request was ever too much trouble, the Concierge team were always helpful & smiling & the food & beverage staff friendly & responsive. A special mention goes to the Housekeeping Service - they were outstanding! A great location if attending the OCCC - the short stroll across the street was a pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, convenient to convention center, great pool & luxurious rooms”
Reviews.Author: harrietfly
Reviews.Content: The Peabody hotel saved our Orlando stay. We were with a convention, International Builders Show 2007 and checked into the International Hotel and Spa at midnight on Thursday. We couldn't check out of this hotel fast enough. We searched Hotels.com and found availability at the Peabody. The Peabody is a very nice hotel, it's away from the madness of Disney but close enough to enjoy everything Orlando has to offer. Convenient to convention center with a nice pool area and accommodating staff. Room was comfortable and clean. Would definitely visit again. FAVORITES INCLUDE: Comfortable bed! Free Internet access which is a GREAT amenity along with two bottled waters a day, shoe shines and shuttle passes. Little things like this make staying at a higher end hotel a pleasure. Front desk staff was attentive to a late checkout and very friendly when you needed something, as were the valets and bellmen.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: DR07070
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the negative reviews of the Peabody on this site, I was expecting to be unhappy for my weekend stay there on business, but was actually pleasantly surprised. The check-in process was very smooth and easy; the young lady who helped me was very friendly, as we all of the staff I encountered while there. Yes, I can see why people get aggravated over that mandatory $8.00/day charge for things you may not want -- a charge you don't hear about until you've pretty much checked in already -- and they really should do away with that. Otherwise, though, I didn't see the problems others have experienced. My room was clean, quiet, and very comfortable. It was adjacent to the elevator, and I heard the occasion "ding", but not enough to really matter. I heard one group of people being loud as they passed my room around midnight, but that's just thoughtlessness on their part, not the hotel's fault. Otherwise I never heard a peep out of anyone. The beds really are great and better than those at most of the 4 and 5 star hotels I've stayed in, and the food from room service was really excellent, and service was quick as well. I couldn't order anything until around 1:00 a.m., but it was no problem. The bathroom is not opulent by any means, but it was clean and modern; it's not done in a Ritz-Carlton style or anything, but there was nothing about it to find fault with, either. It does have a small flat-panel TV on the counter. I didn't find much use for it, but I guess some people might enjoy it. The hotel is located on Int'l Drive, where the traffic can sometimes make you think you're in Manhattan, but if you're not driving or getting out much, it shouldn't be a big issue. If you are, just be prepared to be patient and leave extra time. The lobby area was very nice and clean and bright, with lots of people hanging out and appearing to enjoy themselves. There was one spot on the edge of the fountain where one of the ducks had left his/her ... um, 'calling card', but it didn't strike me as appearing dirty or gross, on the whole. I really noticed it only because I had read comments about that on this site. I'd call the Peabody a very solid 4-star hotel. Not the Ritz, but not the awful place you might think from many of the reviews you'll see. I wouldn't hesitate to go back if I had a choice of places to stay in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Experience”
Reviews.Author: IndianaJill
Reviews.Content: My husband, 3 year old son and I stayed at this hotel during a convention the first week of January. What a great, overall experience! We called before arriving to get directions, and they were very easy to understand. When we arrived, check in took only a few minutes. The room was spotless, roomy and comfortable. The TV in the bathroom was a bonus!! My son loved watching cartoons while taking a bath. The pool was wonderful, and they have a separate kiddie pool with a waterfall. Any request was attended to immediately, and the valet and bell men were wonderful. They were so helpful in giving directions and loading my car. The hotel is minutes from Sea World, and they sell tickets to all the local theme parks. This was very helpful! Disney was about a 15 minute car ride. We have already decided to stay there again next year at the same time, and I would recommend this hotel to everyone I know. PS...the duck march is a Must See!!

Reviews.Title: “Should be 5* - One of the very best hotel in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: Jessica
Reviews.Content: This is probably one of the very best hotel in Orlando. We stayed here for 5 days at xmas. Their website doesn't actually do the hotel any justice as it doesn't show how good it is. We were pleasantly shocked when we checked in. we were impressed, from the time we drove up at the entrance, the style of the building, the ambience, lavish decoration. (The hotel reminded me of the Venetian in Las Vegas without the gold trimmings) You don't actually see the main entrance from the street, so you don't get to see how nice it is from the street. The drive way is well laid out, with beautiful waterfalls and lightings e.t.c. The valet, two opening our car doors, two getting our luggage's out of the boot, very courteous and professional. The check-in staff were very smart, attractive and very professional. The lobby is gorgeous. The check in clerks agreed to our two rooms being next to each other with adjoining door. We had one king size room and another with two double beds both with two TVs in each room, (one in the bathroom) , with stunning views. We had xmas brunch at the hotel, one word amazing. We also stayed at the Omni Championsgate (which is fabulous) for 5 days, but it is not as good as The Peabody in our opinion. We felt spoiled, pampered and indulged. Someone mentioned that the TV channels are limited, gosh there were more than 80 channels (couldn't be bothered to check for more). They have wireless everywhere which you pay as part of the resort fee. The pools and the Jacuzzi were very good. Make sure you go into the spa. They have air-conditioned gym, steam room, sauna and another Jacuzzi in the Spa. They are all placed in the Spa but you don't have to pay to use the steam room and sauna. Obviously you have to pay for any beauty treatments, or massage. The only snag I had with them is that Valet parking is $14, if you don't want to pay park yourself the car park is only a few steps away. We didn't know this and we had been tipping the valet staff every time, probably more than the $14 each day, as we take the car out about three times a day. So check before using the valet. Otherwise we had an absolutely fantastic time at this hotel. We will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother getting Concierge Level.”
Reviews.Author: GatorDocs
Reviews.Content: The concierge floor has a complimentary breakfast, evening appetizers, and dessert. While the breakfast has an adequate amount of food (all cold items and no protein), the appetizers could be improved upon. The sesame chicken had no sauce - I asked the concierge rep if they had sauce and she said "they didn't give us any". The chicken was dry and tasteless without the standard sauce. The desserts consisted of four different types of petit fours on a plate. Other than the benefit of the complimentary valet service, I wouldn't stay on the Concierge Floor again. The highlight of staying at a Peabody is watching the procession of ducks to the fountain. The "duck guy" was very helpful in answering our questions about the ducks. He was also very professional, and you could tell he really enjoyed his job and respected animals.

Reviews.Title: “ncie place”
Reviews.Author: MSAUsa
Reviews.Content: Very nice place, free wifi (part of the daily fee at least), definetly try the restaurants there, great food

Reviews.Title: “Falls a little short”
Reviews.Author: ukbod
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel based on reviews here and a good price. It is, on the face of it, a top line hotel. In actual fact it is almost there but it falls short on some, admittedly small, aspects. The rooms are very nice - well equipped with beds that are second to none I have ever slept in. The TV lineup is limited and operation very fussy. The forced charge for internet etc is unwelcome especially if you dont use it - the room safes arent big enough for anything other than a very small laptop. The food in the B-line diner is mostly very good but can be luke warm - dont even ask for hot water for tea presumably they are scared you might burn yourself. The shop staff and concierge are very helpful. The mezzanine area is quite draughty and cold - in cold weather. No indoor pool was a disappointment as the temp was a lowly 46F. The hotel is right on a main bus and the trolley route. They are however offering some very special prices at present.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Seattlite4
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Peabody during a week-long convention. We reserved 5 rooms through a convention housing bureau for $149/night. This was a great value for such a high quality hotel. The staff is friendly, rooms are very clean, and the lobby and hotel restaurants are immaculate. Though slightly overpriced, the B-Line diner was a great place for late night dinners and is open 24 hours/day. I was impressed by the gift shop as well. We were not bothered by the $8 fee, as we made plenty of use of the free parking, wireless internet and daily water refreshments. Since most hotels charge $10/night for wireless alone, the $8 seemed like a steal. We will definitely make the Peabody our first choice when returning to Orlando in the future...

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: MMGT
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel for a long weekend getaway with my wife. It was a good choice as there were no large events at the convention center. Good pool, nice room and excellent (for central Florida) service. I booked a club level room through Expedia for a great rate. Well, you get what you pay for, the hotel put me on a non club level floor with club access. As it turns out, the club level had large groups and it was a noisy mess up there. Every request was handled promptly and the staff never failed to follow up. All in all, a good adult hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: sparkles1388
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel on Priceline for one night ($76 +taxes and fees - total around $100). It was a great property. Rooms were clean and very comfortable. It was very close to Universal close enough that you did not need to get on I-4 to get there. I was originally concerned about it being on I-drive because past experience was I-drive was a nightmare to drive on. This is on the quiet end of International drive with easy access to I-4 and the toll road to the airport. Would love to stay again for a longer period of time.

Reviews.Title: “Barking dog, dirty rooms”
Reviews.Author: gumbycr3
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Peabody Orlando for 1 night, Saturday, October 14th, 2006. We were looking forward to our stay at a hotel that claims to be 4.5 stars. Our stay was more like a 2 star experience, at best. I called several days in advance to confirm our reservation and to request a king bed. When we got to our assigned room after check in we found double beds. The room was shabby with moldy grout in the bathroom, hairs all over the place and peeling wallpaper. We couldn’t get the mini-bar door to open. The room was extremely hot – the ac wasn’t on. We went down to the pool to use the hot tub and were very disappointed in the quality of the jets – there were hardly any and the few jets the hot tub has are extremely weak. We were upset to find out that the gym area charges guests by the day. I didn’t find mention of this on the Peabody website. Dinner at the Bi-Line diner was horrible – the food (burgers and fries) is very poor quality and extremely overpriced. We went to our room to take a nap at 9 PM before heading out to a midnight movie showing. As soon as we dozed off a dog started barking and howling from the room next door. A dog! Peabody does not accept pets, yet there was a dog disturbing us. We called security who came up and pounded on the door, causing the dog to bark more while the front desk repeatedly tried to reach the room by phone. This meant we had to listen to pounding, a dog and a ringing phone from next door. The security guard asked if we would like to be moved to a different room. We said yes. It took the on duty manager, Elliot, 40 minutes and 2 phone calls from me to get us a new room. Extremely little apology was offered. We were moved from 1033 to 1069. We should have been given a free upgrade or discount or something for our trouble, but we just received a room in even shabbier condition than the first. This room had a dead lizard on the floor and the TV in the bathroom didn’t work. We didn’t bother complaining about the new room, as it was time to get ready to go out and we didn’t think complaining would accomplish anything. No one seemed to care about our comfort. Our whole evening was ruined. Peabody is not a 4 star. Quality and customer service is severely lacking.

Reviews.Title: “The Peabody Hotel - Fantastic stay!!”
Reviews.Author: KimCT
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from a 3 night stay at the Peabody. I booked 2 connecting rooms at a wonderful rate for our family of four. We decided to visit Disney but stay off-site this time. What a great decision. Our rooms were very nice and clean. The beds were so comfortable. We had a fantastic view of International Drive and all the lights. The pools were nice (no slides or anything) but large and plenty fun for my two kids. They loved the kiddie pool with waterfall. It was actually quite relaxing at the pool area. Many of the folks on business were very friendly to us - a few mentioned how they wished their children were with them. I actually don't mind convention hotels as they usually have great restaurants and good service. The staff at the hotel was outstanding. My kids (as well as many adults) loved the Duck March. What a crowd. The Ring Master acknowledged my children which they enjoyed. We ate at the B-Line Diner twice for Breakfast - good food & we lucked out with an incredible Server. We dined at the Capriccio Grill and had one of the best steak dinners ever. Again, we had an amazing Server. Location was close to both Disney & Universal. There are also many things to see & do on International Drive if you have the time. Self-parking at the hotel is free (nice perk). We knew about the resort fee which we had to pay for two rooms. To be honest, we got such a great room rate, the extra charge was what it was. We didn't use the trolley or internet so can't comment. I'm picky about where I stay but this hotel delivers. Love the Peabody!!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely NOT a 5 star hotel!”
Reviews.Author: carib_n_travel
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Peabody for 3 nights at the end of September and was quite disappointed with the experience. As others have noted the lobby area is lovely and check-in was a breeze. The staff were also friendly and very helpful with directions. The first night my wife and I stayed in a room with twin beds on the 24th floor - even though I had requested a king bed and called previously to ensure that we could get one I was told none was available at check-in. The room was quite large and we were impressed at how clean everything was. We requested a room change the following day and were in fact assigned a room with a king bed. The new room on the 16th floor had a smoky smell to it even though I specifically asked for a non-smoking room due to health reasons. It was also much smaller than the previous room and had a seedy feel to it. We also had to call and request that the bottles of water (which we paid a hotel fee for) be placed in our room since housekeeping forgot to do so. Luckily we were out most of the time. Bottom line - the hotel rooms are hit and miss and some desperately need a facelift. Stay here only if you get a good price!

Reviews.Title: “The Peabody Rules!”
Reviews.Author: richemm
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for anniversary and it was great. Upon check in we spoke with the lovely Ashley and she hooked us up. She upgraded us to a corner suite with a terrace! What a room! When we came back from a dip in the pool we noticed chocolate covered starwberries in our room! Ashley is the bomb!! Those strawberries were yummy! The pool area was very relaxing and the duck march is a must. Drinks at the pool were reasonable unlike the obscene amount the Marriot World Center charges. Capriccio Grill and Dux (Mobil 4 star) are two high quality restaurants. The Sunday Brunch at Capriccio is a must. The resort fee of $8 includes high speed internet, Interantional Drive trolley tickets, and two bottles of water daily. Valet is $14 a day and self parking is free. We can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “brits in orlando”
Reviews.Author: yorkshirejohn
Reviews.Content: hi , we have just got back to the uk after 3 weeks in usa. we spent 3 nights at the peabody ( 13-16th aug). the hotels fine however like other guests gripes the wifi facility ok if at a conference with your laptop but if on holiday not appropriate. so i guess 2 bottles of water = 8 dollars. we found all the staff friendly, helpful etc. my main concern with the hotel is that it is servicing two markets, corporate and tourist, hence being awaken at 8.05 am by staff wanting to service our room, not good as a tourist!. a better system would be for housekeepers to be told who are conference people, ie up before 8 am , and tourists wanting a lie in. that apart if on holiday universal studios 5-10 mins away, the bus sevice down international drive great, every 20 mins, 1 dollar, kids free. also expect some level of noise on an evening post conference as the delegates unwind!

Reviews.Title: “Peabody Rocks!”
Reviews.Author: aero0729
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nothing short of excpetional. I booked on Priceline and still got a corner room on the 20th floor. 7.95 for high speed internet and 2 bottles of water is reasonable! The food at B-Line diner was supperb and 10.00 for a burger that good was not so bad for a 4star hotel. Even Disney hotels dont have a 24 hour diner like peabody did! Peabody uses Simmons mattresses. They are amazng! Way above the normal hotel bd, even for nice hotels. This place is great and centreal to everything. 10 min to Disney, 5 min to Universal and Wet N Wild and 2 min to Sea World! Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Lobby, poor rooms and noise!”
Reviews.Author: Dr.Ted
Reviews.Content: Had occasion to stay at the Peabody Orlando on International Drive, for 2 night stay. First room assigned was on the elevator shaft and every time an elevator car went up or down there was noise. Changed rooms and went out to dinner and shopping. Returned at 9PM, party across hallway, doors slamming and yelling. Called front desk at 10:30 to complain, called several more times, no help. Party went on until wee hours. Checked out in the morning, complained and, after 15 minute wait, a junior manager arrived and argued with me for 10 minutes. No resolution. Finally after 3 faxes, 2 Emails and a certified letter to Peabody headquarters in Memphis, a credit appeared on my charge card for the charges. Also, the hotel has the nerve to add a fee (undisclosed until you arrive) onto your bill, for which they say you get 2 bottles of water per day. A cup of coffee in the lobby is $4.00 and the standard rooms are smaller than Motel 6!!

Reviews.Title: “The Peabody is the best!”
Reviews.Author: dolligirl812
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough about the wonderful Peabody! We stayed there because my husband was attending a conference and ended up having a wonderful time. Our 3 kids (ages 7, 9 and 11) loved the ducks and the pool. Nicholas, the duckmaster, was great with the children. He is such a terrific person! The entire staff was very attentive. We would love to stay at the Peabody again. There is absolutely nothing to complain about. You will feel pampered if you stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding, Top to Bottom”
Reviews.Author: Buzliteyear
Reviews.Content: Awesome in every category. First, the bad. My only gripe is that it is about 20 minutes away from the Disney attractions. Also, the restaurants were a bit pricey, but this is to be expected in a 4 star hotel. The good. Everything. The service was outstanding beginning with check-in, all the way to check-out. The staff were all uniformed, polite, eager to help, polite, and friendly. Great pool, great hot tub. If you have little ones, make sure to stop by the lobby in the morning or afternoon while they usher the ducks. They bring them to the lobby fountain in the morning where they sit all day until dinner when they are ushered out. The hotel offered every small convenience of a top hotel from room safe to hairdryer. This is just one outstanding hotel. No room for improvement. Don't change one thing.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Miss the Ducks!!!”
Reviews.Author: PAteacher1
Reviews.Content: Just finished a weekend getaway at the Peabody. The hotel is very beautiful and classy, unlike any other I've stayed at in Orlando. Be sure not to miss the duck marches in the lobby! The duckmaster Nicholas was so wonderful! The rest of the staff was fantastic as well! I'll definately be returning!

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed with the Peabody orlando”
Reviews.Author: traveler110
Reviews.Content: Am currently staying at the Peabody and am very impressed with this hotel. As a travel agent I am very critical of hotels and the Peabody more than impressed me. Friendly and efficient staff, modern decor, very clean, very nice customer service by all staff. The housekeeping staff are funny and helpful as well. Sometimes you tend to see these poor folks as a bit surly! My friend requested a wakeup call and once received was asked if she'd a like a "reminder" call about 20 minutes later, which she accepted. However, she went off to take a shower so didn't answer the second call. Security came to knock on her door to make sure she was okay! That's pretty nice. Grounds are well kept and the hotel is within a short distance of all local attractions. Great place to stay if you are attending a conference which I am. Will recommend for my clients. The ducks are fun to watch and add additional charm to the hotel. The room service menu could be a little more extensive than it is, my only negative comment!

Reviews.Title: “Positive Stay, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Super70s
Reviews.Content: I spent the weekend at the Peabody doing a little reconnaissance for a family trip later in the summer to Disney. The hotel was busy but not packed, thus the great rate of $117/per night. The hotel is next to the convention center and the convention traffic falls off during July and August as do the room rates. After a late flight into Orlando I arrived at the hotel around midnight and was ready for bed. The desk clerk could not immediately find the king bed I was looking for but did locate one at the club level for no extra charge. The bed was a king murphy bed which took up alot of space in the room when pulled from the wall, but wow was it comfortable. The room(2627) was meant to be connected to another room, thus the reason for the murphy bed and no extra charge for the upgrade. The club level allows you access to the private Club Lounge on 26th floor, offering the following complimentary amenities: Continental breakfast (bagels, muffins, toast, juice, coffee), Athletic Club privileges, valet parking, hot hors d'oeuvres, evening cordials and petit fours, private concierge services, and express check-out. A New York Times is at the door each morning. The Peabody is a quality hotel, convenient to everything in Orlando, especially the convention center, but an easy drive to all the parks as well. A quality stay, very friendly and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the night at the Peabody”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. When we first arrived two hours before check in, we were offered a room with two double beds. We requested one with a king. The receptionist took our cell number and phoned us within an hour with a king size bed. The march of the ducks is quite enjoyable. We only wanted something lite to eat. We went to the B Line Diner. I had a fruit plate with banana bread and cottage cheese. It was more than enough food. My husband ordered the assorted appetizer. We are here for a conference and after this one night we checked into a timeshare exchange we booked.

Reviews.Title: “Where's the Coffee?”
Reviews.Author: alandg
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a nice stay at the Peabody. The only complaint I have is that there was no coffee pot in the room, a modern day staple of almost all major hotels world wide. Staff was extremely helpful and friendly. Very conveniently located if attending a conference, but if traveling with a family it's best to have microwave, fridge, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Peabody Found Lacking”
Reviews.Author: Tarsu
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed four nights at the Peabody Orlando. The bedspread in our room was soiled. The drain for the bathtub did not work properly and forced us to stand in drain water while showering. Although we brought this to the hotel's attention, it was never corrected. The staff were polite and helpful. The whirlpool was out of service while we were there. The hotel's website advertised complimentary towels and sunscreen at poolside, but we found only the towels. The sunscreen lotion was in a glass showcase and was offered for sale. This hotel is in a nice location if attending the Conference Center in Orlando. Otherwise, I suggest people shop around as there are nicer hotels in Orlando for less money.

Reviews.Title: “Nickel and Dime you”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: For a four star hotel, I was suprised at a few things. First I get to the Peabody to check in and was pulled out of line at check in because I was not with a convention as three others were. They took our credit cards and Id's and came back 30 minutes later and told two couples they were over booked and asked them if they wouldn't mind going to a lower class hotel across the street. They tell me that my room was booked with a King bed (I had four people). I booked a double. I had a copy of my reservation that was booked through travelocity. The bottom line, they didn't want to give the right rooms to us at the check in counter because we booked on a discount website. I spoke with the other parties and they gave them conflicting stories as well. They tried to separate all of us so we didn't compare stories about our check in experience. So, I had to sleep in a bed with four of us in it!!! They didn't offer me anything as a result of their mistake but offered the other party a discount on their club level room because they complained and said they weren't going across the street to the other hotel. Initially, they told this couple that there were no club level room and conveniently found one for them. The other party stormed out and asked for their money back. Then I actually had to pay to workout in the small gym that they have in house. This is a four star hotel, not getting it. Some of the machines are outdated and crammed together. It cost me $10.65 a day. I also went into the BeeLine cafe and ordered a sandwich with very stale bread. For the most part, the lobby is nice, most of the people are nice but the guy organizing the guests was a little manipulative tryinhg keep people happy. Drinks were expensive and food was overpriced for the quality. Latte's were over $4 our of a machine.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay at the Peabody”
Reviews.Author: LoreenNY
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a first class operation. We got a great deal from hotwire ($120/night) and we were very impressed. From our arrival to departure we were treated with respect and received personalized attention any time we had a request. All of the employees were professional and efficient. The pool is almost Olympic size and the perfect temperature to jump right in. There is waiter/waitress service to your beach chair and you can order delicious frozen drinks and tasty lunch poolside. You can also get a cabana for $75 extra for the day. There are plenty of towels for your use by the pool too. You can easily get a chair in the shade or in the sun. The kiddie pool was a good size too and even had a waterfall. We happily ate at the B-Line Diner, enjoyed room service twice, and had relaxing drinks at Mallards while listening to the live music. The service and quality of food and drinks at this place are wonderful. We used the valet parking ($14 extra a night) and each time we called for our car down it was waiting for us when we got to the lobby. The rooms were exceptionally clean, had the most comfortable beds, and the soaps smelled great. The wireless Internet worked well in the room and throughout the hotel. We were also able to print our boarding passes in the business center. There is an $8.52 hotel fee per night and this includes I-trolley passes, 2 bottles of water, and the wireless Internet. We didn't use the trolley because we had a car, but the trolley stop was right outside the hotel for convenience. The duck show was very cute in the hotel lobby and the kids that were there loved it. I would highly recommend this hotel to couples and business professionals. We have a child, but went away as a couple for this trip. We would bring our child back with us to this hotel. It did not seem kid unfriendly, but the kids that were staying at the hotel were all well behaved. I would not recommend bringing kids that are wild to this location as it does not seem like it would be tolerated. As a side note, we arrived on the day that a high school conference for FBLA was leaving. The guests who were there during that time were not happy with their stay because of the noise and teens at a conference hotel. I suggest calling the hotel to verify that your trip is not at the same time as a conference you would not want to be around. I have stayed at Disney property and other chains while visiting Orlando and this is by far the best that Orlando has to offer. I am planning to stay there again in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “March of the Ducks!”
Reviews.Author: rickbetteridge
Reviews.Content: Loved the style, charm and attention to detail. Staff were wonderful and my children adored the daily March of the Peabody ducks, a wonderful thing to see. Try relexing in one of eight exclusive Poolside Cabanas, this was a great value and again we found service levels were what you would expect from this opulant hotel. The hotel location is great, minutes from everything. A round at Shingle Creeek Golf Course is a must As a hotelier in Miami Beach I could not find fault. I congratulate the Management and staff of the property on a job well done. Richard Betteridge Miami Beach

Reviews.Title: “Old fashioned quality service”
Reviews.Author: Siun
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a stay at the Peabody for a business conference and could not have been more impressed. The room was large and comfortable, the beds wonderful (an opinion shared by my well travelled colleagues), the facilities and food very good for a conference and the location handy for those who wanted to head out for meals, etc. Two things really stood out: 1- the pool area was so spacious and well laid out so that I could always find a quiet chaise for a break and some wifi catching up with my home office 2- the staff provided exceptional service at every turn - and seemed to really enjoy making my stay a pleasure. Each staff member had a smile and took care of each need with a friendly, efficient manner. The hotel's service and style made me feel like I had just had a relaxing mini-vacation along with making it easy for me to get my work done. Bravo!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed by excessive fees”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I travel 4 or 5 times a month for business, and am not too hard to please. All in all, this hotel was very nice. The rooms were clean and the bed was comfy. Other than that -- nothing spectacular. The pool is very big, but it is just that...a pool. The restaurants are extremely overpriced. The big draw is the ducks in the fountain in the lobby, but to be honest, we were kind of grossed out by them. The ducks poop all over the fountain and then lie in it all day.....you are supposed to relax and enjoy food and beverage service around this gross display of animals lying in their poop all day. The other HUGE disapointment is the $8 a day "service charge" that they automatically add on to your bill. Doesn't matter how much you paid for the room or where you booked it, they still mandate that you pay this charge of $8 per day at checkout. It is a total rip-off. The $8 is supposed to include 2 bottles of water a day, free internet access ONLY if you brought your own laptop, and a ticket for a free ride on the trolley. Well, we had a rental car and never used the trolley. We didn't bring a laptop and so we had to pay $.69 a minute for internet access, and we didn't drink their water. I asked repeatedly to have the charge waived, and they said no. We spent close to $50 on internet access, but still had to pay this ridiculous fee. It is like they were desperate to grab every last dime from us that they could. I will never stay here again. It's a shame, too, because I plan conferences for my company and was there "checking the place out", with the intention of hosting a conference for 575 people in November. Nope -- won't do it. Little things mean a lot and that $8 fee left such a bad taste in my mouth!

Reviews.Title: “Not that great for families, but an oasis for couples and business travelers”
Reviews.Author: JessiMIA
Reviews.Content: The purpose of our weekend getaway was to decompress and we were happy that this hotel has a very elegant and distinguished ambiance, with enough well-behaved children and not one screaming one running around (not your norm in Mickey's Town). We arrived with lots of stress on our backs and came back home refreshed after just one day! The Peabody had a convenient location; especially if we had wanted to go to Sea World (we passed it by in our way back from dinner). I booked the hotel the night before our arrival on priceline.com for $100 which came out to a total of $124 with taxes. The infamous service charge is true: $8 for two bottles of water, wireless internet connection, and unlimited local and 800-number calls. The problem is that when checking in they don't make a point to clarify whether this is a mandatory charge or only chargeable if you are planning to use the services mentioned. The lobby is exquisite and it gives you a glimpse of what is about to come. As soon as you enter, the attentive but unobtrusive staff makes sure you feel welcomed. We arrived at 1:00 p.m., two hours earlier than expected and requested an early check-in, which was granted without any hesitation. The ladies at the front desk were extremely helpful and professional. Our room was on the sixth floor. We were very pleasantly surprised that it was enormous! It had a round table with four chairs, a sofa, center table, end table, two chairs, a bar with three stools, a beautiful armoire (which hid the flat screen TV), and a king bed. Even though our view was pitiful (heliport), we did not mind exchanging that for the spacious, clean, and well-tended room that we received. Restroom had all the expected ammenities and was extremely clean, as well. After dinner on Saturday (which we ate outside the hotel), there was free live entertainment (a pianist, bass player, and violinist) in a very inviting area of the lobby, close to the bar. They were so good that we stayed there for three hours, until they played te last song at midnight. The drink prices are a bit high, but what you would expect at this type of venues(we paid a total of $24 for a pina colada and a chocolate martini; and then $4 for a soda). We spent Sunday in the pool which was heated to what I would say were a very comfortable 80 degrees. You could rent their cabanas and well-padded lounge chairs or just use the basic chairs without charge (plenty of choices among sunny or shaded areas). I must confess, though, that we missed the famous "duck parade" -you could not peeled us off from the pool!!) If you are traveling with children, this might not be the place for you. The Peabody seems more appropriate for couples seeking relaxation and a luxurious experience or for people on business (the hotel is accross from Orlando's convention center). All in all, we had a great experience here and will look forward to a longer stay next time around.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: sonnylax
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, great staff, great location. Only quibble was room noise from our neighbors. Walls seemed a little thin for such a high quality place and we heard a fair amount of noise next doors on a Friday evening. Wouldn't hestitate to stay here again if the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “good stay at the Peabody”
Reviews.Author: dlj5
Reviews.Content: My family just stayed a the Peabody for 2 nights. Our room was nice with nice quality beds, linens, etc. Kids loved the tv in the bathroom! Large heated pool and hot tub are great. Service was always above average, helpful, friendly. We upgraded to the concerirge level which was worth the extra cost since it included breakfast, snacks and dessert for two days for our family of 5.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: New2it2000
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed for 4 nights in March, 2006. This hotel is nothing less than immaculate! We enjoyed it so much and can't wait to return. No need for car rental. The trolley has many stops along International Drive that is filled with restaurants and shopping. Never waited more than 15 min. for a trolley. Trolley also takes you to Seaworld and the Premium Outlet shops. The food in hotel is pricey ($3.00 for cup of coffee). All in all, I would do it over and over again.

Reviews.Title: “The greatest”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I am such impress on the way they answer my phone call, very personal and warm. When I drove into the main entrance, I was graciosuly greeted by the doorman, escorted to the front desk, I fel like a king; everybody was smiling and were very attentive. The best part was Felipe Cervantes; he gave us a nice upgrade and even call us the following day to make sure everything was up to our expectations. It seems to us that he was living in the hotel; we saw him early in the morning, late at night every single day.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at the Peabody”
Reviews.Author: LookingforAdvice
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Peabody 5 nights during a conference at the Convention Center. We booked 5 rooms through Hotwire with different arrival times and experienced no problems with check-in. Upon check out one of the rooms had additional charges posted for snacks, which were not used. The problem was quickly corrected. The rooms were spacious and the bed was wonderful. The towels were plush and replenished each day. The pool is very large and HEATED! I don't understand how anyone could post a negative review of the Peabody. The lobby is beautiful with piano music each evening. The restaurants were very nice, but quite expensive. There are many other places to eat on International Drive, but quite a distance to walk. The trolley pick up is located right outside the Peabody, but it is slow. We did experience a security issue. When we arrived in the room, we received a call stating they were setting up express check out and wanted to verify our credit card information. I was apprehensive giving the information over the phone and said my husband would come to the front desk. When we went to the front desk they said they had not called, and immediately reported it to security. Security was not able to trace the call, but the Peabody reassured us they would protect our credit card information. I would not recommend the Peabody for a family vacation, but for attending a convention it is ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Will never stay here again-far better hotels in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel has seen better days. While the lobby is lovely, and the ducks cute to watch, this hotel is past its prime. Rooms are small, overpriced and not updated. The bed spreads were thin, dirty, stained and ugly. I stripped them immediately upon entering our room. Cheap towels and a see through plastic shower curtain that soaked the floor, made the bathroom unacceptable. Only highlight, the bath gels smelled nice. Cracking and chipped paint in room, windows that were so wet with condensation you couldn't see anything outside and the carpet beneath the windows was soggy. Pool was not heated, game room was closed for renovation and the hotel was full of conventioners. Not family friendly at all. I would never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Business not Pleasure”
Reviews.Author: viajeelmundo
Reviews.Content: The Peabody is a lovely hotel if you are traveling for business and have a corporate card that will cover the cost of the pricey rooms. Rooms are larger than the standard hotel and extremely clean. The restaurant food is also good. Check-in was a problem though, my room was not ready for a couple of hours after THEIR check-in time. If you are a family vacationing in Disney, I do not recommend staying here. Doesn't seem like a family resort but more like a convention hotel.

Reviews.Title: “What a great place!!!”
Reviews.Author: clo110
Reviews.Content: I have a hard time understanding how some people are so critical of this place. The entrance to the hotel is spectacular, and the lobby is gorgeous. Though paying a Priceline rate, we were treated graciously by all of the hotel staff whom we encountered. The experience of watching the famous ducks march down their red carpet was great. I'd recommend that five-minute diversion for anyone. We happened to stay here on New Year's Eve, so the hotel was full of energy and people. The Wisconsin football team was staying here in preparation for their bowl game the next day, so we got to chat with some of the players and Coach Barry Alvarez in the elevator. The pool area is expansive and actually allows for privacy. The hot tub is big, so we didn't feel uncomfortable, even though others were in at the same time. The tennis courts were nice, and we enjoyed playing. The concierge was helpful in explaining the public transportation system. We won a $75 bid on Priceline, so the grand total was less than $95. The actual rooms were a typical high-class hotel room. (If you think that these rooms aren't exciting enough for you, then you need to spend some nights in a Days Inn or Motel 6 to get some perspective.) The beds were comfortable as advertised. The view was nice. The TV in the bathroom was an interesting touch, though we didn't use it. Overall, we had a great experience at the Peabody Orlando. I'd recommend this place to absolutely anyone who wanted to stay at a nice place and experience a bit of luxury!!

Reviews.Title: “Peabody is just Ducky!”
Reviews.Author: Leeagle1
Reviews.Content: Arrived at The Peabody for the first night using a priceline reservation - only problem encountered was when trying to reject the service fee. We had no intention of using two I-trolley tickets (for a family of five) or the bottled water. The second night club room was booked with travelocity, and I agreed to pay for the second night service fee (after finding out it included internet access), if the first night fee was waived. Problem was fixed on the spot! As for the hotel itself, the front drive and lobby area are beautiful! We enjoyed checking out the duck palace, located near the athletic facility, and watching the ducks play in the fountain. The lounge was cozy and nicely decorated, and the food assortment was very good. The rooms are smaller than in some other hotels, but very comfortable and tastefully decorated. The flat screen color tv in the bathroom was entertaining! Enjoyed the free parking and back door entrance to the hotel - security was circling on a regular basis. Great location -- very near both Universal and Sea World.

Reviews.Title: “The Ducks save this hotel from drowning”
Reviews.Author: mshellokitty99
Reviews.Content: When I walked into the Peabody, the lobby is very impressive, string orchestra playing, beautiful atmosphere; I walked into a 5 star hotel. When I checked in, I was told of a mandatory $9.00 fee/night. I agreeded and went to my room on the 23rd floor overlooking downtown. The view was not impressive. The room was rated at a 3 star. I guess I expected a grand room based on the entrance but the room was very generic and unimpressive. (Average 95/night with priceline with a package deal with airfare) I enjoyed the Peabody duck demonstration; that was really nice. Overall, it was worth less than 100/night but not a dollar more.

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended, they will fleece you.”
Reviews.Author: Mark4358
Reviews.Content: one of many nice hotels in that area, but at this hotel there are hidden charges that can greatly increase your tab. first there is the mandatory hotel service fee of about $9/day after tax, which forces you to pay for services you prob wont need, and they don't tell u about it until the end of check-in... second is the $10/day fee for use of the fitness ctr, you only pay this if you use the fitness center, but have u ever seen a hotel charge for use of the fitness center? they are all about nickel and diming their guests, they have disney-itis: do what it takes to maximize profits... also the hotel is monolithic and impersonal, the pool is not very inviting, the area surrounding the pool is awkward... it takes a long time to get in and out to the parking lot, the lobby is an uncomfortable patchwork of rooms or areas, and the main entrance is nice, but u only see it once: when u check in, because otherwise u enter thru a lonely side door... and oh by the way, u will be so sick of ducks by the time u leave, they really over-do their little duck theme... you'll see what i mean... finally the walls are thin, surprising given the size of the bldg, but it must have been built a while ago on the cheap... if u have neighbors, u will hear them... anyway, if u haven't finalized ur plans yet, i recommend u look elsewhere... there are many many very nice and less impersonal hotels at much better prices in the international drive area (on universal blvd)... i have stayed at hundreds of hotels and never experienced fleecing like this, really left me disgusted... as i asked the mgr: what's next? a fee to use the elevator?

Reviews.Title: “The Peabody-Utopia in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband was sent to Orlando on a 3 day conference. From the first moment we arrived, our Peabody hotel experience was nothing less than first class! We both had never stayed at a 5 star hotel before-so boy, now am I SPOILED!! Every single employee was very courteous, handled any request swiftly and was an all around joy to be near! There was no condscending attitudes here. The entire staff was the BEST!Our room was gorgeous with down-topped beds,like sleeping on my own personal cloud! The room was always spotless and comfortable to stay in The 11:00 March of the Ducks into the lobby fountain was precious-and even the waitress in the lobby brought me a coffee to sip while I enjoyed the show! The entire hotel was filled with dendrobium orchids in unique containers. The pool was beautiful, the food delicious-our entire stay was HEAVEN!Thank-you Peabody Hotel=you are the BEST!!!

Reviews.Title: “Never staying at the Peabody again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Peabody Orlando for a major conference in mid-October. This was my worst hotel experience EVER. My colleague brought her reservation confirmation sheet with her and was told during the check-in process that they did not have a record of her reservation and she would need to find a room elsewhere. Because there were several conferences in town, there were no nearby rooms. So, she ended up having to stay with me. Strike one. Strike two-- our room was dirty. There were cup rings and large coffee drops on the marble counter, there was lipstick on the lampshade (the side facing the room), a large piece of ribbon was pushed under the entertainment cabinet rather than actually being vacuumed up when housekeeping came in the next day. Housekeep actually entered our room (while we were in it) without knocking first! I often say at five-star hotels and the cleanliness of this room was not at all acceptable. Strike three-- the wireless never wokred after 6:00 p.m., was always slow, and cost $7.00 a day for connectivity for one laptop. You had to pay an additional fee for a second laptop. I do feel lucky to have been given a room upon my arrival. Two colleagues who arrived at the same time had to wait for over two hours to be assigned a room. And we arrived at about 5:00 p.m. Numerous others at the conference told stories about not having a room, having to vacate their room before their reservation was over. No one had success with the wireless access. Everything is a $13 cab ride, except for the airport which is about $35.00, from this hotel. The hotel is close to nothing except the convention center. I phoned the hotel to discuss my stay and spoke to the front office director. The director said all the right things, but as it turns out, talk is cheap. On a memo dated June 3rd (for my October stay!), I was told I would receive a refund of 20% of my stay-- a total of $140.63-- issued to the credit card on file. Being as this trip was being reimbursed by my employer, this was not even a close to an acceptable resolution. To his credit, I requested, and was given, a reversal of the refund (writing a $140 check to my employer was not something I was interested in doing). For a hotel selling itself on wonderful service, my experience was the opposite... from the first impression of a dirty room to an apology memo dated months BEFORE my stay. If you are attending a conference at the convention center, stay at the Sheraton or one of the lovely hotels at Universal Studios.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to the price”
Reviews.Author: Ferrariking
Reviews.Content: My wife and I paid for club level accomodations for two nights. The place is clean and the staff is friendly and helpful enough, but the rooms are small, ceilings low, one desk chair in the room, otherwise you had to sit on the bed. This is supposedly a convention center hotel, but there was no shuttle to the convention center. The Italian steakhouse restaurant was the only one we tried and the food was very good - but not nearly the wine list one would have expected. Club level offered little in my opinion. Would stay there again in a regular room if able to get a great price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel with a great view”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 3 days. It really has a nice pool and recreational facilities. But the rooms are not all that spacious. The staff are quite courteous. Loved the restaurant,bar. Overall a nice hotel but is a tad expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Honeymoon Retreat”
Reviews.Author: lagibson91
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at the Peabody Orlando Resort from Oct 30-Nov 3. My birthday is Oct 30, and we were married the morning of Oct 31st. We informed the front desk of these two events upon check-in, and they did EVERYTHING possible to make sure our stay was fabulous. The hotel in general is utterly gorgeous... marble floors in the lobby, in the bathrooms, beautiful artwork on every wall. The March of the Ducks brings a certain charm to the hotel... boy are they proud of those ducks! When we arrived in our King Suite, we were shocked at the size and amenities the room provided. One cannot comment enough about the comfort of the Peabody Dream Bed. The bed was absolutely the most comfortable bed I have ever slept on. They even sell them on their website peabody at home. The linens were soft and luxurious. The suite has a sitting area with chair, couch, desk, and coffee table separate from the sleeping area. The television was large and hidden in a beautiful armoire. Peabody Hotel Robes were provided during the stay and more than enough towels were available in the room upon arrival. The toiletries were even coordinated to the hotel, with soaps in the shape of 3 dimensional ducks! Free newspapers and "Architectural Digest" magazine were in the room, along with a very handy guide listing all the local eateries. Room service was quite pricey, with the hotel charging nearly $55 for a 12 pack of beer. But, we never used room service anyway, so the high prices did not bother us. The best part was the special treats provided for us. Happy Birthday chocolates were left on the pillows, and on the day of our wedding, they provided a bottle of champagne, strawberries covered in white and dark chocolate (looked like tuxedos), and a sailboat made of chocolate. All of these "treats" were provided at no extra cost! This definitely made our stay much more enjoyable!!!! The pool was beautiful and not at all crowded. I especially enjoyed the hot tub, which was great for relaxing after the stress of a wedding and theme parks!!! We did not eat at the hotel, but went over to the Rosen Plaza Hotel and had an absolutely fabulous meal at Jack's Place. While the rack rates for this room are over $200/night, we only paid $95 per night from an online special. We had a car with us, so we did not need to utilize any shuttles or transports. Overall, this hotel was absolutely wonderful, and we will DEFINITELY be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable beds at the Peabody”
Reviews.Author: Geri0
Reviews.Content: The beds are the highlight in this hotel. They are dream beds. The pool area is okay. The restaurants are pricey but give you good portions. The service is excellent. I would stay there again for the beds alone. Not enough for kids in this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Are you kidding?! This hotel is Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: People, People... If you are looking for an extravagant hotel, look NO further. The Peabody is for you. I got the peabody for 75/night on priceline and I was So happy I did. Like you, I read many many reviews for the peabody and I was truly impressed with what I saw. During this review I will inform you all of the key questions I had that were never answered in ANY of the reviews. It was just me and my boyfriend there for a disney/universal studios vacation for 8 days. From the moment we stepped in, we KNEW we were going to enjoy our stay. When we checked in, I knew to ask for a high floor king bedroom with a (distant) view of disney's fireworks. (Thank you tripadvisor!!) Melanie made that dream come true checked us in early (1:00 pm), picked up our disney tickets that was delived from ticketmania from the concierge and we were off to the room. We went upstairs and everything was so Clean! It even smelled soapy. The TV is pretty big and modern for a hotel, and there are three phones, one next to the bed, on the desk and behind your toilet seat. I didn't get the famed TV in the bathroom, but I didn't notice until our last day there! Thats how much I didn't need it.
