The marble bathrooms were beautiful and the maid service was absolutely great, folding the toilet paper, placing the soap duck on top of the towels. Very nice touches in the bathroom. The Bed. My goodness, need I say anymore? You SINK in to that bed. I have learned to RESENT my own bed after sleeping in the Peabody's. There were nights I was full of energy when I got in, once I hit that bed I was out like a light. Its a wonderful place for naps in the middle of the day. That first day we jumped on the I-Trolley which was interesting to say the least, the drivers were nice and there are a LOT of things to do on I-drive. We went to belz (now prime) outlets and had a ball. It was about a slow 25 minute ride just to get out there. We used our free i-trolley passes that was included in the resort fee. The gave us two for everyday, we only ended up using 6. On the way back we walked to pizza hut, came back and ate and went to the pool. The pool is NICE. If never been in a heated pool before and man it does make a big difference. It was really really nice out there, i didn't get to hit the bar but that looked nice as well. The one thing that urked me was the fact that there is a separate kiddie pool that none of the parents take there kids to. I mean it IS a kiddie pool for a reason, so the adults can be in the main pool. Other than that we went in the pool twice during our stay and sure wished we could have went more often (IT WAS HOT). Side note: The pool DOES close at dusk but plenty times I looked out my window there were people swimming as late as 12am, with no lights...so I guess its at your own risk. Now here's the good stuff, the stuff I couldn't find on the site. DISNEY transportation is pretty good. On the 1st day we had ressies with Cinderella for 8:10 so we had to cab it. $35 people. Stick with MEARS! They provide a shuttle, a decent greyhound sized bus that is always on time and only $6 roundtrip per person. They have a station in the hotel, and the drivers are really nice. Thanks Raphael!! The $6 is really worth it. As for Universal Studios, I'd rather take a cab because with Mears its 14.00 per person round trip and with the cab its about $10-12 per person and a very easy ride. The Bellhop were extraordinary. Just magnificent. Their customer service is very very good. They were always there to help, Thank you. The ducks! They were cool, try to catch them on a weekday morning, on a tuesday it wasn't so crowded as people mentioned, it was quite comfortable. Shower's were nice, not just your basic showerhead you could change it to massage etc. There was a peabody robe which I did not use. B-Line was ok. We had Breakfast there and were not too impressed, the food was pretty bland to us. But it was hella convienent to have them open 24hrs a day! If you ever have a sweet tooth in the middle of the night, that is THE place to go! Lynx is right outside as well, I didn't ride it, although I did understand you could take it straight to universal studios which would be even cheaper, seems to run a LOT more frequently than the I-trolley. Restaurants withing walking distance (and for us walking distance is a mile) Sizzler, Pizza Hut,(takeout) McD's, Houlihans, Friendly's(good food, great service), Denny's (good food, great service) , IHOP(great food, great service), Johnny Rockets Diner, Red Lobster. Many Many more down the way. Did I mention there is a mall (although under construction) right across the street? Pointe Orlando, filled with shops and restaurants. I attended the gym facilities while there, not a bad selection at all. Several treadmills, ellipticals, stair masters, all top of the line brands, Lifefitness, Precor, etc. Strength machines were good also. Fee: 10 dollars, which includes locker. Check out was smooth, kinda lost my appetite when I saw the $60 resort fee bill that is mandatory. But I expected it, once again thanks to tripadvisor. I did request to checkout one hour later, which was granted, we waited and hung out with the ducks until mears came to pick us up. All in all, great hotel! You won't regret it. Really. Any questions? E-mail.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a great relaxing hotel, be sure to see the march of the ducks... every day in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “A touch of class!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a class act. From the moment you drive up to the main door you can tell that a treat is in store for you. I've stayed several weeks at several Carlton Ritz hotels and this one would be a close 2nd or third place finisher. The staff were helpful and pleasant. I liked the fact that it was a very quiet and peaceful hotel. The room we got was on the 19th floor with a view that can't be matched! It was awesome. We are a family of 4 so we asked for a king and a sofa bed and that is what we got. The room was very nice and large which is very important to me. The price for all this... $95/night. We stayed 4 nights but I wish we had stayed longer. I used Priceline for this hotel and didn't know what a deal it was until we got there. The whole place is nice. Others have written about the ducks marching in etc. It's nice. The piano music and the ambiance are hard to beat and the feeling of rich surroundings and beautiful interiors will linger on long after you have left this beautiful hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Pretty, but overpriced”
Reviews.Author: sgardner42379
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for five days while at a conference. Conference rate was $199 a night plus tax - very high, I thought. The hotel was very clean, nice lobby. Their claim to fame is that they march a few ducks in on a red carpet every morning and let them swim in the lobby fountain for the day - at the end of the day, they march all the ducks back out. There are usually more than a hundred people trying to watch and photograph this "event." Stay out of the lobby at 11 and 5!! The room was clean, comfortable, and we had plenty of towels, etc. I didn't find any staff that I spoke to who were very friendly - most of them had the attitude of "uppity". Excuse me -you're hotel employees, not British royalty! Outside there is a white sidewalk, white curb, and white road - very hard to differeniate the difference with sun glare. I fell, and was badly bruised for a month! Security took my statement for an incident report, offered to take me to a hospital, and provided me with ice and an ace bandage for my knee. Afterwards, they called once to see if I was OK. Bottom line - I don't think guest safety is a big factor. Food and beverages in the hotel were very high priced and nothing special. The background music was kind of old-fashioned. Overall, I could have had a room at several other hotels locally that were more down to earth, price wise and a lot more pleasant service-wise.

Reviews.Title: “Trouble at the Peabody”
Reviews.Author: momSarasota_Florida
Reviews.Content: My husband was out of the country so I decided to take my kids to Orlando. I thought since we were alone we should stay at a very nice hotel. Upon arrival I asked the conciere a question and was about to ask another but I was interupted with O.K. very loudly so I said O.K. and left. He was very rude. Then we went to a theme park for a few hours. After arriving back at the hotel I loaded my 2 year old into her stroller along with some of our things. We had already put some of our things in the room. While walking into the hotel, the parking lot was very dark with no lighting in that section so we continued walking when suddenly the stroller is abruptly stopped and my daughter is screaming. There was a rope blocking another parking area that could not be seen it was red and we were in the pitch dark. I am very lucky it only resulted in minor injury, a small bump on the head. There was no flouresent tape, no barricades, no lighting only a thin red rope. She seemed to calm down after we got inside of the hotel. Then my 7 year old son decided to watch a little t.v.. So he was surfing channels when suddenly I see and adult film, When I say adult I mean xxx they were in the middle of the worst thing he could see. I was horrified I could not believe what he saw. We are a religious family. How can I ever erase my child's memories. What he saw was irresponsible of the hotel. We did not order that movie or the adult channel. Before you take children to this hotel please check channel 23 to make sure the adult movies are not assigned to your room and tell them to block all adult programming. Other comments: The kids pool was very dirty,

Reviews.Title: “HIghly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Peabody for business and hated to leave. The entire staff was friendly and warm, extremely service oriented. Even the maids were friendly...always saying hello. The pool area was beautiful as well as the entire hotel lobby. My room was extremely clean. The high point. I cam back from a long, hot run on international drive and the bell person handed me a towl and a cold water as I was walking in. Now that is servce.

Reviews.Title: “very nice”
Reviews.Author: emichele22
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend surprised me with a two night stay at the peabody. We had a wonderful time. It was very nice and clean. Everyone was very helpful. My boyfriend even made friends with the valet. It was quiet and comfortable. We had breakfast delievered to our rooms which was so nice. My boyfriend had scheduled two massages for us that were supposed to be done side by side, but when we went for the massages we were told that they didn't do side by side and had to be done in seperate rooms that were on opposite sides of the building. that was a little disappointing. however, i had a great weekend and it was a nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We paid $75 per night at the Peabody via Priceline. Needless to say we weren't disappointed. The Peabody is by far the nicest hotel on I-Drive and in the best location. Our main interest during our stay was Universal, which was an easy drive. We didn't eat at any of the hotel restaurants...we made the short drive to the nearby McDonalds or Sizzler for breakfast, so that we could get to the parks sooner and tried many of the City Walk restaurants for dinner. Parking is free (except valet, of course) and the parking lot is very easily accessible to the hotel. Only downsides- they implemented a mandatory $7.00 nightly hotel fee which is "mandatory" for priceline users...the impression that I was left with is that it is optional for other guests, but not totally sure. But the 7.00 pays for itself...no parking fees, 2 bottled waters, internet access, free local and toll free calls are included for the 7.00. My husband was very disappointed with not having a coffee pot and having to pay a $10.00 fee to use the "workout facilities" On the last night there, they had a band that was playing at the House of Blues (I believe it was the band itself on our floor) they were very loud and disrespectful, however once security found out about it, they intervened....the officer actually pulled up a chair at the end of our hall to ensure peace and quiet for the rest of the night. All in all a nice hotel, I've stayed in better and worse. But then again, we feel that the hotel is not the destination...Priceline is really spoiling me

Reviews.Title: “comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: MontrealVoyager
Reviews.Content: Stayed on executive floor with lounge access. Room well appointed, very nice bed and linens. Well located to Disney and convention center across the street. Depending on the rate I would return.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly Still FABULOUS!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at the Peabody with family in the early 90s. What a refreshing surprise to see that it still has all the luster and majesty that it had when it opened! Beautiful, classic hotel, with wonderful service. Duck theme is carried off wonderfully and surprisingly! I would recommend it everyday of the week, and twice on Sundays!

Reviews.Title: “Just Ducky!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is classy without being stuffy. They carry out the famous Peabody duck theme in fun surprising ways throughout the hotel (ex: mini duck shaped soaps, adorable b&w duck postcards). Beautiful, calming lobby and common areas. Extreme attention to details . . . Comfy robe in closet, wonderful matress & bedding, nice assortment of tolietries. . . I had them deliver a crib for my Toddler . . . in the crib was a babycare kit (lotion, powder etc . . .) as well as a miniture rubber ducky and baby blanket. The Large clean pool heated to just the right tempature. Also large whirlpool for the adults and seperate wading pool for the kids. Stayed on the 20th floor and I have to say the Peabody's elevator has to be the fastest one I've ever expirenced in a hotel. As for the Peabody's duck parade into the foutain, don't blink - it last about 2 seconds. Not overly impressive. We stayed at the Peabody after spending the first couple of days of our Orlando trip at the Disney Yatch Club. I enjoyed my stay at the Peabody as much if not more. The Peabody is not design for Children however, they were very accomdation to our toddler. I especially liked the price of the Peabody $104.00 on Hotwire. Disney's Yatch club ran $420.00 per night. All and all a wonderful hotel!

HotelInfo.Name: The Peabody Orlando
HotelInfo.Address: 9801 International Drive, Orlando, FL 32803
